text:
22. 6. 2017, Berlin, TXL. Canned. Aroma is classical banana bread like. Can not the best choice, but still prominent heffeweizen geschmack with a smallish hint of souerness in the aftertaste. Balanced well. A good staple of Deutsch brewing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent beer as it compounds cereal, floral, leaves, banana flavors and delivers a great palate taste. There is only one disadvantage from my personal opinion: I cannot find it in supermarkets in Romania.Anyway, it is my number one beer for more that 15 years !

Pours orange from the bottle, leaves behind a murky, frothy white head. Aroma is banana, lightly herbal, dash of chlorine. Taste is banana sweet, white bread, light clove, mineral notes. Medium body, a touch less carbonation than the average Weizen. Overall not bad, but not worth seeking out, even if it is (as currently) a top 50 pick.
Bottle bought in Rome. Also had it on tap. Hazy golden/orange with a good white head. Aroma of banana, spices, yeast, lemon, wheat. Same taste. It is a good mellow beer.

Nagy, tart√≥s hab, f√©lbarna sz√≠n, sz≈±retlen. Enyhe, b√∫zas√∂r√∂s illat. B√∫z√°s, ban√°nos, enyh√©n van√≠li√°s. K√∂nnyed, kr√©mes, enyh√©n sz√©nsavas, alig keserny√©s. Finom, j√≥l eltal√°lt b√∫zas√∂r.
50 cl bottle in Muscat Oman. Cloudy gold with a nice head. Aroma of banana and some esters. Very refreshing, one of the best hefeweizens out there.
semi clear golden colour with medium white head, aroma is yeasty and wheat, taste is mainly wheat and banana.
jdjdjdjdjdjdjdjfjfjdjdjdjdjdjjdjdjdjdjdjdjdjdjksjd via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at pub. Pours hazy golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Taste has some banana and citrus with wheat. Pretty nice and refreshing.
franziskaner weizen uit munchen; een wat lichter gekleurde variant, ook minder zoet wel wat van de tarwe ,aroma¬ís van banaan en citrus geven een fris zure voor een zonnig terras weizen
Piwo wypite jaki≈õ czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnie≈Ñ z degustacji, w ramach uzupe≈Çnienia profilu.
Aroma claro a trigo, aspecto turbio, espuma blanca, baja carbonatacion. Cerveza liviana, refrescante. Muy rica en su estilo.
Aromas of lemon, orange rind, some bubble gum, and cracked wheat. Taste is lemon, orange, yeast, and slightly burnt cracked wheat.
My boyfriend and I loved it but the bottle broke when he used a bottle opener right at the cap. And it sliced his finger open.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 Bottle. Cloudy orange beer with large white head. Aroma of wheat, clove, light banana, with notes of citrus. Taste is light sweet with very light tartness, some bread and banana, clove, citrus, orange. Spices in light bitter finish, Light to medium body, average to lively carbonation. Not very surprising, but highly drinkable and fine weizen.

Ar: Slightly underripe banana, at a medium-high intensity; some hints of tart peach skin and clove; fresh, light, bready malt. Ap: Deep gold and hazy; very large white head, great frothy and thick consistency, high retention; foam forms a merengue -like cap. T: Light sweetness with fairly pronounced banana and peach; lightly tart, with a fresh grainy bread quality; slight black pepper, medium-low clove, with a herbal, floral hoppiness and very low, clean bitterness; finish is peach skin, cracker malt, and banana. P: Medium body with very high carbonation; creamy and lush; finish is medium-dry. O: Stellar German hefeweizen; the banana, peach, clove, black pepper, and fresh maltiness are all present; light tartness keeps the beer bright, crisp, and quaffable.

Aroma of banana and yeast. Pours lovely cloudy yellow-orange with a snowy white head, two fingers thick.Taste is strong banana and cloves, with a slightly bitter finish. Awesome. One of the best wheat beers.

Aroma of wheat and yeast, mostly banana. Pours opaque yellow-orange with large snowy head. In flavor a nice slightly sweet blend of wheat, bananas and other yeasty flavors, touch of cloves & citrus, with very mild spice and bitterness in the finish, great balance. Smooth body, fitting medium-high carbonation, very drinkable. As good as it gets, it¬ís great.

Color amarillo naranja nebuloso opaco con la cabeza blanca grande. Se asienta en una capa de espuma de 1 cm de grosor. El aroma es fuerte y de limonada con toques de chicle y notas agrias y afrutadas. Carbonataci√≥n media y paladar ligeramente grueso. El sabor es fresco y afrutado. Dulzor mediano seguido de acidez agria. Muy bien equilibrado. No es nada sorprendente, pero una cerveza de trigo bastante bien equilibrada.

(500 ml bottle) Cloudy orange beer, with vigorous medium carbonation, and a rocky white head. A big malt and yeast aroma: biscuit and bread, fresh wheat and cereal, banana and clove, then smooth caramel, caster sugar, citrus flowers, kiwi, and a hint of rice. The finish is clean, with a wisp of mineral water and pine.

The mouthfeel is fairly light and bubbly; but the balanced aroma more than makes up for it. This is one of the best Wei√übier I¬íve tried so far. Highly refreshing.
Very good beer. Tha carbonation is perfect. The taste is really good and the appearance cloudy. Very good head and color. Very good.
Es duftet fruchtig. Beim Antrunk leicht s√§uerlich, bananig mit sch√∂nem w√ºrzigen K√∂rper. Sehr erfrischendes und s√ºffiges Hefe-Weizen!

500ml. bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a cloudy dark orange with a retentive head. Aroma of wheat, malts, banana and yeast. Taste of light citrus, banana, wheat, bread. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel. A pleasant Hefe.

Botella 0,355l Color- dorada clara, turbia, espuma fina, alta, media duracion. Aroma- complicada, notas de trigo,citrico, banana, clavel. sabor- citrico, trigo, banana, clavel, algo dulce, postsabor frutal prolongado.
Aroma and taste of wheat with a distinct aftertaste of banana and some yeast. Fruity, not too sticky but lacks a bit of depth. I prefer my wheat beers softer and less sweet.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 Drinked in bottle. At the nose, banana and yeasty esters. In mouth is very refreshing, quite carbonated. Some spiciness, mature fruits and hints of vanilla.
Very cloudy. Draft. Dark orange. 3 finger creamy head. Nose is banana runtd. And sweet sugar. Delicious flavor. Dense and thick wheat body. Orange peel banana and sweet candied yams.
smooth flavour with banana aroma, one of the better wheat beers i tried only negative is a bit higher carbonation

That beautiful German wheat beer aroma that¬ís so familiar yet not entirely describable. Cloudy medium pale yellow with a dense and persistent but small white head. Nice light banana flavor and light allspice/clove flavor of German hefeweizen with a good toasted malt background. Just enough mushroomy/earthy noble hop bitterness to balance out the light sweetness. A light bread yeast character presides throughout the taste in elegant fashion. Body has a light creaminess but it melts away to a more watery consistency. Finishes smooth and creamy with a lasting banana ester essence. A quintessential German Hefeweizen. Happy German Beer Day 2017 everyone!!
Color p√°lido casi anaranjado muy bonito. Espuma blanca total. F√°cil de beber. M√≠tica
Pomara≈Ñczowe, mƒôtne, obfita drobnopƒôcherzykowa piana. Spore wysycenie. W aromacie banan, w smaku banan, pszenica. Dosyƒá jednowymiarowe, ale dobre
Weissbier com colora√ß√£o amarelo turva e boa forma√ß√£o e persist√™ncia de espuma, al√©m de refrescante
Uzupe≈Çnione z notatek. Klasyczna jasna pszenica, por√≥wnywalna z Paulanerem.
Bottled. Deep, hazy golden with everlasting head. Solid weizen with the necessary banana and yeast characteristics and medium sweet finish.
Lovely widely available wheat beer. The banana is there but with a lovely dry finish
On tap. Hazy golden color with average sized white head. Aroma mostly of banana and clove. Somewhat sweet with banana and clove notes. Light bodied. Refreshing.

Presenta un colore oro torbido con un bouquet di odori richiamanti il frumento e la banana. Il sapore viaggia sugli stessi binari dei profumi e una buona frizzantezza con una leggera punta di amaro le conferisco un gusto sapido che appaga dal primo all¬íultimo sorso.

Bottle: Golden orange color with quite a bit of white head. Aroma has a noticeable yeast presence, a little clove, some wheat. Flavor is cloves, bananas, more yeast, and some wheat. Very smooth and rich in overall taste.
500 ml from tap, served in Weizenbier glass. Citrus, Grapefruit, yeast, grain, grain. Slightly bitter and sour. Very refreshing. Lively carbonated, sour finish. Oily texture. Nice!

Barwa z≈Çota, solidnie zmƒôtnione, piana bia≈Ça, obfita, nie≈∫le siƒô trzyma. W aromacie sporo banana, ≈õwie≈ºego, trochƒô go≈∫dzika i nut s≈Çodowych. W smaku p√≥≈Çwytrawne, wyra≈∫ne nuty bananowe, go≈∫dzikowe, do tego sporo podbudowy ze s≈Çodu pszenicznego, piwo jest bardzo g≈Çadkie. Wysycenie wysokie, prawid≈Çowo, goryczka leciutko zaznaczona, dobre cia≈Ço, dobra pijalno≈õƒá, rze≈õkie, zbalansowane. .
50 cl bottle. Classique de la bi√®re allemande commerciale. Notes de banane et d¬íagrumes sur le bl√©.

Aroma: Strong citrus and herbs notes.
Appearance: Pale golden color with a thick cloudy liquid and a frothy white head.
Taste: Medium sweet notes with a bitter and sour touch.
Palate: Medium body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Long sweet/sour finish.
Overall: Very fruity and easy to drink but not as refreshing as other weissbiers. More for a winter afternoon. Drink slowly.

0.5 bottle. Aroma is great, giving respect to the hefe profile: bananas, yeast, cloves, oranges. Spicy. Taste is also good and respects the style. Spicy and creamy. Will quench your thirst. HVery nice!
pours a semi-cloudy rich gold with a substantial white head. wonderful aroma of spice, clove, banana, yeast. Great taste of spice and a hint of citrus. Pleasant bittersweet finish. Great Hefe!

I love this beer. The aroma is unique and smooth; The cloudy in the beer shows you the real wheat on it. I learned in Germany to flip the bottles first before to open it, in this way all the beer gets the consistence of the wheat settle in bottom. I came back to Canada with 10 cans of Franziskaner.

Poured from the bottle in home. Aroma is malt caramel. Appearance is orange color, cloudy liquid,white head. Palate is light body, slick feel, average carbonation, abrupt finish. Taste very good a bit fruity. If you like not filtered wheat beer, is your choice

prezencja dobra, zamglony z trwa≈ÇƒÖ pianƒÖ drobnƒÖ. zapach i smak: nie jaki≈õ super intensywny, lecz przyjemny, banany, brakuje go≈∫dzika.pe≈Çne w smaku, wysycenie ≈õrednie. na minus dosyƒá ≈ºelaziste.
Uklar gylden hvede√∏l med duft af citrus og banan. Flot hvidt skum der holder l√¶nge. Smagsnoter af banan, g√¶r og krydret eftersmag. H√¶derlig weizen.

[Butelka]
WyglƒÖd: S≈Çomkowe, obfita piana.
Aromat: Banany, intensywny go≈∫dzik, s≈Çodki.
Smak: Kwaskowate, orze≈∫wiajƒÖce, wysokie wysycenie.
Podsumowanie: Ok weizen. Tylko tyle i a≈º tyle.

12oz bottle. Pours cloudy orange-gold with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is spicy wheat, banana, and clove. Taste is nectarine, banana, clove, wheat, spicy yeast, and a little bubblegum. Light grassy bitterness. Dry finish. Light/light-medium body. Medium carbonation. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

Aromat: mocne go≈∫dziki i s≈Çabszy banan, s≈Çodko
WyglƒÖd: ≈Çadna zbita, drobno pƒôcherzykowa piana, leasing s≈Çaby, kolor - solidnie zmƒôtnione, s≈Çomkowe
Smak: wytrawne, mocno go≈∫dzikowe, s≈Çaby banan, nieco cierpko≈õci, goryczka niska, stylowa
Podniebienie: wysycenie niskie, jak na parametry pe≈Çne g≈Çadkie

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Birra di colore arancio opalescente.La schiuma √® di un bianco sporco e compatta.All?olfatto si sente lievemente un sentore di banana. Al palato ha una nota dolce di lievito e di frutti a polpa gialla. Il corpo √® equilibrato con una lieve acidit√† finale. Una buona birra
Bottle. Dark orange. Beautiful big head. Aroma of bananas and lemons. Taste is bananas, yeast and citrus fruits. Sour. Medium carbonation. Creamy and light mouthfeel. Solid Hefeweizen.

Bottiglia da 50cl.
Colore dorato, torbido, schiuma bianca abbastanza presente. Parecchio fitta e persistente.
Profumo di grano e lievito, un leggero sentore di pane che rimane anche al gusto, dove arriva anche vagamente della banana e degli agrumi. Al palato tornano principalmente il lievito e il grano.
Una delle migliori Weizen, davvero gradevole.

ahem ahem ahem, we got this at a local bar happy hour with a 20 oz pour. It is a golden color with a smooth and light palate. It tastes wheaty and sweet like a cross between peaches, bubblegum, and banana. Very drinkable, refreshing, and nice. One of the best hefeweizens out there!

Trouble, blonde tirant sur le rose. Mousse g√©n√©reuse. Deuxi√®me bouche tirant sur l¬í√©pice (clou de girofle), le poivre et le fruit m√ªr (banane et poire)
Une grande bi√®re de bl√©, d√©salt√©rante et vraiment tr√®s subtile.
Aromat banan, go≈∫dziki. Barwa z≈Çota, mƒôtne, ≈Çadna drobnopƒôcherzykowa piana. Smak banan, go≈∫dziki, pszenica. Goryczka niska.
Lemon fruity and juicy. Decent for the style. 16oz bottle poured at the cabin in park city.
0.5l bottle. Cloudy orange color with white head. Aroma of banana, clove, yeast  and spices, somewhat parfumy. Taste is bitter and little sweet. Nothing spectacular.
Strong wheat and mild fruit taste. Texture is oily. Not really my thing, but much better than I anticipated.
The foam is resistant and dense. The aroma of wheat, fruits. The taste is the same wheat, wet crusts of bread and fruits. Few oiliness is present. Hops are a little bit there at the end.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow/golden in the glass, thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove, spices, wheat. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, low bitterness; flavors of esters in the kind of banana, clove, spices, wheat malt. Medium to high body, smooth texture, medium to high carbonation.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czas√≥w przed za≈Ço≈ºeniem konta na ratebeer
12 ounce bottle.Little bit of white head. Deep bronze in color and a little hazy. Sweet with wheat tone and smooth on the palate. Overall this beer is yummy and above average for the style.

Jeden z klasyk√≥w stylu, kt√≥ry w sumie nale≈ºy do moich ulubionych, wiƒôc z zainteresowaniem po niego siƒôgnƒÖ≈Çem. Piwo ma barwƒô s≈ÇomkowƒÖ, jest wyra≈∫nie zmƒôtnione, choƒá do pewnego stopnia przejrzyste, gdyby Weizen by≈Ç bardziej mƒôtny, to nie mia≈Çbym cienia pretensji. Piana ≈Çadna, obfita, bia≈Ça, puszysta, po opadniƒôciu pozostawia ko≈ºuszek na powierzchni, ale nie lepi siƒô do ≈õcianek. W aromacie dominuje banan i to wcale nie jaki≈õ bardzo wyrazisty. Szkoda, ≈ºe zabrak≈Ço go≈∫dzika, ale dla mnie najwa≈ºniejsze, ≈ºeby ten by≈Ç przede wszystkim w smaku. A w smaku... go≈∫dzika nadal brak. Je≈õli jest, to w ilo≈õci minimalnej gdzie≈õ w dalekim tle. Wiƒôcej jest banana, jeszcze wiƒôcej wyra≈∫nej kwaskowato≈õci, niby rzecz typowa dla piw pszenicznych, a z drugiej strony ta kwaskowato≈õƒá jest jaka≈õ taka nieprzyjemna, kojarzƒÖca mi siƒô z kiepskimi koncernowymi lagerami. W zasadzie brak jakiejkolwiek goryczki. Wysycenie jest wysokie, drobne, intensywnie musujƒÖce, co jak najbardziej typowe dla stylu. Piwo mimo wysokiego nagazowania, kt√≥re teoretycznie powinno dodawaƒá pe≈Çni, jest raczej wodniste i puste. Dla mnie Franziskaner to rozczarowanie. Klasyka stylu, kt√≥rƒÖ warto znaƒá, ale mnie nie przekona≈Ça.

Znakomita s≈Çomkowa , pszeniczna barwa. Obfita, drobnopƒôcherzykowa i trwa≈Ça piana. W zapachu ciep≈Çe go≈∫dziki, banany i guma do ≈ºucia.

Orze≈∫wiajƒÖce, kwaskowe, wysoko nasycone.
Goud gelig bier met een aroma van: banaan, bubblegum en tarwe. Smaak is identiek. Waterige afdronk.

Barwa z≈Çota, solidnie zmƒôtnione, piana bia≈Ça, obfita, nie≈∫le siƒô trzyma. W aromacie sporo banana, ≈õwie≈ºego, trochƒô go≈∫dzika i nut s≈Çodowych. W smaku p√≥≈Çwytrawne, wyra≈∫ne nuty bananowe, go≈∫dzikowe, do tego sporo podbudowy ze s≈Çodu pszenicznego, piwo jest bardzo g≈Çadkie. Wysycenie wysokie, prawid≈Çowo, goryczka leciutko zaznaczona, dobre cia≈Ço, dobra pijalno≈õƒá, rze≈õkie, zbalansowane. Klasyczny weizen, nie ma siƒô do czego przyczepiƒá, wszystko w jak najlepszym porzƒÖdku.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2017 Mi cerveza de trigo favorita. Un muy buen aroma, acompa√±ado de un sabor espectacular, unido a un regusto a trigo que no me dejan otras cervezas del mismo tipo.
Dentro de las Weissbier, mi favorita.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: Bottle pour. Wheat takes a while to settle down. Refreshing citrus/wheat aroma. Zesty body with only mild earthy wheat flavor.

Large head copious carbonation and cloudy 
Nose yeasty with some light fruit notes, banana
Lively mouth feel medium thin 
Tastes upfront Banana then bread, mid sweet and smooth
Not much following through but a pleasant drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromaty typowo weizenowe, banany i go≈∫dziki. Barwa z≈Çota, mƒôtne o obfitej pianie. Smak podobnie jak aromat, lekkie orze≈∫wiajƒÖce i smaczne piwo.

It¬ís so hard to find this in the US, I¬ím more of a dunkle guy but I fancy hefe & kristal. I consider this real beer and the taste lights up your palate! Beer that has been around for almost a century should tell you something!
Flesje gedeeld door TomHendriksen. Geelbruin troebel bier. Aroma is kruidig met een vleug van graan. Smaak is hoppig. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
Bier gedronken met Inoven en JoepvW bij de watermolen in Spoordonk. Het is een mooi troebel geel bier met een volle witte schuimkraag en een frisse afdronk.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer.
Bottle. Pours orange, white foamy head. Nose is floral, banana, bubblegum. Palate is tart, banana, bread. Good.

Copenhagen 24/12 2016. 50 cl bottle from Netto. Ancient Monk drinking beer with a very satisfied smirk on his face on the label. Pours opaque hazy orangeish yellow with big white head. Settles as 1 cm thick creamy layer of foam. Aroma is strong and of lemonade with hints of bubblegum and tart fruity notes. Medium carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is fresh and fruity. Medium sweetness followed by tart sourness. Nicely balanced. Not anything surprising - but a quite well balanced wheat beer. Well worth a smirk.

Z≈Çote, mƒôtne piwo o bardzo obfitej pianie, kt√≥ra zdobi szk≈Ço i pozostaje do ko≈Ñca w formie do≈õƒá sporej warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat i smak typowy dla wazicena banan i go≈∫dziki.Goryczka niska. Og√≥lnie typowa niemiecka pszenica, wszystko na miejscu, fajnie orze≈∫wia.

En klassiker blandt hvede√∏l. Smagen er meget hvedeagtig, med den klassike smag af syntetisk i eftersmagen.
Den har mere fylde og "gods" end mange andre hvede√∏l jeg har smagt.
herbs, citrus, banana, clove, ginger, vanilla, very, very dry. quite the experience to say the least. really depends on personal taste, but its worth a try. aroma is the best part.

Bottle from Alcostock in Tallinn, ¬Ä 1.89. BB 16.06.2017. Pours cloudy golden yellow with big creamy head. Looks great. Aroma of ripe banana, wheat products. Tastes soothingly sweet of banana and very soft white bread. Fine but active carbonation, good medium body, great drinkability. Better to drink it quite fast as it flattens considerably when you forget about it for 15 minutes. Wouldn¬ít mind having it again if it weren¬ít an InBev.

Proper white beer. Bought a few bottles from the local supermarket. Good colour, properly cloudy, proper weissbier smell. Really nice taste, just as it should be. I wanted some proper wurst to go with it!
Cloudy yellow with moderate white head. Malt aroma. Creamy and light, beautiful malt and wheat taste. A hint of sourness.
Piana ≈Çadna, piwo mƒôtne. Aromat banan√≥w z go≈∫dzikami. Wszystko gra. Prawdziwy hefeweizen. G≈Çadkie i miƒôkkie. Nie wyczulem kwa≈õnego smaku( kt√≥ry m√≥g≈Çby byƒá).
Excelente carbonata√ß√£o e refrescante, m√©dio corpo, boa forma√ß√£o de espuma, espuma espessa, grossa, amarelo alaranjado turvo, aroma de especiarias, aroma de banana, na boca lembra v√°rias frutas.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours hazy and cloudy orange golden with big, foamy off-white head. Lovely. Fruity, wheat and yeasty as you¬íd expect from the type. Clove, ripe banana, pepper spices, malt and slight hops in the nose. Flavour is similar to the aroma with more sweet ripe banana, wheat and yeast which is balanced by some sourness and spices. Fine balance, perhaps a little bit too sweet. Good have been good with some more bitter hops, but nonethe less great taste profile. Light-medium body, lively yet subtle carbonation and sticky texture. Great beer, very enjoyable.

Hazy orange to golden, small creamy off-white head. Choco-banana candy aroma. Overly ripe banana. Light sweet, fruity flavors, estery. Light citrus. Malty profile with perfumed fruitiness. Medium body, medium carbonation, abrupt fruity finish. Good.
Good beer but too heavy aroma and taste of banana etc. Its probably better for winter months.
Me encanta esta cerveza. Forma parte de las turbias de trigo que son de mis favoritas. Suelo consumirla de forma habitual.
This is exactly what I always hope every hefeweizen is going to be. Huge nose and good.
Mistig oranjegoud bier met witte kraag. Mandarijn, tarwe, deeg. Licht zuurtje, licht zoet, licht bitter. Prikkelend.

Well, had this several times but finally decided to rate it. Banana, citrus, bubblegum aromas with some spice and practically nonexistent phenolics. Wheat, dough also present. Could be a bit more intense in the aromatics department but nicely balanced. 
Appearance typically perfect for a hefe. 
Taste is similar to aroma with smooth sweetness from the wheat and malt and gentle spice bitterness from the hops. Bit more sweet than necessary, could have a higher bitterness level and more prominent taste that is again similar to aroma. Pleasantly balanced. 
Body is light to medium slick feel, lively.
Overall a superbly balanced and a very drinkable beer that is smartly made to appeal to a wide range of people.

Yeastery smell opaque body with a nice with head.
Grainy taste.
Medium body Balance toward a very light sourness.

Pours hazy orange with a dense, white head. Lots of banana and clove in the aroma, plus some malty, bready notes. The taste is banana, cereal, spices and some sourness, which provides balance for the banana-malty sweetness. The body is medium, the carbonation is medium to high. Very refreshing, drinkable and smooth on the palate. A good, classic weizen.
0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, banana and yeast notes. Hazy yellow color, white head. malty and yeasty taste, soft sour. Light body, watery texture, average carbonation and soft sour finish. Good.
Bottle from supermarket. Cloudy orange color. Such a large head. Body is thick and that feels good. Some banana and clove in the aroma.

Somewhere in the middle of yellow and orange, translucent, very hazy even for the style. Usual big and dense white head, not much lacing. Aroma is pretty strong: shows dominant banana, plus citric notes and an underlying dough/cereal base. Taste follows the aroma, obviously very much on the sweet side, but a slight hint of refreshing acidity helps attenuating sweetness. Some clove hints may also be noticed. Body is light to medium, crispness is maybe slightly lower than the average hefe. Overall it¬ís a pretty vivid and quite refreshing hefe, though a bit too much focused on banana for my liking.

Bottle from Tesco. Pours hazy orange with thick foamy white head. Aroma banana ,clove,fresh bread & bubble gum & floral notes .Taste is rich banana,bread,biscuit,clove, bubblegum & wheat cracker with some spice. Smooth & on the lighter side of medium bodied. The finish is dry ,wheaty with more banana & clove

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-orange with a white head. Aroma of yeast and banana. Light to medium body with a lively carbonation and a light sweetness. The taste is a little faint and not too exciting with pale malts, grains, apples, pears and cloves.
platano, platano y mas platano, cuerpo medio bajo y tipico final de trigo, para mi de las mejores de trigo comerciales

Bottle from Trader Joe¬ís. Finally rating this one after having it many times on draft at the Alehouse. It pours a hazy glowing orange color with a fine bubbled off white head. 500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, large, white, long-lasting white head, require multiple pours into the glass, good lacing. On tap at Kilkenny Ale House in Newark. Pours a cloudy, coppery orange with big foamy head with good retention.

In compensation, a nice creaminess that complements the refreshing finish. Another good warm weather brew.

Murky light brown, kind of unappealing looking beer with a huge, fluffy, white head and moderate carbonation. The nose has the expected sweet wheat and banana esters but also less pleasant funky aromas like mouldy fruit or bad breath. The taste is much better though with awesome sweet banana and clove and hints of apples and pears, bready and creamy notes and even a hint of smoke. A syrupy flavour stays on the palate for a while, a little too long for my liking. The mouthfeel is thick, smooth and slick. All in all an enjoyable beer but a little too syrupy and sweet to absolutely suit my tastes.

Pint 9 bottle shared. Pours a medium yellow to orange color slightly hazy with a white head. Nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is wheat, malt and bananas and some spice. Pours slightly hazy dark golden/orange with a small white head. Aroma is quite common Hefeweizen. Aroma of banana, wheat, yeast, some spices... Bit estery. Taste is malty and sweet with some bready, slightly spicy (cloves), mildly wheaty and some slight fruity tones. Tasty banana//vanillaish aftertaste as well. The palate is however a bit disappointing. Although Hefeweizens are often a bit thinnish, this one is a bit too watery for me. I would love to have had it a bit thicker and somewhat stickier in texture, since it would fit better with its full body. It is certainly good on sunny days like this, but it falls short by the Weihenstephaner for example.

I've been meaning to try this German classic for a while; I was mildly disappointed because of my overly high expectations, but this was certainly still an enjoyable hefeweizen. Nothing wrong with this one, but I would say the Paulaner and Wehenstephaner renditions had more character and robust flavor.

Esta weissbier muestra un color anaranjado con tintes dorados siempre en un fondo turbio t√≠pico de la cerveza de trigo. Su espuma es blanca y consistente y le aporta gran cremosidad. La entrada regala un cuerpo ligero y balanceado, con un paso medio que va en consonancia con su aroma, en el que saboreamos el trigo malteado, matices de lim√≥n y cura√ßao, caramelo, pl√°tano y clavo, en un fondo a malta muy agradable. El final es semi-seco, producto de su elevada carbonataci√≥n, pero regala una sensaci√≥n muy refrescante y completa que en ning√∫n momento llega a empalagar. El recipiente m√°s adecuado, y recomendado por cerveceo.com para saborear esta weissebier, es aflautado y alto, estrecho por la base y ancho por la parte superior. I acquired a taste for German Weissen beer during my time living in Germany in the late 80¬ís. This is one of the most common brands available in my local area bars and beer distributors. It has a nice amber color with a nice wheat / yeasty aroma. Pour slowly to avoid the massive head of foam. Very effervescent. The excess yeast filters to the bottom. Leave a little beer in the bottle to swirl around and finish the pour. This was an acquired taste for me switching from Pilsners to a wheat based beer but I haven¬ít regretted choosing to expand my flavor palate. Overall this is a good choice for anyone not familiar with this style of beer. I always have some on hand for me and the wife. Goes great with a little lemon wedge.

Classical helles Weissbier with a very stable, dense, mousse-like, sticky, creamy white head and a slightly orangey blonde colour, equally cloudy throughout the beer, as is to be expected in this style. Friendly and inviting bouquet, at least if you like fruity sweetness, with the unmistakable banana smell typical for the style and further impressions of ripe peaches, mango, apple sauce, cloves, cinnamon, very subtle black pepper, ever so slightly sourish wheat, biscuit; taste kicks off with a rich yeasty fruitiness (again the banana, apple and peach, hint of orange), very smooth and soft mouthfeel with medium carbonation, even a bit sugary but never cloying, powdery and supple at the same time, in the end the subtle wheat sourishness appears with a gentle drying effect to balance the sweetness, extremely thirst-quenching. Tasted this from a bottle and more recently from a can labelled "Franziskaner Weissbier naturtr√ºb". A perfect introduction to the style and very enjoyable.

It pours very cloudy and has a wonderful orangey yellow golden color with a big creamy white head. The head has great retention and makes nice lacing. The aroma has earthy/fruity yeast character with notes of banana, clove and lemony citrus. Its flavor has a smooth creamy malty wheat flavor with a big earthy yeast influence. There are notes of banana and clove with some light hints citrus and hops. It all finishes with dry dusty yeast and very mild hops with citrusy lemon flavors.
Its carbonation is soft but active with a smooth and slightly slick texture in its medium body

Hazy golden, white foamy head. Thin aroma. Taste is refreshing with banana and citrus tones on top of some grainy wheatmalts. Mouthfeel is light, thin watery body and lively carbonation. Decent German beer.

Review according BJCP2008 (style 15A). Bottle 50cl - Batch L013436. AROMA: slight banana aroma with a wheat background. no hop aroma. Transfer from BA review on 3-21-12 - 
Poured from bottle into fluted glass

Appearance ¬ñ Pours a hazy yellow-orange color with a very large billowy white head. The head has really good retention and lasts for some time before giving way to a moderate level of lacing.

Smell ¬ñ The smell is very peppery in nature. A nice lemon aroma is also mixed in there with a good yeasty smell as well.

Taste ¬ñ The taste begins with a nice wheaty base infused with some lighter citrus flavors. A good presence of yeast is also detected at the forefront of the taste. A peppery flavor develops more in the middle of the taste. It lasts throughout the rest of the taste profile and in the end mixes in with a more biscuit malt body leaving a nice somewhat spicy flavor on the tongue.

Mouthfeel ¬ñ A medium bodied beer with a rather average level of carbonation. Makes for an easy drinking brew which is quite appropriate for the style.

Overall ¬ñ A good brew that is easy to drink. It has some nice peppery flavors as well as some very nice aromas.

Hazy yellow color with big thick head. Fruity (banana and some orange) aroma, bread. Sweet taste. Medium body, soft carbonation. A fine Hefe.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled on 6/11/2013. Pours very hazy golden amber color with a 2 finger dense white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big banana, pear, apple, lemon zest, clove, wheat, bubblegum, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big banana, pear, apple, lemon zest, bubblegum, clove, wheat, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of banana, pear, apple, bubblegum, clove, wheat, bread, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice robustness and complexity of malt, and fruity/spicy yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and moderately crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with no warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent hefeweizen. All around great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle. Clouded honey in colour, frothy white head and good lacing. Gentle aromas of bready yeast and hints of banana and honey. More pronounced yeast, banana and honey flavours. Silky smooth mouthfeel, yet well carbonated as a hefeweizen should.

Although I¬íve had much better Hefeweizens, this still is a classic example of this style. Maybe the taste and the mouthfeel are a bit too thin for my liking, but still really quaffable.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2013 Poured from a bottle with a beautiful, cloudy golden color, and a thick white head. Citrus aromas.

Reviewed 3/6/13. This was probably the first beer I bought that I truly loved, so I¬íve been meaning to revisit this one for a long time. 12 oz bottle into a weizen glass.

A: Pours a darker amber color that seems both less hazy and fizzier-looking than others in the style. The head is a beautiful five-finger pale cream color. It has one of the softest-looking textures I¬íve ever witnessed in ANY beer head, and retains itself reasonably.

S: This one is relatively clove-forward, with the general malts being the secondary aromatic feature. It seems like this one comes off ¬ídrier¬í than most.

T: Differing from the nose, the flavor itself is quite banana-forward to start. The banana esters will fade to a midtaste/finish of lactic cream, wheat, and cloves. No real depth here, just a solid no-frills hefeweizen.

M: I wondered if the feel would be dry due to the lack of a sweet nose - and I was wrong. This is a creamy, semi-sweet weizen, and pulls it off well. The thickness of the texture conceals the high carbonation somewhat, but as the carbonation fades, it seemingly becomes dry - very nearly to the point of being watery. On the plus side, it becomes more drinkable this way.

O: I don¬ít know if this is quite the beer I fell in love with...ah well, it¬ís still good stuff. And it¬ís available practically everywhere to boot.
An amazing hefeweizen that is almost perfect for this type of beer. I definitely recommend this, you won¬ít be dissapointed.

Taste: slightly sweet and citrusy, banana-like initial flavor and lightly sour, yeasty finish with short duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and fizzy carbonation.

Overall: excellent. One of the best hefeweizens I have ever tried.

Overall, it¬ís a good deal better than the other big Hefes, but still a bit sweet for my sour tastebuds.

I prefer the much less fruity hefe weissens, and it could have more complexity in the body, but overall good beer.

Pours a cloudy dark orange brew with a two finger white head with poor retention, aroma is moderate to heavy yeasty and moderate sweet with notes of caramel, clove and banana, m√©dium to light bodied, refreshing, flavor is moderate to heavy yeasty moderate sweet and low bitter with notes of clove, banana, caramel and bublegum, slightly bitter finish; not bad but quite simple
Un bon ar√¥me de banane sur une bi√®re bien construite. Cr√©meuse avec un finish un poil sec.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellow gold body with a rather small fizzy white head that faded to a thin covering.  The nose is pretty spot on for the style, very fruity with lots of banana and light spiciness with a hefty amount of yeastiness.  Doesn¬ít get a whole lot better than this aroma, pretty nice considering it¬ís wide availability.  The flavor is a bit off kilter though.  There¬ís a lack of softness and smoothness here as well as a lack of the creamy mouthfeel that I want from the style.  There¬ís very little depth to this, there¬ís a bit of spiciness throughout, but it¬ís a little aggressive and overpowers what should be the subtle beauty of the style.  Lighter bodied and more fizzy than what I prefer for the style as well.  I think this beer is either a shadow of it¬ís former self from when I started to get into better beer, or maybe it¬ís just very different from what is kegged.  Disappointing.
500 ml bottle. Aroma powerful, yeast and banana mostly. Taste with wheat, yeast, banana. Rich and smooth

(From Notes 2010) Bottle from Thrifty Beverage Chester, NY. Poured into a Pilsner glass. Very murky gold color. One finger head, minor lacing. A yeasty smell, slightly earthy.

Taste is a bit doughy and a little sour for my taste. Not bad, just not my particular taste. As such, it is a little less drinkable than others in the category in my opinion.

Tasting notes:
Bottle at around 50F. Rolled to put yeast sediment in suspension.

Aroma:
Low banana and spicy aromas (esters/clove). Even at higher temperature and swirling in mouth. However low, very balanced.
Subble grainy, wheat aroma. Not powerful. No doughy aroma that you¬íd get from a fresh version.

Appearance:
Great tall fluffy white head. Very creamy and lasting. 
Golden cloudy as this is the unfiltered version.

Flavor:
Subtle but balanced Banana and spicy flavor. Wheat, grainy, but not doughy from the yeast as you¬íd see on a fresh version.
slight tartness from wheat, very welcoming.
Moderate hop bitterness balances the fruity esters of this beer. No hop flavors, such as floral, herbs, etc.

Mouthfeel:
Medium - med-low body. The sediment in suspension gives a front impression of fulness, but that is gone very fast. Creamy with a dry finish. Very carbonated. Spritzy.

Overall:
A good Heffe. Not as flavorful as the fresher ones, but that is expected from an imported bottle.
Appearance and mouthfeel as well as the moderately complex flavor is very inviting and quite light, which is accentuated by the effervescence of this beer.

Had right after weihenstephener. Both very good. This is just a little less dull and put together. I would not complain about having either in my glass. Find this to be pretty accessible and great summer beer.

50 cl. bottle split Kraddel. Hazy bright orange with a fading white head. Thick yeast, banana, lots of thick cloves in the smell, light orange peel and some fruit. Thick wheat bit orange peel wheat, some age showing, although BBF is still far away, light banana pure, thick cloves and spices, some light bitterness in the back. Thick wheat, pure,¬Ö body.

thnx to 77ships pours blonde big white foam .

Bottled 0.5l ; Devon ; UK ; Spice,fruity and yeasty aroma ; Golden cloudy color with proper head ; Sweeter yeasty and fruity taste with some bitterness ; Very nice beer.
Fruity aroma, clear white head. Beautiful hazy yellow colour. Fruity flavor, with some sweetness. Nice weissbier, one of my favorites.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden colour, foamy white head and aroma of banana, spice, orange rind. Taste is banana, fruity malty yeast & hint of orange, with a very slight bitterness. Milky mouth feel. Light body and medium carbonation. Quite drinkable.

Bottle at The Brussels Beer Cafe, Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. Poured a cloudy rich amber with a thick white head. The aroma is mainly of banana with a little citrus fruit. The flavour is mildly fruity, a little sour and slightly watery. The palate is disappointing. It¬ís a refreshing beer, no classic.
Draught at the Gingerman Pub Plano. Hazy golden color, bubbles rising, with a nice white top that vanishes over time. Banana, clove, coriander, orange peel. Highly carbonated on the plate. Delicious
Slightly cloudy. Nice white head. Lovely fruity, yeasty smell. Tastes like it smells, but a bit too light comparing to other weiss.

50 cl. Very similar to the Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier (both watery in my opinion). The only differences are that this one has a less full body. Another classic German Hefeweizen. Good drinkability.

Well made hefeweizen with a slightly spicy flavor and relatively marked hops. The familiar banana flavors appear in the aftertaste.

Tap at brixx Greenville - pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is heavy on the banana with a touch of clove. Palate is kind of creamy. Pretty good, but not the most exciting hefe I¬íve ever had.

Bottle from Tesco 311212
Orange, very hazy, big frothy white head that dissipated to a fairly thin bubbly layer, some lacing
Aroma - soft wheat, light spices, touch of clove, only a hint of banana, soft pale fruity malt, soft yeast ester
Taste - soft wheat, pale fruity malts in the background, light pale fruits, mellow yeast, quite spicy, some soft citrus. I like it that the spiciness is not overpowering but nice and subtle.
Palate - Soft to medium carb, medium body. Spicy fairly sweet fruity palate. Finish as main flavour, soft spicy, wheat, clean finish

Slightly hazy light yellow pour with small off white head. Aroma of malt, hay and corn. Taste of corn, wheat, slightly sweet, touch of citrus. Thin mouthfeel and getting some metallic taste lingering, might be slightly skunky. Thinking I must have got a bad bottle after reading some of the other ratings.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2013 50cl bottle in the restaurant of a German Intercity train. Hazy amber, nice lasting head. Aroma is classic: yeast banana spice. Similar flavor, smooth in mouth and easy to drink. Sound beer. A good introduction to this style for beginners.
Bottle.  This is a true classic that is a good go to in spring with some sour cheese and bread.  Takes you right to Munich.

Browniah yellow in color. Thick white foam which dissolves slowly. Aroma has banana and citrus in it. Very smooth on the palate. Taste is fresh with some orange and banana in it. Good aftertaste that vanes slowly. All in all a fine wheat beer.
Not really strong aroma with little fruity smell and more like a bad smell.(from the bottle) Nice "milky" look - my favourite. The taste was greatly flowing with touch of wheat and hops.
Smell is weak but inoffensive.  Pretty cloudy gold.  Taste is citrusy and smooth.  Light on the palate - sweet and not at all bitter.  Overall, one of my favorites.

Absolutely fell in love with this beer, citrus fresh malt aroma, tastes  citrus, yeast spicy like taste, malts nad hops balanced.
Perfect, light enjoyable beer!

Hazy gold with lots of tiny bubbles. Big, lasting frothy white head. Yeast, banana and spice on the nose. Burst of carbonation in the mouthfeel. More soft banana and spice in the flavour. This has an amazing lightness to it. Smooth and bright, lovely finish.
Very light smooth bodied beer with a slight fruity or citrus hint, but not overly sweet, would definitely recommend
500 ml bottle. Bought at Interspar, Austria, 0,85 EUR. Golden, hazy, white foam, citrus, herbs, medium body, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Very good German hefe!

Draft at Moriartys. Finally decided to get around to rating this. Hazy light amber pour with a big pillowy white head. Strong wheat notes on the nose. Feels fuller than most wheat beers but no strong flavors. Almost juicy. Light orange soda. Slight green banana. Toasted oats. Lemon pith. Some yeasty bready notes. Not bad, but is lacking in character.

Bottle - big foamy head, hazy dark straw color, fair German spice aroma and flavor, pretty good hefe

A little adjuncty but lots of bananas and some cloves, pretty nice but a little cheap tasting

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 Bottle at home. Dark golden hazy color, massive smooth white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, malts, something sweet also. Fresh wheaty taste, light-medium bodied, balanced, short taste, low co2, some citrus. I can imagine drinking this on a hot summer day. Easy and decent.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2012 Cloudy hazy orange appearance; Good foam with quite thick and lasting head; strong smell of yeast with banana and slight orange peel; underlining sweetness, rich taste with banana, hop taste is glassy but oh so slightly; Very easy tasting with a dry aftertaste.

Overall: It¬ís more solid than Erdinger Hefeweizen, very filling stuff . Its cloudiness, lovely foam, aroma and taste is typical of German hefeweizen. A joy!
Rating some beers from. Alimentary, first time I¬íve tried this one, been eyeing it for a while and it doesn¬ít disappoint

Smells like a typical german Weizen beer. Nice aroma. It has a sweet taste but with a "dry" aftertaste. It will taste a little bitter when you poor the last bit in, butt when when the glass hits the bottom, the better it will smell...

Het ruikt naar een typische duitse Weizen. Goed aroma. Het heeft een lichtzoete smaak, maar met een "droge" nasmaak. Het smaakt licht bitter wanneer je het bier naschenkt, maar het ruikt steeds beter naarmate je bij de bodem van het glas komt.

Bottle from Lidl. Appearance: Hazy golden orange, thick fluffy white head. Aroma: Orange peel, so very yeasty, banana, vanilla with a little grassy hoppiness. Flavour: Hugely yeasty, lots of banana and citrus peel, long fruity yeasty finish. Quite lovely and crazy cheap!
Bottle, 50 cl. Hazy golden, impressive creamy head.Nice fruity aroma, led by wheat and also a little malty. Nice taste, very drinkable but a little under Paulaner in my opinion.

Bottled, 0.5 l. Pours cloudy deep golden with large frothy white head and lively visible carbonation. Aroma of cereals, banana, yeast and light vanilla note. Taste starts with sweet and sour grainy malt, followed by fruity and spicy flavor with gentle hoppy finish. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. No need to complain about it...

Correct beer, without great failures but with no great achievements...Typical Hefeweizen, with banana, clove and some orange in the aromas and a watery texture that makes you miss a little bit of body. Smooth mouthfeel, refreshing, with notes to raw wheat, citrics, banana and spices. Good for its price (less than 2 euro...).

Golden hazy colour with a large creamy head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and some banana. With some grassy notes and a hint of citrus. Taste of wheat with yeast, lots of banana, some other fruits and a hint of citrus. Rather sweet beer. Good medium body.
Una gran cerveza alemana, de las mejores junto con la Paulaner. Gran apariencia y excelente sabor.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2013 1/5/2013 draught Bavarian Beer Cafe, Brisbane. Poured a cloudy pale amber colour with a two- to three-finger white foamy head that collapsed and laced poorly. High carbonation seen as lots of small bubbles forming trails. Aroma of sweet musty malt with spice/cloves coming through as the beer warmed up. Taste while cold was sour but as warmed up a small amount of cloves came through then this faded to a sour after-taste. Light to medium body. 
1/12/2012 On tap at Bavarian Bier Cafe, Broadbeach. Poured a cloudy amber colour with a three-finger white foamy head that collapsed and gave poor lacing. Aroma of spice/clove. Taste with subtle clove right through. Light body. Soft spicy finish.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Behanglijmgeur, wat niet negatief is bedoeld, met fruit element en stro. Smaak is zoetig pils, wat bloemen eromheen en dikkig mondgevoel, fijn bij eten. I think this is overall the best beer I have tried, it smells and tastes very unique, overall a pretty easy tasting beer  when it comes to taste and palate which isnt all to complex. For beer it also has quite a interesting arome in my opinion, both the taste and arome has a light touch off what reminds me of eggs. The most unique wiessbier when it comes to the world of beers!

Pours a golden yellow with a slight cloudiness to it.  Aroma is fruity with a slight spice to it.  Taste is of lemon and citrus mixed with a hint of spice possibly coriander.  Overall an easy drinking beer that was mildly complex.

Cloudy honey colour. Aroma of yeast and spruce. Flavour are grass, barnyard, some citrus and yeast. Smooth mouthfeel. A hefe-weissen without any flaws.

Aroma: banana, citrus - Appearance: cloudy, golden - Taste: medium sweetness - Palate: medium body, thin feel

Aroma.. fruity, yeasty, wheat
Quite sweet with sweet banana finish. Creamy.

Fresh, nippy aroma. Slightly creamy, strong foam head with a yeasty yellow hue like infected urine. Very refreshing and rather light, but not overly so. Strong metallic flavor, but not repulsive and laced with rice as in domestics.

Single bottle from a Publix mix pack. Pours a cloudy orange with a thick foamy head. Aroma is citrus, bananas, wheat, and a bit of mint. Flavor is bananas and anise up front, citrus and cloves following, with a bit of bitterness at the end. Really good palate for the style - medium body, a little oily and sticky. Very good example of the style.

Purchased this one on an impulse - I¬íd see it everywhere. This was a very refreshing Hefeweizen. The aroma pretty much matched the taste; lots of clove and yeast with light banana becoming abundant as it warmed up. The finish was a little tart and with a light body - was very drinkable.

Hazy dark orange with a thick disappearing off-white head. Strong smell of banana, yeast and spices. Medium thin body. Tastes of cloves, banana and yeast with a light citrus bitter watery finish. Liquid bread or dough. Not very enjoyable. A sad start to the style. Not sure why its so popular. Worst Hefeweizen so far.
Well executed hefeweizen from Munich.  Weizen aromas abound on the pour, head is perfect pillow of foam. Color is cloudy and amber. Taste has elements of banana and bread. Well done!

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2012 Pours cloudy orange with a good head. Has a fruit/ nut aroma to it with other hidden aromas. Tastes like I bit into a slice of banana nut bread with other hints of wheat and fruit. A good German wheat I will buy again.
Hazy golden colour. Aromas of bananas and cloves. A nice hefe-weizen.
golden, hazy, white foam, citrus, herbs, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Bottle from local Liquor Mountain store. Lovely banana and yeast aroma, maybe a little bacon, too. Cloudy honey-yellow color with a creamy off-white head. Starts off with good banana and spice; mid palate goes tangy and lemony; finish is mild banana and light orange juice. Thin-medium body. A very solid hefeweizen.
Draft to pint. Looks Good; a cloudy orange with white head. Smells of banana and clove. Tastes the same with an average mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Aroma fraco. Aparencia densa e muito amarelada. Sabor bem suave. Nao produz muita espuma

Pours cloudy orange with a thick, frothy head. Aroma of wheat, fruits, yeast and banana - very typical for a hefeweizen. Taste is light sweet, soft and refreshing. Notes of wheat, fruits and banana in the flavour. Light to medium bodied and slick,  palate is exactly what it needs it be - light enough to be drinkable but full enough to feel good in the mouth. Slightly souring finish. A well made German wheat beer.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Taste like any other Weizen you get in the shops, nothing special at all. Milky golden colour with steady head. Aroma of pure yeast and bananas. Taste of sour bread, yeast and overripe bananas. Too high-carbonated.

Bottle shared with McTapps. In the end this is just another simple weizen. But this one is not hurting us with maximum yeast in the aroma. Well, the taste is bit more sweetish than other weizen therefore this one was just a nice beer.

Aroma of spice, fruit, and some sugar.  Pale orange/yellow with thick, frothy head.  Taste hits powerfully with both sugary citrus and nice sour, yeast balance.  Carbonation is just right and spices tingle on the finish.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a long lasting white head. Light sweet aroma. Slightly sweet, wheaty flavour.

And so to Munich. Who¬íd have thought that 29 Acacia Road was in Germany? Not me, but then, what do I know? What I do know is that this pretty much does what it says on the label. Is there any beer brewed in Luton? How about Swindon?  Bognor Regis? I went to Bognor once. Can¬ít remember it. Think I was about 5. Time to split. (See what I did there?) NB This review won most question marks award 2012.

This ale has a creamy white head with a deep straw hue, it looks good enough to drink. Bread, caramel, peppers and fingerberry (banana) make up the smell. The smatch (taste) is, as to be weened, sweet with little to no hop bite. The mouthfeel is crisp and lively. Overall a good thirstquencher, but maybe a little light on smatch.
De trigo, ideal para tomar con los amifos refrescante pero de sabor fugaz en comparacion con otras cervezas del mismo tipo.
Poured from bottle (and tap last night), not bad for prepping the yard for autumn.

Hay and citrus, slight hint of fruit aroma too. Pours cloudy yellow-orange with medium white head. Tastes light sweet (a bit of banana there) and a bit watery with light bitter finish and lively carbonation. Body is medium and texture is oily. Overall, its an interesting hefe-weiss (which is my favorite style) but not even near to my first options.

Troebel gele kleur. Banaan aroma. Simpel mondgevoel maar wel goed doordrinkbaar en daardoor licht en lekker. 
Licht witbier met iets hop maar vlakt snel weg, daardoor wel makkelijk drinkbaar.

5/IX/2012 50cl bottle from my trip through Germany @ home - BB: VI/13 (2012-1011) 
Cloudy orange to beige beer, big creamy solid white head, very stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet ripe banana, some fudge, caramel, sweet malts, spices, little grassy, bit peppery. MF: good carbon, medium to full body. Taste: quite some banana, citrus, wheat, bit sweet and malty, refreshing. Aftertaste: green banana, hint of citrus, carbon (?) sourness, little sweet, slightly hoppy. Very decent Hefeweizen!

Decisamente meglio della Kristall, in pi√π i sentori di scorza di arancio sono pi√π evidenti. Un pelo pi√π frizzante del dovuto, poco amara ma acida al punto giusto! Dopo la Paulaner la mia preferita tra le weizen da supermercato a parit√† di prezzo

500ml bottle - cloudy yellow pour, white laced head,, sweet yeasty aroma. A fruity bite, with a nice fresh after taste.
On tap. Orange pour, not much head. Sweet malt aroma. Banana ? and  wheat  taste.

Cloudy golden pour, huge yeasty head.  Nose is hefe yeast, soft fruit and lightly kilned wheat.  Taste is surprisingly dry for nose.  Light body, lively carbonation and slightly sweet finish.  Great Hefe, very consistent.
Caramel, bread, banana, vanilla, cereal, nuts, toast, roasty, earthy, cooked vegetables
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. I¬íll add a more detailed description as I drink it again.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 Got a pint in a bottle at the local grocer for $3. Not usually a heff guy but this is very good. Crisp and fruity with a touch of bitterness. Like the viscosity and the finish.

Aroma has crisp citrus, wheat, herbs, pineapple, banana. Hazy amber, long creamy big head. Taste is bit like aroma but sweeter, lots of fruits. Light to medium body, soft and round, crisp, fizzy. ¬¥Light, fresh and tasty for thirst.

Large creamy white head on a cloudy, wheat-hazed deep golden body. Subdued banana aroma with hints of spice and orange peel. Classic and nice! Taste is sweet banana up front subdued by fizzy, wheat-pungency. Finish has hints of bitterness, but still on the sweet side. Medium body with lots of carbonation.
Though there are two other weissens that are readily available in Germany, this is the best weissen that can be purchased in the US
Bottled. Pours cloudy yellow with a big white head. Smells moldy, citrus and stingy. Tastes fresh bitter malty, and grape,

0.5 l bottle at Acoustic pub, Livno, BiH. It poured wonderful hazy orange body with big head. Very nice aroma, bubblegum, fruity, especially banana, some spices and yeasty. Flavor was mildly sweet, mostly chalky, lots of banana and cloves as well, pleasantly rounded although not strong flavored. Medium to full bodied with smooth, very pleasant, sweet and only slightly acidic wheat, chalk and fruity finish. A great Hefeweizen, possibly about the best I had although can only imagine better.

Eso est√° claro, antes que una Pilsen o Lager del monton, estando bien fresquita, dame una Franziskaner, pero bueno, de las cervezas germanas de trigo, posiblemente es de las peores. Tiene demasiado amargor, puede que caracteristico de la marca, pero resulta demasiado protagonista en un trago que no me termina de encajar...las hay mejores.

Bottiglia da 50 cl. Color giallo opalecente con schiuma abbondante  color sabbia di buona persistenza. Al naso un leggero citrico con sentori di frutta a polpo gialla e una leggera puzzetta di zolfo. Al palato √® leggermenti watery con sentori di frutta e cicca per chudere con un discreto amaro, gasatura abbatanza bassa.
