Aroma of banana with a nice spicyness. Very fruity flavor. Lots of banana and orange with some spicyness. Very refreshing. Awesome.

Enjoyed at the Palomino on tap on Thursday evening. Pours an orange gold to light gold fade to the bottom on a top glass with a medium white head clinging to the glass. Smells like carbonated orange soda and baking bread. Creamy, orange and carrot flavor with a smooth finish.
Nice wheat beer.  I¬íve had it bottled before, this was on tap in Germany. It didn¬ít taste significantly different.

Top notch. The beer smells like sweet lemon bread with notes of banana and clove. The beer is golden with a fluffy white head. Citrus notes blended with bread, clove, and a hint of bananas. Smooth and crisp.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy yellow with white head. 
Aroma yeast, banana, malts. 
Taste is sweet, little bitter, fresh. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Excelent hefe weiss!
Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, clove, & some bananas; Flavor of wheat, some clove, bananas, and citrus; Nicely balanced; Pretty decent.
Light orange with a bigh white head. Very much yeast in aroma, some citrus also. Sweet taste, can¬ít say i like it as much as other hefe-weiss, it¬ís too much yeast.
Had in a bottle very good cloudy color with a good refreshing crispness of this beer with hints of orange and spice in the aftertaste
Das es ein Hefe Bier ist ist die F√§rbung tr√ºb hell. Der geruch erinnert an typisches bayerisches Bier. Im Abgang sehr heffig. Insgesamt ein sehr gutes Bier.
Nice smooth wheat aroma. Vanilla flavour. Nice cloudy  appearance. Head lasts quite a while.
This is the perfect beer to drink year round. It has a great effervescence and hoppiness.
I guess it¬ís fair to call this a classic. Banana is strong but still all around lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Citrus lemon, malts, and the expected banana and clove aroma. Nice crispy weisse. Silky wheat, some not as appetizing lemony side, but the finish is fine malts and wet. Still good, but after sampling more weisse biers I realize this one is not as big a deal as I once thought.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Golden beer and cloudy, bananas, wonderful fruity yeast. The aroma is a wonderful smell, this is a beer of the Gods!
Truly one of the best. Spices take the taste up another notch in complexity, but otherwise it¬ís clean, golden, estery goodness.
Una gra heffeweizen . Con un gusti muy natural y deja recuerdos de cereal. En el paladar pesada y nutriente

This cloudy white golden beer pours with a full cream colored head. It has a refreshing mild almost fruity taste. This style of wheat beer is growing on me. I also really like the bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0.5L bottle, legit pour.  Absolutely decent, a great beer by any measure.  Make sure to follow the pouring instructions
One of the first hefe¬ís I tasted, at first it was too skunky and clovey, but now that my palate has grown, so has my taste for this beer!
Yellow pour with a banana and sweet malt aroma. Banana, wheat and clove taste. Good!

Van de tap in Berlijn. Lichtoranje met een mooie kraag die lang bij je blijft.
Aroma van sinaasappel en passievrucht en zo smaakt het ook gecombineerd met die wat melige weizensmaak.  Weinig body. Niet mijn ding dit bier.
Bottle. Cloudy golden beer. Fruity aroma. The. taste is of bananas and floral, very refreshing and quite sweet. I don¬ít know why i don¬ít drink more of these sort of beers because I love them.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Aroma: Vegetable and herbal notes.

Appearance: Murky orange body with a huge white head that gradually fades. No lacing. 

Taste: Flavours of banana, pear, yeast and coriander. Quite a bitter wheat beer. 

Palate: Medium body with a slick mouthfeel. Gentle carbonation. 

Overall: A solid, tasty wheat beer.
Hazy orange color with a thin layer of foam.  Smells of yeast, orange, banana.  Sweet taste, bitterness not apparent. Fruity aftertaste.  Minimal carbonation, light/medium body.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2012 Bottle; cloudy, orange, thin head; banana yoghurt aroma; spicy, creamy and refreshing with all the usual weissbier flavours - banana, clove, bubblegum - present and correct; whilst nothing in particular stands out, it¬ís a remarkably easy drink; an undemanding pleasure at the end of a long hot day.
Bottle. A very good German hefeweizen. Good yeast character and crisp refreshing finish.

A fairly clear appearance for a hefeweizen, this beer is an orange color. The head is very bubbly and recedes rather quickly, leaving minimal lacing. The aroma is of banana, clove, wheat, alcohol - what one would / should expect from the style, though not as mouth-wateringly tempting as I have enjoyed. The beer tastes very good, and is quite enjoyable. The mouthfeel is decent, but has room for improvement. The feel is similar to a soda in some regards - very fizzy and highly carbonated, making for a slightly harsh finish. There is a subtle note of alcohol in the finish. Overall, this is a good beer, and worth a try. In my opinion, Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier still sits comfortably in first place, and I would always choose it first when in the mood for a hefeweizen.
Qualified statement: don't like this style of beer much. Having said that, pretty mild taste. Not my favorite but not bad enough to piss me off.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours an hazy golden-amber with a nice two inch white head that slowly collapses.  Taste is of wheat, yeast, fruit, banana and some alcohol.  Similar aroma.  Has a decent body, slightly thin.  Good, but not what I was expecting.
500 ml bottle and on tap in Dublin. good example of a nice weissbier. Fruity taste. I recommend

Wonderful aromas of fruits mixed with yeast.  Mild banana and clove flavors with a edge of sourness balanced with sweetness.  Lively with smooth and creamy palate.  Very refreshing.  Great example of the style.
Cloudy gold color with a thin head. Grassy nose. Lemony, apple and pineapple notes to the flavor. Only slightly bitter and sweet. Finish a bit tart. Mildly refreshing.

50cl can thanks to Dutchdrebus. Cloudy hazy yellow color, small white head that quickly disappears. Smell and taste wheat, sweetness and banana. Soft mouthfeel, low body, low carbo. Actually better than most other hefe-weissbieren I¬íve had, but it just isn¬ít my thing.
Can @ home. Hazy yellow, small white head. Smells banana, malts, some weird earthly smell. Tastes banana, malts, ¬íroze kermis zoetstok¬í. Don¬ít like this. Low carbo, low body.

I am giving this rating based on a bottled sample. This had a much more muted flavor and aroma as compared to a glass of this beer on tap at Ebenezer Ale House in West Seneca, NY. there it tasted like the best hefweitzen I have ever had. I am looking for feedback if others had had similar experiences.

I had this in a bottle at pesto Caf√© in Fayetteville Arkansas. Served in a chilled glass. Great Example of a hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Franziskaner is a very good German Hefeweizen. Light aroma of banana and pineapple. Lovely weiss taste. Very good appearance.

Il colore √® un misto difficile da definire, presentando un corpo di un arancio scuro con intensi riflessi dorati. L¬íaspetto √® fortemente torbido, tale da impedire la visibilit√† del processo di fermentazione se non attraverso l¬íosservazione in controluce.
La schiuma √® uno dei caratteri pi√π belli di questa birra. Ad eccezione del colore, che risulta essere di un bianco sporco, si presenta particolarmente alta, compatta e pannosa, dalla scarsa persistenza.
L¬íaroma f√† perdere qualche punto, evidenziando come pecca una presenza scarna di odori all¬íinterno del bouquet di aromi. Vi √® un forte sentore di lievito, ed un lieve aroma fruttato di banana. Nel complesso un naso prettamente dolciastro, quasi burroso.
Il gusto √® qualcosa di portentoso: pieno e rotondo, con un gusto dolce di lievito che colma il palato e delizia la bocca, accarezzando in maniera estremamente leggera. L¬íimbocco dolciastro √® appena appena smorzato da un leggero pizzicorio amarostico a livello palatale. Una nota di amaro agre (cedro?) in punta. La persistenza amarostica √® scarsa.

From the bottle. Cloudy pale golden colour, white head, grassy aroma, taste is all banana and bubblegum. Surprisingly subtle and immensely drinkable. Probably the best hefe-weissen that I have tried. My wife is a massive fan too and gives it the firm thumbs up (she¬ís very much into weissbier).
The best hefeweizen around.  Lots of flavor and extremely easy to drink - either by the bottle or the stein.

This is my go to beer. It is always perfect for just about any occasion I have, and if I cannot decide between two beers I toss them and get this. Great aroma, pleasant, slight bitter beginning and then immediately smooth and ends with an amazing full bodied flavor.

A good beer, but a bland flavor after the amazing aroma. Pours out a bright cloudy orange gold with a massive and foamy soap bubble head. The head dies to a miniscule cap leaving a few lacing spots. The nose has a light zesty hop, grassy and toasted malt notes as well as a hint of coriander. Bubblegum and banana as always are appetizing on this nose. The flavor has a light crisp and refreshing wheat character with a bit of a citrus flavor. Bubblegum and banana smoothie come in on the finish. Thats it...quite lacking of overall flavor.

fles 50cl
kleur: gougeel, niet helder, flinke witte schuimkraag.
geur: graan, kruiden
smaak: graan, fris, klein beetje bitter
lekker fris bier

Encorpada, por√©m com sabor suave e levemente adocicada. 
Muito boa! Recomendo!

50cl bottle. Lightly hazy, orange/golden liquid with big white head. Nose : strong malty smell with light caramel notes. Barnyard. Sip : Creamy body with oily texture. Fluffy carbonation. Moderately sweet and a bit sour palate. Malty with metallic ending that leaves a bad breath. The aftertaste is metallic and sour. Buerk overall aftertaste....
One great weiss beer. You can feel the wheat starting from the aroma until the last drop of it. Has a sour taste in the begining and ends with a light sweet. A respectfull beer.
This sweet weiss is one of the best around. The caramel taste in the background puts this beer on the top #10 for weiss
Very fruity aroma!  Flagship of the style in my opinion.  Always a great choice after working outside on a hot summer¬ís day.
I liked the Clove after taste very much. However The initial sour taste was hard to look over.
Somewhat bland and frothy but none the less drinkable. Not the best from Franziskaner. 500ml bottle.
UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 Deep yellow towards orange and hay color wheat beer. Cloudy, fruity, yeasty.
Draft. Pours slightly cloudy golden with thin head. One of my favorite blonde ales and would definitely recommend.

From a bottle. Cloudy, yellow to light brown colour. White quickly fading head. Very fresh, malty aroma. Soft carbonation and watery mouthfeel. Taste is wheaty with mild, sour finish. Started really good but it let me down in the end.
Bottle. Pours golden orange muddy color with thick but quickly disappearing head. Aroma is wheat and yeast, slightly sour. Taste is wheat and yeast, slightlt sweet. Medium carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2013 Barva: nepr≈Øhledn√° oran¬ûovo-¬ûlut√°. Pƒõna: velk√© bublinky, kter√© na vrchu pƒõny p≈ôech√°zej√≠ v men¬ö√≠, stabiln√≠. V≈Ønƒõ: lehk√° ban√°nov√° a citrusov√° v≈Ønƒõ s t√≥ny h≈ôeb√≠ƒçku a s nen√°padn√Ωmi kvasnicemi na konci. Chu≈•, ≈ô√≠z:
fantasticky pln√° a svƒõ¬û√≠ chu≈•, kter√° prakticky kop√≠ruje v≈Øni. Kr√©mov√° chu≈• ban√°n≈Ø, kter√° se m√≠s√≠ s citrusov√Ωmi plody .Velice vyv√°¬ûen√Ω a adekv√°tn√≠ ≈ô√≠z a su¬ö¬ö√≠ konec d√°v√° tomuto pivu opravdu kr√°sn√Ω celkov√Ω dojem skvƒõl√© p¬öenice.

Pours a murky orange with a thin white head that leaves lacing.  The aroma is a beautiful blend of spice and fruit.  The taste pretty much follows suit.  It¬ís a pretty solid blend of spice/fruit but the taste just leaves a touch to be desired for me.  Don¬ít get me wrong, it¬ís very well balanced but there¬ís just  something I¬ím missing in flavor explosion.  Otherwise, a very solid beer!

500ml bottle pours a hazy yellow gold color with a 2 finger white head that settles slowly and leaves very little lacing behind.  Aroma is orange citrus, banana, clove and yeasty with a mild spicy hop.  Taste is a light citrus fruitiness and malty sweetness with some banana and cloves and a spicy hop bitterness.  Light to medium body with loads of carbonation.  One of the better German hefes on the market, very satisfactory and highly recommended.
Aroma, paladar e aparencia sensacionais. Uma das melhores cervejas weiss do mercado na minha opiniao.

On tap at Barley & Hops in Temecula, CA. Cloudy orange color. Wonderful smell: orange, spice, maybe banana. Taste is smooth and sweet. This is a great hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Classic cloudy banana hefe, on tap at Fighting Cocks in Moseley - they have good range, including Sierra Nevada Pale ale and Brooklyn lager on tap - standard, not spectacular.

Classic spicy citrus and banana over hints of tannin. Many hefes have this odor, but this one is especially profound. It¬ís a hazy yellow, although one can see through it to the other side of the glass. The taste bud fall to an avalanche of bitter, spicy, sweet and tart in that order. Get your first impression quickly, as it will quickly saturate the palate. Feels smooth and zesty at once. A great series of contrast. Allegedly ruined by InBev, although what would they gain from changing it? Seems fine to me.

Pours a hazy golden orange from the bottle, with solid white dissipating head and little lacing. Aroma of german yeasts and citrus, taste follows suit with that characteristic hefe funk. One of the cleaner and better finishing weisbers out there.
Instantly fell in love with this World Class Weissbier! There have been 2 beers that have made this kind of impact. And I¬ím glad it took a trip to China to discover this jewel...
Stor & trevlig skumkrona. J√§st, syrlig frukt och lite banan. En av de b√§sta hefe som finns.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with loths of rising bubbles, lasting white head and some lacing.  Aroma has lots of cloves, banana, and orange.  Taste is on the edge of bitter with a bready finish.  Very lively mouthfeel, due lo lots of carbonation.  Medium body.  One of the best in its style.

Served on tap into a Weizen glass.  Poured perfectly with a bulbous, billowing white head.  Deep orange in color with a beautiful haziness characteristic of the style.  The nose is a wonderful blend of fruit esters, especially bannana, and some clove.  The mouthfeel is firm and good carbonation.  The taste is spot on with banana, orange peel and spice of cloves.  Very refreshing and my standard for all hefeweizens.

If you¬íre into Hefeweizen, this is one of the best traditional examples. It has a light straw color with a white head. A great aroma that prepares you for the taste to come. Don¬ít drink this with lemon as it will crowd the citrus already there. If there is one downside to this Hefe, it would be the overly carbonated mouthfeel that makes me burp with almost every sip. Otherwise, if you are in the mood for this style, it¬ís a great choice.

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. Pours a nice, golden, sunflower color. Hazy beer with a large, white, cloudy head of foam. The aroma is lovely banana and clove esters with some orange thrown in the mix. Taste is just a touch sweet and on the verge of tartness, without actually stepping over that line. Finishes light and bready. Impressively long finish. The only downfall of this beer is that it¬ís taken me so long to try it. Glad I finally did. This is a fantastic beer!

Poured cloudy golden-orange, with a big, foamy head.  Aroma is oranges and sweet citrus.  Taste is smooth and fruity.  Orange is apparent, with a little bit of lemon rind hidden in the hop profile.  Great hefe!

The head is nice and fluffy and white. The aroma is sweetly appealing. The palate is lively, but not quite a tasty as some other hefeweizens I enjoyed, but it was an older bottle. Still, a very good beer.

Tap.  Hazy golden pour with a froth of white foam.  Aroma is banana and clove with a soft, wheat malt backbone.  Taste is clean clove with light banana followed by some pepper and wheat.  Quenching and clean mouthfeel.  Man, I need to drink more hefes.

50cl can from Albert Heijn.
Nice white head,  Hazy blond pour.  Nice and drinkable.  Bannana notes
Bottle at bar. Thick orange color, white head. Sweet fruity taste with banana, grass and citrus. High carbonation. A bit bitter finish. Good weissbeer.

Bottle. Rating #2168. Lightly hazy and dark gold in color with a decent white head. Nice aroma, a little banana followed by a touch of lemon and wheat. Sweet and mildly bitter, more banana with a citric bite in the finish. Tasty. (2389)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours the expected golden with the good white head as is the standard of this style.  Aroma is of banana, wheat, and a bit of orange.  Aroma is the same, mostly banana and wheat.  Pretty crisp, but a little more bland if anything.  Not as good as my previous beer rated 15 minutes ago, but similar.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Golden beer with aroma of banana and yeast. Medium palate; carbonic. Taste includes yeast, wheat and banana. Good wheat beer.
Kullankeltainen, samea, vaahtoaa runsaasti mutta vaahto katoaa nopeasti. Tuoksussa banaania ja hiivaa. Suutuntuma keskit√§ytel√§inen, hiilihappoinen. Maku vehn√§inen, banaaninen, hiivainen. Hyv√§ hefeweizen.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 from bottle. hazy orange colour with a white frothy head. aroma is yeast, banana, pear, citrus, some orange and some bubblegum. I could smell this all day long!! medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation. nice fruity flavour of banana, citrus and vanilla. not too sweet. very refreshing, wonderfully balanced and excellent beer!
0,5l bottle. Hazy yellow color. Nice thick white head, stays. Wheat, citrus in aroma. Creamy, citrus, wheat, light sweet flavor. Nice beer.
Pours hazy golden with a high head. Aroma banana, hops, wheat. Some citrus. Very classic wheat. Not Bad.

50 cl bottle @ Pub Pikilinna, Tampere.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of grass, citrusy fruits, yeast and wheat. Flavour of wheat, spice notes, hay, yeast and fruits. Well balanced hefe.
4435

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 500ml on tap. Fresh, yeast-ish, sweet, fruity, banana aroma - not often you get such a great Weizen aroma. Apperance can?t be better. Just what you expect from a Weissbier. Dark cloudy orange with a hughe white head. Light bitterness, very sweet. Has a nice, soft, almost creamy but still refreshing mouthfeel, a soft carbonation and a long banana-ish finish. Overall, this is a Weissbier I always have some bottles at home. I love it.

This gets full marks guys! This beer ticks every box for me! It is absolutely amazing, not only was it the beer that got me into craft but it is a spectacular beer! Pours a beautiful large head. Lovely banana like aroma, sweet and smooth body with a banana like taste. It¬ís beautiful golden colour really highlights the warmth of the beer. This is one of my all time favourites and a frequent revisit, if you haven¬ít had it... give it a shot!

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 Fantastic, best German Hefeweizen to date. Immediate full but calm citrus taste with a lasting flavor. Slighlty heavy even view when stirred not lumpy. Pours great in a weizen glass witha full head and carmel/yellowish body. Reminds me of being back in my local in Jettenbach, Germany.

One of the best weiss beers I¬íve had!  Once you pour you get the immediate citrus flavor but it¬ís not overpowering.  Looking at the glass you pour it it in is like a lava lamp with bubbles.  Tastes great, smooth and nice finish.
A sweet, citrus-like aroma.  Pours medium gold, cloudy, with a frothy white head.  Has a bit of spice to it, but is rather smooth overall.  A fairly decent, drinkable hefeweizen.
Very nice, well-rounded hefeweizen. Nice deep golden color and cloudy. Light wheat flavor with prominent orange notes and aroma lasting throughout.
Nice puffy white head with slight citrus aroma. tastes slightly citrus. overall slightly above average
Rather solid throughout for a Hefeweizen. This beer seems much more defined to the palate than other Hefeweizens.
This beer looks great, but then you taste it. Light lemon flavor and smooth mouth feel, but this beer is not enough. Needs more flavor, more hops, just more.
Bottle. Puts cloudy orange worth a finger of puffy white head. Aroma is very fruity with orange peel being prominent. Taste is sweet and full of orange and a little lemon. Finish is smooth.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 0.50cl Bottle. Used my Hefe-Weizen glass, approximate temperature of 7¬∫C. This is definitely one of the best beers in the Hefe-Weizen world. Strong banana and fresh wheat aroma, cloudy beer with a top quality thick long-lasting head. Medium to heavy sweetness, very fruity flavour indeed. VanDer.
straw colored with healthy head. strong banana and hints of sweetness. almost effervescent with excellent carbonation. i¬íve yet to find a hefe that tops this. reasonably priced as a bonus.
Very fruity aroma.  Orange color minimal head.not much taste up front.  Poetry sweet after.  Light easy drinking.  Not much to it but guid for a hot day.

Kdy¬û lahvov√Ω kvasnicov√Ω  weizen, tak Franziskaner, nebo t≈ôeba Maisels weisse. (samoz≈ôejmƒõ kromƒõ Schneideru..kde dƒõlaj√≠ lah≈Ødky) V¬öechno jak m√° b√Ωt, v√≠ce ban√°nu, m√©nƒõ h≈ôeb√≠ƒçku, ho≈ôkost minim√°ln√≠. Chu≈• kvasnic a sladu - lahoda:-)
Weissbier yellow hazy color with large foam head. Sweet fruity taste, citrus, and nice smooth finish. One of the originals. (Velp 201201)

Oct 2006 from BA: Poured into the correct glass, it looked a picture, good white head on a body of bubbling, cloudy, soft golden coloured liquid. 

From then on it went downhill, in every aspect. 

No aroma of banana¬ís or vanilla, which is what I have come to expect from a good hefe-weissbier. It didn¬ít smell of anything really (the beer is was in date and at the right temp). 

Sharp taste but not tart enough for me, average is being generous for this style of beer, compared to many others. 

Weak flavours and a thin feel to it, leaves a bad taste in your mouth.
Had this beer at the 4th Annual Casanova Beer Cave Festival. Not over powering banana/clove, good for a hefe.

Mmm nice Belgian style. Such a soft aftertaste. It's what you'd expect when opening a beer like this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2014 Hazy orange colour with huge head. Aroma is yeast, citrus. Flavour is sweet, wheat, banana.
Aroma was very yeasty (maybe I stirred up the sediment before pouring). The taste is silky smooth. Not a huge fan of Weiss but I can appreciate the finer points of this one
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Great weisbeer. Strong banana flavor. Nice crisp almost watery taste to it. Lots if spice. My favorite everyday beer by far.  6 pack from tjs ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Typical german weissbier. Great oily palate, banana and cloves in the flavor. Might be from a cheap 50cl can but it is good. At the lical C1000 supermarket in Wilnis.

12oz bottle into a weizen glass.

Pours a hazy brownish orange with a one finger head. Pretty poor head retention and lacing.

Smell is quite yeasty with loads of clove coming through along with a light musty odor. A small amount of bubblegum and orange too.

Taste has a lot of bubblegum and clove but not a whole lot of orange. A definite yeasty quality is there but nothing is present in large amounts. Honesty it taste really watered down. Mouthfeel is extremely watery.

Overall I was a little disappointed by this beer. I¬ím not sure how fresh it was but I have had much better hefe¬ís. Might have to revisit it sometime.
Bottle. Banana, citrus, yeast, wheat malt aroma.  Hazy golden with a large white head. Banana, citrus, wheat malt, clove flavor. Medium body and carbonation. Nice blend of spice and fruit.

Pours a hazy gold with heavy carbonation and a thick pillowy white head. Aroma is orange citrus and bananna bread. Taste is very yeasty, orange peel, bananna bread, fairly light body. slight amount of spiceyness to it. A very refreshing tasty Hefe.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange body, that stays fully. Very yeasty aroma, I expected it to more banana-like. Flavor is malty, with notes of orange. Medium body, watery texture. It¬ís a decent hefe, but I have surely expected more.
Solid - by the end the banana is a bit more than I would like, but what a great beer.

Tap. Pours hazy gold with thin, creamy white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is citrus fruit, straw malt, banana, grassy hops, and light spice. Flavor is balanced malt and fruit esters with light supporting hops; sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation with low warmth.
A light hefe with a hint of lemon and orange. Cloudy light yellow pour, fluffy light head. Pretty good.

Solid, crisp hefeweisen. What it lacks in complexity, makes up for in drinkability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap in Lady Godiva, Geneva watching a glorious boat race victory. This is mid coloured orange-brown weissbier with a good white head. Taste is quite complex, some yeast, spice, apple and a bit of toffee. Nice.

This is one of my favorite beers That I have had since beginning my ratings. The pour is a delight as a cloudy dark amber with a glistening white head pours from the gold foil bottle. It has a strong citrus aroma and it has a good bread-like smell to complement it too. Th taste is similar to the smell too. Overall it is a good beer almost warranting a 4.0 on the rating scale too. Good Drinkings
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2012 Pours opaque gold with a medium white head. A hint of banana. A good hefeweizen

Tulip snifter from bottle. A: lots of citrus, orange peel, and coriander-true to its roots. App: super cloudy, golden hue. One hand, not finger, thick, white, slowly dispersing head. Gorgeous! T: some what sweet up front, floral, bready, and grainy on the back. Short this aftertaste of orange peel. P: firm, hard bubbles, goes down crisp, bubbly, and smooth.
Great wheat beer. Very cloudy, settled yeast, great aroma and taste, crisp with a clean finish.

This is a good beer. Naturally cloudy, great aroma and taste, very crisp, even a bit yeasty. Could have had a bit more of a fruity taste, but who am I to criticize the German purity law and the long history of great beer making?

Bottle. Pours dark hazy golden, medium white head. Aroma of orange, spices, and peach. Taste is medium sweetness. The fruit and spice are present in the flavor and finish. Medium-light body, smooth and crisp finish. Overall this was quite refreshing and tasty.
On tap.  Hazy and murky.  Aroma of cloves mostly and high hop content.  Taste of clove, mouthfeel is tart, clingy and spicy.  Quite a tongue buster.
Pours with a thick white head, it¬ís slightly cloudy, but light gold in color. Nice citrus tones to it.

Dark yellow , orange cloudy hazy body with white creamy long lasting head. Aroams wheat, yeast,  peaches, banana, nutty. Palate medium bodied, with slick little watery mouthfeel. Carbonation is smooth , tart, smooth and mouthful. Taste is dry from yeast, distinct wheat, with some citrusy fruity notes. Aftertaste is astirgent sweet, fruity. Finish refreshing, no bitterness some grassy wheat malts. Overall light Weissbier surely drinkable, however balance lacks in the middle taste, palate being thin and dry yeasty notes overcoming the smooth flavours composition. Ok, but not the best Weizen. Somewhere higher average level.

Cloudy orange-gold colour with big head. Aroma ob barley malt, bread, banana and some citrus hints. Oily structure, lively carbonation, acidic/sweet taste and aftertaste. My favourite German Hefe Weisse so far...
Pours a cloudy golden color with thick white head.   Malty,  orange aroma.   Lots of raisin,  malts,  clean palette.   Pretty good.
Bottle, pours clean bronze with towering pillowy head, aroma is heavy mix of wheat and banana/clove, big and wheaty with tons of banana throughout, finishes fairly clean a classic
golden haze, aroma of toast, orange, coriander, very earthy, flavors of orange, coriander, toast, biscuit, grass, slight yeast, decently bitter, nice body, very solid for the style

Pours a cloudy orange with thick white head, lots of lacing.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, orange, clove, and a bit of nuttiness and smoke oddly enough.  Flavor matches well and does the job, but just not in my top hefes.

Slightly hazy orangish yellow with a light white head. Smell is a nice mixture of yeast, sweet oranges, and lemons with a hint of cloves. Taste is full of crisp lemon, orange peel, clove, and a hint of pepper with a nice backbone of wheat and a decent bit of crisp hops.

50 cl bottle @ Palaveri, Sein√§joki. Rated on 24.04.2011
Aroma is refreshing with banana esters, some bubblegum and wheat. Flavour has banana esters, bubblegum, some citrus, wheat and yeast. Refreshing stuff for a hot day ¬ñ but still not too straightforward.
resin, toast, bread, cooked vegetables, cheese, banana, vanilla, orange, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, full body, creamy, lively, bitter, long finish,

Enjoyed with a jam sandwich witch was a nice combination. Beautiful rich inflected amber color with a medium mouth feel. Not as bannany as a Hefeweissen and slightly more carbonation and every bit as enjoyable. .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden color with overly abundant white puffy head that made the pour difficult. Smell was stong on cloves with banana notes. Taste was sublime and loaded with cloves and other spices. Finished great.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 Un p√≤ pi√π delicata e meno persistente della Paulaner. Classica Hefe-Weissbier di Monaco. E quindi  sapore di banana e aroma di bubblegum. Frumentosa.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy orange with a huge frothy white head.Aroma of yeast, cloves and citrus. Taste is wheat with the banana and clove easy detectable, moderate sweet aftertaste. A good hefe.

On tap poured into pint, also served with orange slice, removed from the glass

A: nice hazy golden color, slight head with ok retention. Good bubbling carbonation

S: clean aroma, mainly wheat and banana 

T: clean taste, fruit esters from yeast, clean wheat

Tasted from 1pt 9oz bottle into nucleated tulip glass. Poured a beautiful, cloudy orange color with enormous white foam and lasting lace. Strong banana yeast esters, hints of rising dough and whole-wheat bread, very faint noble hops. So many interesting dichotomies: it tasted sweet and dry at the same time, light but somehow full-bodied, simply good but also quite complex, satisfying but addicting. So very flavorful, no wonder it¬ís such a frequently imitated style. I¬íll definitely be purchasing this classic again.
I  hate it! I found a little bit disgusting Banana flavour that I didn¬ít like at all.
Bottle. Solid Hefeweizen. Banana and citrus flavors. Average carbonation. Finish is a bit thin.
Bottle. One of the best GHF I¬íve ever had. Poured gold-hazy, stable, thick head, great aroma of banas, fine yeast. Banana dominates the very pleasing, well-balanced taste.  Nice one.
A great hefe weiss with a cloudy orange color and a nice foamy head.  Nice hint of fruit in taste with a pleasing aftertaste.  Always a favorite.
50 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy old yellow with a white head. Yeasty aroma with lots of banana. Taste is also heavy banana, cloves and yeast. Great weizen.
From a 50 cl bottle at home in Sk√∂vde. Pale golden/yellow hazy beer with a offwhite head. Fruity aroma with banana and citrus and some pineapple.  The same flavour. An ok weissbier.
Bottle. A good example of a hefe. Good full flavour with well balanced banana, clove and yeast. Very drinkable.
Tasting faintly of yeast, fruit, and cloves, this beaker of golden sunlight will delight the most discerning of tasters.

Draught at Little Prague, Tel Aviv. Pours cloudy orange with nice, white head. Aroma: bubblegum, banana and faint clove. A little sweet, a little bitter, a little watery. Light body, lively carbonation, short finish.

Appearance was cloudy golden with 2 finger head that last awhile and good lacing.Aromas are bananas with  sweet yeasts, spices are there, no hints of alcohol. Taste was heavenly Hefe, cloves, bananas sweet biscuity yesats. Mouthfeel was estery yeasts with tight carbonation with creamy body with a smooth long sweet finish. Beautiful Hefe...

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 0.5 bottle. Rich aroma consisting mostly of fruity scents, banana and some minor clove touch. Nice light orange color, naturally hazy although the head has rather mediocre if not poor retention. Taste is a mixture of sweet and sour tones, crisp and refreshing, flavor is slightly too soft. Medium body and thin texture with some average carbonation. Finish is surprisingly indecisive. Overall a very good beer, highly drinkable, not flawless although really nice as for a mass produced beverage.
12 oz bottle poured a cloudy golden color.  Aroma is yeast and a hint of fruit.  Taste is of yeast and bananas.

Cloudy off golden color with a white head that stays with the beer throughout the session. Banana¬ís and spice dominate the flavor with a slight sour finish. This is a refreshing beer that is made more for spring and summer than winter. A good overall beer with lots of flavor.

Pours yellow frizzy with low head
Low tones of wheat corn and bread
Taste is frizzy refreshing and a bit metallic. Ok weissbeer
Pours a cloudy golden with lots of white head. Bananas on the nose and palate, also a very nice slightly sweet finish. Smooth and drinkable.
Golden/Orange and hazy with a nice big head. Very intensive smell of yeast and banana followed by a similar taste with a bit malt/sweetness. full bodied and lively carbonization.

Cloudy amber pour with a foamy white lid. Heaps of citrus, hops, pine, hay and spice aromas. Full bodied with medium high carbonation. Very refreshing and vibrant with slightly sweet/sour from the citrus. Spicy with lovely pine forest sensations. Not too dissimilar to the Vitus I rated a few beers ago but less complex. Very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled, really good weizenbier, as usual!pale, medium sweetness, lightly bitter,
500ml bottle, Tesco. A straight-up Hefe, with plenty of cloves, spices and banana. Sweet and creamy, soft on the palate, clean lemon and orange finish, which is a bit short. Lively mouthfeel.

Bottle. Medium hazy light copper colour. White disappearing foamy head with minimal lacing. Balanced and fresh aroma is mostly banana and yeast. Malty banana flavour. Medium body. Strong carbonation. My favourite Hefe Weissbier.

500 ml bottle. A classic hefe that delivers all you¬íd expect from the style. Pours a deep hazy amber with a firm, fluffy white head. Aromas are banana and summer fruit. The taste brings more banana balanced with spice, some grassy hops and what appears to be rye. This is a complex and quite refreshing experience. Good value too.
12 oz bottle. Pours beautiful translucent honey with an inch of head. Familiar citrus clove nose. Taste is more of the same with a mild lingering aftertaste. Good mouth feel. An old friend.
Franziskaner weissbier glass, shaked hefe. Taste: heavily sour, bitter long finish.white foam,

Aroma is big orange and citrus with a hint of bread and nuts. Light golden in color with a massive foam top. Taste is incredibly sweet with flavors of orange and citrus. Thin, crisp texture with a pleasant, lingering fruity finish. Overall, A very refreshing and flavorful brew with a spectacular finish. I¬íd give this an A rating.

Vacker. Brygden skall h√§llas upp r√§tt bordust i glaset..gjorde inte det f√∂rsta glaset och d√• vart den p√• tok f√∂r kolsyrad och smakl√∂s. Men g√∂r om g√∂r r√§tt som s√§ger - s√• blidde den trevligare..anar lite banan och kanske lite nejlika. Men den √§r ganska intets√§gande. OK no more no less.
Crisp with aromas of dough with a light touch of fruit. Overall, really good and enjoyable.

Pours a hazy orange with a nice soapy head that stays around forever. Aroma of bananas, dough, and some light fruit. Taste confirms the scent with a bit of a buttery taste and a little fizz on the tongue. Overall not a bad beer from a style i typically dont care for.

Very good I Can¬ít complain on this wonderful hefe no complaints here................

Complex Weissbier but when poured correctly is about as perfect as it gets.

12oz bottle from Pick¬ís poured into a shaker. Pours a hazy dark gold with about half a finger of white head. Light aroma of banana and clove. Taste is lightly sweet and watered down. Banana and clove, barely. Light bodied with a thin yet creamy texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, it¬ís ok. Nothing to write home about but drinkable nonetheless.

08-01-12 Bouteille 500ml: Superbe couleur jaune-orang√©e et dor√©e, trouble, avec une forte effervescence et un √©pais collet de mousse blanc et l√©g√®rement cr√©meux qui disparait tout doucement. Nice orange cloudy jefe weisse - not massive banana or clove but pleasantly subtle. Judas priest!
Its hazy with small a high head. It smells fruty and notes of wheat dough. very light and yeasty beer. Overall a very easy to drink beer
h√¶ldes i h√∏j glas.. generel lys ravfarvet, meget lille let skum.. smag ok.let til moderat bitter i efter smagen... Netto.
Poured a hazy orange with a pillowy white head. Aroma was spice and banana peel. Taste had spice and citrus notes and became more lemony as it warmed. Pretty good and very easy to drink.
Franziskaner hefeweizen is one of the best hefeweizen beers available.  It has a great balance of yeast to malt and hops and the solids level fits nice in the mouthfeel.
Det h√§r √§r en god weissbier med mycket smak av citron, j√§stf√§llning och n√•gon opreciserad krydda. Dessutom med en god arom. Slutsats: en riktigt bra weissbier.

Bottle. 12oz. A classic hefeweizen with a cloudy complexion and golden color - fluffy off white head. Aroma of banana and fruit. Malty grain and oats in the nose too. Oaty, banana, and fruit flavors mix with a touch of hop bitterness and spices. One of the most delicious beers I have ever had. It was just tasty and I can¬ít wait to purchase again.

On tap.
Pours a murky golden colour, firm head. 
Fresh fruity notes in the scent.
Sweet citrus flavour.
Goes down clean and fresh.
Fine orange hazy color with big white head. Good wheat aroma with notes of bannana.  Flavor of banana and wheat. This is how a good german hefe weisse shold taste like.
Bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon, portugal. Cloudy golden appearance. Thick smooth white head and texture. High fruit/wheat aroma. Low to medium bitterness and low sweetness.

An old favourite that I¬íd never thought to rate. However, my last taste was from an INFECTED 5 litre keg (one of a batch expiring 01/12) where the usual banana aroma was overwhelmed by a sharp, tangy lacto sourness and abrasive acidity... it had accidentally ended up a pretty authentic Berliner weisse, enjoyable on its own terms. Ordinarily though, Franziskaner is an archetypical phenolic Bavarian wheatbeer - one of the best that is commonly and readily available.

Into a weizen glass at Uber in Seattle. 

Pours murky golden with about two to three fingers white head. 

Smells are subtle but straw, wheat, and light honey. Very fresh.

Tastes crisp and fresh. Subtle flavors but what you expect from a weizen.

Palate was smooth, crisp, and refreshing. 

Overall, a very good example of what a hefeweizen should be.

Pours hazy dark oragne, huge rocky head that forms a beautiful cap, incredible retention.  Aroma is banana, clove, wheat malt, bread.  Taste is flaked wheat, clove, banana, tons of bread, hints of nuts.  Body is light, sticky, frothy with tiny bubbles, effervescent, dry clovey finish.  Overall, a great example of the style, incredibly delicious even at room temp, which is how I drank it.
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2012 from lidl milford. notes of banana and clove. Hazy golden with a fluffy white head. Smooth and crisp. no harsh aftertaste.
Bottle. Pale gold pour with a white head. Very nice clove and yeast aroma and flavor. Top notch hefe.

(bottle) slightly hazy orange-gold with generous white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, mild clove, mild banana. Flavor is wheat malt, mild clove, some banana and citrus. Not as heavy on the banana and clove as some weizens.
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2015 Very good beer. Pours well and is nice deep gold and a little cloudy with tan foam, smooth taste that is not bitter or sour.
5.0% cloudy gold with a good but fading head, smells like and tastes like a good German Hefe Weissbier, if it didn¬ít, I would let you know, another good one.
A lot of fruit (which i dislike) and a bit barley in the taste..... Cloudy-golden color....  Good quality beer.....
Nice German Wheat, much better without the lemon, which i don¬ít recomend putting in any good wheat beer
16.9 oz bottle.  Hazy pale yellow with a pillowy white head.  Nose is banana, lemon, coriander and wheat.  Watery medium light with a tang.  Taste is lemon, wheat and bubblegum.  Fun brew.

Franziskaner Weissbier has a very thick, fluffy, whipped-cream-style head (off-white) and a cloudy, yellow-golden appearance, with a good amount of streaming bubbles and some lacing rings left behind. The aroma is of cloves, white wheat bread, and clean water. Taste is of banana, water, coriander, and there is also some decent hop bitterness present to balance the beer. Mouthfeel is a bit watery, and Franziskaner Weissbier finishes wet and easy drinking. One could really guzzle this. Overall, it¬ís very good. RJT
A very refreshing Hefeweizen. Easily accessible. Well Priced. Foamy, golden color. Yeasty and sweet.
Hazy golden pour. Aroma is fruity with clove and banana esters. Taste is similar. Easy to drink.

Aroma is sweet oaky vanilla, minerality, and a subtle hint of belgian-like funkiness.
Appearance is hazy dark gold.
Taste is pale malt, tart wheat, yeast-bite, minerality, and complex but subtle fruity yeast esters.
Body is creamy and medium-full.

Poured a cloudy orange color from the bottle, with a thick white head that took a long time to dissipate.  Aromas of banana, and wheat.  Flavor is a mild clove, banana, and wheat.  A decent hefeweizen that doesn¬ít disappoint.

Una de mis weisse preferida,olor intenso a banana y clavos dulces con un ligero olor a citricos,al paladar una sensacion refrescante y muchos aromas tipicos de una weissbier de grande liga,poco lupulo es si dudas una de las mejores weisse del mundo. Recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
Bottle
Clove, banana, and doughy wheat are in both the aroma and taste. This is a great German Hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy gold.  Head starts off large initially, but fades quite quickly.  Notes of clove, banana, yeast and hay in the nose.  Taste is similar - banana, clove, yeast.  Very refreshing.  I¬ím not getting a lot of hops here, but maybe that is the point.  Very good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 50cl bottle cold. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Typical weissbier bannana and clove flavour, a tad dryer than most. Very enjoyable.27/05/2014. I have grown to love this style deeply, and this has become my go-to German Hefeweizen, Cloudy golden body, big white pillow of a head. Sweet banana aroma, but with a bit of acidic, almost metallic fruitiness as well. Big juicy mouth filling flavours, deeply swiggable. Crisp, spicy refreshing, my preferred beer for veg prep, cooking, or any activity where a good quench is required.

Bottle pours hazy orange yellow with sediment. Smell is light all around, banana some date and musty grain with light sweetness. Taste is much the same, light with nothing jumping in front of the great taste of wheat malt. A little green grape and raisin in the finish makes this more of a beer than one sip would let on, very enjoyable.

Bottle 500ml @ Rosie McGee¬ís, K√∏benhavn
Pours cloudy dark golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of wheat, caramel and banana. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Cloudy with a thick white head.   Banana notes.  Fruity palate.  Enjoyment.
Hazy orange-amber with a foamy white head. Lots of banana and citrus, of course, plus some nice spices.
Nice citrus aroma upon opening.  Super cloudy in appearance.  The taste is a little too sweet.  Very orange, which is typical for the style.  Overall it¬ís not bad, but I¬ím not crazy about it.

Bottle 50cl.export version.white creamy head cereal color.strong banana smell once the cap is off,cloves peach pear lemon wheat mature banana aroma after the beer is poured.the taste is not so strong and rich as the aroma, you can get the cereals and cloves mostly.slightly acid at first than sweateer.really fizzy,light/medium body. The finish is quite long and dry but weak.not the best weizen you can drink but i have to say that the german version is actually better and deserves an higher score

Pours a cloudy hay color.  Head starts at about 1.5 inches and quickly recedes to a quarter inch.  Aroma is sour with notes of clove and banana.  Taste starts slightly sour and hay like and finishes with a sweet banana flavor.  Carbonation bites the tongue.  Soft mouthfeel.  Medium light body.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2011 This is the best Heffe-Weisser bier i ever tasted. Smouth, full of flavor..

(Flasche in Wei√übierglas geschenkt) Die Farbe ist organge-gelb, wie ein Weizenfeld. Es hat eine starke Hefetr√ºbung und eine dichte wei√üe Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist stark hefig. Der Geschmack ist schlank, was zum erffischenden Charakter passt. Der Geschmack selber ist  hefig mit fruchtiger Note.  Der Abgang ist leicht s√º√ülich und es ist kaum Bittere zu schmecken. Im Ganzen ein leckeres erfrischendes Wei√übier.

Bottle enjoyed from a weissbier glass at home
Deep orange hazy, hints of brown, big white head. Smells of banana, citrus, wheat and yeast esters. Taste of banana and wheat malts. Good sweetness  balanced off with some nice citric acids. Palate is a bit dry, works ok. Good bitter finish. Nice example of a almost perfect german hefe
Tap, pours a nice bright hazy yellow, with a big wheat head. This one was better then any of the craft hefes we had. It was a good strong yeasty spicey hefe brew. Good solid body.
Bottle fae Tesco. Delicious Hefe. Cloudy yellow with a durable head. Banana notes. Textbook.

On tap, serve in a 50cl. glass Murky yellow colour with abundant and persistent white foam. Smells to malt and fresh herbs. Taste to citric and banana notes. On palate result a soft carbonation with citric hints, perhaps some watery at the end. No some much hopped but very refereshing.

Deep brilliant gold, slightly cloudy. Huge fluffy head. Aroma is of banana, bubblegum, peppercorns, popcorn, lemon. Body is medium with high carbonation, buttery and creamy in the middle, prickly on the finish. Flavors are clean wheat, lemon, tropical fruits, grassy, and a long finish with some spice developing. Beautiful. $2 at the corner deli.

A - Spicy cloves
A - Melted butter with thin head
T - Sour and a touch of bitter
P - Fizzy with medium to thin body
O - Nice weissen

Couple pints at the Uptown Cafe, Bloomington, with a great old friend. Lovely pour, a deep pale orange with moderate cloudiness and a brimful, prickly head. Nose is nice and dry, mouthfeel is lively without being too aggressive. Flavors are just the ticket, not banana-y or estery, but dry and crisp.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours a hazy gold-orange, with a big 2-finger pillowy head. Aroma of wheat, ester, banana and a little bit of coriander. Taste is wheaty, with banana, more ester, a touch of lemon and coriander, and a little touch of hop bitterness. Definite clovey thing too. Fairly creamy mouthfeel, but refreshing. Drinkable. Lovely. Not spectacular but perfectly solid. And you can¬ít say fairer than that for less than ¬£2 a bottle.

Cloudy orange in colour with a nice white head. Aroma is wheat with overripe banana and some yeast. Taste is also wheaty with overripe banana, citrus and spices. Little hops. Mouthfeel maybe a little thing. Overall, really nice weissbier.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2012 Bottle. Dark yellow hazy. Small head fairly good carbonation. Basement bananas and citrus.  Sour dry palate and finish. Very refreshing

Vacker som sig b√∂r f√∂r en weissbier, dofterna finns d√§r av blomster och frukt som sig b√∂r, och √§ven smaken √§r r√§tt bra. Tyv√§rr n√•got vattnig vilket drar ner betyget en aning. Det finns b√§ttre weissbier, men √• andra sidan finns det o√§ndliga m√§ngder med s√§mre √∂l √∂verhuvudtaget.
This beer has a marvelous taste. I tried in Kiel, Germany. I advise you to try.

16.9 ounce bottle from Publix.

Appearance: Pours out a cloudy, golden-orange body with a rather large, fluffy, off-white head, though it quickly gasses out into just a very thin layering of fizzle.

Smell: Mild nose smelling of wheat malt, lemon wedges, ground coriander, and banana...the usual suspects.

Taste: Lightly tangy-tasting malted wheat. Small hint of raw grain. Light touches of lemon, coriander, and banana pass by the tongue. Hop bitterness remains very low, just enough to be felt. Things thin out considerably as you near the dry finish, but there is a bit more lemon to be had.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body, though lacking the creaminess of other weiss beers. In place of that a little more carbonation and tanginess.

Drinkability: It¬ís a nice Hefe. It does everything well.
Bottle on tgv from stuttgrat to Munich. Pours cloudy golden with fluffy white head. Aroma and taste is what you¬íd expect from a Bavarian hefeweiss. You¬íve had one, you¬íve had them all...
Poured from a bottle it formed a large head. Color was a murky yellow. Taste was very smooth with grassy earth notes. It also had a touch of citrus with a little bit of banana. Smooth finish.
On tap. Light hazy yellow with large head that retained. Lots of banana and bubblegum flavours. Very interesting.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy orange golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, flowers, cloves. Taste wheat, yeast, banana, cloves, light citussly. medium body, lively carbonation. 300811

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2012 Hazy glowing orange - pillowy head - nose of clove, strong herbal notes (sage, lavender), orange, yeastiness, toasted wheat - creamy and full in the mouth - mostly dry up front - flavors of wheat, yeast, moderate phenols, mild acidity - develops a sweetness through the middle and finish, with flavors of melon, citrus - lingering yeastiness and moderate peppery character - really tasty - probably my favorite German hefe next to Weihenstephaner - however, this one is 9 bucks a six pack and that is over 3 bucks a 50cl - this will probably be my new go to hefe.

Can, 50 cl: Cloudy golden orange beer with a frothy lasting white head. Sweet, spicy, slightly perfumed aroma with bready malty notes and yeasty hints of yeast, banana and clove. Soft mouthfeel and a medium sweet, lightly bitter flavor with some eteric and fruity orange-citrusy notes. Creamy texture and a slightly astringent finish but I would prefer a little more acidity crispness underneath to really get this one going.
Very nice aroma and little spicey for my taste, but still a very good beer.

(Bottle, 0.5 l, 20110820) The beer poured pale orange and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had clove, fruitiness and banana. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, clove, banana, malts, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. A clean and quite tasty hefeweizen.
Has got to be one of my favorite German Hefeweizen¬ís. It has a nice golden rather cloudy color and it¬ís taste of yeast and banana is very good. A very well balanced Hefeweizen.
Cloudy golden with a whitish head. Aroma of banana, spice, wheat, citrus. Taste is yeasty and fruity, mildly sweet. Medium bodied, smooth.
Just a nice classic in the style.  It may not wow, but it has everything it needs in the style with the german yeast, banana and clove.

From a bottle 0.5l bottle in Munich, label just says Weissbier. Nice dark and cloudy golden pour with an off white head. Strong yeasty banana aroma. The flavor is earthy with a little bit of spice, the banana is strong on the finish, nicely carbonated. Very clean and refreshing beer. 
One of the best beers i¬íve drank.
I don¬ít usually drink foreign beers and often stick to British ales. This was a breath of fresh air, spicy & fruity, love the taste of this beer. Must get hold of other German wheat beers.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text: Mooi bier met lekker volle schuimkraag. Weissbieren zijn toch duidelijk lekkerder dan witbieren, al blijft het iets voor mooie zomerse dagen.
Tried this in Germany. A nice hefeweizen. Hazy and golden. Very tasty I must say.
Surprisingly no citrus or fruitiness in the aroma, nice hazy colour. Bitter finish.
Franziskaner Hefe-weissbier pours a cloudy off golden color. Has a characteristically fruity finish which keeps me coming back for more.
2 liters at biergarten house!  Pours cloudy, grassy, wheaty nose with a light flavor that has some citrus and banana, finishes light and clean.  Good expression of what a wheat beer should be.

If you like a German Hefe, then this is for you.  Pours a cloudy a slightly dark golden yellow with a big frothy white head. Aroma is intense banana esters and loads of wheat.  Taste is a full bodied Hefe that drinks like a meal.  Banana esters, very cloying to the palate, big wheat and a hint of hop.  Awesome beer.
Very dark colour and hazy liquid. Nice yeast and cereal aroma. Medium, balanced taste. Very good, refreshing weissbier.
Sort of a benchmark. Sweet and pleasant Hefeweizen. Aroma of banana and yeast.

From a bottle 0.5l bottle in Munich, label just says Weissbier. Nice dark and cloudy golden pour with an off white head. Strong yeasty banana aroma. The flavor is earthy with a little bit of spice, the banana is strong on the finish, nicely carbonated. Very clean and refreshing beer.
Good "basic" white beer. Nothing really unique, still really good. Some banana in taste.

A hazy, orange-brown pour with a big, white head.  The aroma has a lot wheat with some banana and clove.  The medium body has an oily texture with average carbonation.  The taste is moderately sweet with a lip smacking finish.
Tastes like a hefeweizen. Perfectly matches my expectations. I like the style of beer, and I like this beer. Nothing especially exciting, but its a decent beer.
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 2.4.2010. Good and well balanced, slightly spicy hefeweizen with notes of banana.
Non esiste persona in questo paese che quando gli parli di birra non ti dica, come gli √® buona la birra di frumento col frate...

Bottle. Pours hazy dark yellow with a massive white fluffy head that never really fades. Aroma is odd, there¬ís something meat-like here, kind of like cold ham. There is also the usual hefe weissen suspects of spices, banana, yeast and lemon. Nice and full bodied, the ham not following through in the flavour department. Well balanced between the fruity sweetness and the lemony finish. Lively, but smooth carbonation. I¬íve read somewhere that Paulaner, Franziskaner and Weihenstephaner are the three big german hefes that set the bar. I gotta say, neither this or the Paulaner comes close. It¬ís still a very good summer drink, though.
poured 12 oz bottle into weizen glass.  golden color with very nice head.  smooth beer all the way around.  One of my favs

Out of a bottle and I am a Wheat beer fan.
Pours pretty reuslting in a pale gold colour with a frothy looking head.
Tastes simple with citrus overtones and strong carbonation.
I would say this is a refreshing beer and don¬ít mind stocking up on it.
If you like White wheat beers, you won¬ít go wrong with this one.
Please see the other 1900 ratings for an accurate description.  This is not my thing....

Sampled at SIB. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma of orange peel, Belgian yeast, citrus hops, pine, wheat. Flavour of pine, orange peel, Belgian yeast and wheat. Not very complex though.
poured from a bottle. nice creamy head, small bubbles. wheaty a bit of banana. not as citris-y as some other hefes I¬íve had. I think it is a decent beer but I¬íve had better.

Brown 12 oz botte labeled "Weissbier" instead of the 16.9 oz foil topped "Hefe-weisse" bottles I usually buy. I did some forum searching and I¬ím fairly certain these two beers are one in the same, just different labels. Poured into a 16 oz. pilsner glass. A - Cloudy golden color. Nice white frothy, soapy head. S - Belgian yeast, bannanas, bubble gum, clover, and some light spice. T - Same as the aroma. Some nice carbonation makes the yeast and wheat flavors very refreshing. The spice and bannana tie it all together. Light yet flavorable. O - Its not super complex, but its well balanced and simple. Refreshing as all hell, readily available, and always well priced. One of my favorites.
Really great beer defo getting this again great taste looks great really nice beer one of my new favourites
Pale gold, slightly hazy, white head. Aroma has an earthy, yeasty twang, with spice notes. Flavor balances lemony bitterness with bread-like sweetness. Long bitter citrus finish. Nice.

Honigfarbenes HW mit feinporigem Schaum. 
Bananig-fruchtige Geruchsaromen. Im Mund hefe-fruchtig mit moderaten Hopfenakkzenten. Leicht trinkbar. 
Solide Leistung von Spaten-Franziskaner. Zu einem Top-HW fehlt aber noch was.Test vom 23.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Very nice classic Hefeweizen style, lively and flavoursome with fruit, cloves and yeast.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is golden yellow, slightly orangish color with plenty of foamy head.  Aroma is rich in Hefeweizen goodness - bananas, wheat, yeast, and clove.  Taste is similar with the fruitiness being balanced with lots of malted grains.  Flavor notes included spices, yeast, citrus, and faint astringent alcohol taste.  Palate is medium-bodied, creamy texture, lively carbonation, and a long, sweet finish.  This is definitely one of the best Hefeweizens out there.
Good weissbier, solid in everything. Taste of fresh yeast and wheat. Refreshing and enjoyable.
tastes and smells like banana. i guess its okay but not for me i did not like it.

Bottle. Pours a fairly transparent golden yellow with a fluffy white head. Aromas of banana and citrus. Delicious banana notes gradually transition into a long and crisp finish. Very drinkable and tasty beer - 10x better on draft!
Pours yellow with a fairly big, foamy head.  Aroma of banana and bread.  Great banama and bread flavor.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2012 Hazy golden color with a big head that deflates rather quickly¬óbeautiful beer to look at. The aroma is classic Hefeweizen with cloves and banana, some citrus, some spices, and plenty of grains. Easy body with wheat dominating the mouthfeel and vigorous carbonation. The overall feel could be perfectly summed up with one word: natural. Dry, mildly bitter finish with a sweet, distinct aftertaste of bananas, cloves, and wheat. Great beer.

Pours a deep yet hazy straw yellow with plenty of frothy, sticky head. Sediment is apparent as it separates in the glass, spreading its yeasty goodness. Plenty of retention and lacing on the glass. Great Aromas of wheat, banana and clove. Slight hints of citrus and floral presence

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2011 0.5L bottle, 5%. Cloudy yellow-orange ad massive head. Nose of yeast and flowers. Foam has a feel of herbs. High carbonation, fizzy on tongue. Classic banana and lemon aroma with some spices and lots of yeast. Sweet taste. Very dry on palate, maybe somewhat harsh, light body, short finish.

Das Bier wird den Anforderungen gerecht. von leichter Fruchtigkeit √ºber ein hefiges Aroma bis zu einem leicht herben Abgang ein Referenzweizen. S√ºffig, vollmundig, gut. 	 
Test vom 30.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,12,13,10,10,11 - 11,05
Oh mama! This is a supar beer. It have such a sweetness like ripen banana fruit. Cloudy like urine after many vitamin and color is like water in camel trough after vigorous sand storm.

Pours and has an incredible structure to it.  Nice long lasting head that¬ís perfectly smooth like a pillow of carbonation.  Wonderful aroma, lots of ripe fruit, banana, clove, spice.  Color is a light cloudy golden hue.  Taste is wheat fruit, spice, and alcohol burn.  Seltzer like finish.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2012 Tap @ Caf√© Conrad. Pours hazy heather honey with small rocky white head. Aroma is banana milk shake, drinkable yoghurt. Taste is medium acidic, light bitter and faint sweet. Body is milky with soft yet crisp carbonation. Finish is light bitter with notes of milk, chalk and ripe tropical fruit. Faint hints of spices.
