On tap for growler fills at Half Time.  Pours a hazed light gold with a medium sized white head.  Soft wheat, sweet toast, banana yeast on the nose.  Light and clean, crisp banana notes again.  Smooth, clean, crisp wheat.  Nice toast and yeast notes.  Simple and easy drinking.

bottle pours hazy orange gold with finger of off white, fluffy head.  Aroma has classic banana / clove tones, but there is also a kind of an earthy mustiness.  Medium bodied and creamy.  Flavor is at first, spicy, creamy wheat, as yeast characterizes the finish with bread and a soft basement dankness, no fruit really in the flavor.  Overall a nice hefeweizen but didn¬ít blow me away like paulaner hefeweizen.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty ¬ñ wheaty and lightly sweetish fruity aroma, some banana. Body is light to medium, malty ¬ñ wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, some banana and yeast. Finish is short to average, malty ¬ñ wheaty and dryish, faint banana and fruitiness. Light-bodied dryish hefeweizen.

Slightly different from some of the other weissbiers in that it¬ís got a hint more fizz, much like a Belgian Blanche. It¬ís got a very pronounced funky taste typical of German Hefe-weissbiers. The after taste sets it apart from others.... excellent!
Non sono un grandissimo amante delle Weisse , ma questa √® senza dubbio la migliore al mondo, le altre sono tutte una spanna sotto, secondo me.
yeasty aroma. golden pour with thick white head. wheat, grainy, light fruit and some yeast in the flavour. very nice hefe.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle into original glass. Aroma has yeast, grains (malt and wheat) and a bit of lemon. It¬ís a murky, hazey yellow colour with a soapy white head on top that stays on remarkably well. Leaves little lacing on the glass. A bit carbonation in the beer itself. Flavour is full, wheaty, citrus and some fresh malts. Incredibly fresh, but too bad the flavour is gone in a snap. Costs some points.

bread, herbs, cheese, golden, hazy, sparkling, frothy, white foam, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent, This was a standout beer I would recommend to a friend.  It met all expectations.  It goes well with chicken dishes.  I appreciated the herbal overtones, mild lemon-sour background, and fine, smooth, champagne-like bubbles.  This is my favorite beer at the moment, as of May, 2011.
Pours golden with a large white head. Aroma is wheat, banana and clove. Flavour follows the nose. Light notes of co2.

Wheat and orange flood the nose with full-packed aroma. Hazy brushed gold with a small-ish white head that lingers and gives some lacing.  Flavor of orange dominates with the wheat providing nice bready structure and well-rounded mouthfeel. Slight spice is nuanced.
draught. Cloudy pale yellow, large white head. Aroma of banana. Thin, watery, slightly fruity, slightly yeasty, not much going on here. Boooooring.
full body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, medium sweetness, lightly sour, floral, basement aromas, banana,

Somer head, cloudy, no laces
malty nose with some wheat carachter, a little rubber
Medium body, some length.
Rubber, banana, - wheat.
Pours golden cloudiness with a nice puffy head. A bit of banana on the nose but also a overripe vibe. Some burst of esters on the tongue but it finishes a bit watery.
Bought a crate of this home after sampling a few bottles at Rammstein. Nice example of the style. Banana and clove overtones from the yeast. Cloying, but thats a hefe for you - lovely in small doses!

Wow... I guess this one is easy to get in the States (but I have never seen it in Canada). I had to come to Doha, Qatar and visit my friend in order to try it. :) Pours a cloudy golden-beige colour with a light beige creamy head that had great retention and thick patchy lacing. A 3mm foam topped the brew and I saw a few darker sediments at the bottom of the glass. Mild dark fruits smell with hints of spices and bread. Refreshing mouthfeel, slightly creamy, slightly watery. Nice spices in the taste, with Belgian yeast reminding me a lot of Unibroue (but lighter overall). An easy drinking Weissbier that is good for sessions.

Pours hazy orange with a large, fluffy white head. Smells like wheat, citrus, hints of banana and coriander, and a bready yeast aroma. Tastes of banana and wheat, with hints of citrus and spiciness complimented with a bready flavor as well. Light-to-medium bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier finishes crisp with a banana finish.

The fat guy on the label looks appropriately happy; he¬ís drinking a tasty hefe.  Smells slightly of burnt grain, but mostly of wheat and bananas, spicy and inviting.  Not the prettiest wheat beer, no, but my last hefeweizen was Sierra Nevada¬ís Kellerweis, which looks like a five million dollar pint.  Good-n-wheaty, full of banana slices and cloves, with a slight tart yeastiness that starts everything off.   The feel is effervescent and brisk, keeping things moving along before they get too sweet.  Great beer to drink after waging war on the greedy, gluttonous bamboo plants in the backyard.

Pours a cloudy light gold color with an of white head.The aroma is of sweet bananas.The flavor is of bananas with a skunky note.The body is rather thin and has a light banana aftertaste.Overall it was ok.

0,5 l. can from the supermarket. Large head that lasts with a cloudy orange/golden colour. Pleasent  sweetness and fruity taste with notes of banana, herbs and apple at first. Has a spicy aftertaste that lingers in the mouth. Soft carbonation and not too strong yeasts. Very good price - taste ratio. An excellent beer for the summer!
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2011 A welcoming lively carbonated sensation blends to a smooth banana flavor. Overall a very good beer, especially for dessert.

Cloudy amber/gold with a frothy white head and very nice lace. Bananas come through strongest on the nose, with wheat and lemon also featured. Wheat flavor is more pronounced, but bananas still dominate. Slight hops bitterness also peeks through. Nice soft mouthfeel, highly carbonated, and a crisp finish.

Can. Cloudy amber with huge white head. "Classic hefeweissen look". Aroma bananas, clover, sweet esters. Taste Refreshing sweet, bananan, wheat. A fine hefeweissen, that I somehow hasn¬¥t made a rating of before now.
Hazy golden with white head - malt and spicy yeasty aroma - wheat malt taste, with hints of banana and followed by some hints of yeast - very good, easy and refreshing to drink
Bottle shared with the wife. Average middle if the road hefe here - nothing too crazy from the style.

I have to say that I¬ím reviewing this is the category of wheat beer. They don¬ít tend to have that much of an impact to me as maybe others do, and variety and characteristics is hard to find, but still they have a certain place in my world of beers. So, this is one of the first "special" beers i¬íve ever tasted back in the days. It has a very nice fruity, banana aroma with dry herbs and a fresh character. not that much variety in the aromascape, but what you can pick up is very clear and perfectly balanced. Very easy to drink. the body is medium with dry and full texture. the carbonation is very well balanced with the taste palate. The appearance is very nice with it¬ís golden and deep colour and refreshing look. i have to say that this is one of the best and most nostalgic wheat beers i¬íve ever had. it¬ís a shame that the category is not my cup of tea with limited diversity, but considering what they wanted to create, this is very close to a perfectly balanced "iconic" wheat beer.

Aroma consists of cereal notes with a hay background. Produced a fluffy, pillowy-white head that quickly settles into the hazy-golden beer. Web-type lacing appears when tipped to the lips. Absolutely perfect balance in the taste!! (Well, Germans are the masters of the art). An ever so slight sweetness that dances perfectly with the cereal aroma that lingers in the nose. Medium-bodied hefeweizen with a slightly creamy texture. Lively carbonation (hard to view due to the haziness) that is evident on the palate. There is also just the right amount of acidity and alcohol that is made aware in the mouth. Finishes long, smooth, and refreshingly....... That monk on the label knows what he¬ís doing!!!!
Bottle. Excellent texture, wonderful and distinct banana aroma. Short finish. Cloudy golden appearance. Excellent flavor.

i"m not a good alcohol drinker but like to try new beers when i see one...this stuff is easy to drink but it smells like NYC DURTY WATER HOTDOGS...
IT OK BUT NOT ALL THAT...

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 Cloudy pale golden body with a huge white head. Yeasty aroma with cereal and banana. Incredibly easy-drinking, banana and vanilla in the great flavour. (8/5/8/5/18)
Cloudy dark golden body with a big white head. Aroma of banana, wheat and vanilla. Incredibly smooth palate. Yeasty flavour with wheat and banana. An excellent hefeweizen.

Picked up a bottle of this at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a Mikasa weizen glass.

Pours a very hazy apricot color with a super-fluffy white head that sticks around for quite a long time, leaving behind gobs of sticky lacing. The nose hits with some malty bread plus a bit of bubblegum and banana. Faint hint of cloves in the background. The flavor comes through with all the same notes. Not nearly as much clove as I would prefer, and the other yeast elements are a tad bit muted as well. Mouthfeel is light and moderately creamy. Nothing too special about this, but it¬ís certainly easy drinking and is a good choice on a balmy February afternoon.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-19-2011
Good overall beer. Great light taste. Loved it.

A-pours a deep amber color with notes of orange and a light haze.  the head is thick, white, heavy lace.

S-the nose has some subtle malt complexity to it, notes of yeast, a fair bit of lemon, light bubblegum, spicy peppers and lightly phenolic.

T-the flavor is very toasty, lots of toasted bread, very nutty, dark malt complexity, lighter on the lemon, almost no bubblegum, light spice and lost the phenolic quality.

M-light body, lively feel with a soft subtle texture and crisp clean finish.

D-this is the toastiest malties bottle i¬íve ever had.  typicall not quite like this but still interesting.  always a good beer.

Pours a hazy yellow gold that sits beneath a cloud of heady white.  A nose of clovacious citrus greets the nostrils entering the oral phase of our journey.  Taste is banana, clove and hints of bubble gum spritzing through a round body of chewy wheat.  This is a perfect summer refresher and a great example of one of my favorite styles of beer.
Bottle. Pours a nice hazy, cloudy yellow/tan color. Thick head. Smells od wheat, lemons and yeast$ tasye is orange , whaty and citrus. Really easy drinking and lots of flavor. Awesome beer

Appearance:   deep cloudy gold, huge white head.  Aroma:  typical HW:  banana, clove, wheat, yeast, light citrus.   Taste: bright and crisp, solid wheat, with banana, citrus, and wheat undertones.   Finish:  medium, slightly sweet, crisp and refreshing.   Notes:  Solid HW.  Did not really detect any bacon, although my buddy Z swears it¬ís in there.  Worth another taste.

Bottle - Pours a hazy marmalade with a good firm white head.  Yeasty fruity aroma, slightly citrus.  The flavour is very nicely balanced with no flavour overpowering the others. This is one of the first beers I¬íve had that the bubblegum taste has come through.  nice mouthfeel and short dry slightly malty aftertaste.

A decent hefe. Very yeasty and clean. Not too much in your face but enough to know you¬íre drinking an import with some heritage (Reinheitsgebot). Something different for a change. If you want to brew this stuff, northern brewer has a kit that tastes just like it-T Can and Bearcat¬ís Wheaten Beatdown. Not a clone kit but very close.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange with a white head.  Aroma is citrus, banana, yeast.  Taste is the usual hefe-weisse banana, clove, citrus, but spicier and with heavier pink bubblegum notes than usual.  Great stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2012 50 cl, bottled. Pours hazy amber beer with a white irregular head. Aroma: Fruits, citrus, banana. Taste: Moderate sweetness. Palate: Soft bodied, thin texture. Average carbonation. 
Rerate, 20.5.2011: Aroma: Candyfloss, wheat, yeast. Noticeable carbonation.
13.3.2012: Pretty same.

Hazy yellow beer, with a thick, foamy head.  Aroma is fresh wheat, grains, citrus, and a little hops.  Taste is pure hefeweizen... lots of farmy, wheaty, grainy flavors, a nice light malt backbone, and a strong, citrusy finish.  This is one of the best wheat beers on the planet.

Bottle: Cloudy orange/gold colour with a huge, white foamy head that lasts incredibly well, only shrinking slightly. The head itself is relatively thick and leaves some nice lacing on the glass too.

Quite sweet smelling. Contains a pleasant mix of banana, cloves & possibly some coriander in there as well.

Nice banana & clove flavour. It is quite rich & creamy but very nice indeed and goes down easily.

Very smooth, full bodied & very refreshing to drink.

Very drinkable and scores well in each category.Although it is not the best hefeweizen I have ever tried it¬ís not too far off. - - - - abarwithnoname.wordpress.com
bottle; hazy gold with moderate with head; aroma-yeast, wheat, mild citrus and banana; taste-really effervescent, mild sweetness and moderate bitterness, water down really but not bad

Bottle - from sampler pack. Medium golden color - quite cloudy.  Quite spicy aroma - bananna/clove associated with hefewizens. This is a good one - the flavor is just like the aroma. It is very well carbonated, too.

pours cloudy orange with a large white fulffy heat.  the aroma is cloves, banana, yeast, and malt. the flavor is lots of banana, and is sweet. with a tart finish..   very smooth mouth feel and is really good one of the best hefe iv had.

Bottle at home. Cloudy pale orange with a big, lasting white head. Aroma is typical yeasty wheat beer, slightly more fruity than I was expecting. Full and mellow in the mouth, with a slight hint of banana amongst the heavy malts. Bit weird. Finish is soft and malty. It¬ís OK, I guess.

Hazy orange with a big and lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana, yeasty and light spicy - cloves. Flavor is rather sweet. The finish is light acidic and dry. Soft, smooth and refreshing. A great Hefeweizen. 230809
Malt and yeast aroma. Cloudy golden yellow colour with huge white head. Flavour of malt, grass and yeast.
Pours a golden yellow with a thick white head, excellent lacing.  Citrus and wheat flavor.  A slight bready and yeasty aroma.  One of my favorite hefeweizens.

0.5l bottle. Pours a hazy bright orange body with a solid fluffy white head. Nose is wheat, citrus, yeast, and sun-dried tomatoes. Really aggressive carbonated and light bodied. Tastes quite watery and feels like the aggressive carbonation has killed off most of the flavors. Still there are some wheat, grapefruit, thin banana and perhaps a hint of a pepperish note in there. All in all it¬ís a OK hefeweizen, but nothing special.

It looks perfect. The thick, wheaty head lasts forever.  It has a classic clove/banana combo on the nose with floury bread and a hint of acetone cutting through it.  I¬ím not totally sold in the mouth. It is a little green and brassy. Not quite as mellow as I¬íd like it though as the carbonation calms down a little it does improve.

50 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, orange/dark yellow colour with big, foamy, white head. Aroma is yeast, clove, banana, wheat, fruits and some cereal malt. Taste is somewhat sweet with loads of wheat and yeast. Light bitterness. Refreshing and balanced. Light to medium bodied with nice carbonation. Really refreshing, good hefe. One of the best of it¬ís kind. Had this one with some Schinkenschntizel, great combo.

0.5L bottle in Berlin. A delicious smell of malt, wheat, and light spice. Feels very finely fizzy and lathing on the mouth. Taste is classic German wheat beer - lots of sweet wheat and grain malt with some spice and hints of coriander, orange, and banana (though clearly defined fruit flavors). Drinkable, balanced, and delicious. One of the best hefeweizens I have had.

Hazy orange yellow with a fluffy egg white head that becomes almost a fingers thick lid and refuses to go away.
Classic aroma of wheat (very strong at first, but it calms down after a while), citrus, slight banana, spices and yeast. Pretty light and smooth.
Taste is sweet with the classic elements of wheat, yeast, spice, some pomerans, orange and banana. Never too cloingly though. Light easy going flavor. Body and carbonation is light.
Since Im no fan of the style I expected it to be worse than it was. For me it had high drinkability.

Sampler at the pub.  It poured a cloudy golden color with a white head.  The aroma was of banana and yeast. The flavor was of wheat with some banana and minor spice.  This was a really good Hefe-Weissbier.

World classic. Super Tasty. Poured, then shook, then poured again into a Weihenstephan weizen glass. Glory! The head is massive and frothy, sitting atop  a yeast-hazed bodacious body. The nose...,.you down with 4VG, yea you know me! Banana/clove madness with that accompanying wheaty umami dankness. The flavour is as straightforward as the aroma. Hefe perfection that never ceases to be uber refreshing, yet savory. There is a very mild citric character to note as well.   Velvety smooth palate with long duration. Doesn¬ít get much better than this hefe standard. Win!
A cloudy orangish-yellow body with a thick white head that had some impressive lacing. A somewhat moldy aroma gave way to a very fruity flavor with definite spice accent. Finished clean.

pale, very hazy yellow and not appealing
nose is bananas and spice (coriander and maybe cinnamon)
full body, moderately fizzy, 
a very banana flavoured weiss beer. some coriander as well but mainly banana

500 mL bottle poured into a Karmeliet glass at home.  Also had this in an All Bar One in London before on tap.  Delicious looking orange coloured with reasonable head.  Refreshing light/medium wheaty aroma.  The first taste was pleasant, its light and has a bit more to it than the usual weiss beer.  A pleasant beer, but not as good as I¬íd expected.  Similar to Paulaner Hefe-Weiss (which is also pretty good), but doesn¬ít have as much going on as my favourite beers.  Still this is an enjoyable beverage and one of the best of its style.

Serving: 500ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a cloudy gold color with a pillow, white head.  Good head retention.  The nose has nice lemon and banana notes, a bit of clove.  The flavor is light with a crisp wheat note.  The lemon, banana, and clove are there as well, rounding things out.  Light to medium body with smoother carbonation than I was expecting leading to a short to medium, slightly spicy but crisp finish.  This is a nice, smooth hefe.  Very solid brew.

Bottle pours hazy gold with a white head.  Aroma shows notes of wheat, clove, citrus, and a touch of banana.  Flavor shows the same with a definate banana bread thing going on as well as some underlying 
spiciness.  Overall body is moderate and creamy with light bitterness.

A - totally hazy orange with yellow and very nice and still head. Awesome.
S - lot of banana, citruses and clove with creamy yeasts
T - bananas with citruses and clove - almost the same as the smell
M - medium carbonation with medium body
D - very drinkable and easy going. Since it is not so high in ABV, very good for summer time
2011 - 03 - 07 500 ml bottle. hazy golden colour. medium white head. very low in taste. disapointing.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Pours unclear brown with a quickly disappearing white head. Aroma of tropical fruits,wheat and yeast. Taste is a bit dry with citrus and some light hoppy notes along with some fruity yeast.
Pours hazy golden/orange with a white head. aroma of wheat, malt, citrus, and fruit. Flavor is carbonated, citrus, and wheat.  Something different about this one that I can¬ít put my finger on.

A: The beer pours the typical cloudy orange color with a massive white head that has awesome retention and lacing.

S: Very bready on the nose with a fair amount of banana. There is a moderate level of clove spiciness and some undertones of bubblegum. A decent wheat sweetness and some mild citrus notes.

T: A pretty decent flavor profile. Sweet bread, malt, and wheat with a nice banana note. The spices seem more pronounced than they were on the nose. The flavor is actually pretty creamy.

M: The body is medium with a moderate level of carbonation and a slight creaminess to it.

D: For this price, this is tough to beat (less than $2.50 after tax for a half liter). Pretty solid hefeweizen.

0,5 l bottle, S√∂rspecialista.hu
Hazy deep golden pours with a fine foamy-creamy stable white head. Mild aroma with tropical fruits like lemon, banana, lichi and figs, some honey and caramel, spicies of top fermentation. Balanced beer with a fine oily texture, nice lactic acid, lemons and citrus oils comes on the malt and caramel based flavor. Fine lemony aftertaste with some mild lurking hops. Very good, well rounded pone.
It is one of the most common hefeweissbiers, and usually in the green bottle. however, if you find it in a brown bottle and fresh it is a very solid Bavarian Hefeweissbier.
Among the best hefeweizens, even though it took quite a while to get used to the unfiltered part.
A good example of classic German style Hefe. This has a good balance of esters and phenols with a moderate banana and clove aroma.

Aroma: yeast, spices, wheat malts, bananas, 
Appearance: Hazy golden colour, big white head, some lacing. 
Flavour: yeast, sweetness, spices, some fruit notes, wheat. 
Mouthfeel: Bit thin otherwise smooth. 
Total: Guess i¬ím spoiled by drinking weihenstephaner¬ís version of hefe.
Poured a cloudy amber with a big, but quickly dimishing head. Great aroma with fruity orange notes and wheat malts. Refreshing beet, but I wanted to like it more.

Deep cloudy and crisp light orange in colour with a creamy bone-white head. Aroma of typical hefe; wheat, clove, orange rind. Tastes sophisticated with crisp wheaty flavors, a bit of citrus. Refreshing and quite carbonated, but not to the extent of soda or Coors.
weiss aroma,yellow,cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Incredibly fun beer. Tasted like a sour with no sour properties. A wheat beer with some fun in it. Loved it.

The most refreshing, best tasting, good looking, finest beer in the world. Looks delicate, smells delicate.
The most refreshing beer I have ever tasted

12 oz. Bottle - Pours a hazy golden orange/yellowish with puffy, creamy white head.  Aroma is orange, citrus, yeast, clove, cinnamon, spice, bread, and a bit doughy and some slight funk too.  Looks and smells marvelous.  Taste is sweet at first, very orange/lemon zest/citrusy then gives way to a bit of acidity and then rounds out with long-lasting spicy aftertaste of cloves/cinnamon/nutmeg(?) and the funk is most noticeable at the end as well.  Mouthfeel is a bit abrasive at first due to the fruity acidity then rounds out to be smooth and creamy, medium to high carbonation.  All together a very delicious, complex, and sessionable hefe.  I always recommend this to unsaved heathens instead of the beloved Blue Moon or Bud Light Wheat.  Excellent gateway beer to be brought into the fold.

Cloudy orange-gold pour with biiig head. Lotsa yeast sediment. Aroma is yeast and fruit. Flavor is mellow yeast and banana with a hint of spice and a semi-crisp finish. not too dry though. A little *too* mellow for me, I wish it had just a hint of bite to it.
Pours light caramel with white head.  Not a very strong aroma with a sweet taste.  Great beer!

12oz bottle.  Poured a hazy golden color.  Aroma was very musty so I gave that a low score.  Not a bad flavor.  Def can taste the citrus and fruit in the beer but certainly not bold enough.  almost too light and would be better if this were a bit thicker.  Refreshing though on a summer day.  Better then I expected but not great.

I love the fact it is known for being the pope¬ís favorite beer.  You could take him out of bavaria, but you could not take bavaria out of him.  the man is importing this beer to the vatican.
good for marketing....

If I had to live on a desert island with only a bed, a fridge and one beer, this would have been my choice. It is simply the best beer I have ever tasted. It is complex enough to enthrall with every single sip- a sensation that lingers through each encounter. The hops must be of the noble variety, for it exudes delicate floral undertones. The malt hints at caramel and the aroma is exciting, enticing. I love to slip this beer into a long, original Franziskane glass, and sip it ever so slowly. And I end up with the same facial expression as the monk on the label...

(Bottle) Pours cloudy dark oranges with a large and creamy, off-white head. The aroma is of juicy, orange and banana-like esters up front with a solid background of spices, clove-ish phenols and (dough) bready wheat. Undertones of grass, buttery fudge/toffee, herbs, bubblegum and incense. The nose is soft, round and balanced. The flavour is light sweet, light bitter and light acidic. Tones of wheat, clove, banana, subtle spices, light herbs and oranges. The mouthfeel is round, soft and creamy with medium lively carbonation. Wheaty, light acidic and tiny salty finish. Medium bodied. I really nice ¬ìmacro¬î.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 Cloudy white/yellow beer. First smell was bit disappointing and later on I decided it was the strong hop I smelled. The taste was suprisingly good, the mild and fruity taste made me drink the beer over and over again!

Update: had this one again from the tap in Austria

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2012 Bottle @ home. Pours a very hazy, murky orange appearance with an off white head. A little citrus, banana, and wheat in the nose but mostly yeast. A  bit citrusy, moderately yeasty, banana, clove, wheat malty, somewhat spicy flavor. One of the better German Hefeweizen beers out there.

Poured into a weizen glass.

4.5 A: Hazy light orange (plenty of yeast going on here). Big three finger pillowy white head has reasonable retention and the last 1/2 inch sticks around for a long ass time. Very good start.

4.5 S: There¬ís a lot goin on here. Solid wheat backbone, with banana esters and clove being strongest. Nice yeastiness as well.

4.0 T: Again, pleasant banana esters and clove spiciness. Mellow wheat flavor. Again, good yeastiness. Well done again!

4.0 M: Lighter medium body. Lots of carbonation, which is correct to style. Light and bubbly. Very nice.

4.0 D: I¬íve been avoiding this beer for a long time since it¬ís pretty ubiquitous. I would rather try something a little more harder to find. I received this bottle as a Christmas gift and was glad that I did because I¬íd love to have one of these from time to time.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-03-2010 00:08:42

Golden orange pour with a lingering white head.  Yeast and earthy aromas, taste is more of the same with some honey notes as well.  I need to stop buying hefe¬ís because I¬ím not a fan at all, but this is the best tasting one I have tried.
500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a large head.  Aroma is yeasty with some bubblegum and clove.  Taste starts with some clove.  Yeasty and nutty, dry finish.

I¬íve had this before, but this paticular rating was an interesting expeience.  I¬íve seen sediments in hefes before, but there was some gunk at the mouth of the bottle, it looked like melted milk chocolate.  Strange color, strange texture, strange place to find it.  
Of course ... 
I drank the beer anyways - I needed a beer for the football game obviously.
So on to the beer:
A good hefe.  There¬ís no denying ol¬í Franziskaner that.  It pours with a fluffy white head that lingers for a long while.  Its a bright orangey-yellow gold color that is bright.  The aroma is fairly minimal, the flavor is a little clove-y.
A quality brew, but too bland for my tastes. Little aroma. Light body, but very pretty with a cloudy , golden sparkle. Light spice and grain in the taste, with little aftertaste.

Bottle at Mr. Dunderbak, Daytona Beach. Pours a one inch white head that recedes quickly over a pale orange body. Creamy, round aroma of wheat & malt. Flavors are mild but fresh with more creamy wheat and hints of clove and lingering banana in the finish. Mild/medium body and medium/full carbonation. Very drinkable and refreshing.
Always good, easy drinking. I wish American corporate beers were like this.

Great pour, shoots out of the bottle, highly carbonated, a bit murky, light yellow/orange color, nice nose, lemon scent.  Very frothy, bready, yeasty, a little more bitter than I expected, not as bitter as one would think, sort of a toned down hefe IMO, a bit dull, but I still like it, think it is refreshing, just missing a little zest, or pop for me.  Has a distinct taste of yeast/bread.  Decent, better options available though.  Just comes off a little watery.
Bottle 50 cl. Poured golden colour with white head. Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast. Flavour is quite fruity wheat and banana.
26th June 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Bottle in Dusseldorf. Sweetish wheat beer. Not that much wheat beer fruit going on but some bubblegum flavours. Not bad.
Hazy dirty brown color. Small head okay lacing. Nose is light and hard to pin down. Tastes like a heffy, not my thing.
UPDATED: JAN 14, 2011 Cloudy yellow beer with huge smoothy head.Smell sweet,wheat,fruity.Taste banana,citrus,wheat,Nutmeg,vanilla.good drinkability.More tasty on tap than bottle by far.

This beer is simpal supar. It has the flavors of banana and other special tree fruits. It is not too strong and not too weak. It tastes great and gets you a good buzz and is smooth, delicious.

I recommend drinking it while you have your best girls sweet butt cheeks nuzzled up next to you while listening to Louis Prima.

Bless this supar beer from the Munich region of the previous attempted world conquerors area.

i get that fruity belgian yeast aroma, with some slight spices, a cloudy blonde beer due to the yeast in the bottom, very carbonated, a thin white head with some lingering on the wall the first flavor is apple then i get a pear flavor and finishes a little dry overall a pretty good lighter beer

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark gold with a substantial fluffy white head of good duration. Contains all the classic aromas of the style with banana, vanilla, cloves, bread and a hint of lychee. Palate is medium bodied with a spritely refreshing mouthfeel and sweet tropical fruity flavours. Probably behind Weihenstephan and Schneider in the league table of unfiltered Bavarian wheat beers but still very good.

Flaske 50 cl. Gylden gul, med tykt hvidt stabilt hovede. Kryddered duft der hurtigt afl√∏ses af en s√∏dlig banan. Smag let krydderet med noter af g√¶r og banan. Lidt vandet med en kort meget let bitterhed i finich

There¬ís everything, yet nothing to say about this beer. Do you like wheat beers? no ? probably because you havn¬ít tried this one.  Mellow and refreshing, this is the real deal.  And don¬ít put any citrus fruit in it, what the fuck is wrong with you people. Men specifically. Ladies, whatever floats your boat.

Bottle. Pours dark golden, hazy with a generous pillow of a white head. Nose of clove, bananas, yeast, wheat, and some honey. Added lemony notes on the taste. Wheat overshadows some of the other flavors and aromas. Fairly standard, but quite refreshing.
I love this beer. It just feels great in your mouth. The light sweetness takes me to the heaven and that¬ís probably the reason why I buy Franziskaner Hefes all over again.

Pours cloudy gold with a persistent head, but very little lacing.  Taste of light grain, yeasty caramel-butter rum, with a light finish that hints at candied banana.  Well-balanced, one of the best of the hefe-weizens.
One of the better Weissbiers, never fails to please. Readily available, and very drinkable.

Hazy, gold body with a thin albeit lasting white head.  Wonderful aroma of yeast, banana, and clove.  Medium mouthfeel with a nice punch of carbonation at the end.  A mild, sweet entry is pushed aside by some nice spiciness.  Sweet, doughy bread fading to clove and a bite of citrus.  Nice!

One of my favorite beers.  Brings back memories of walking the streets in Hamburg with a Franziskaner in my hand.  caramel, dough, butterscotch, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter,creamy, lively, long finish,

I fell in love with this beer drinking it on the streets in Munich. Appearance: pours cloudy straw colored with a huge head. The carbonation is very lively as it should be in a weizen. Aroma: yeasty, banana and clove notes fill the nose as you approach the beer. Taste: the banana and clove continues in the taste with nice cereal wheat notes that round out the flavor. It finishes crisp and slightly dry from the high carbonation making it very light and refreshing. Overall: personally, I enjoy my weizens "mit hefe." Unfortunately, the yeast doesn¬ít hang in suspension as much as I¬íd like (at least compared to say the kellerweis from Sierra Nevada) but it still adds that extra punch I like in a weizen. All in all, this is a great, widely available, authentic German hefeweizen. Prost!

T√§m√§n saksalaisoluen v√§ri on oranssin kellert√§v√§. Neste on sakeaa ja vaahto on valkoista ja paksua - ei tunnu hevill√§ katoavan. Aromi on banaaninen, sitruksinen ja vehn√§inen. H√§iv√§hdys savuakin l√∂ytyy. Franziskaner on kevyt ja raikas olut, joka maistuu banaanille sitrukselle ja hiivalle. T√§t√§ juo aina silloin t√§ll√∂in mielell√§√§n tuopillisen. Suomessa Franziskaneria tuntuu olevan hyvin saatavilla.

From bottle pours a cloudy  golden with a nice white head. Aroma of wheat. Taste of wheat and the same of putting sourish flavor that hoegarden has and i don¬ít like. This wasn¬ít as bad but still not good.  I¬íd drink it if it were there but not something i would buy again.
Thick, off white head, cloudy in appearance. Banana and yeast scents that come through in the flavor. Slightly carbonated, very well balanced.
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Had this at Kickbacks on King Street in Jacksonville, FL. I love the smoothy thickness of an unfiltered beer. One of the best tonight. Definitely top shelf.
12 oz. bottle.  One of the great German hefeweizens.  Hazy golden pour.  Frothy head.  Sweet from start to finish.  Hints of orange and other fruits.
Cloudy amber color, darker than I was expecting.  The yeast flavors are strong and delicious.  Malts and hops are excellent.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2011 Typical hefe weiss in every way. I don¬ít need to describe it. With a touch of lemon. Very nice hefe. Hefe haters are dumb. Tastes way better straight from the bottle.
Lovely hefe; banana, bread and a bit of bubble gum. Body is quite thick. Very cheap and easily available. I drink this all the time, always goes down nice.
One of my favourite weizenbier. Aromas of banana, lemon, grass and wheat. Refreshing and pleasant.

a pint from draft in Luxemburg City. Nice white coloured with foamy white head. Smell: citrus, banana, Taste: sweetness, banana, citrus, some malty touch. Very refreshing and easy drinking. No negative taste wihin en very pure beer! Maybe the best Inbevbeer I¬íve ever tried!

Darker golden coloured. Nice big head that holds very good. Smell is yeast, wheat, spices, fruits. Very nice one. Spices, wheat, yeast at taste. Decent spiced but a bit out of balance. Dry earhty finish. Good brew.
Bottle 500ml. Color dark gold with small head. Aroma banana, lemon. Taste banana, lemon, wheat.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2011 50cl bottle, bought at supermarket. Not my kind of beer. Aroma of malt and banana with some bread and citrus, the taste is balanced, quite complex, low body. A classic beer, nothing special.
sample at the belmont brewery.  Nice light hefe.  Nice and spicy and good citrus flavour

Poured a pale golden color.  Aroma of banana, clove, slight citrus.  Frothy head.  Light to med sweetness.  Above average carbonation makes the beer sort of creamy when it goes down.  Med body.  Smooth finish. Actually smooth all-around.  This is good, refreshing hefeweizen beer.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Samuel Adams Perfect Pint glass.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy dark golden color with a foamy 2-3 finger white head. Excellent head retention. Nice lacing.

Smell: Banana and clove with a hint of lemon. Very nice aroma.

Taste: Banana, clove and lemon up front followed by typical wheat flavors in the middle then finishing with mild phenols. Aftertaste is dry and subdued.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a nice amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. This would be a great summer beer.

Overall: Excellent beer overall. This is one of the best hefeweizens I¬íve ever had. Definitely recommend this one.
Aroma is of oranges and spice. The taste is very similar with a nice balance between the spices and fruits. Overall one of the better hefeweizens I¬íve had.

Bottle. The first wheat beer I ever got into. Had this one on a hot sunny day wandering through the mountains with my liitle lad. Hazy orange colour with both fruits and spice in the aroma.  Fills the mouth with an array of flavours. Head lasts nearly all the way down. Quality beer
Slight orange hue in the glass. Spicy hefeweizen yeast aroma. Wheat malt is smooth on the palate and the finish is refreshingly crisp.

Bottle. Hint of smoked cheese in the aroma and then the standard wheat beer smells.  Slightly cloud orange-gold colour. Crisp mouth feel. Light flavours of melon juice, bit of lemon and wheat.  Tastes a lot like lager. Not unpleasant. Quite drinkable even. A lunch time beer to go with a ploughman¬ís.

Tap. Moderate malt aromas of grain and cereal, light hop and yeast notes of lemon, perfume and earth, with strong background notes of clove and banana. Head is small, creamy, white with some thin lacing and is mostly diminishing. Flavor starts faintly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes moderately acidic, faintly bitter and a touch sour. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Pretty much the  standard for German Hefeweisens. This one is very refreshing, but more complex than most.

What a nice beer this is. Perfect for those hot days on the beach. It has a light amber color with a big head. The aroma is fruity with some bread. The flavor is very fruity with some clove and banana in there. It finishes quite clean and crisp.

For the eyes: orange-yellow colour; the head is large, foamy, white and mostly diminishing; fair lacing; hazy body. For the nose: sweet malts; banana and perfume hops. For the mouth: medium body; oily texture; average carbonation and metallic finish. For the tongue: a little more acid and salty than the regular weizenbier.
hay, cereal, citrus, grass, cheese, bubblegum, pale, hazy, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour,

~Aroma of mostly banana and light clove. Bready wheaty scent, light vanilla.
~Pours cloudy light yellow color with dig creamy dense white head.
~Banana flavor at first then taken over by clove and smoothed out with banana bread at the end. Very nice. Fun to drink and experiment with flavor rush in mouth.
~Medium creamy body with medium high CO2. Prickly CO2 in finish. Wheaty banana bread like flavor lingers. I want more after each sip.
~This is a quality brew. Excellent. Very well rounded and well made. I think this is the best Hefeweizen I have ever had.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 3.7.2010.
Pours a golden colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of yeast, spices, banana. Flavour of wheat, fruits and spices. Tastes good. Medium bodied with a fruity finish. Pleasant brew.

Bottle.  Pours a thick, foamy, slightly off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves not lacing.  Body is a hazy orange.  Aroma is clove and citrus.  Flavor follows suit.  Mouthfeel is light and crisp.  An excellent hefeweizen, great for a hot day, but good for any day.

Tap. Good and tasty. Aromas of banana, and coriander. Taste was sweet, with bitter notes, and average duration. Palate was velvety, with a thin-to-medium body. Dark yellow, with a frothy persistent head.
Surprise gift from my wife. Pours hazy yellow with a nice white head. Citrus aroma with cloves, ginger and yeast. Weaty flavor with lemon, yeast and spicy herbs.

Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a huge, dense, white head that resembles Swiss cheese. Good retention with slippery lacing. The aroma is very doughy, with light banana and clove, and a hint of citrus on the finish. Nice full flavor with a well blended mix of flavors. Full feeling but light body with soft carbonation. Great hefe-weissbier.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2010 Bottle. Cloudy orange, large white head. High bead. Sweet doughy aroma with lemon, coriander, banana, over-ripe lemons.Light bready mouthfeel. A little sweet, nice wheaty sourness, mild spicy finish. Refreshing but too clean to be terribly engaging. [3.1]Mini keg. Cloudy dull gold, large white head that fades a fair bit. Aroma has lemon, bready yeast, vanilla, cloves, a little banana. Taste is mildly sweet with a good wheaty/ lemony tang. Really nice drying finish (that I don¬ít remember from the bottle) is not all that spicy. It¬ís still kind of clean but the dry finish brings the other flavours into balance quite a bit.
Bottle. Typical weissbier acidity with cloves and some spices. OK, but no favourite.

(12 ounce bottle - red cup)  Pours a yellow color with thick head.  Has a wheat malt with notes of lemon.  Tastes of wheat, lemon,and  banana and clove yeast.  Has medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness and very light sourness.  Light body, thin texture, average to soft carbonation and a long light lemony finish.

On tap into a Weizen glass.  Smells strongly of bananas with some cloves and a bit of alcohol, very nice aroma.  Pours straw colored with a nice, fluffy head, leaves great lacing behind as you sip it.  Taste is also bananas and cloves, but with a bit of lemon.  Body feels a bit thin.  Overall a nice, well-balanced, refreshing Weizen.

On Draft at Munich Haus ! A nice white head and cloudy orange in color. The aroma for the beer is more on the banana scent with a clove undertone to it. I can get the wheat overtone. Very light in flavor with the banana coming through more than spices with no hops. A little light on the mouth,  wheat taste with a nice mouth feel,  I could drink this all night long.

I love this beer. It is one of the most manly beers I have had. Honestly It makes me feel like I am a Viking boasting about the monsters I have slain in a great meadhall. The aroma is very unique and spicy like cinnamon. It is thick, and has a crisp aftertaste that clings to your tongue and leaves you wanting more

Pours slightly cloudy with a light golden hue...adequate white head. Smooth and refreshing...notes of banana frolicking freely in a field of sweat wheaty hops. Great hefeweizen! 

K-3.7
S-3.9

very crisp and citrusy, amber, hazy, off white head, heavy cloying sweet,  average carbonation, medium body, complex and long finish.

Overall:  I love this beer!!!  It is a very pleasurable experience every time.

Bottle from local supermarket. It pours a cloudy golden liquid with a thick lasting (unending!) white head. Its aroma is yeasty, of fine fresh wheats, hops, banana and a little citron. It tastes great, very balanced: according to its aroma, with fizzy carbonation, medium body and an elegant light bitternes when it finishes. One heck of a beer, within the greatest wheat beers, and generally available everywhere (lucky us!).
Pale gold with copious white, fluffy head.  Esters, banana, clove.  Sweet wheat and fruit.  Soft hop finish.  One of the best wheats.
Very attractive hefe with complex bouquet; tastes is rich, which notes of clove, banana, spiciness; nice hefe from Franziskaner

On draft in a plastic cup.  Pours murky, bright orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of citrus, spices, and sweet malts.  The wheat is the main flavor here.  Pretty refreshing, but there are much better beers.
UPDATED: SEP 5, 2010 Light, white head, strong carbonation.  Strong lemon aroma, crisp.  Finish lingers, can taste spices as well.
Bottle. Poured light orange with a bubbly white head. Light aroma of yeast and bananas. Light bananas, and wheat taste. A very nice mild hefe.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2010 OK I,m not very fond of the hefeweiss beers but this one is something else.Perfect balanced taste,not so rough taste,and leaves a wonderful taste behind...
My favourite bavarian hefe-weizen! It¬ís a great summer beer! Full of banana, wheat and bready yeast. Very flavorfull and refreshing... A classic!
Bottle. Poured anamber color with a medium head. Aroma of yeast and bananas. Bananas, wheat and light yeast taste. Too light/thin, but certainly a very drinkable beer. 5.0% alcohol.

Bottle: Pours a medium golden with a nice fluffy head in the weizen. I¬ím immediately  reminded of everything I love about the weihenstephaner variation. That combation of yeast, clove, spices, banana, on the nose and in the mouth is delicious there, as it is here as well - I find the two extremely similar, but feel like the weihenstephaner balances out just a touch better in comparison. Either way, this is an incredible example of the style in my opinion.

Served in a Erdinger Weizen glass.

A: Golden going orange with a big foamy head, lots of visible carbonation.
S: Banana, golden apples, yeast (or at least the smell of fermentation)
T:Banana, melon, apples (yellow fruits in general), some spice and the fermentation flavor from the yeast.

Overall a refreshing beer with lots of fruity flavors kind of watery. I would have it again cause I bought two of them, but there kind of cheap and widely available.

12oz. bottle poured into a weizen glass. Incidentally the bottle is brown, not green. I¬ím not sure when Franziskaner made this switch for their 12oz. bottles. Just an observation. No freshness info. Two inches of lumpy head forms and slowly dissipates. Color is a cloudy golden yellow with ample carbonation. The nose is classic banana-clove. I love the smell of a good Bavarian wheat beer. Well carbonated mouthfeel accentuates the lighter body of the beer. Definitely a good session beer. The sweet banana and coriander flavors on the palate are very mellow, not overpowering. This is a beer built to session. All the right attributes are there and are perfectly balanced. Paulaner is still a favorite of mine but I would choose a 12er of Franziskaner to bring to a party first.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2011 Malty, basement, spices, light alcohol, leaves in aroma. Very nice. Cloudy, hazy orange body looks prefect for this beer, solid head if  you use the right glass. Perfect bitterness with a good aftertaste that¬ís a bit sweet ¬ín salty. An easy drink even though it¬ís full of flavour. Highly recommended! (50cl bottle)

Bottle 50cl. A cloudy yellow orange beer with good head that remains properly. Smell is malty and on yeast. Aroma is very perfumed on fruit, apricot, banana, not creamy, very yeasty, on wheat and cereals, body is low to medium. Texture is watery, some bitterness at the finish with long clove smell and some acidity. Expected a more creamy one, good but not exceptional.

Can:
Big white foamy head.
Color is hazy orange.
Smell fruit, malts, sugar, wheat and yeast.
Taste is fruity, malty and wheaty.
Petty light taste, though not watery.
Filled with a long taste of malts and fruit.
Pretty fruity not bitter.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: JUN 7, 2015 It is not to hard to come by in liquor stores round these parts so I often over look it, but every now and then I try it again and I think, "Oh, yeah. I remember this is pretty darn good"  Yeasty and banana/clove going on, which I enjoy. Serving: Bottle and Tap

Pretty deep color for a wheat, cloudy of course. Decently crisp, I don¬ít get much spice but do get some other yeastiness. My favorite part about this beer? The awesome bottle opener I got at PIB 2009 with their logo.

Colour is unclaer dark golden, whit a white top.
Aroma is malt, banana and graasy hop
Flavour is light banana, flower and fruity notes

Appearance clouded and muddled. Enjoyably fruity notes, although with a somewhat stale finish. Pairs well with German sausages and other German cuisine. A beer that demands a hearty dinner¬ónot so much a standalone drink.

On tap @ UNO¬ís in Madison, WI.
pour was hazy gold with a tight medium white head.
aroma was a ton of banana and a sweet bubblegum presence.
flavour started with tart pear and lemon then sweet banana taking over. Light grassy bitterness led to a nice balanced and clean finish.

Cloudy lemon-yellow with pillowy white head and tons of lacing. Aromas of tangerine and banana; more banana on the palate along with baking spices, orange and corriander. Palate is round and finish is moderate-long. Classic for the style, and very, very good overall.

Poured into a hexagonal Hoegaarden glass (only thing i had).  the woman fianlly out of the house... so time to get drunk.   Thick foamy head about four fingers.  Hazy straw in color.  Hints of orange zest.  I actually enjoyed it more as it got warmer.  Very nice Hefeweizen...

Poured golden with thick white head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat and citrus with a slightly sour tang.  Taste was reflective of aroma with a sourness that was unexpected and detracted from the overall experience.  Crisp.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow gold with a thick white head that dissipated slowly but never completely dissipated. Aroma was full of light fruits, particularly banana with lots of clove and a bit of wheat sweetness. Flavor was similar with banana and sweet wheat complimented by the clove.
500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy golden yellow with a tall and lasting head. Taste has notes of banana, wheat and yeast. Really well balanced.
Aroma is yeast and some kind of freshness. Taste is yeast, thick weiss vibes and thick texture, goes very well with chrimps.
Bottle at Finisterre. Malt and yeast aroma. Cloudy golden yellow colour with huge white head. Flavour of malt, grass and yeast.

Cloudy dark yellow with firm white head.
Crisp spicy aroma with notes of banana and vanilla.
Crisp, prickly flavour of vanilla, cinnamonrolls, banana, ham and cloves. Somewhat sweet.

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a huge thick white head. It has the aroma of banana, citrus, spices and vanilla. It has a wonderful creamy mouthfeel. It tastes of bread, banana, spices, cream of wheat and a little citrus. This is a fabulous beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with big white head. Has nice grassy aroma. Spicy wheat flavor with some citrus notes and plenty of yeast.

Bottle of a brew I¬íve tried many times.  Poured a cloudy gold with plenty of carbonation and a big white head.  Nose is fruity, banana, bubble gum, and wheat, with light spice.  Taste is similar, with plenty of spice, wheat, and fruit.  Body is nicely carbonated.  Overall, a solid hefebrew.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy, dark golden with off-white pillowy head. Taste has definite sweetness to it with citric acidity. Palate has light body, a bit sticky texture. Aromas have cloves, banana, yeast, cereal, citrus.
Chuggable.... This beer is super easy to drink and has a nice fruity wheat flavor.  Great summer beer.  Smooth and easy for a hot summer day.  Sweet after taste.

Poured hazy, honey yellow with a delicious white foam that stays. Strong furity aroma, this is where this beer really shines. Banana, vanilla, apple. grapes, honey and yeast. Medium dense body, somewhat oily, with high carbonation. Sweet taste, almost like honey was added, the aftertaste is also sweet. This is an excellent one.
Cloudy deep golden pour white creamy head decent lacing .... aroma of yeast --- fruity banana ...... creamy taste of banana yeast and clove with a clovey spice finish ..... well done

Light green 12oz bottle poured at 48¬∞.  Color is a light hazy golden with good carbonation and a tight white head.  Aroma is a fruity yeast scent with a light banana note.  It has a light body that goes down smooth and easy.  Flavor is light and clean with a nice fruity flavor coming from the yeast and just a hint of spice.  After taste is clean.  This is a great Hefe, flavor is a touch light but its very clean and refreshing.
Golden with generous head. Aroma sour fruity and yeast. Taste sweet/sour fruit and yeast. Medium body, text smooth.
Poured a hazy orange/brown with a small offwhite head.  Aroma of citrus malt, and wheat.  Taste is of oranges and citrus.  Slightly skunky but sweet.  Finish is crisp.  A good hefeweizen.
This beer has a typical weiss banana aroma with a hint of mild cheese on the taste, pretty good weiss beer which I would drink again

12 oz. bottle. Pours a thick white head, of short duration, over a cloudy, yellow (SRM 5) body, with heavy yeast on the bottom.....nose is lemon/citrus, light apple, clove, bit of banana.....taste is light spice (clove), lemon/citrus, slight apple/pear...mouth feel is light, carbonation high. This is a very typical, high quality Hefeweizen. It has the appearance, nose, flavors that it should. BJCP 8/3/15/4/8

Pours hazy yellow with great white head. Fruity citric, bananas, yeasty, acidy sweet and malty aroma.  Well carbonated. Smokey fruity and yeasty great flavor. Love this stuff. Acidy and crisp on palate. Finishes sweet and sour with hints of hops.

Rating #375, bottle from F√∏tex  

Brownish yellow beer with a big but dissapearing head. Aroma is obvious with refreshing banana and hay. Flavor is likewise refreshing with banana, hay and a bit of grass. Creamy, soft and medium body - a good hefe.

500ml bottle thanks to Andrew... Pours a hazy golden brown with a medium frothy white head.... Quick rate: quite refreshing with lemony wheat flavors with a perfect body and carbonaion for the weather outside. Very quality hefe actually.

Wonderful brew enjoyed at the Kaiserhaus in San Diego tonight.  They¬íve got like 10 German brews on tap.  Hazy amber yellow with big pillowy head.  Nose is yeasty, citrus, and light spice.  Taste is crisp and high citrus/lemon.  Great light flavor.
(draught) cloudy medium yellow-orange with offwhite head. Nose of citrus (orange, lemon), wheat and clove. Taste of orange, Wheat, banana, and cloves. Creamy body. Good hefe.

500 ml brown bottle, not sure how fresh. Mild citrus flavor and light banana. This isn¬ít a hefe with tartness. Some cloves come through in the finish and help dry it out a bit. Nice creamy body. Good, but not top tier.
Great Hefe. Light and very flavorful. Smooth and balanced. A hefe for the masses. The quality is very apparent. Spicy, sweet, Subdued clove, banana. Delicious.
A litter on the lighter side, but still very favorful.  Quite refreshing.  One of my favorite hefes - especially for the price.
Nice citrus aroma on a good looking blonde pour with almost no head. Good weiss flavor, but a tiny bit watery.

Bottle.

Hazy golden/orange with a large white foam. Aroma and taste of banana, citrus, spices and some yeast. Not the best Hefeweizen out there but descent and very drinkable and refreshing.

A hazy golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of fruits like banana with some citrus. Wheat and it¬ís sweet. The taste is sparkling, fruity like banan with wheat. The aftertaste is mostly sweet with some bitter.

Appearance: Golden brown and cloudy.
Aroma: Good aroma of banana and cloves.
Palate: Soft mouthfeel.
Flavor: Very well balance set of flavors: fruit (banana)-spice-yeast-malt and hops are all present but not one overpowering the rest.
Overall:  Excellent, this beer is such a great Hefeweizen. It and Paulaner are neck-and-neck as my favorite beers in this style. In side-to-side comparison it is hard to tell the difference between the two aside from color. Flavor-wise, Franziskaner has a slightly more fruit/banana flavor and Paulaner has slightly a more roasted malt flavor.

Wholly mediocre tasting, and surprisingly watery for its dense style, this particular brew is the clawless cat in the kingdom of hefeweizens. There is some verbose banana flavor going on, but the complexity is pretty limp. I¬íd feel pretty classy using that bottle in a bar fight, though. That gold aluminum seal would give me extra confidence. And lastly, the head, pictured in the rate beer photo, is totally ridiculous; that looks more like a scoop of lemon gelato than anything else. I would recommend this beer, but I¬íd feel like I¬ím offering someone a lazy recipe. Might do in a pinch, but you¬íd be better to pass.
OK its been a while since I had this. Very good as I remember. Unfortunately I can¬ít remember much of the taste. So I¬íll be back soon for a full review.
La mia prima esperienza con le birre di frumento: √® naturale, √® la pi√π comune. Ma il primo amore non si scorda mai! Buona a ogni ora della giornata.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2013 Bottles in Berlin & Hamburg. Sweet & sour grassy bubble gum & citrus aroma. Cloudy light yellow brown colour with big foamy head. Tastes of lemon, banana clove & biscuit.  Bitter sweet wheaty aftertaste. A decent hefe.
Tap  - damn tasty Hefe. Hazy yellow pour, banana, cloves, creamy fruity. Classic.
A hazy yellow pour. Small white head that does not fade. Scent is malt, wheat and fruit. Taste is same with just a touch of bitter. Dry finish.
Pours golden yellow. It has a nice sweet fragrence with a mild clove appeal. It has a mild taste with a partial sweet and bitter after taste. Decent wheat beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours hazy golden-orange color with a huge foamy head and lovely carbonation. Aroma is floral hops, spices and some fruity notes. Floral hops, spices and banana provide nice balance of flavor.  Medium body. Long, fruity finish. Great hefe.
(500ml bottle).  Pours hazy deep yellow color with thick white head. Aroma of banana and clove.  Taste is sweet with a light bitterness.  A good hefeweizen.

tap in a pint glass.  Golden orange color and slightly cloudy in color with minimal head.  Aroma is citrus.  light sweetness and medium body.  Goes down nicely and quite refreshing, considering the weather lately.  Though I tend to like stronger beers, I really liked this one.
Bottle. Pale hazy yellow color. Light  malty, wheat aroma. Taste malty little bit watery. Boring beer.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a murky, golden colour with a large, beautiful, fluffy white head, . Aroma suggests lots of acidity, as well as typical weisse aromas. Taste is indeed very acid, with a weak body but refreshing character. Also had a very slight industrial feeling, but it doesn¬ít damage the beer much, hardly noticable. Average weissbier.
Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Aroma is yeast and citrus, flavor is more skunky with hints of lager and metallic aspects.  Disappointing.
bottled. pours a murkey golden green with a large white head. it smells of sour mash, wheat and yeast. It¬ís a bit skunky. Finishes with long lasting yeast/bread on the palate. decent.

This beer had a distinctly cloudy appearance with a thick aromatic head that seemed to last long when enjoying it.  There were several aromas and tastes that become apparent when first poured and sampled.

Wow. not a bad hefe... one of the better ones out there in fact.  Had a pint of this at the Trion and was glad I did.  Cloudy blond pour with a big white head that stuck around for a little while.  Left some nice lacing by the end of the pint.  In my notes I say "Full traditional hefe nose.  Clean, smooth, easy, traditional."  I would love to have this around as a session beer if I can find it in a 6pk.

Pours cloudy orange with large white head; creamy sweet, yeasty bananish aroma with a touch of clove; flavor is moderate sweet, slightly bananish and yeasty with light to moderate sourness and some crisp wheatness in the finish, aftertaste has a bit spicy feeling; body is medium with softish carbonation. Still the taste could do with a little more intensity, but ultimately pretty safe and quite well balanced hefe.
One of my favorite beers. A love the price too ; ).. A hint of banana flavors with citrus. Drank from a 12 0z. Hazy and light golden in color. Definitely one of my favorites.

tap (better bottled) always 50cl.
Better than paulaner i think. cloudy, hazy golden orange color with head. spicy aromas and taste but in medium "editions". well blended beer.

One of the best Hefeweizen out there. Sweet banana and citrus, smooth mouthfeel and refreshing finish. Very drinkable and even better on tap! Although I prefer Weihenstephaner for its more balanced taste, I enjoy Franziskaner more than Paulaner. Try it if you haven¬ít - this is an outstanding Hefe and an excellent thirst quencher on a hot summer day!
Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head.  Aroma is yeast, citrus and clove.  Taste is strongly of citrus and bubblegum. finishes sweet.  Very refreshing.

Bottle. Pour was medium to light hazy golden with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma was very full of banana, clove, and some spice with some bread-like characters. Body of the beer was almost perfect with the slight dryness of the wheat balancing flawlessly with the sweet biscuit malt. Very well blended beer with full flavor, absolutely an awesome beer

12 oz bottle.
Big frothy and creamy head. Slightly citrus/banana aroma.  I get some sort of floral as well--elderflower? The weight of this beer is truly its most attractive feature.  A perfect silky-yet-refreshing feel (I think the small bubbles contribute) with just enough sweetness.  The crisp finish doesn¬ít entirely wipe out the lingering creaminess.  Very pleasant. 
Without a doubt one of the most ideal weissbiers for session drinking.

On tap at a German restaurant.  Dark hefe that pours an amber color with a moderate to thick head.  Aroma is outstanding and has all sorts of spciy elements - vanilla, cloves, oak, citrus.   What I really liked was the depth of flavor and the long finish of it...it seems to stick to you compared to other hefs.   Very nice.
One of my favorite all time wheat beers. Deep golden amber pour with frothy white head. Nose and taste of spices, citrus and light wheats and barley. Rated 12/30/99

On tap at Redbones in Boston. Cloudy ochre color with nice white foamy head. Nice spicy banana and clove aroma. Intense banana with slight bubblegum flavors, nice carbonation and lingering aftertaste.

Bottle. Pour was medium to light hazy golden with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma was very full of banana, clove, and some spice with some bread-like characters. Body of the beer was almost perfect with the slight dryness of the wheat balancing flawlessly with the sweet biscuit malt. Very well blended beer with full flavor.
Can. Golden beer with a medium white head. Aroma of honey, spices, bread, fruits. Taste is sweet, nice dry finish. Good beer, especially for it¬ís  price!

Draft at Mecklenburg Gardens in Cincinnati.  Pours a cloudy gold color with a finger-thick soft white head.  Aroma of lemon citrus, banana, wheat, bready malts, and a bit of clove and coriander.  The same notes comprise the flavor, which also has light hop notes.  Medium-bodied, with gentle carbonation and a bready mouthfeel and dry, bready finish.  A fine German hefe.

Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse is a hazy, very sparkling, golden beer with a soft, pillowy white head that has outstanding retention and lacing.  It has a spicy, clove aroma with some possible dark fruit.  It smells great.  It has a smooth, foamy, medium-light body and a clean, crisp finish.  What an excellent spicy clove flavor!  It has a hint of sweetness and a touch of lemon and a lemon pepper finish.  It¬ís absolutely quenching.
(Bottle 50cl) Pours hazy yellow with a tall white head. Nice Wheat aroma. Smooth refreshing wheat flavour but I wolud have liked a little more spice/edge.

12 oz bottle into footed pilsner glass (I still need to replace the weizen I broke a month or two ago!!) Aroma is all banana esters and fizzy candy. Smells clean. Pours a hazy gold with a medium dissipating head full of big bubbles and average lace. Taste starts out sweet and finishes with only a hint of bitterness and a citrusy sour note. Medium-bodied, medium-high carbonation. A good beer, but maybe not as good as I remember it or was hoping (just bought a case of it!).

Bottle from Beers of Europe sipped in the spring sunshine during my bi-weekly drink ups with a few pals who have only recently stopped calling me a ¬ísad bastard¬í whilst i scribble down notes. i think they¬íve grown accustomed to it now! Anyway, a cloudy gold pour with an off white head. Aromas of honey, banana, light malts, juicy fruit. Flavours of peaches, banana, quite sweet. Dry sweet finish.
Aroma is lemmon, citrus, yeast, and wheat.  Notes of sweet malts, banana, and bread stand out.  Palate is a bit strong, but good mouthfeel.  Taste brings out the banana, damn good hefeweissen.

Can.  Generous white head that held out fairly well, and a good sign for the style.  Almost a muddy burnt orange color.  Aroma is citrus-driven with some sour bananas hiding behind.  Fainter yeastiness for the style, and flavor very much mirrors the aroma.  Nothing spectacular, but nothing off or bad.  Body is a little slick with very soft carbonation and a touch thin.  Not a bad hefe, but just doesn¬ít stand up there with others.

Spaten Franziskaner Brau Munchen--Hefe Weisse--1998 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (2.5 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Cloudy light orange straw golden color.  Pours with big head.  German yeast citrus accents dominate front and medium body initially but mellow with addition of loose pellicle.  Citrus dry finish.  Sampled 3/25/1999.

Spaten Franziskaner Brau Munchen--Hefe Weisse--2001 12 oz. Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  (3.5 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Hazy golden orange color.  Green bottle.  Slightly warm.  Medium creamy white head.  Mild wheat front with slight Bavarian note.  Medium textured mildly malty wheat body.  Mild long malt citrus spice end.  Sampled 6/26/2001.

Spaten-Franziskaner-Brau Munchen--Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse Weissbier--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  10 IBU¬ís?  (4.5 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Bavarian.  6-Pack $9.50.  Green Bottle.  Foamy big lacy white head.  Light tight sediment.  Cloudy bright pretty lemon orange color.  Rich Bavarian banana fruit ester front.  Cloying crusty mild sweet creamy rich wheat banana clove body.  Refreshing vibrant wheat spice mild hop end. Sampled 8/20/2008.  Classic Bavarian Hefe.
33 cl bottle. Pours golden color with a white head. The aroma was full of bananas and bread. The flavor was a spicy, clove, yeast, wheat flavor.
Big banana and clove on the nose.  First impressions do not disappoint.  Very bright and crisp.  A proper hefeweizen.

Pours cloudy golden with a massive white head and a banana and yeast aroma. Hey, this is a pretty good hefe. Mellow wheat flavor with some banana ester and light spice and a crisp, slightly bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours totally opaque but evenly-toned dark honey-ochre with a thick, voluptuous head that lasts. Estery aroma is overtly fruity with caramelized banana, custard apple, and soursop. Some milkiness. A deeper inspection reveals a good wheat malt backbone beneath the sweetness and yeastiness. Body is highly carbonated but only slightly prickly. Fairly thick and certainly yeasty but without being too cloying. Flavors linger on the tongue, and a decent level of acidity adds good balance. Guava notes. Moderate complexity. Pretty good.

Aroma con lieve nota di banana, frumento e leggero sentore agrumato. Al palato √® morbida ed equilibrata con note fruttate di banana e chiodi di garofano. Finale poco persistente. Comunque una delle mie weiss preferite.

a very nice weissbier.  Pours golden colour with white head.  Moderate carbonation which dissipates to a low level  that doesn¬ít interfere  with the palate or flavour.  This wheat beer has a very pronounced citrus, bannana and spice character in the nose and taste.  A very tastey one, great for a hot summer day.  Very easy drinking (as is the case for most of the class)

Another great Hefe enjoyed at Fritz & Franz Bierhaus. Deep golden color, cloudy with a nice white head. Aroma of cloves, dough, and grains with some banana. Tastes of bananas, some roasted grains, a tiny bit of chocolate, but mainly of cloves. Very smooth, pleasant taste, another new favorite hefe.

500mL bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a persistent white head.  Yeasty, spicy and slightly estery aroma.  Fairly clean flavour, a bit yeasty and spicy.  Light bodied, average carbonation and creamy with a yeasty finish.

Bottle to weizen glass.  Pours hazy golden with thick white head.  Aromas of spice, hay and malt.  Nice cloves and well balanced.  Very nice creamy feeling palate.  Great finish.  This is a good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2010 This Hefe-weissbier pours a hazy golden color with a fair sized white foam.  It has a complex aroma containing apple, banana, floral, spice, and citrus tones.  The flavor is estery with light sourness, medium sweetness, and a yeasty finish.  Palate is medium bodied with a long, crisp finish.  Overall, Franziskaner is an exceptionally crisp Hefe-Weissbier with a nicely layered, complex flavor.

Slightly hazt yellow, nice white head, tiny bubble carbonation, decent lacing. Doughy banana bread highlights both the aroma and flavor. Hints of clove. Creamy/smooth mouthfeel turns spritzy. Lingering juicy fruit/bubblegum. Nothing mind-blowing, but always a reliable session beer. Score reflects that more than anything.

A- Very cloudy pale yellow body with thick foamy white head. Head tapers to a nice thin head with great retention. Plenty of lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- Citrus hits the nose first followed by yeast, bananas, and spices. Smell is very welcoming and in-line with a good hefe.

T- Good balance of citrus and yeast up front with other spices and some banana in the background. Finish is all yeast. It lingers between drinks.

P- Light carbonation and yeasty body. Mouthfeel is very smooth and refreshing.

O- This is a great beer. Very sessionable and very drinkable. Easy to session on any day and a stand-out hefe.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-23-2007 18:05:27
17 ounce bottle A cloudy goldish pour- 3 finger head.sweet aroma- taste of citrus, clove, banana, . A real good brew
nice sweet wheat aroma. pours a beautiful cloudy color. tastes as sweet as it smells with a light sweet finish. overall a good wheat beer.
On tap at The Taphouse, pours a hazy yellow with a thick head. Aroma is bread and yeast. Flavour is similar, with wheat and citrus. Great wheat beer.
Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma is very bready and yeasty. Taste is of a strong yeast and wheat. This is an excellent weizen beer.

Pours a hazy medium golden color with a thick white head.  This beer has an aroma of light malt.  The beer has a light, sweet flavor with hits of banana.  The beer is crisp in the mouth and has a pleasant aftertaste.  Overall, this is a clean, easy drinking beer without a lot of flavor.
500 ml bottle from the trinkgut a hazy yellow orange colored beer with a white head aroma fruity mostly banana and malts taste fruit banana light sweet and malts a nice beer

Good beer.  Nice color (had a somewhat darker hue than the Boulevard Wheat that was right next to it.)  Great aroma.  Didn¬ít seem too cloudy, but couldn¬ít see in the restaurant that well.    Great taste, very drinkable.

Beautiful cloudy yellow with good head. Banana/citrus aroma and taste. Medium bodied. An excellent session beer, one of the top brands of it¬ís style and great German beer. Do not be a stupid American sheeple by adding lemon or lime in it, just drink as is from glass or bottle

pours a hazy yellow with a rich white long-lasting head. Great lacing. Aroma gives a citrus, banana, wheat. Very pleasant as you drink. Thin to medium body. Taste is wheat, yeast, banana, sweet fruit. Not over carbonated. Overall, a very pleasant beer to have when you want more than just a few
On Tap. Cloudy orange gold with puffy white head. Aroma of citrus & spices. Just a whisker fizzy. Excellent HefWeis.
Cloudy golden with a dense head. Aroma-lemon, banana, clove, yeast. Taste-wheat, clove, banana, lightly sweet. Finishes medium bodied and creamy. Excellent.

Pours a hazy yellow body with a foamy white head on top. Looks damn fine in the tall weizen glass. Nose gives me clove and bananas (classic) and taste is well-rounded notes of bread, with hints of pine and grapefruit. Palate is nice enough, and this is a good hefe-weizen. Not as good as its current rating indicates, though.

Bottle. 1pt 9floz. Pours a cloudy light-orange color with a white fizzy head. Smells of wheat with a hint of banana and bready malts. Tastes of bready malts with even more banana this time. Head leaves a fine lacing and is regenerated from the bottom. An excellent heffe. Great beer for a random pick for something different.
This beer was nothing specieal.. the taste was really the only reason i finished it.
Huge white lasting head with good lacing. Sparkling and hazy orange body. Yeasty, fresh, bread, hay, cereal. Medium sweetness, lightly sour. medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation.

16.9 ounce bottle - $2.59 at Bullock¬ís in Marietta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out a cloudy, golden-orange body with a rather large, fluffy, off-white head, though it quickly gasses out into just a very thin layering of fizzle.

Smell: Mild nose smelling of wheat malt, lemon wedges, ground coriander, and banana, with nothing previously listed being particularly aromatic.

Taste: Lightly tangy-tasting malted wheat with a thin measure of honeyish sweetness. Small hint of raw grain. Light touches of lemon, coriander, and banana pass by the tongue. Hop bitterness remains very low, just enough to be felt. Things thin out considerably as you near the dry finish, but there is a bit more lemon to be had.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body, though lacking the creaminess of other weiss beers. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Sure, it¬ís got ease of drinking and refreshment on its side, but it comes across as simply being dutifully, dully average. So, all in all, while it¬ís by no means bad, I¬íve had better

16 oz. Pours hazy orange. Sediment visible. White fluffy head. Not much lacing. Aroma of bread, yeast, citrus. Flavor is sour citrusy. Dry finish. 

Overall pretty good.

Cloudy golden orange, thick creamy head.
Aroma of fresh bread, citrus, spices and some hops.
Flavour is a fresh bitterness with sour citrus and some spices.
Nice beer for a hot summer day.

I wouldn¬ít say I¬ím a huge fan of hefeweizens and wheat beers in general, although I have discovered some very tasty beers of the style over the last year or so. Franziskanker Hefe-Weissebier is one of the lesser-known names when it comes to authentic German wheat beers. What¬ís odd is the beer is the only one of its kind that comes packaged in green bottles, and we all know the perils of green bottles, right?I should disclaim this review by mentioning that the bottle I drank out of appeared to be old as a thick layer of yeast literally stuck to the bottom of bottle like pancake batter (despite the fact I gave the last 2 inches of liquid in the bottle a good swirl and shake before I poured them out). Still, I was quite surprised at just how well Franziskaner was able to perform given its inherent handicap.APPEARANCE AND AROMALike most hefeweizens, this beer pours to a very hazy body of dark amber/light brown. I actually saw some big chunks of yeast floating around the edges which eventually settled to the bottom. However, I didn¬ít notice much carbonation. The head was surprisingly small at only two fingers tall and dissipated much faster than your average German hef.Since this beer¬ís bottle is green it¬ís not surprising there was a noticeable skunky scent to the aroma, but it¬ís not nearly as bad as the more notorious offenders (i.e. Heineken). If you take a deep whiff you can detect some spices and a faint sweet scent as well. I just wish they had been stronger.TASTESome people complain that hefeweizens, especially authentic German offerings, are ¬ìtoo spicy,¬î but beer geeks like me often find them to be complex and full of character. I think Franziskaner might work well as an introductory beer for those intimidated by the style since it¬ís actually rather mild. However, despite its low-key palate, it still manages to maintain the basic properties of a wheat beer of this type.I did detect a slight banana and clove taste, but only on the finish. The initial mouthfeel is watery and mild with a faint sweetness. Perhaps I detect coriander and/or orange peel or maybe a general m√©lange of spices. Whatever it may be it¬ís noticeable, but again, rather mild. There¬ís also a slightly skunky taste, but it¬ís tolerable and doesn¬ít subtract from the overall palate.DRINKABILITYLightweights often pooh-pooh the spiciness of beers like this, but they never acknowledge just how easy these beers are to drink. Since Franziskaner Hefe-Weissebier is much milder than your average German brew of the type, it¬ís actually quite impressive how high it rates in terms of drinkability. The mouthfeel is extremely soft and yet a little thick so as not to be watery. There¬ís almost no noticeable carbonation, so it finishes extremely smooth and also makes it very refreshing. It was difficult for me not to chug this beer!WEIGHTNeither the bottle nor the brewer¬ís website indicates any statistics about this brew, but third-party sources say Franziskaner Hefe-Weissebier has a potency of only 5% ABV. I would certainly believe that since the mild body goes perfectly with a weight of this sort. In fact, I wouldn¬ít be surprised if the actual numbers were lower since this beer drinks like an American macro ¬ìlight¬î as it does not come close to overwhelming or filling up the drinker. FINAL THOUGHTSI always try to give the benefit of the doubt, so I believe it¬ís very possible Franziskaner Hefe-Weissebier is actually much closer to being a top-notch brew than it appeared to be. Since my bottle was old I know I didn¬ít get an accurate reflection of how this beer should really taste. But considering all it had going against it, I¬íd say it¬ís still a good beer since it¬ís tasty, smooth and light. NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A0ESZD_IIPY

Pours a cloudy, light yellow with a thick head. It has a pleasant aroma of hops with a hint of cloves and spice. The taste is of a very good balance of malt and hops with traces of cloves. Far more balanced than many weissbieren that go too strong on the cloves.
floral, citrus, golden, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, light body, average carbonation, astringent,
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a large white head. Nice aromas of wheat, yeast banana and sweet malts. Very light flavours of much of the same.
Grabbed lunch at Oktoberfest in Epcot.  This hefe pours hazy yellow with a medium head.  Tasted citrusy and doughy with a little bitterness.  Pretty tasty brew that my wife also enjoyed.
Hazy orange with a medium frothy white head.. Fresh malty aroma with plenty of fruity sweetnes. Satisfying finish. Very refreshing and easy to drink one after another.
