Good hefeweizen. Taste is thin with low hops and slight citrus aroma. It might have just been me but I swear there was a tone of splenda-like sugar within the dryness.

Split this one with a friend.  Golden beer with a great white head.  Aroma of banana and perhaps a bit of bubble gum.  Great wheat beer taste with slight hints of banana.  This has always been a good beer for me.

EXCELLENT HEFE. Worth trying. Smells sweet like fresh baked bread almost. Mild hints of citrus/banana aromas are present. It has a golden, thick cloudy appearance with a head that falls fast but is cream like and laces up a bit. Its taste is mildy sweet with a very mild hint of, i want to say banana, and yet distinctly wheat flavored. It is smooth and has NO bitterness. So far the best hefe i have tasted to date, out of 8 brands i have tried; including the WAY to barly flavored Paulaner hefe. If you like Wheats and Hefes you will love this. CHEER!!!
Pours golden with thick white head, aroma is fruity and estery.  Taste up front is banana, cloves, and fruit flavors that finishes a bit spicy and sweet.  Very nice beer.

Pours out of the bottle a cloudy orangish yellow with a mid sized white head that dissapates in a average fashion.  Nice lacing on my glass.  Aroma is of wheat, yeast and banana.  Taste is typical for the style, as the beer warms the flavors become more complex.  Great beer.
This one makes me feel sick. It looks quite good, but thats all.
Purs a hazy straw pale colour with excellent weiss head. Herbal fruity and sweet aroma. Flavor is spicy with sweet and fuity orange notes. Excellent weissbier.

12oz bottle.  Pour results in a hazy orange-ish body with a fluffy off-white head that recedes quickly.  Nose is slight banana, spices, yeasty and cloves.  Flavors of banana, bubblegum, hint of clove and slight sweetness.  Lively carbonation with a thin, crisp body.  Short finish ending in bananas and bready.

Bottle from Fresh Market into weizen glass. Pours a nice hazy golden color with generous amounts of fluffy white foam. Yeasty aroma of bananas, large amounts of oranges, and clove. Taste is largely the same, but the citrus somewhat takes a backseat to the bananas and spiciness. Palate is light, but certainly not watery. Pretty good.

Birra color giallo oro luminoso, con una bella schiuma bianca piuttosto persistente,  al naso √® una classica hefeweizen tedesca, pi√π agrumata che di banana, note speziate. al palato dolce del frumento, piuttosto  liscia, ancora ritorno dello speziato, corpo medio. rinfrescante come solo le weizen tedesche sanno essere.

My favorite weiss beer, best enjoyed on tap.  There¬ís a subtle richness to this ale with an equal balance of fizz, notes of banana and clove.  I view this a gateway beer if you¬íre a fan of Blue Moon and just getting started in craft brew appreciation.
20.01.2010, 0,5l Bottle. In Bremen. Golden yellow colour with a large white head. Aroma is wheatmalt with banana. Very nice and smooth weissbier to enjoy after breakfast!
nice color and palate for a hefeweizen, great taste, good citrus notes but not overpowering, extremely easy to drink, very enjoyable, will definitely do it again.

Sour mashy aroma, pours hazy gold with an exuberant white head, sticky lacing. Initial flavor of nutmeg and mash, lightly tart, a bit of a citrus edge, turning sweeter as the flavor develops and gains banana character. Palate harmonizes somewhere between smooth and zest. Medium bodied. Nice hefe.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2010 Bottle. Pours a nice sparkling golden with a spicy fruit aroma. Taste begins with spiced yeast followed by cloves and bananas. Finish is crisp, dry and refreshing with a mild clove aftertaste. Great hot summer day beer.

Assaggiata in bottiglia da 50Cl.
Aspetto veramente bello, giallo oro opaco e schiuma alta, corposa e persistente. Il gusto richiama i profumi della frutta con, ovviamente, la banana in evidenza. Piacevole da bere e con un buon corpo. Una delle mie preferite
murky golden orange.  Floral aroma.  Taste is heavy citrus and floral like perfume. Light, smooth, and refreshing.  Wheat with definite floral notes.

Bottle. Aroma was mostly of yeasty malt, appearance is lighter than I expected, taste is funky, but good, little bit syrupy yet not too much body, overall good, but I would seek out other makers of this style.

I normally don¬ít mind wheat beers, but this one¬ís got a sour, pungent bite that lingers, making the next sips harder and harder to take.  It helps if you hold your breath and let the beer slide just down the center of your tongue.   Sorry, not my style of brew.  I received a crateful of random brews for X-mas and I¬ím gonna slog through then all.

My favorite Hefe. Pours light gold almost yellow with a good head. Mild tangy aroma. Fresh lemon taste but not too sweet.Goes down real easy and clean. Another great food beer as it is not too filling and goes well with almost everything..

poured clear white producing a finger thick off white head.  the body is hazy and cloudy that is light oarnge in color and the head fell at a medium rate making a thin cap on the top of the beer.  the aromas are grassy and has some wheat in the nose also.  theres some bitterness in the nose  too with some yeast.  the flavor is really balanced and carbonated really good making an enjoyable brew.  its slightly sweet, slightly bitter, and slight malty.  the germans know exactly what the hell their doing when it comes to making beer.
On draft in Cleveland, OH. Pours straw yellow with a big foamy white head. Taste is wheat, banana, clove. I¬íve had this plenty of times in a bottle but fresh on draft is really the best.
I think that Franzi hefeweissbier is a very popular beer here in Greece. Nice weissbier with well balanced aroma and taste. Ideal for every moment during the day.

2007-05-23, bottle, G√∂teborg
AP: golden cloudy body, high heavy foam
AR: citrus, yeast
F: fruits, yeast, apricot and citrus
very wheaty, caramel-y, butter smell, rich, dry. Not something I will revisit.

Unfiltered, pale, almost no head,

Sweet aroma, some complexities. Bread.

Citrus, low in alcohol, bitterness.

Flat. Thin.

 Maybe I had a shaken sample? Fairly ok.

 Gift from Peter / Krakow.

Pours a hazy sunny yellow with a large thick head and very lively carbonation pushing a few floaties from the bottom to the top of the glass and back again. The aroma is reminiscent of bread dough with some bubble gum, some banana, some lemon and some light floral notes. Every time I taste this it takes me back to my early days of beer drinking, this was at one time what I considered to be my favorite beer one taste shows me that I was without a doubt on to something. The flavor of the beer is complex but at the same time "drinkable" enough to sit and sip without pouring over every nuance, it is at once a beer both to be savored and sessioned sometimes at the same time but without guilt this can also be done very separately.  The first thing that hits you is the banana and spicy clove, although hallmarks of the style they seem to come forth in this beer in a way that makes it one of the necessary beers to try within the style. Going beyond that there is a lemon like citrus character and a fruitiness including apple and pear that tricks one into thinking they are drinking a far sweeter beer, this beer is by no means bone dry but the fruitiness lends the beer both an approachable quality for beginners and a nuance for connoisseurs that make this all around a pretty nice go to beer.  The beer is also bready and lightly bitter. Just a very nice example of the style.

Pours a beautiful foggy golden yellow with a huge head that fades very slowly. A wonderful yeasty, fruity (banana) aroma I¬íve come to expect from good weizens. Very malty, fruity taste with spicy finish with lingering banana taste. An excellent weissbier; the Dunkel is good to!

Pours a hazy blonde color with a thick white head. Aroma of bubblegum, banana and a bit floral. Taste is moderately sweet, quite watery but refreshing. No finish at all, taste is just gone after gulping down.
Orange pour with a white head. Sweet and fruity. Solid without the cheap adjunct taste. Very good.
500mL Bottle -- Pours hazy burnt-orange with a big white head.  Very solid flavors and aromas.  Cereal malts, banana, orange, clove.  Yeasty notes towards the back-end.

Draft on tap at the Bavarian Lodge (Lisle, IL). Pours a nice murky yellow gold, with a moderate whitish head that dies to a decent layer, laces ok, soapy. Aromas are flaked white wheat, banana fruit esters, a light touch of lemon, and a soothing sweetness. Initial is fruity banana, a light bitterness, flaked white wheat sweetness with the typical bitterness on the backend. Cereal malts, a touch of lemon, and a nice overall drinkability, despite the cliche of that term. Banana esters come ona bit stronger into the body. Pretty solid German Hefe. Finish leaves subtle sweetness, fruity banana, and a light bitterness. Good.

I can understand why this is popular.  Having my last one tonight with pulled pork and it fully stands up to that and balances out the vinegar bite.  Yellow green with champagne type bubbles and really active carbonation.  Smells like unripened banana, aloe and light spices.  Flavor and mouthfeel are so spot on for the warmer months with plaintain and a wheaty breadiness dominating here.  Don¬ít let this one warm up to much.  Great brew.  Thanks Franziskaner.  2009 12oz.
About average for a hef. Dry, light hoppy taste and not too smooth. Not much flavor beyond that. Somewhat disappointing for a beer, but middle of the road for a hef.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2011 12 oz. bottle- Let me start off by saying that I had Iron Horse High Five Hefe directly before this, and this is what a hefe should look like, High Five I give credit for trying something unusual flavorwise, but this wins hands down in every way. Pours Cloudy golden with a nice thick white head, aroma is of citrus, wheat and yeast. The flavor is very similar to HB hefe, which it should considering they come from the same country, although I would have to compare them side by side to see which one was better. One things for sure, this is one style of beer that Germany usually does better than America.

50cl bottle: Murky yellow with an orange hue and a fluffy bright white head. A subtle, sweet maltiness compliments the thick yeast aromas - fresh citric/fruity smell of orange peel, apricot and banana. Flavours of orange, yeast (cinnamon and clove -like esters), spicy herbs and overall pretty sweet but drinkable. Not watery but light on the palate. Nice for a Hefeweizen.

500ml bottle
Hazy golden appearance. The traditional hefeweize yeast bubblegum banana flavor. Quite dry. Not my favorite hefeweizen, feels a little more watery and not as full-bodied as Schneider or Weihenstephaner.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 In brown bottle (avoid green bottle), pours a hazy golden with big white head.  Some lacing, medium body, and medium carbonation.  Taste is clove with some banana.  Good for a hefeweizen, but not as good as Weihenstephaner hefe weissbier.

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Touchstone aromas of citrus, clove and grass. Flavor is likewise lemony and spicy with a dry finish.  The flavors are pleasantly integrated, with none overwhelming the taste. Very drinkable and refreshing.
bottle.  rating #1657 for this beer.  pours a hazy golden with a white head.  some lace.  notes of typical banana, cove, bread, and spices.  light and crisp.  easy drinkin.  pretty good.

A: Poured with a huge, white creamy head... this baby hung around for quite awhile, and eventually dissipated to about 1-finger. Dark yellow and cloudy body.

S: Very nice aroma of wheat, with lots of lemon. Not too strong at all, which is a trap a lot of hefes seem to fall into.

T: Mildly sweet, with light tones of wheat and lemon. Short duration; very easy drinking and refreshing.

M: Creamy texture with a medium body and soft-to-average carbonation.

D: Highly drinkable, very refreshing... an excellent hefeweizen, and a fantastic session beer.

Nose of wheat, citrus, and some spices.  Taste is quite dry and snappy, with a predominantly wheat character.  Finishes very clean and smooth.  Easy to drink, and a pleasure to drink.  That¬ís a win-win right there.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a creamy white head.  Has a stong yeasty aroma with ester and fruity notes.   Vanilla and banana are the first tastes and last all the way through with subtle wheat flavors. Full and creamy mouthfeel.

5.000 ml keg. From Straubing, Germany. 
Banana, wheat, caramel, citrus and hints of yeast. Banana, wheat, caramel and some bitter hops in flavour. Excellent Weizen.

Pours hazy orange with a large white head.
The expected banana and wheaty bread instantly recognisable in the aroma, along with oatmeal and just the slightest hint of cloves.
Flavours include white bread, subtle banana and hints of cinnamon.
Body seems slightly watery, but carbonation is good.
Lemony Banana Super easy to drink, beautiful light gold color. A bit light for my taste, but really very good.

Poured from bottle into Frankfurter glass.

Very bubbly, somewhat dark, cloudy orange-yellow with a huge fluffy head. American-made Hefeweizens wish they could look like this. Wait a minute, where did the head go? - it settled down to a thin layer with no lacing. Oh well, nice while it lasted.

Aroma of spicy clove, wheat malt, banana, lemon and light noble hops.

Major clove and wheat taste, while the banana is a little more restrained. While very good, not quite as flavorful as hoped for. A big chunk of yeast settled on the bottom (despite my best efforts to break it up), and when I took that last sip, it tasted much more flavorful. While this bottle only arrived at my store a couple weeks ago, I can only assume this would have been better if it was fresh in Germany and the yeast had been mixed up better.

High carbonation, light body, dry finish.

Nice refreshing Weizen that could have used a touch more depth or maybe the Germans need to figure out how to get their beers here faster.

Bottle.  Hazy golden pour with a foamy white head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Sweet, ripe banana flavor.  A very standard hefeweizen in many respects but this is a common beer that is really good.  No big wow factor just a solid beer.
Bottle. Hazy golden beer with a foamy head. Aroma has (not a suprise) yeast and banana. Quite sweet flavor is pretty much the same. Medium body, very well balanced beer.

Golden hazy pour, with a very slight hint of the typical hefe on the nose.  Taste of course has the banana and clove but certainly not as pronounced as other hefes that I¬íve had.  Has a bit of a bitter note at the end.  Not bad at all but nothing transcendent.

50cl brown bottle, as shown. Pours a hazy, pale yellow golden with a big, fluffy white head that collapses quickly. 

Aroma of banana, citrus and herbal spices. Active carbonation, medium-bodied weizen. Good mouthfeel.

Taste is dominated by sweet banana, very typical for a Bavarian hefe. A healthy citrus note prevents this brew from being cloying. Spicy, dry finish and herbal after taste. 

One of the signature mainstream hefe beers from "down under": very well balanced, at once, supremely quaffable and quite characterful. If this kind of weizen is too banana-ish for you, try the Belgian variety like "Hoegaarden" - their beers are usually drier and more citrusy. Otherwise, Franziskaner is one of the best!
Just an excellent hefe.  If hefe or wheat beers are one of your favorites, this is a must try.  Typical cloudy golden pour (from bottle).  Fruity, bananaish taste.  Smooth finish.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a medium sized white head with nice carbonation. Nose is citrus and spices. Mouthfeel is very creamy and medium bodied. Taste is wheat, citrus and spice. No bitterness, lightly hopped. A fine weissbier that pairs well with cheese, fruit, poultry or fish.
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2009 On tap; great wheat beer. Aroma of banana and spice. Great medium bodied taste with the same strong banana and spice notes. Not as good in bottle; would rate in bottle lower
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2010 bottle - Typical Weizen - can detect a bit more spice in the nose than some others in its category - high accessibility also a plus.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2010 Bottle. 
Cloudy as hell. Good head. Full aroma of malt, yeast, fruit (banana). Great rich taste, pretty sweet, medium to full body. Yeast and wheat malt finish, long lasting. This is one of the great wheat beers. Rich and satisfying.

Poured from the bottle.  Pour produced a hazy, golden-brown body, topped by a small white head, which diminished mostly, leaving small, islets of foam.  Lemon citrus aroma, indicative of the style, with slight hints of spice (though I felt it could have used more) Crisp carbonation, with a watery body.  Flavor is sweet-sour, with a a good citrus profile, though not much in the way of spice.  The overall flavor drops off sharply, unexpectedly, leaving a flat aftertaste.  Initially, this beer has a typical, if unassuming palate.  The shortness of the profile, while making this a quaffing beer, do little to fit the style.
Good Hefe. Lots of clove and spices on the nose, banana a bit muted for the style. Medium bodied and good easy drinking without being cloying.

Refer to past 1600 reviews for description.  Nothing new to add.  Beautiful golden hazy appearance, wheat aroma.  A little too much banana for my taste, but overall and excellent beer that I can count on finding all over the globe.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2010 On tap at Bear Mountain Octoberfest 2009.  Rerate.  Noticed a lot more bubblegum upfront this time around.  Very cloudy yellow, with a tinge of orange.  The aroma is wheat, cereal grains, spicy.  The flavor is bubblegum, clove, other spices, banana.  The finish was spicy, clove, slight noble hops.  Medium mouthfeel.  Decent hefe overall.

Cloudy golden orange, with a nice tall head that dissipates a bit too quickly. Strong clove aroma, with a bit of bubblegum. Flavor is clove and bubblegum, with a bit of banana aftertaste. I guess this is a pretty basic hefeweizen. Not bad, but it leaves me wanting more.
Poured hazy orangish golden, bananna, little citrus peal, little yeasty, little spice.
50cl bottle. gold color, nice white head. Usual weizen aroma of banana and yeast. Very refreshing.
Bottled.. Pours cloudy gold with a white head.. Aroma is bananas and hefe yeast.. Flavor is bananas and a little bit of spice.. Lots of carbonation.

Pint on tap in Schenectady, NY. Pours a nice hazy golden color, moderate head. Aroma is quite malty, a little spice noted. Flavor is quite spicy and bitter, nice and crisp and refreshing. Well balanced, really hit the spot.

I bought my first six pack of this at John¬ís Grocery in Iowa City without trying it and I really enjoyed it. Golden pour with a white head. I got an aroma of citrus with a little bit of smoke. A refreshing beer, enjoy it

Bottle from coldbrewky. One of my favorite Hefe¬ís. Pours a hazy honey color with a generous fluffy white head. Aroma is yeast, banana, and a little spice. Light flavor has a butt load of banana and citrus and some mild clove. Finishes clean and smooth. Great beer!

This is one of the more available heffes  (inBev) you can get in just about every liquor store around here. (northern NJ) Pours a large fluffy head, aroma is typical pleasant hefe. Taste is nice and balanced with good flavors. Mixes of bubblegum, banana, spices and citrus. I really like the way this beer finishes... you get a little spice at the end that compliments the bubblegum mouth-feel nicely.
Always good. Solid hef. Enjoyable. Wheat with citrus, banana, spice. Good body, fluffy white head. Great in the summer.
A great hefeweizen lots of banana and clove notes.with a slightly bitter finish. A very refreshing beer.
Overall, a good representation of German style wheat beers.  Bubblegum and banana notes mixed with a bit of citrus.  Better than the Kristall, but not as good as Weihenstephan.
Bottle from Whole Foods Arlington.  I like the dunkel better, but this wasn¬ít too bad.
Bottle. Pours an odd, hazy gold. Gorgeous, fat white head. Aroma of clean wheat, spice, clove, and a hint of yeast. Medium body with a sturdy finish. Slightly bitter aftertaste.
One of the best hefeweizen beers out there. The banana and clove flavors are much more bold and stand out more than a typical hefeweizen.

It¬ís a "tr√ºb" beer with an average head. Nicely carbonated.  The wheat flavor is very much like "banana". Finishes smooth and wheathy. This one is ok but why does it cost more than other beers of the same "Hefe-Weissbier"-kind? Maybe a little too refined...
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2009 Cloudy golden yellow color with a thick creamy head. Great refreshing wheat flavor with a little fruitiness and a pleasant yeast aroma.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2010 I think this it¬ís one of the best weissbier I have ever drank, because is well balances.
Franziskaner has a pleasant aroma and the liquid is oily/creamy.
Have had from the bottle and on tap, tap being better.  Typical profile and flavor with banana and clove, but well executed.

Initial Appearnce on this one is very nice, as most of this style are.  Golden liquid with a very thick and frothy head.  Good carbonation.  Aroma is light spice over clove/banana.  Taste is thankfully light on the spice..but unfortunately pretty light on everything.  Refreshing and good on the palate with a medium body and high carbonation..but pretty bland.
500mL bottle poured into Weissbier glass. Pours deep golden with thick white head. Spicy fruit aroma, nice thick bready taste. Another solid weissbier.
Sweet maple syrup, banana, some pepper/clove, breadiness. Pronounced aroma. Foamy head.

A very good hef. Cloudy golden pour with a tall vanilla head that has legs. Aroma of lemon, orange, banana, and strong clove. Medium body and carbonation. Taste has a pleasant balance of spicy clove, white pepper, and citrusy lemon, orange, and ripe banana. Great stuff here, classic for the style. Best hefeweizen in a bottle that I¬íve enjoyed in quite awhile.

unbelievable, yes im american, but yet a beer taster of them all.  Franziskaner, tastes as the jungle of it self. Natural, smooth, and  a sweet taste of banana zest. What more can you ask.  Starting out with smooth buaetiful head, pearly in color, almost like the puff of a cloud.  The first taste is almost legendary to its nature.  Light but flavorful, weizen at its best. And who new, the suprise of banana with no part,  Almost as it fell of the tree of a fransiskaner bloom. Smooth, like a baby¬ís bottom.

Memories¬Ö there is nothing quite like the Franziskaner Hefeweizen to take me down memory lane. While it may not be gilded in gold or over the rainbow, I have many a fond memory of this beer, and thankfully, the memories always hold up to the impartial blatancy of reality. The Franziskaner Hefeweizen was my first hefeweizen, and to this day it is still one of my favorite. I know I can always sit down with a hefeweizen glass filled to the brim with Franziskaner, and life is good.


Hazy oranges mingle with soft golden straw colors resting easy under a gentle white head that is easily 2-3 fingers thick, as she should be. In absolutely no rush, she fades at her own pace, leaving clumps of lace and a rocky blanket of white foam behind. Her nose is a beautiful bouquet of spice, bananas, banana bread, clove, and bubblegum. The spice hits first followed by soothing notes of orange and clove. Orange zest nips at the back and soft wheat holds it all gently in her embrace. Taking a moment to bask in her presence, I finally surrender to the growing thirst which must be satiated. Soft, lightly chewy, with a coating palate of bananas, moist banana bread, and orange esters. Cloves, spice, and more bananas linger in my breath as her softness lulls me into fond memories of past times spent together. Like a good friend, after the first sip of my Franziskaner Hefeweizen, it is as if no time at all has passed. Light and highly aromatic, her body prefers a more subtle approach. A bit more orange comes into play, mingling with banana while wheat provides a soft bed upon which her palate unravels. Hefeweizens will always be my favorite summer thirst quencher, followed very quickly with Belgian Witbiers. While not the best, Franziskaner Hefeweizen will always hold a soft spot in my heart.


Franziskaner also offers a Dunkel Hefeweizen which is equally as nostalgic and thirst-quenching as her standard brother, the Hefeweizen. Many who taste a hefeweizen for the first time after being misled by American wheat beers who claim falsely to be hefeweizens, are shocked, surprised, and quite often put-off by its aromatic nature. Cloves, spice, banana, and breads are the spice of life when it comes to German hefeweizens, and I wouldn¬ít have it any other way. Grab a sixer of Franziskaner Hefeweizen and create your own treasured memories.

Pint on tap. Looks like a typical hefe, cloudy with tight white head that fades but doesn¬ít disappear. Aroma of banana, but very weak compared to most of the hefes I¬íve had. Typical smooth mouthfeel, flavour of mostly vanilla and banana, with a touch of clove, but once again it was weak. Swallow was mostly banana, with a decent dry banana aftertaste. Decent, but overrated, Weihenstephaner blows this out of the water, either that or I got a bad one.

Straw-colored pour with a medium head. Aroma of citrus and faint hit of plantain. Taste is crisp, maybe a little too much malt. Aftertaste is heavy on a spice, maybe clove? Good hefeweizen, perfect for a summer eve.
Wheaty beer, with a smooth aftertaste.  Enjoyable fruity taste comes out in the middle-taste.

500ml bottle.  Cloudy thick orange-tan color.  Big foamy head.  Excellent appearance certainly.  Pronounced banana-clove aroma.  Classic banana esters, smooth and easy drinking.  Thicker and creamy, but has a dulled unfresh malt underlying character.  Assumably pretty awesome fresh in Germany.  Classic Hefeweizen, though hardly the best.
Pours a hazy straw color body with a lasting ring of white head.  Smells of yeast and malts.  Flavor is clean and yeast.

On draught at the Lazy Boy Saloon. Unfortunately, this was served in a shaker. Still, it had a voluptuous head with a strong, spicy nose (hints of citrus and even banana). Perfect balance of wheat and other flavours. I can see why this is a standard for the style.

cans @ home. great hefeweizen! pours hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is very strong with hints of banana. Taste is impressive en very refreshing. Liked Weihenstephaner more but this german hefeweizen is also a very nice treat!
Beautiful banana and citrus notes on the nose and the palate. cloudy yellow/orange pour with a non-lacy white head. very refreshing
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow with lasting white head. Wheat dominates with nice mixture of fruit and spice flavor, very little hops. Outstanding wheat beer.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2010 On tap into a 500 mL Franziskaner weizen. Pours a hazy gold with a two/three-finger white head that has great retention and a little lacing. Aroma of bubblegum, cloves, nutmeg, overripe bananas, sourdough malt, and a little apple cider vinegar. Flavor is similar but with a little too much sourdough malt and not enough bananas and spice. This was the first beer I ever had that broke me out of the macro pale lager world into the real ale world. I would consider this the hefeweizen standard.

Tap at PIB. Nice golden yellow pour with a thick and puffy white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat. Flavor throws some spiciness into the equation, but it all balances out very nicely and is incredibly refreshing when it¬ís in the 90s. Also, picked up some cool beads from the brewery at the beerfest!
I need to taste this again before giving a good description.  It was a great hefe that I tried a JKO, but the same night I was jaded by the weihenstephaner.
A good hefe! Banana smell that doesn¬ít reflect in the taste. Dry finish, very satifsfying.
Pours cloudy orangish gold with a long lasting, uneven white head.  Nose is banana and wheat.  Taste is sweet and spicy, with notes of wheat  and banana.  This is a delightful hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy gold that is a bit dull yet glowing. Did not really resemble the picture on this site. Aroma has strong wheat notes and banana. There are more subtle citrus and spice notes as well. Flavors of shredded wheat, banana, orange, and cloves. Again, the wheat and banana are at the forefront. A little spice in the finish and perhaps a bit sweet. I like.
A good overall beer that is light enough that you don¬ít get too full, but enough body that you know you¬íre not drinking a macrobrew.

Bottle - This is a perfect pour, all cloudy yellow with a massive foamy head. Whether I¬íve just mowed the lawn or got home from work, I want to drink a beer that looks this good. The smell is where it¬ís lacking--it¬ís wheaty with some sweet sugar and slight skunk. It doesn¬ít smell fresh like it looks. It tastes waaay better, with wheat and lemon leading the way. It¬ís refreshing and creamy. A satisfying brew that would be wonderful if it had a better nose.
Dark yellow with a huge pillowy white head. Banana, spice, and doughy aroma. The flavor is bright, slightly sweet, and a very clean finish. Excellent.

Overall Impression: 
Probably the standard example of what I think of in the German Hefe style.  It is a nice beer, and a good representative for this style for sure.
In a word: solid. Pours a cloudy gold color. Nose is all floral and citrus. Taste is sweet, with notes of wheat, coriander and orange. Overall really damn good.
Pours gold with a large white head. Nose of citrus, yeast, coriander. Flavor is sweet, crisp  and citrusy. Very clean delicious summer beer.
Cloudy orange-yellow with a rocky white foam.  Aroma is big banana and bubblegum and clove.  Taste is nice smooth banana, a light spiciness, and just enough wheat to add body.  Nice hefe.

Sorry - the ratings here are all over the place. How can this have a 92 percentile and Weltenburger has 39? Anyway, 
there is no doubt that Franziskaner is a widely know (and marketed) weizen, therefore it needs to be good. And it is! 
Spicier than most examples - it has always
given me a hot cross bun type after taste. which is not necessarily a bad thing! A fine quality weisen, though if you buy the 5l barrel make sure you drink it all in onenight - like I did...twice..

Had onboard the Sapphire Princess (no plug intended!).  Creamy white head, two fingers¬í worth at least, along with a cloudy gold body.  Smells of both citrus and hops.  Taste of citrus and coriander was obvious.  Smooth mouthfeel and a sweet finish.
Golden hue with tall foamy head... great smooth Hef... I prefer a little more spice but this is great on a hot summer day

Pours cloudy gold with that beautiful white head one expects from a good hefe.  Bit of banana and lemon aroma but not all that much.  First sip was mostly head and thus fairly metallic.  Secondtaste is where the wheat brightness and the yeast flavors shine through: loads of lemon, clove, and some nuttiness from the suspended yeast.  Nice creamy carbonation and a clean finish.  Body is a bit thin but the full carbonation picks it back up.  Good, well rounded beer.

Got this to tick of the Dunkel style, and its not a damn dunkel. Oh well. Hazy muddy brown with fast fading head that leaves just a thin off-white ring. Smells like a hefe ¬ñ banana, clove, and wheat. Flavor is the same.  Simple but refreshing.  Medium to light bodied with medium carbonation.  Overall: simple, sessionable, not very interesting though.

Bottle.  Pours a foggy russet yellow with thick, creamy-fizz head.  Aroma is spicey, floral and citrus.  Not picking up on the cereal, but something like banana bread is very present and pleasant.  Taste matches aroma very nicely except I finally get the bran cereal taste mixed in.  This is like a breakfast muffin beer, but in a really satisfying way.  I¬ím impressed, and maybe that¬ís in large part because I wasn¬ít expecting to be.  The palate is just mobile and complex enough to make this a really interesting beer.  I like it!
50cl bottle. Pours pale-yellow body with big creamy head. Floreal and cereals aroma with some citrus. Taste: bread, banana, grass. Really refreshing and easy to drink. Great beer!

Large frothy head great carbonation in a misty straw to lemon colouredweizen.Aroma yeasty hoppyness,lemon spice banana.Flavour banana wheat mild bitter lemon clove,fresh tasting no nasties ,smooth finish hop herb and fruit taste.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours an opaque honey color with a nice, white fluffy head that hangs around for a fairly long time.  Sweet caramel and toffee notes, maybe a hint of anise and clove, nice layer of flavors as you delve into it more.  Light to medium bodied.  An interesting and dynamic selection.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2009 500ml bottle. Poured pale hazy yellow. Big creamy head. Aroma is wheat, yeast and citrus/coriander. Taste is malty and bready. Some spices as well. Quite good and refreshing.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a cloudy orange body with a big, two-finger width, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a moderate amount of lacing. Aroma is a bit sweeter with wheat bread, citrus, banana, and lots of yeast. Flavor is bready with a more noticeable spicing. Still maintains a sweetness and a nice fruit flavor of banana and citrus. Finishes yeasty with a lightly spiced citrus aftertaste. Body is full with a slight tickle of carbonation and a smooth finish. Overall, a pretty solid hefe with lots of refreshing, balanced taste. Good one.

Look of a classic german hefe with a nice big head. No real lacing was disappointing. Smells of banana, clove, and fresh bread. Banana throughout the taste with clove afterward with wheat. I maybe got some citrus on my second sip. Very nice hefe.

Pours a super turbid neon yellow with a quickly dissipating white head. Complex aroma of banana and cloves that is rarely matched in any Hefe outside of Germany (this is somewhat masked by an issue detailed below). Taste is restrained banana/fruity character with spicy clove. The major problem I have always had with this beer is that it is way over carbonated. The stinging carbonation scrubs away most of the flavor. If I want to taste some of the complex tastes in there, I have to spend ten minutes forcing carbonation out of the beer by swishing it around. The high level of carbonation also makes it really difficult to get a good whiff of the aroma because the nucleating bubbles carry away all of the smells. So, it is not until you work out the carbonation that you can truly partake. Other than that, it is one of the poster children of the style and deserves a chance from anyone looking for a good Hefe.

Not sure about the people saying that there isn¬ít  much for flavor.  I got a strong and sweet wheaty flavor with hints of citrus and bubblegum.  The appearance was cloudy and thick, with a creamy head.  One of the better German macros that I¬íve had.

Comes out of the tap a hazy honey-yellow with a decent white head. Rich aroma is wheaty and yeasty with a strong citrus overtone, mainly orange. Refreshing flavor is perfect after being out in hot weather - wheaty and yeasty with a firm orange tone. Texture is fizzy and smooth. This pleasing beer leaves a nice wheaty and fruity finish.
Poured yellow with white head. Aroma of citrus, nothing else. Taste was of citrus and sweet malt. Nothing really there.
hazy camel colored. smells yeasty and a bit chemical, fresh, banana fruit flavor, bitter spicy finish with a seltzery carbonation edge on the tongue, refreshing light beer,

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2010 6-07-09 Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum and spice with flavor the same and a hint of black pepper spice. A little too much carbonation and the body seems a little thin. This is a good representation of the style, but I have had better. 

Had this on tap @ Baumgarteners in Monroe WI on March15. WAY better on tap than bottled. Incredible head, aroma and flavor! 4.5!!!
Aroma of banana and spice. It also has kind of a sour banana flavor. It¬ís not a bad beer, though I like their dunkel better.
Bottle - pours a cloudy deep yellow, nose of yeast.  Some fruit notes, easy to drink, carbonated finish.  Ok beer, but I¬ím not into weizen¬ís right now.

Cloudy nectarine pour with minimal head. Fruity aroma- lots of peach, apricot, and yeast. Flavor is unassuming but delicious- classic hefe, but very well crafted and very tasty. Nice palate, stellar example of the style.
UPDATED: APR 22, 2010 50 cl bottle poured to weizen glass. Great German Hefeweizen, great aroma and flavor.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2010 Single from Newflowr - decent price.

Hazy color like this style; huge long lasting white head.  Couldn¬ít place the aroma - nice (I see from others what it was).

I taste some spice, high carbonation and a crisp sharp dry finish.

Had again 3/10/10 - agree with above; a much better blue moon if you will.  very refreshing; may be a got to when it gets warmer!

I had only tried a few American HF¬ís and was beginning to think this wasn¬ít the style for me.

After tasting this, I want to try more.

Very good beer; not heavy either.. nice on a warm day.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2009 (bottle). Cloudy gold color. Medium white head. Wheat aroma, with light banana and lemon. Wheaty flavor with light spice. Avg duration. Smooth but dry finish. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

Bouteille de 500 ml. Ar√¥mes citronn√©s avec une pointe de clou de girofle. Robe dor√©e assez fonc√©e et trouble, belle mousse qui tient bien et effervescence active. Moyennement ronde en bouche, les touches de levure rappelant la banane sont appuy√©es par une touche de bl√© procurant une belle finale l√©g√®rement acide, citronn√©e et d√©salt√©rante. Bien √©quilibr√©e.

Pours hazy golden yellow with a massive white head.  Smells of citrus, lemons, and a lot of spice.  After sitting in the glass for a few minutes, a new musty aroma was noticeable.  Not a pleasant smell.  The taste was decent though.  Tastes of sweet citrus fruits is foremost followed by  strong spicey notes.  There are also copious amounts of banana and yeast.  Finishes light and very refreshing.  I wonder if this was sitting in the store a little too long, it just didn¬ít taste very fresh.

A decent German Wheat beer with a very nice cloudy appearance with a large off white head. The aroma is that of yeast and the flavor is good, but lacks the diversity that I love in wheats.  There is a tad of clove and some yeast but overall, it doesn¬ít match up to the upper echelon wheats.  I would like to have this on draft now like I did in May of 1994 in Kansas City.

From bottle,  Orange-Honey color, hazy, with a huge head that stays for a long time, aroma of orange banana yeastiness sweet fruity aroma and some pleasant acidity, flavor is deep sweet and crisp some clove and banana some zesty feeling and spicy low bitterness finish. Nice beer

Draft at Absolutely Delicious.  Hazy yellow, very pretty.  Typical aromas of banana, clove, some bubble gum.  Very "soft" palate, light flavor, some tartness, but not enough- was fairly sweet.  Good solid beer.
Bought this after having an excellent pint of Gordon Biersch recently.  This beer is rated higher and I don¬ít understand why.  Good beer, but would have liked a yeastier nose.
A good white beer.  Decent taste and a clean finish.  I would not actively seek it in a bar or restaurant but if it was served, then I would glady drink it again.

I like the drawing of the smug, yet peaceful, old monk on the label of this half liter bottle.  The plush head fills up my dimpled round pint glass.  The aroma is initially floral, but gives way to some yeast and skank.  Franziskaner is a fairly watery and malty hefe that has some bitterness and astringency in the finish.  Like other brews of this kind, it gets more flavorful as one reaches the bottom of the bottle.  Enjoyable enough, but not the best.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy, golden color with a nice white head and great lacing.  The beer had a distinct aroma of cloves and banana.  The beer has a medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, and a nice long finish.  The flavor was just as good as the aroma with a very distinct clove, banana, and spice taste.  Overall, I absolutely love this beer.  I like how the beer tastes like it smells.  It is also good with a lemon slice in it.

50 cl Bottle. It poured a cloudy golden liquid with a huge creamy foam that left allot of lacing. It smelled allot of sweet bananas, very nice. Im not sure how common this candy is outside Sweden, but I relate it to something called foam banana.  The taste is very fizzy at first, then I feel the sweet banana flavour. The overall impression is that this is a very well balanced beer and one of the best wheat beers I¬íve tried.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 500ml on tap at the Bavarian Bier Cafe, O¬íConnell St, Sydney. Even better than the superb dunkel version. It pours a clear gold colour, with a medium head. Extremely limited bitterness, it is instead full of some lovely weissbier floral and fruity notes. Exceptionally crisp and refreshing, it finshes with just the slightest hint of mango.

Pours medium golden, hazy, with rocky white head that releases the aromas quite well.  Nose is restrained compared to some other weissbiers I¬íve sampled recently, but a light banana/clove is clearly present with some bready components.  Palate is more wheat cracker malty than big banana/clove, with more breadiness overall especially from the yeast esters.
Bottle. Aroma of wheat, hop. Full taste with spices, a lot of wheat, full body. Creamy head growing and staying long.

Not sure why I haven¬ít reviewed this old friend until now. Cloudy opaque light goldenrod color with a healthy off-white cap of dense foam. Lots of bubble columns help maintain the retention. Nice ripe banana aroma with some bubblegum, lemon, and light clove. Slightly green banana flavor with some light citric tanginess and a sprinkling of clove. Silky texture is interrupted by the overly rambunctious carbonation. After some time and swirling, it settles down and the mouthfeel improves. Very drinkable and refreshing.
Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with thick white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves, yeast.  Flavor is heavy banana with some citrus and clove.  Solid beer, good summer beer.

Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow pour with a white head. Left some lacing on the side of the glass, with some floaters. Aroma is banana, spices, yeast, and malts. Flavor is much of the same. Light carbonation, smooth aftertaste. Good for the style, I¬ím just not a huge fan of the style, but it is a decent beer.

Cloudy goldenrod beer with a rich foamy white head.  The best word for this beer is banana.  Aroma is banana, flavor is banana.  Also has a lightly spiced note in the flavor.  Very drinkable light-medium body and perfectly carbonated.
A hazy yellow beer with a beautiful head. Aroma is yeasty and banana. Taste is also yeasty with citric notes. Good mouthfeel. Refreshing and drinkable. A good weizen
16oz bottle from BevMo! Mission Valley.  Pours a hazy medium yellow with a fluffy white head.  Nose is citrus and yeast, same with the flavor, the finish is light and crisp.

Aroma is wheat, clove, yeasty, peppery.
Taste is clove, citrus, pepper, banana, coriander, and slightly sour.
Finish is slightly cloying, some sourness.
Yum!

[Bottle] Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a nice off-white head.  Aroma was spicy with fresh bread.  Taste had a stong yeast flavor with some citrus and stong pepper spice.  Finish was very peppery.   A fine hefe but I didn¬ít care much for the finish.

Colore dorato e schiuma spumosa.Al naso sa di lievito con sentore fruttato.In bocca ancora lievito e gusto di agrume,il tutto abbastanza rinfrescante.Pur essendo una birra abbastanza comune da trovare anche nei supermarket direi che si fa apprezzare.

12 ounce green bottle obtained as a thanks for holding a meeting. Pours a murky yellow color with a three finger width white frothy head, mild carbonation, and a lot of yeast floating throughout the beer. The aroma is very pleasant but is not that strong. It consists of a lot of yeast with some floral and citrus notes. The taste is very refreshing with a lot of yeast and some light citrus hints lingering in the background. Overall this is a very good Hefeweizen but is nothing extremely special.
Great hefe.  Hazy yellow pour with thick white head.  Citrus and pineapple on the nose as well as palate. Good crisp, clean bubbly finish.
Cane. aroma of yeast and fruits. Pours a cloudy yellow, carbonation high, head is thick.; sweet flavour and mild citrus. Similar the other German Wheats.

500ml bottle. Dull orange pale straw colour with a huge rocky head with tightly formed dense bubbles. Hazy with a coriander and orange aroma. Full flavoured with the sweetness of citrus and a good cleansing taste.
Bottle 50 Cl. Apperance; Yellow, hazy with a minimal white head. Aroma; Wheat and some lemon. Flavor; Wheat with a medium sour ending.

12 oz. poured into a English pint for lack of a Weizen.  Served with a lemon (which I wouldn¬ít do next time).  Poured a hazy orange blossom honey color, with a large white head, full of large bubbles that dissipated quickly.  Zero head.  Smelled mildly floral, with a yeasty, bready, quality.  Tastes similar, mildly spiced.  We paired with grilled lobster.  Excellent combo.
One of the best.  Pours an orangeish color with a thick white foamy head.  Aroma of bananas, some vanilla, and some orange citrus hops.  Flavor of some bubble gum, bananas, light spices, and citrus.

[1894-20081206] Tap. Light wheaty fruit yeast aroma. Hazy, light brown orange body with a quick creamy white head. Light banana wheat flavour has a light fruity wheat yeast. Medium body. Refreshing and tasty.
(@ Cole¬ís; Buffalo, NY)

Bomber. Hazy cloudy bright gold with a nice thick dissapaiting head. Nose is a bit musty, yeasty, spicy. Taste is mellow tangy, tart, yeasty, a bit peppery-but overall not as tasty as some of the better hefes. Still a nice, smooth drinking beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bottle. Pours yellow with a white foamy head. Strong notes of banana and clove, with some coriander and bread. Tasted is strong banana, wheat, clove and a hint of citrus.
Great taste, nice look and strong.A lot more than drinkable. I¬íd say enjoyable.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is lemon and cloves - smells clean and refreshing almost like a gueuze. Taste is very weak - bannana and cloves with some yeast and bread. Drinkable, but uneventful.

50cl bottle. Best before 2009-08. It poured a hazy light-golden colour with a medium big white foamy head that settled down fast in the glass. The aroma is a bit sour with notes of yeast, wheats and hops with a hint of citrus. The flavour is a bit thin and watery with notes of wheats, hops, apples and some spice, cinnamon perhaps? It has a short aftertaste.

(Draught from Fat Cat, Norwich) Pint looked cloudy golden with a small white head. Sour citrus and flowers with a hint of lemon on the nose. Flowery wheat taste, cloves evident lots of hop and distinctive wheatastes. Very refreshing and a good example of the genre.

Draught Always. Hazy sunburst golden with at least a half inch of white foamy head. Aroma is citric (it was served with a lemon however) and spicy yet floral wheat with some banana and clove. Flavor was spicy wheat, and banana-citrus. Very smooth body, carbonation is somewhat peppery. Great balance here, no complaints.

had this a while ago. poured cloudy golden with a white head. aroma yeast, banana, hints of cloves, lemon. flavor about the same as the aroma, but faded some when it warmed, I would have to drink this very cold to enjoy
Not too different from other weizen beers. Nice soft and sweet aroma, bananas and some citrics. It¬ís really refreshing, and you can still enjoy the aroma and flavors while it¬ís still cold.

500ml Bottle - Hazy gold/amber in colour. Yeasty and slightly spicy aroma with hints of banana and lemon. Clean tasting with banana, wheat and some sweet and slightly spicy elements. Very refreshing and a good quality beer.

Bottle. Hazy yellow color with a nice white remaining head. Aroma is typical spicy with clove, yeast and some light banana notes. Flavour is spicy and lighlty fruity with banana, clove, a light acidity and citrus. Medium carbonated beer with a slightly thin mouthfeel. Very drinkable Hefeweizen, it got what you can expect from the style and it¬ís also pretty much how I remembered it. Recommended for those hot, sunny summerdays ...

Tap. Looks great, foggy yellow and a decent lasting white head. Medium carbonation and light feel in the mouth. Aroma of banana, citrus and some hops. Fresh taste of fruits, orange peel, wheat malts, some acid, and slightly hoppy finish.
Was probably a good hefe but I have no taste for them.  Had nice floral/wheat notes.
Nice color, warm orange.  Taste is sweet up front, kind of straw like malty ness.  Finish gets a little bit blah, with malts tasting like cheap beer.

Not a significant smell with some banana and caramel malt with some esters.
Pours a hazy blond color with a nutmeg hue in the center with a frothy white head and lots of carb action.
Grainy malt taste, sort of bland, with some hop esters.
Light bodied, dry slightly watery, soft and lively carbonation, and a smooth metallic finish.
Just a bland taste compared to the other great hefewiezens from Germany.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 HUge foamy cream head above murky bronze. Banana , crust , spice , custard , spice nose -its all vibrant and inviting .    A crisp palate , at times tart ,bitter apple notes ,with spicy  dry  texture that is united with big powerful rich  banana , clove and creamy full on palate . Refreshing as fuck ,while copmplex and easy to drink .  A very good Hef. !

Nice aroma of bubblegum, some cloves. Big white head. Cloudy golden colour. Taste consistent with aroma and nice slightly tart finish. Hefeweizen is one of my favourite styles and I like this one - very easy drinking.

12oz bottle with noticeable yeast strands swirling in the bottle. Pours a nice hazy gold yellow with a thick white head that fades leaving peaks. Aroma is strong wheat along with the taste, finishes slightly sour.
Bottle.  Musty spicy aroma.  Hazy orange body, fizzy white head.  Pleasantly balanced flavor of wheat and malt, with some citrus notes and banana.
Quite spicy. I¬ím an IPA drinker, so the malt and spices are not my favorite drink. I have to say that this is better than other hefeweizen I have drunk.

Bottle. Poured a hazy orange with a huge white head that rapidly diminished. Loaded with ester and yeasty aromas - orange and banana. More ester in the flavours with a dominant orange peel quality along with an apparent herb/spice component - clove mainly - and some acidity. Wheaty and yeasty again with a warming alcohol character and a nuttiness mixed with an ester finish. Light but lively and refreshing palate texture.
I had this on tap at Roosevelt¬ís in Farmington Hills, MI. I thought it was gross. I was drinking Hacker Pschoor all night, and I thought that was a million times better.

Moderately cloudy deep gold with a finger of pillowy white head that goes away pretty quickly. Nose is banana and clove with a hint of citrus and a tiny note of alcohol. This is a delicious beer- taste is banana, cereals, and citrus. Mouthfeel is just right for a Hefe- right in the middle. Finishes pretty clean. I like this beer a lot.
Pours a BIG fluffy head. Smells like bread and rubbing alcohol. Taste is that of gumballs and some banana and yeasty flavor. For what this is, its not a bad beer. I actually kinda like it.
Nice dark-ish golden color with a thin head. Nice nose of wheat. Starts with a kind of alcohol flavor and finishes with a light touch of wheat.

Bottle... Friend brought it over to try out.  The fruity aroma is slightly reminiscent of a plantain mixed with the obvious yeasty-wheat smells that wheat beers have.  Smooth as any Hefe around.  Good beer, widely available.
Bottle.good beer with great taste .. easy for drinking .. gold color ... fruit taste
Bottle. Deep golden colour with a medium white head. Sweet aroma of wheat and yeast. The flavour is sweet, yeast, banana and malt, some bitterness in the finish. Nice and refreshing brew.
bottle. pours a golen yellow with a quick dissolving head. has an aroma of yeast and spices. has a very crisp flavor with hints of spice and even a bit of a smoky aftertaste.
My favorite German Hefe.  Good blend of spice and wonderful taste make this one what its all about.  Great look, cloudy, and bright.  Wonderful feel and not long taste. Crisp.  Great brew.
Pours cloudy orangish yellow with a dense white head. Aroma of bananas, yeast, and clove. Flavor is much of the same with a little tart wheat malt added in.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy dull yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast with a hint of fruit. Tastes of cloves and wheat. Was a very enjoyable beer.

(bottle) pours a hazy yellow colour with a bubbly white head. aroma of dry wheat and peanuts, banana, with a hint of grain and herbal hops. flavour is smooth banana and wheat, light cigarette smoke. lightly-bodied, with smooth carbonation.
Tap at CNY Beerfest. Pours cloudy gold. Aroma is banana and yeast. Flavor followed suit. Nothing new for a hefeweizen. Tasty.
good beer with great taste .. easy for drinking .. gold color ... fruit taste

50cl bottle at the Nut House in Palo Alto.  A very solid bet as far as weissbiers go.  Nice cloudy orangish-yellow-golden appearance with a frothy white head.  Great banana/clove notes on the aroma and the flavor.  Flavor also has sweet malt and lots of yeast.  Smooth and really drinkable. Hits the spot.

Bottle at home on February 1, 2009.  Wow... I can¬ít believe I haven¬ít rated this yet!  Maybe that¬ís because I¬íve always thought I have.  Franziskaner has always been one of the few real true German Weissbiers available at the local grocer.  A friend from Germany was even astonished that it¬ís carried here.  This beer has a wonderful, thick, frothy white head that lasts forever... or until you dive in and cover your nose with it.  Aroma of yeast and wheat... palate crisp, flavor fine and refreshing.
Thick creamy head invites the drinker, but the color is slightly unappealing.  Smells like a good wheat beer.  Taste is calm and mellow with a light fruity flavor.
A weisse beer with  a very fruity taste. it can be drink any time

Bottle picked up at the Vons in Thousand Oaks, CA.
Pours with a murky orange hue  with a huge white head that is mostly lasting. A very good looking beer indeed!
Aroma is of yeast, citrus fruits, and spices. Amazing nose!
Watered down taste, some yeast at the end of the taste, but not much. Very watered down in my opinion. A disaapointment  - I was expecting more after smelling the beer.
Medium mouthfeel, with medium carbonation.
Not the biggest fan of this beer.
Bottle or tap .. Dark yellow muddy body. White head. Fresh heavy yeasty aroma. Medium to heavy flavour. Sourish and fresh. Light finish. Not at all too sweet. (Akkurat, Stockholm, 20.07.08)

Pours the typical hazy orange/yellow with a thick long lasting white head. Aroma was quite strong of wheat, cloves and banana. Flavour the same with hints of bubblegum, citrus and grain. Fairly light bodied. Celebrated my arrival in Scottsdale Arizona with one of these over X-Mas and boy was it tasty while sitting out in the sun.
Pours hazy yellow with a mild head. Aroma is very wheaty with a hint of banana and the flavor is much of the same. Very enjoyable hefeweizen.

Forgot how much i like german hefeweisse more than belgian wits when i had this beer the other night... Nice hazy golden with a thick head... Banana, yeasty aroma, more in the taste... Very easy drinking, very summery, but still holds up all year long...

Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a substantial thick white head.  Aroma is banana and clove.  Tastes of wheat grain, grapefruit, banana and bready yeast.  A very good well-balanced example of the style at a reasonable price.

Bottle.  Murky orange colour with large white head.  Sweet, yeasty aroma.  Very mellow flavour with the usual banana hints and vanilla in the finish.  Remarkably light and crisp palate.  Very drinkable.

Pours a hazy gold with a 2 finger rocky white head that has good retention. Aroma is huge on dried banana chips, some clove, and a hint of lemon. Flavor is mellow banana sweetness, grainy wheat, lemon, yeasty bread rolls, black pepper,  a decent helping of earth mustiness, and some clove spice to the finish along with some vanilla aftertaste. Body is dry, astringent and slightly acidic.
First beer rating and my favorite beer - may be biased. Murky golden beer with a golden thick head calls my name from the glass. Nice citrus and banana tastes.

12 oz bottle imported to USA. Great head as most Weiss bier‚Äôs sweet tasting hint of citrus and full of carbonation. A good beer. I wish I had the larger bottle size. a very good summer bier as are most Weissbier‚Äôs.

Murky golden, pretty basic pale weizen head. Strongly yeasty nose, wheat, slight cellar, vanilla and ripe banana. Wheaty flavor, same yeastiness and cellar, little alcohol, quite low on fruitiness. Not all that fresh, but otherwise good.

From tall bottle pours golden yellow with plush white head and characteristic haze. Aroma of banana and faint clove. Soft mouthfeel leads into balanced banana esthers and clove phenols as well as some orange.
Finish grows more dry and clovey.

hazy golden pour
sweet malt, banana, clove, spice
effervescent, finish is a bit dry
wow. i love beer from germany. this was amazing.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2009 enjoyable weissbier with a great orange/amber color to it.  i like the balance of fruit and spice...neither is overdone.  the head is remarkable.  i found the finish to be a bit thin and lacking but overall a good weissbier.
Bottle. Hazy beer with golden color. Smells yeast. Tastes vanilla, orange and mild citrus. Dry aftertaste that reminds me of sparkiling wine.
This is a good wheat beer with the golden color and white lasting head to start.  The parts left in the bottle and yeast make a good combo.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
It looks like a sparkling wine but darker and whith a compact white head.
ISmells of yeast. Taste reminds of sparkling wine and oranges.

Surprised to find this in the bar we were at (even though its made by InBev).  Its got a good strong tasty yeast flavor to it.  Has some decent citrus notes, and really highlights the yeast.  There are some metal and funkyness flaws to it but its a solid beer.
Bottle. Yellow with a white head. Aroma is citrus and wheat. In my oppinion it¬¥s one of the best hefeweizen

Buttery sweet banana aroma.  Small, white, head.  Cloudy with a fair amount of noticeable sediment particles floating around.  Nice spicy and floral flavors, including banana and sunflower notes. Yeasty.  Leaves the mouth dry and thirsty for more. Moderate body, a little more carbonation than its non-Hefe counterpart.
Bottle.  Poured a cloudy yellow color with a two finger white head.  Aroma of citrus and wheat.  Flavor was citrusy with a good malty backing.  Good beer.
slighly sour aroma with a wheat color and thin head. taste is overwhelmingly yeasty with a lemony flavor. ends slightly tart and grassy. not bad, but ive had better hefes.

Poured a large frothy white head over a very cloudy straw colored body. Faint smell of honey, and citrus, mostly lemon.  Wheat and grain taste, slightly sour, strong lemon and other citrus fruits, lasting citrus aftertaste. Foamy and zesty on the palate, easy to drink. If you want a citrus edge to your wizen - look no further.
On tap at Prost.  Pours a cloudy yellow with medium white head and nice lacing.  Banana and citrus on the nose.  Pretty smooth on the palate.  The flavor is nice and refreshing.  Tasty!
I was very impressed with this beer.  It was actually not too much money with a 500ml going for about two bucks USD. The after taste and appearance of this beer were amazingly refreshing

Had this beer on tap at Max‚Äôs Taphouse in Baltimore, served with a slice of lemon.  A bright but cloudy, milky-yellow color with a medium-sized, foamy white head.  It had a strong citrus and wheat aroma with some yeast and banana present too; also touches of lemon, straw, and grain.  A veru sweet, lemon-fruit, and citrus taste, with some sourness too.  A watery, thinner beer with low carbonation, but a somewhat drying finish.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Very wheaty brew.  Looks excellent.  Smells aight, a little nast.  Same in flavor, but overall it¬ís mostly a pleasant drinking experience.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2009 Bottle. Pours quite an opaque/cloudy golden colour, with sediment swirling, with decent long-living head. Aroma of banana, some citrus, with yeast notes. Similar on the palate, though yeastier, and slight bitterness. Decent enough Hefeweizen.

The flavor of this one depends on how you get the yeast off the bottom of the bottle. If you shake it up and get chunks in your glass, it wont be near as good as if you swirl the beer around in the bottle until it is all gone from the bottom and the last 1/4 of the beer poured makes the glass of beer all that more cloudy, and tastes worlds better. I have noticed that you win some and loose some with this one but this one I am having now is a sure winner hence the high rating.

On tap at ¬íKaldi‚Äôs Coffeehouse¬í in Cincinnati, Ohio - This one poured a cloudy, sun-hued hefe with a thin white head of fine-bubbled foam and the requesite ¬íspiced banana¬í aroma. Tastewise, it was very ¬íbready¬í and rich, a very hefe!
Bottle, poured in pint. Very refreshing on a hot Cyprus night. A great hefe, but i prefer Paulaner.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of banana, cloves, nutmeg, spices, and yeast.  Poured a muddy light brown/dark yellow/orange color with a medium-sized, creamy, frothy, white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Full of large particles.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of bananas, cloves, yeast, slight bubblegum, slight citrus, and spices.  Medium body.  Slightly thin, chalky texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Yeasty, dry finish.
Pretty damn good Hefeweizen but not my favorite which would be the Paulaner.  Pours a golden yellow with an aroma and taste of fruit and weat.  I drank this out of some wierd looking glass.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2009 On tap in Germany. Very good but I like Paulaner and Andechser and other hefe-weizens a bit more more. This is still a good and favorite beer.

Pours a deep golden straw with fluffy white head. Typical aroma of banana and cloves for the style. But not much else. Taste is the same with some crispness in the finish but it just doesn¬ít have the complexity of better known Hefes.

After some shitty trippest ales and an even worse American Ale this beer did it right for me. Like waking up to a large breasted beautiful woman blowing you after a night of fat mistakes, after drinking this beer you know your day is going to be great no matter what the night brought you!
Bottle: Pours cloudy golden with white head. Nice aroma and flavor of citrus and banana. Not much spice flavor or aroma. Enjoyable
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with huge white head. Flavor and taste of fruits (citrus, banana), wheat, yeast.

This is the Famous "Belly Rubbin Monk" Beer --- The individual or foil wrapped is better than the regular capped 6-pack offering === Yes there is a difference.....
This is my Favorite Weiss Beer!

On Tab at Barkers Bar and Grill in Hudson, Wisconsin.  Beautiful looking Hefe.  Hazy golden color with a decent sized white head. Very creamy smooth palate with lots of spice and banana.  Excellent  beer.
Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is banana and wheat. Flavor is banana, citrus, wheat. Very easy to drink and quite refreshing, good hefe.

Medium offwhite lasting head. Opaque orange body. Light mealy bananaish aroma. Taste is very light, again mealy banana with chalky notes. Light, clean palate, soft mouthfeel. No separate aftertaste. It‚Äôs OK, but very boring. (0.5l bottle, ICE train Berlin-Leipzig, Germany.)
Bottle Pours a golden body with a 3 finger white head.  Notes of clove and spices, fruity esters of banana and citrus.  Enjoyed this even more with a twist of lemon.
Great Hefe.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Medium murky amber\brown color.  Extremely pleasant appearance and good mixture of flavors.  On par with Ayinger.

Pours hazy yellowisih amber with minimal head. Aroma is loaded with citrus and yeasty spice. Flavos is much the same- an excellent citrus flavor with great balance and yeast character. Palate is thick for a hefeweizen. Nice one.

Pours a cloudy light orange color from the tap with a trim white head.  Smells of lemon and faint banana with heavy flavors of wheat, citrus, and breadcrust.  Quite possibly the standard for this style.
I like this beer good for me and for my taste! ;) I like the color and the perfume... FabioSound

Bottle from my local bottle shop. Poured a dark gold / orange with a nice head and good lacing. Definitle banana and fruit in there. Something about this didn‚Äôt hit the target for me. I did add to my rate that it was the last beer in a very very heavy session and to try again to see if it deserves more respect.

Aroma: citrus, yeasty, bread, orange, banana, cream and butter
Appearance: frothy white foam 2 finger head with excellent lacing; golden, cloudy orange throughout
Flavor: medium sweetness
Palate:light body, thin feel, average carbonation, pronounced yeast finish
Overall, this is a solid, refreshing beer that I would I be happy drinking on most any occasion.  Had it several times, and it must be poured correctly with full head for proper enjoyment or the experience is severely hindered.

This one pours a pale, opaque wheat/golden color with a shallow head and nice sticky yet fast lacing. Smells of wheat, grains and a lightly fruity pastures with slight hay notes. The taste is light but full. Flavors of wheat with a light bitterness and light barn-like notes on the finish. Has a fair amount of carbonation and the flavor finishes pretty quickly. A very nice brew overall.

12 oz bottle.  Very nice, but also rather standard aroma in this wheat beer, bananas, orange/lemon zest, and lots of yeast.   Poured with a decent white fluff head, no real staying power or lacing, very cloudy orange juice color.  An enjoyable taste overall, lot of good fruit flavors, banana, orange, and a more prominent lemon than expected, but as expected a good amount of wheat dough and yeast, very citrusy finish and linger, in the feel though, there is just a little too much carbonation to me.  Not alot to complain about, definitely an upper-end hefe.
Nice thick head. Great banana/gumball flavor - yet not so sweet that you wouldn‚Äôt not have 3-4 in one sitting. One of my favorites. Can‚Äôt imagine anyone not enjoying this beer.

middle orange hhazy color white head
smell of cklpve and banana
tasts of clove and banana
aftertaste bittersweet
Wow, I actually found an import that doesn‚Äôt taste like an import!  Very smooth wheat beer.  Great malt flavor that dominated.

Draft.  Really a great hazy yellow-orange in color.  Nice, tight head.  Some lacing.  Dense-looking.  Aromas are banana and very light spice -- heavier on the yeast.  Creamy on the palate.  Lots of yeast again, with a fine complement of banana and apricot.  Slightly thin on the finish.

Bottle at Frankfurt Airport (the only good thing about my flight interruption). Hazy blonde. Wheat, banana nose. Bitter and wheaty, slightly yeasty sherbert. Mouth is banana milkshake, some bitterness. Pretty watery end. Quenching and refreshing.
Very nice pour of golden brown and easy large head. Nice mouth feel, very carbonated and is b-a-n-a-n-a-s! Great beer.
Sweet sweaty aroma. Cloudy caramel colour with no head. wheaty yeasty with a hint of spice.fizzy. Not very nice at all would not buy it again.
Bottle at The Headkeeper (Greensburg). Pours a hazy yellow, fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, malt and yeast. Flavor is more of the same. Nice beer to have with a good tapas meal.

Poured from a 500ml foil-topped bottle and served in a weizen glass.  This hefe poured a hazy, darker golden hue with a thick head of fluffy off-white foam.  Excellent retention throughout the glass.  Some slippery lacing was left behind.  The aroma of the beer consisted of fresh bananas, wheat, light citrus, and a light clove spiciness.  The fruitiness took a back seat in the flavor.  A healthy dose of spicy yeast and clove was followed up by mild notes of banana, creamy wheat, and a touch of orange and lemon zest.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and softly carbonated.  Very smooth and highly drinkable.  A nice example of the style.
Definitely one of the better Hefe-Weizen beers. Nice aroma and taste of wheat and fruit. I would rank it towards the top but definitely would prefer a Weinstephaner.

Poured a golden color, settling to a light gold hue. Good head retention,lacing, lemony. Pear, banana, apple and yeast tasted on my palate. Buttery finish smooth as glass. Truly a world class brew that I will drink again.............and again...............and again.
Orange yellow color with a thin head. Sweet orange flavor throughout and bits of spice to go with the wheat. Not too much to complain about.
Cloudy golden with medium white head. Sweet aroma with banana and yeasty Notes. Flavour goes the same way and ends weet.

Draught, Palm Beach Sports Bar, Stuttgart. Cloudy yellow colour with a big white head; looked quite enticing....or was that the fit barmaid? Mild lemony aroma. Banana, clove, yeast and citrus in the flavour. Typical of the style and one of the better exponents. Was getting bored on the second one though.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 16.9oz bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: It pours very cloudy and has a wonderful orangey yellow golden color with a big creamy white head. The head has great retention and makes nice lacing.

Smell: The aroma has earthy/fruity yeast character with notes of banana, clove and lemony citrus.

Taste/Mouth feel: Its flavor has a smooth creamy malty wheat flavor with a big earthy yeast influence. There are notes of banana and clove with some light hints citrus and hops. It all finishes with dry dusty yeast and very mild hops with citrusy lemon flavors.
Its carbonation is soft but active with a smooth and slightly slick texture in its medium body.

Notes: Overall it¬ís very refreshing and drinkable with all the wonderful flavors you expect in a good hefe-weizen.
bottle.  Pours a clear golden with a big, white head.  Nose is of lemon and yeast.  taste is of lemon and banana bread.  Mouthfeel is medium-to-thin.  Not bad.

Sweet aroma of banana and clove with a hint of vanilla.  Smooth creamy mouthfeel and taste of banana, wheat, and  spices, with no hoppy taste at all.  If you can get this unpasteurized (i.e. in Germany), you will find that the spices are much more apparent than they are post-pasteurization.  Even from the bottle, however..."Es ist sehr schmeckt!"
This is a lovely hefeweiss. Just great in every respect. Nice citrusy nose, beautiful fruity taste, with banana and  a lot of sourness, very very refreshing...
From bottle. Aroma is tons of yeast, banana, and spice. More banana and wheat in the taste. Smooth, clean, and refreshing.
Draught at CAH.  Great typical hefe aroma.  Pours cloudy mustard with a good white head.  Flavors of banana, clove, and a little medicinal.  Velvety mouthfeel.  Pretty good actually.

Golden cloudy.  Very spicy and yeast wheat beer, love it.  Lemony citrus with cloves and pepper.  Fruity and sweet, but also well balanced.  Crisp, soft, smooth and very refreshing.  Yeasty finish.  Man, this is good.
UPDATED: SEP 8, 2008 La mia prima weisse bier in assoluto e una delle mie preferite. D¬íestate √® particolarmente dissetante e rinfrescante.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2008 12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber color with a thick white head.  Has a fruity taste, but very balanced.  

Not usually a fan of this style, however this is a good beer.

Pours a cloudy golden amber with a foamy white head. Citrus and light malt comes across most clearly on the nose with faint aromas of bananas and possibly cocoa. Immediately spicy on the tip of the tongue. Citrus and yeast come across in the finish. A bit too yeasty for my tastes but overall a very good beer.

Loooonnng time favorite. Many years ago some friends and I sat at a local bar and compared some hefe weizens side by side and this one came out on top. Still does. Poured with a fine white head and a bit of lace. Hazy amber color. Extremely fragrant! Intoxicating (sorry) spicy,estery, grainy aromas. Same flavors but stronger and a bit of yeasty bitterness. Superb balance. Body is just right for this masterpiece. Great clean finish. Champion session beer. Kudos to Spaten!! Having this on draft at Bodega downtown La Crosse, Wis. USA.

7 oz draught sample.  Cloudy golden pour with a medium white head.  Aroma of bananas, lemon and ginger.  Taste of yeast, bread and bananas.  Full but not overpowering finish.  Great on a hot summer day.
Pale yellow color, smell is wheat and some lemon, spice. Taste is very wheaty

Pours a hazy golden brown with a big white head.  Aroma is yeasty with banana bread like notes.  The taste is a spicey, yeasty, clovey banana hefe flavor.  A very good example of a hefe, and usually decently priced, although it just went up above 12.$ a twelve pack, before that it was about the best buy around along with other Spaten brews.
50cl bottle, hazy pale yellow colour, persistent white head, wheat and banana aroma, sweet flavor, dry finish with banana and light hops presence

First, THE HEAD--the stuff of legend--almost celestial with flecks of light dotting pillowy clouds stacked three fingers thick... the body is a blend of light yellow to dark orange--imposingly attractive... clove and vanilla mesh with banana in a beautiful bouquet, the scent strong but not overpowering... soft, almost watery(!) presence through the mouth; without the taste factor, a medium-bodied consistency that leaves a remainder to be savored... clove, banana, vanilla and a slight acidity that tickles the throat adding a bit of feistyness to an otherwise steady wheat backbone... I recall the first sips I ever had of Franziskaner and the following disbelief that a beer could taste this clean and refreshing, yet challenge the taste buds beyond the well-filtered American premium pilsner... ten years later, still a revelation for this beer drinker....

Always been a fan of Franzi. Not quite as fulfilling as the Weihenstaphaner or Julius Ector, for example, but still very tasty and quite drinkable. I have noticed that the half liters are more yeasty (and flavorful) than the green 12ozers. Worth trying fordefiniture.
Nice golden color,BIG white head,smell wheat and flowers,Taste is smooth and refreshing.Some lacing on glass.Excellent weizen

Pours a light gold in color with a huge four inch pillowy head.  Took a few minutes to complete the pour.  Smell is beautiful wheat and some lemon, spice.  Taste is very wheaty, almost seems like there‚Äôs a little tobacco or smoke flavor as well.  Very crisp and refreshing.  I like.

Bottle:Pale golden, huge beige fluffy head; distinctive lemony-fruity nose with a wheaty touch; light to moderate sweetish-sourish flavour, light bodied, soft MF; sweetish-sourish finish with a light tartness in the aftertaste. Pleasant, but a bit overrated.....

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 Here¬ís another jolly monk beer, and inside, a delicious German beer and the perfect example of the simple satisfaction that comes from a Hefe-Weizen.  This dark golden beer emits a fluffy banana smell, accompanied by well fitted oat aroma and the general scent of banana bread baking in the oven.  The aftertaste is heavy in weight, but faint in flavor, making it the ideal way to conclude a sip - the beer leaving the mouth like a diver off the diving board, leaving a wobble when its gone.  The taste repeats the ode to banana and oats (a classic breakfast mix) on a very soft and fluffy palate.  It¬ís a pleasant, tasty, light beer, which has the odd effect if being both filling and refreshing.  It nourishes both body and soul, as I find myself slowly nodding and smiling at the simple elegance of this style. 3.7

Re-rate and tasting notes from May 30th, 2011
Puffy white head, tickles the moustache, luminescent orange body glowing with a deep hearty orange and yellow on the edges. Smell has light coriander notes and wheat, a little banana and a touch of clove. Flavor starts fuzzy, lots of soft carbonation that smoothly delivers more of the banana, clove, and wheatiness in the aftertaste.

essa √© uma t√≠pica Weissbier alem√£, o que se nota logo de cara na apar√™ncia pomposa de sua espuma inicial, que, al√©m de enorme, √© extremamente borbulhante. A cor da espuma √© branca, enquanto que a do corpo √© √¢mbar-claro. H√° boa forma√ß√£o de colarinho, com longevidade duradoura e corpo tamb√©m borbulhante. H√° grande presen√ßa de sedimentos de tamanho razoavelmente grande, a densidade do corpo √© grossa (4/5). No aroma tamb√©m n√£o se nota nada de muito novo: notas c√≠tricas de lim√£o, presen√ßa moderada de levedo e os j√° tradicionais banana e cravo (7/10). O sabor inicial √© levemente doce e √°cido (a leveza √© semelhante a de um refrigerante), mesma descri√ß√£o do final, este de curta dura√ß√£o (5/10). O paladar √© composto de corpo m√©dio-leve, textura aguada, carbonata√ß√£o bem gasosa (semelhante a de um refrigerante) e final ligeiramente met√°lico. Est√° presente um gosto lupulado e condimentado, com notas de canela (2/5).
My favorite Hefe, much more of a complex flavor than most.  Fruity, yeasty, bready, and malty.  Great for sitting out or BBQing.  Very balanced and easy to drink.  THE Hefe imo.

From the larger bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color with a significant amount of foamy head that dissolves after a bit.  Yeast and something fruity in the aroma.  Decent mouth feel.  Overall a smooth brew and one of the better hefes out there.

Amazing that I‚Äôve never rated this yet.  Actually, hefeweizen isn‚Äôt my favorite style of beer, but it‚Äôs growing on me.  Pours a very cloudy brownish-gold color, with a big, fluffy white head.  Bready aroma, a touch malty.  Smooth mouthfeel gives way to a balanced body with a nice yeast presence.  
A staple beer.

Great personality in this beer, incredible body and colour pale yellow with a huge head of white foam. Taste is perfect balance between malt and hops, the grade of the roast malt is the one. Carbonation is a bit high but it makes a refreshing beer at the same time that is is delicious,
Bottle. hazy yellow color with a nice head. Aroma is full of bananas and some spicey notes. Flavor is banana and some citrus.
Schiuma discreta e compatta, non svanisce all‚Äôistante, il frumento si sente bene, nessuna fastidiosa nota metallica, magari scarseggia un poco nel corpo, ma vabb√® c‚Äôe‚Äô di molto peggio.
hazy gold blond coloured body with a white head a hoppy herby fruity aroma a hoppy fruity herby spicy taste with a fruity bitter finish
