sweet and citrussy flavor. very good of its kind, my rating is probably too low. great weissbier, refreshing and smooth, and well balanced. head to head with others, it truly shows its muscle. well balanced.
This great hefe pours the tell-tale hazed golden yellow with a strong aroma of banana and clove with some bread and citrus.  Flavor is much the same with some peppery clove in the finish.  Good beer.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2009 golden yellow with very nice head.  thick mouteel.  clove like flavor with bana esters, classic yeasty weizen aspect.  great example, one of the paradigms

we love this beer!!! WHOOOOOOOoooooOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
OOOOO

50 cl Bottle. Cloudy dark yellow colour, big white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, wheat and some spice. Taste is slightly sweet, banana, yeast and wheat, also some citrus and spices. Nice dry mouthfeel, very refreshing weizen.

Bottle.  Mine is different than the photo (green bottle and no fancy neck label). Pours a hazy honey color with 2 finger white head.  Nose is sweet wheat and yeast.  Taste is wheat, light banana, coriander and mild citrus in the dry finish.   Medium mouth feel.  Decent beer ¬ñ crisp and refreshing.

It was a decent beer, a lovely gold color with a rather small, white head.  A little sweet, a bit spicy, but all in all very mild.  A touch of fruit went into it, but it was a bit malty for my tastes.
Hazy goldblond coloured beer with small white head and few carboation. Hoppy bit spicy aroma. Full palate. Finish is bit bitter with some fruity touches.

Strong hazy orange yellow coloured beer with some average carbonation and an average white head. Herby citrus yeasty wheat aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is herby and fruity balanced with some light yeasty touches. Medium weissen.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Sixer from The Wine Rack. Aroma: A good dose of banana and clove with lighter gum and... caramel? Hmm. Appearance: Pours a hazy gold with a sticky white cap that settles into a skin. Flavor: Clove up front with more banana thereafter; the finish is lightly peppery and lingers off-dry. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: Sadly, this is probably my last purchase of this InBev-owned beer. Still a solid weiss with a velvety mouthfeel.

Quite similar to the Paulaner, maybe a bit more sweet and spicied. No other beer style beats german hefe‚Äôs in the summer. Flavour is wheaty, yeasty, hardly any hops. Banana and citrus are there like in most hefes. I like to jump from this to the dunkel and back if im to drink a few, since this stuff can get too sweet after a while.
Bottle, 50cl.  A fantastic golden colour, and a great long lasting, fluffy white head.  If you miss lunch, have a drink of this and you‚Äôll be sorted until dinner.
Golden in color, very cloudy, white head.  Strong aroma of yeast/dough and wheat.  Taste is similar with additional orange flavor.  Very solid hefeweizen.

Bottle pours a cloudy straw color with a fluffy head that lasts.  Nice lace.  Yeasty aroma with some orange, banana, bread and some spice.  Light body with tight carbonation.  Good snap swallowed.  Nice hefe.  Some banana in the taste too.

Bottle. Pours a pale orange colour with a white head. The aroma has notes of herby yeast and some orange and banana. The flavour is light and pretty thin with notes of herby yeast, and some orange and banana. Quite watery. I‚Äôm a bit disappointed.

Pretty much a golden pour.  Floral smell, some fruits.  Nice carbonation, definete tinge of banana, light spiciness.  Clean finish.  Can‚Äôt get by the banana, prefer more citrus notes.  I like their dunkel much better.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text:
Pours a golden orange with a cold haze in it. Pours a big rocky head that recedes almost entirely. 

Smell is clean and wheaty. Light hints of banana and coriander. Also has a bit of earthy funk.

Taste is mild and slightly bitter from the hops. Refreshing. 

Mouthfeel is light and metallic. The metallic finish sticks long after the beer is done. 

Decent drinkability.
This is one of my favorite German Wheat Beers.  A hang-over buster. Pairs really well with pancakes.

Draft at Laschet‚Äôs in Chicago. This was quite a subdued Hefe. Nose was lightly citric and fruity, some banana and clove though more malty than anything. Taste is slightly metallic, somewhat bready, fizzy. Not as full bodied as I would like, though the caramelization is definitely there. Nice, but not my favorite.
Excellent, almost like banana bread. Smooth finish. One of my favorites on tap.

.5l bottle, abundant head that lasts, smells peachy, some lemon, faint banana and clove. Taste is nice, fruity, peppery, slightly acidic, fades out dry. This is much better than their dunkel, more dynamic.

Always looks a tint brighter than card board. Exceptional head that is laced with easters from the yeast. A balance on the palate of citrus, banana and earthy finish. Earthy like sweet raw mushrooms. Not enough hops to break the malt flavor but there. Refreshing.
Got this one on tap at Kclingers pub.  Nice cloudy gold color.  Good carbonation with a nice combination of fruit, malt an yeast flavors.  Very tasty.

Pours a cloudy golden brown - looks just like fresh apple cider.  Has a very sweet aroma of clove and coriander.  Slightly tart, bready taste with a strong coriander note.  Very little aftertaste.  Pretty damn good for a $3 pint at a Mobil station!

Poured from bottle a hazy glowing pale blond with a large tight white head that slowly disappeared.  Aroma is mildly soapy with banana, clove, and doughy yeast.  High carbonation creates a spicy tingle on the tongue and throat with the flavors coming in with light banana, clove, caramel, honey, very light touch of tart yeast, and some dough.  The palate is refreshingly light with a nice carbonation zip with some sweet and not much bitter.  Easy to drink, especially on a hot day.  I‚Äôll be having more.

500ml bottle. finally rating this one. pours hazy dull orange with creamy white head. banana and cloves with touches of caramel and bread in the nose. flavor is bready, banana, cloves, and yeast. the malt notes comes off slightly oxidized. sort of a thin mouth feel for a hefe. a classic example of the style.
Tremendous hefe. Loads of banana spices while retaining a good balance and a citrusy aroma.

On tap - hazy golden pour with a thick white head...a typical hefe pour!  Aroma is very bready and yeasty with citrusy accents.  Flavor is full and yeasty...lots of banana, clove and orange accents.  Oily on the palate and very refreshing...another underrated hefe on ratebeer.com!
(Bottle at Jacoby‚Äôs German Biergarten in downtown Detroit). Bubbly gold with average wheat beer head. Classic light fruity aroma and taste, lively on the palate. Crisp and refreshing.

Bottle from Safeway in the United States.  One of the classics.  Pours a cloudy orange with a thick white head.  Bready and citrus orange.  Bready, yeasty flavor with notes of lemon, apricot, clove, and coriander.  Richer than most hefeweizens  here in the United States.

(Draught at MacKinlay‚Äôs, Stockholm) Orange, cloudy colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity nose with citric hints of wheat, bread, peaches and banana. Fruity, malty taste with notes of banana, plums and sweetish hints of cereal. Nice, consistent and refreshing summer beer, but doesn‚Äôt really rock my world.

Nice to rate those that I‚Äôve had before, but not had the chance to write down.  Pours slightly orange-gold into the glass, hazy, with a large fluffy head that leaves lace.  Lots of banana on the nose.  The brew is semi-dry, with banana notes (maybe mingling with some lemon).  High carbonation levels, per the style, show next, beginning mid-palate... accompanying this begins the wheat contingency and a tad of orange.  This eventually leads to a dry spicy finish, closing with slight clove and yeast/wheat notes.  Nothing is overt or overdone, and the mouthfeel is a bit seltzer-like.  German hefe‚Äôs tend to have large carbonation levels, but I‚Äôm really missing some substance in the middle of the pull.  Better than its dunkel counterpart, it‚Äôs a decent summer brew.  Still at odds with it somehow.

Appearance is light amber, slightly cloudy, with a decent head. The flavor is a NOT your typical Hefeweizen. It has hints of orange, barley, and just a hint of clove. Overall, a sensational beer and an extreme pleasure to the pallet and definitely memorable! Even for those that don’t normally care for the wheatier brews.

Well Done Franziskaner

The beer that got me into wheats. Had on tap at Stuff yer Face. Golden, cloudy pour with a full bouquet of citrus. Hints of banana peel, and citrus, orange with a lot of spiciness to finish it of f. Very drinkable and refreshing and I tend to order it by the liter :)
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold color.  Thick, three finger white head.  Grassy aroma with hints of bananas and spices.  Muted, yeasty flavor with some clove.  Finish is clean and dry.
one of my old favorites.  P\our hazy golden yellow with thick head.  Aroma of orange, banana and a hint of spice and clove.  Good hefeweizen flavors.  Good beer.

Sweet aroma of citrus and barley. Appearance is light amber, slightly cloudy, with a decent head. The flavor is a typical Hefeweizen with hints of orange, lemon, lime, barley, and perhaps some sugar. Overall, a nice beer. I likey.
Protypical hefeweizen with a spicy kick in the rear!  Yeasty aroma leads into the fruit tones.  Extemely refreshing brew in the Las Vegas heat!

bottle.  Pale, hazy yellow pour, monster head that foams over then tones down pretty quick, leaving a nice healthy layer. Aromas of what you¬íd expect from a classic here- bananas, cloves, and multiple notes of sweetness in the nose.  Flavors of dried bananas, plenty of spicy yeasty notes, and a smooth underlying bready sweetness.  Great on the palate- creamy and smooth without any excessive carbonation.

Golden color with long lasting one inch head. Very cloudy. Banana and cloves in the nose. Malty, somewhat chewy entry with a moderately carbonated mouthfeel that meets a ripe banana, honey, lemony, spicy, dry finish with a slightly noticeable alcohol presence and persistent yeastiness. Quenching and crisp.
Bottle.  Quickly fading head.  Light cloudy amber in color.  Wonderful aroma.  Citrus in taste. Will buy again.  Good wheat beer.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2008 Appearance: Pale brown, cloudy. A bit of head, not lasting long.
Aroma: Wheaty. Raw dough.
Taste: Wheaty (of course), not too bad.
Info: 500ml bottle, 6/11-2005, 46/300
Bottle from Market Street Wine Shop Downtown. Hazy orange-yellow pour with a big head and decent retention. Bubblegum and banana aroma. Taste is banana, citrus, clove.
Hazy golden yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma of yeast, banana and clove.  Taste of banana, clove, lemon and mild yeast.  Mild sweet and spicy finish.
Pours a hazy straw color.  A big white head that dissipates quickly.  Yeasty aroma.  Flavor is sweet with a spicy yeast finish.  Great for a hot day!
Bottle Pored cloudy gold with thick white head..  Aroma of toast, spice and citrus.  Citrusy flavour, light enough drink on a very hot day. Light faint but pleasing finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: One of my favorite wheat beers. Light in color, clean yeast flavor with a hint of sweetness. This is a beer I will buy again and again.

On tap at The Yard House at Village West in KCK. Pours a cloudy orange-amber with hardly a remnant of a whitish head. (In its defense that seems to be the way they serve beer at The Yard House.) The nose is of big banana and faint clove over a clean wheat. Light to medium-bodied with a soft, wheaty mouthfeel and a clean, lightly dry finish. Sweet wheat and German yeasty esters (banana & light citrus) finishing with a lightly wheaty, clean finish. This is a nice hefe.

bottle at OpusK Lohja 180608
Color:hazy dark yellow
Taste:bit fizzy nice banana,phenols bit sweet lasting aftertaste
Cloudy yellow, thick white head. Aroma is of bananas and cloves. The flavor is of wheat but it almost takes second to a sweet citrusy/yeasty combination.

Draft at Flying Saucer Nashville, served in the proper glass by a sssssmokin waitress in white lace stockings. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a white head. Typical banana clove aroma and nice refreshing, but earthy texture (from the yeast). Nice pale wheat malt backbone with balanced accents of clove and citrus, with the right amount of sweetness. Yeasty finish. Nice beer.
Bottle and tap. Three fingers and 100 degrees of heat! Need I say more. A superior example of excellence!

I have tried this beer on tap a few times now so it is time to rate it.  Pours cloudy golden with a frothy white head.  Smells of a wheat beer but sweeter.  Good so far....  The taste is peculiar, as it seems almost minty.  Maybe it¬ís my imagination.  Overall, this is one that you order while you¬íre thinking about your next one.
0,5l bottle. Color is rather dark, typical rich head. Nose of wheat and yeast. Flavor is quite heavy for a Wei√übier - but not in a bad way. Quite malty.

Thanks to Ali for this one.  Light cloudy yellow with a creamy layer of white head sitting on top.  Aroma has a hint of skunk compliments of the green bottle I suspect.  Behind that resides a chewy yeast, lemons, and banana.  Light flavor has a load of banana, biscuits, and clove.  Palate is light and prickly, making it quite nice and refreshing.

Pours from the bottle with a nice white head and cloudy orange in color. The aroma for the beer is more on the banana scent with a clove undertone to it. Very light in flavor with the banana coming through more than spices with no hops.  A little light on the mouth wheat feel with a slight watery feel from this bottle. Overall a decent beer but I would imagine it would be much better on tap or fresh.   I have had better but this is pretty decent.

Cloudy yellow with dense white head.  Phenol, banana aroma.  Spicy flavor.  Carbonation of this brew enhances the refreshing flavor.  Not my top Munich Weiss but I certainly wouldn¬ít turn it down.  On tap at The Shep¬í

2008 Botte from Falcon Tavern - Pours a murky dark yellow with a small white head, aroma is all spice and grain, first impression was that this was not a weissbier but a belgian strong, spice and particulate wheat, finishes clean, this was awesome, will definitely drink again...

4/24/08 notes:  bottle, shared with Bin.  Color is light yellow orange.  Cloudy with white one finger head.  Aroma is of fermented fruits, yeast and spices.  The flavors blended in this beer are very well balanced.  I tasted yeast, citrus, banana, light spices, and some hop character.  I liked the body of this beer as well, it was smooth, medium thickness, and with pearly carbonation.  So far, definitely one of my tops for this style.

Bottle 50 cl (from fakta) Pours a hazy, amber body with a large, mostly to fully lasting, white, creamy head.
Characteristics: Wheat malt, cloves (nelliker) and hints of banana. Sweet and good.
Mild banana and clove like spice nose.  Cloudy gold with no head.  Smooth no hop bitter as expected but nocitrus either.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy dark beige color weizen with a huge pure white foamy head with good retention and great lacing. Aroma of banana and cloves is huge and very enjoyable. Taste is also dominated by some banana, cloves and bubble gum notes with a perfect creamy texture of wheat malt. Full body with limited filtration and great carbonation. No date on the bottle but I am guessing that this is somewhat fresh. Probably the best form a style that I enjoy consistently.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2008 Bottle 50cl. Hazy yellow/orange body with a large offwhite head. Lots of wheat and yeast in the nose. Flavour totally dominated by wheat and yeast. One of my favorite Hefeweizen and a true classic.
this is aother i feel is ranked to low this beer is the shit whish i could get it in afoty ina skirt
What a wonderful wheat beer!  Nice looking milky amber color upon pour with a nicy floralt nose and great spice taste!!

Pours a cloudy gold color with a medium-large head with fairly good persistance.  Potent yeasty nose with malty and fruity notes.  Taste is of banana and apple with a slight tartness.  Tart apple-like finish.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is light malt and green hops. Flavor is wheaty with hints of banana, clove  and citrus. Not my favorite but a nice, refreshing beer nonetheless.

Hazy orange color. Big head is white, cloudy and long lasting. Aroma is yeasty and banana-like. Flavor is wheaty, banana-like and sour in the end. Light-bodied, smoothly carbonated palate. Very refreshing hefeweizen.
Dark cloody gold body, white head. banana and spicy flavor. Sweet and little bitter in the palate. A good beer for me.

1. Gorgeous - cloudy golden.  Just says drink me all day long!  This beer is pure business, party business.
2. Awesome yeasty, banana-y, sweet aroma!  But, not too yeasty, banana-y, or sweet!  It is in your face, but not steppin¬í.
3. When it hits your lips, it is sooo good!
4. As I write this beer review, I need a new pint.
5. Some people on RateBeer love it, but only rate it a 2.9.  Give this beer some love.  Please!
6. If I was stuck on an island with only one beer, it would be this one.  I would gladly drink myself to death with this beer!  And, since it has yeast in suspension it would easily keep me healthy for 200 years.  Minimum.  Don¬ít underestimate the bower of B12!
7. The taste is really smooth - not bitter or malty.  Just smooth.  Typically smoothness in a beer comes from vanilla or oak.  Not for this beer!  :)
8. Delicious is the understatement of the year for this beer!
9. This is the only keg we have ever gotten that required a new european adapter.  (we have gotten A LOT of kegs over the years!)  And, it was a 13.2 gallon keg!  ---an unusual volume for a unusually tasty brew!
10.  Why stop at 9?
hazy orange with a thin white head.  Aroma is orange and spice.  Flavor is up front banana and clove,  some grass,  earth, bubblegum,  and lemon.  Finishes slightly sweet,  very refreshing.

Hard not to like. Dead clean style that shows the necessary bubblegum sweetness and clove spiciness that is key to the genre. Some excess fizz takes the edge off the flavour.About 1yr to run on the BB so another example of how fresh is best.
Hazy gold colored beer with a neverendng creamy white head. Aroma of sweet malts, slightly fruity. Fruity flavor and notes of vanilla.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2008 Quality Hefeweizen. Aroma is present but not overly influential. Flavor is very good, but not nearly as complex or enjoyable as a hefeweizen such as Hacker-Pschorr. More citrus than some other hefeweizens. Quallity hefeweizen, but falls short in some areas to other hefeweizens. A bit overrated in my personal opinion- there are better hefeweizens out there.

Coudy yellow with a fluffy white head, which quickly disappears and leaves little to no lacing. Great, fresh, citrus/spice aroma. Taste is very much along the lines of a Hoegaarden or Hacker-Pschorr, clean, refreshing with a long citrus end. I was pleasantly surprised. A great wheat beer, esp. for the summer.
Pours a cloudy gold color with billowy white head.  Wheat bread, banana, citrus, fruit, and lemon zest.  A nice refreshing German hefe.

Colour is a bright hazey golden colour with an enormous white top. The aroma is so natural and wheaty, sweet and enticing. Tasting is very pleasent, light and bubbly with great citrusy fruit. Great beer to have around.
Draft:  Cloudy golden colored pour with large white head.  Fruity, bready aroma.  Fruity, spicy finish.  Not bad at all.
Great taste, cloudy color and a nice foamy head. A great overall hefe that won¬ít leave you full
Cloudy light amber with tall white head.   Strong banana, clove, lemon aromas.  Bright flavors and high carbonation make this a perfect sunny afternoon drink.
I tried this at the yardhouse in las vegas nevada last night. definitely one of the better hefs ive had

I first bought this beer at a local liquor store in Las Vegas and was impressed. Pours a pretty amber and white head. Smells fruity and spicy. Nice zesty fruity and semi sweet taste of fruits and spices. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2008 On tap at Tank¬ís Tap Room (Carrollwood, FL).  pours a cloudy yellowish orange color with a white head.  Always an enjoyable aroma of yeast, bananas, spices, and wheat, with hints of citrus behind the scenes.  Great flavor highlighted by the wheat, yeast, and spices.    Has grown into one of my favorites!
The epitome of a German Hefeweizen.  This is fruity, almost lemony, with zest and spice.  Pours yellowish with very frothy head.
Pours a hazy light brown color with a white head. Aroma is bubble gum, clove, some banana, and a hint of spicy hops. Flavor is wheat, bubble gum, clove, and a spicy hop finish.
Always a reliable beer on tap or from the bottle.  Nice yeast and a bit of malt on the tongue with a crisp hit of hops.  Well balanced and always good if you cant find any craft brews.

Bottle. A classic hefeweizen this pours an immediately cloudy, pale straw colored beer with a puffy white head. Good aroma of bananas with a light yeast aroma and some bubblegum notes. Light citrusy flavor, yeast highlights the soft wheat malt character and bubblegum under notes. Light to medium bodied with good light carbonation. This would be awesome fresh.

Smells of peach, malt, and citrus with a hint of banana and clove. Taste is heavy of yeast and hopp. Also banana and citrus and clove. This is a very drinkable beer. The carbonation is perfect and it is very smooth.
Bottle from TJs in Fairfield, CA.  This one had banana flavors throughout... very Hefe-style, highly drinkale.  Good beer for the money.

Fredagsbaren p√• Biologi, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled.
Aroma and flavor of a lot of bananas. Refreshing and with a nice appearance

A- Pours an unfiltered apricot color with an absolutely massive head.

S- Spicy fruits, orange, pear, sweetness.

T- Fruity and wheaty with earthy notes. Slight metallic aftertaste.

M- Creamy with a decent amount of carbonation.

D- This is your run of the mill hefeweizen. Fairly easy to drink but nothing special compared to other german hefes.

Bottle, 500ml. A cloudy orange colour with a good head. Aroma is citrusy orange, banana  and yeast. Taste has plenty of wheat, a touch of yeast and underlying citrus notes. High carbonation. A very good hefeweizen.

On Tap at Bavarian Grill, Plano, TX.
Poured a gorgeous cloudy yellow-orange with fluffy white head with excellent retention. Strong aroma of bannana that is dominate. Flavor has mostly bannana present with hints of clove with citris notes....Palate was light-medium mouthfeel, almost watery with medium carbonation..........good heff though....

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 probably my favorite all time session beer. complexities are at a minimum, and weizen stereotypes are at a maximum.  still, this is highly drinkable if you dont think too hard about it.  abundant in all the categories weiss beers are typically measured in: banana, clove, etc... it maintains a ¬íthickness¬í on the palette which doesnt exist if you could chemically measure the viscosity.  not the most challenging brew, but good as a session brew for repeated drinkings if necessary.

On tap at Louie Fuller¬ís in Providence.  Pours cloudy orange golf with a fluffy white head.  Nose of bananas, citrus, spice, and bread.  Finishes with a nice sweetness.  I¬ím a Hefeweizen fan, and this is an excellent one.
Another classic German Weissbier.  Great with a meal or by itself, light-bodied and very refreshing.
Bottle. Hazy golden-orange color with a white head. Sweet, spicy and yeasty aroma. Taste of citrus, cloves, yeast, grain, banana and slightly sourish notes. Light bodied.
It had a VERY citrus taste, hazy cloudy yellow body, with a good amount of head.

Bottle.  Pours yellow/orange with a fairly good head.  Smells of orange, banana, and a hint of dough.  Good light to medium body with a sweet flavor and finish with a bit of bitter for proper balance.  Beer Club favorite for April 2008 tasting.
Hazy orange, and a grand wheat aroma. Refreshing flavours of banana, esters, bubblegum and coriander. It¬ís a fine hefe-weizen.

From the bottle, pours a hazy light orange with a thick foamy white head.  Aroma is of clove and banana, and something else that I¬ím going to blame on the glass.  Taste is smooth and there¬ís just a bit of bubbles on the tongue.  Flavors of banana and some bready yeast make this a fine tasting beer.  It¬ís also good on tap, as I recall.
Small head, banana and hints of orange in aroma.  Very cloudy and dusty gold appearance.  Smooth banana and sweet taste, followed by tart and lemon zest.  Extremely smooth finish.

50cl bottle from Total Wine Tampa. Pours a cloudy dark golden with a one finger white head. Aroma: Lemon, flowers, citrus, grass and straw. Faint aroma of orange. Flavor: Slightly dry with flavors of bread, grasses, spices and fresh citrus. Hints of sweetness and perhaps caramel as well. Smooth, mild, lemony finish.
Bottle.  Really nice beer for the style.  Very Cloudy, light amber color, fragarent with Bananas and Lemons.  Nice tart taste with a hint of pepper., not too much carbonation and thirst quenching.

500ml bottle. i tried this beer a couple of years ago. it was ok. so i tried it again with a fresh attitude. same, it¬ís ok. i¬íve realized that i really don¬ít care for the banana molding hay after tastes of European Hefes. it just reminds me of of cleaning cow shit out of a barn in Oregon. it¬ís not bad, but it¬ís not that good either.

Hazy yellow color topped with a thick off white head. Fruity, banana, vanilla flavor with a touch of spice in there. Mouthfeel is kind of thin though. Pretty much what I had expected. Light bodied and refreshing.

This is definitely now one of my favourite hefe-weizens.  It is hazy light amber with a very big off-white head that slowly shrinks.  The aroma is at first grain and herbal hops rather more like a German pilsner-which is good to me-but thenthe classic German hefeweizen qualities take over, with banana, bubblegum, marshmallow, wheat, yet always with a grainy-hoppy, alcoholic lager quality mixed in, as well as an odd musty quality which slightly detracts.  In taste, it is great, with lots of fruit, some bubblegum, good sweet-bitter presence and balance, a long, slightly alcoholic grain-banana finish.  It¬ís not to soft, a complaint I ote have with wheat beers of various types.  In the end, this is a great hefeweizen for me, combining the typical Geramn qualities for the style but more muted than usual with a non-wheat beer quality.
Tap  @Faegans, Hazy, murky yellow. Big banana and bubblegum aroma. Medium body, and banana taste. Nice wheat aftertaste. Solid!

Wow, what a beer.  Cloudy in appearance and a light fluffy head to boot!  I was not a fan of the wheat ale until I tried this.  Very very flavorful with hints of citrus and banana.  It is refreshing enough to swig after mowing the lawn, and refined enough to intrigue the in-laws over slides of their trip to the Rockies.  Must try!

Cloudy golden yellow colour with a thin white head. Lots of chunky sediment. Sweet fruity aroma. Overall flavours quite sweet, malty and banana. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Quite nice. 500ml bottle.
Cloudy yellow/gold with fluffy white head.  Medium carbonation and body. Wheat malts with  banana aroma and flavours. Maybe a wee bit of cloves. Sweet finish.
pours a golden yellow color with a white fluffy head. Aroma of banan, lemon and wheat. Flavor mainly wheaty and citrusy.

500 ml. bottle. Huge, white head. Liquid is hazy and butter-like yellow. Yeast, bana ester and sweet wheat malts in aroma. Flavor is yeasty sour in the finish. Body is light to medium. A bit watery mouth feeling. Sparkling and quite refreshing. Not my favourite hefe-weiss, but still tasty and easy to drink.

Pours a bright orange yellow cloudy color with a huge amount of froathy white head.  Looks absolutely delicious!  Aroma is doughy banana and a tad bit of lemon - pretty typical of hefes. Flavor very crisp and refreshing but without being watery and thin.  Nice banana and subtle citric taste with a bit of the doughy yeastiness.  Overall, excellent hefe.

On tap. Very nice tawny golden color in the glass, with a standard huge hefe head. The aroma is mostly of citrus, with classic hefe spice in there too. The flavor is excellent -  a bit more citrus than the standard hefeweizen, otherwise a pretty straightforward (but excellent) example of the style. Palate is a little thinner than would be ideal, but is still quite smooth. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2008 Nice orange cloudy color... smells lightly like orange and banana... very refreshing taste hints of fruit banana and light spice.... very subtle beer I enjoyed it.....re-rate... had it on tap creamy bubble gum greatness I really like this my favorite Hefe...

Bottle. Smelled wonderful. Nice yeasty, bread smells. No hint of skunk at all. Nice clean citris taste with little tinge of pepper and bananas on the back side. A very complex hefe, realitve to what i¬íve been drinking. I really like this hefe. Im glad I bought a sixer. Topnotch!

Pours a beautiful orangy hue with a bit of haziness.  Nose is very nice with whisps of clove/ripe banana.  Mouthfeel is light and clean. Taste is very nice with a spicy/malt alongside of the crispness of the wheat.  The finish is perfect and leaves you totally wanting another, which I believe I¬íll have!

Bottle from Trader Joe¬ís in Fairfield, CA. Pours a hazy yellow with a large white head. Smells of bananas. Taste of bananas, other citurs flavor and a little bit of spice. I have to admit I was very surprised at the quality of this beer. Definately one I will have to drink again.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2008 Lovely orange body topped by a longlasting beige head, with wonderful citrus notes up front and a crisp finish.  A real fine hefe-weissbeer.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2009 ...had both the bottle, and draft varieties, but of course, draft is always better.  The imported bottle is decent, but not the greatest.  Nice spicy notes, and creamy head.  Hints of orange, and nice malty wheat aroma.  Flavor is there, and feels nice in the mouth, light and refreshing. 

RR.  Had this again recently, and was better than last time, I noticed more clove notes, so I¬íll up the raiting.
Bottle, pours a hazy yellow with large white head. Pleasant aromas of wheat, banana and sweet malts. Similar flavours with a hint of spiciness. Refreshing clean tart finish.

A good Hef, but a little bit sour to me.  I taste a bit of clove in this, which kind of limits this beers satisfaction to me.  The sourness combined with the clove brings this beer down IMO, but still a good hef.  I¬íll drink it when I can¬ít find Paulaner.
N√°lam az egyik etalon sz√ºretlen b√∫za a csal√°dra jellemz≈ë legjobb jegyekkel.Ezt musz√°j megk√≥stolni! √©s m√©g,√©s m√©g...

(bottle) Pours a hazy orange with a white head that lasts.  Aroma is of light banana, but mainly clove and yeast.  Taste is lightly sweet upfront, but then switches to some clove and finishes with some wheat twang, light lemon, and yeast on the finish.  The mouthfeel is pretty thick, but the finish is far too short.  Not bad, but not great, I¬íd like to try a really fresh bottle.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2008 Awesome!!!   This is truly a beer alone on an island.  First the aroma is just plain awesome.  It‚Äôs got hints of banana, maybe some sort of spice, maybe its some sort of malt charachter.  It‚Äôs appearance is just perfect.  Huge fluffy head.  It‚Äôs a cloudy color yellow.  It‚Äôs flavor is just outrageous.  It‚Äôs got a banana, spice, wheaty taste.  It‚Äôs mouth feel is perfectly smooth.  This is like cream in a glass.
This is a very good wheat beer.  The color is a little lighter than it could be, but still very good.  The aroma is not as strong as some others.  the taste is excellent, and the head is perfect.
Bottle...very pleasant beer, somewhat light in flavor, but not thin. Refreshing! Dull and cloudy in color, yellow-gold. Not too overwhelming or sweet, just right.

The pour was a turbid brown with lots of golden highlights streaming through.  The head was foamy white and didn¬ít hang around long.  Spotty lacing.  The aroma was wheat and yeast dominating over mild citrus.  The flavor followed suit with some mild spice coming into play to give it some nice balance.  The body was on the thin side and it was a fairly enjoyable beer.
Pours the prototypical hefeweizen head that doesn¬ít dissipate. Citrusy taste with a high carbonation zing. Finishes with a little more of a bitter taste than most hefes. Not bad
A tasting at Three Cellars Milwaukee.  A lot of carbonation, Sweet, fruity aroma with citrus. Wheat, bananas

0,5 l bottle, in La Manga, Spain. Hazy orange color, lovely big white head. Aroma is citric and fruity, with yeast and wheat. Flavor is fruity (banana), with yeast, sweet malt and citrus. A nice weiss.
My favorite beer.  Has a rich, creamy head that when penetrated by the beer, results in a malty wheat style with hints of pumpkin nad spice.  Great balance and taste.
Had this out of tap and I hated it. Something wasnt right.  Went and bought a bottle of this and loved it.
Bottle at Haket 2008-02-08. Cloudy light colour with plenty of creamy head. Sweet, fruity aroma with citrus. Wheat, bananas. Highly carbonated.
Thick creamy head invites the drinker, but the color is slightly unappealing.  Smells like a good wheat beer.  Taste is calm and mellow with a light fruity flavor.

Very nice hefe here...the bottle I got was just a little skunky but it didn¬ít affect the flavor too much.  Looked really good, nice and cloudy but as I said the smell was a little skunk mixed with banana and a biscuity smell.  Taste was great, just like a good banana nut bread. 

Overall, I liked this one.

Orangish golden in color. Not as much head as usual for a hefe. The white head is spritzy. Light wheat aroma with hints of banana. Medium-darker wheat taste with a highly carbonated mouthfeel. Zippy finish. A good weizen, but not the best.
Bottle. Hazy orange beer with fluffy white head. Sweet aroma of wheat and yeast. Light banana flavor with a yeast finish. Its nice but very light.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy deep yellow color with thick head. Grainy and clovey aroma with hint of banana and vanilla. Wheaty and clovey flavor with quite smooth and oily mouthfeel. The deep fruity and spicy tartness separates this from other weizens. Good, allthough not my favourite weizen.

Lovely cloudy-orange beer with a huge head that lasted the whole glass, with lots of sticky lacing. Pronounced lemon-yeast aroma, with a hint of something warm -- maybe clove? Taste was really delightful -- mild, citrus with a touch of yeasty banana, and a lingering spicey, almost peppery clove-like aftertaste. Not as heavy as Paulaner or Weihenstephaner -- milder, less forward, and a bit less hops bitterness. Amazing mouthfeel for this style of beer: quite smooth and rounded. At 5.0%, and such a pleasant taste, you could drink these comfortably for a long session.

Quite simply, there probably isn¬ít a better German wheat beer. American wheat beers WISH they could be this good. In fact this style might be one of the "original" session beers. 

The beer pours out a cloudy, yellow-orange color with a stunning one three finger head which transformed to a 1/2 inch creamy thick cap which stayed during my entire drink. Aroma...bananas. And oh so refreshing. Even on a cool March evening it still manages to refresh. Some sweet malts and just a kiss of citrus. Bananas is the main attraction on the aroma though. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth. Flavors had some nice maltiness to it, subtle citrus...maybe even a bit of vanilla. The flavors just meld incredibly well and transform this into a top notch thirst quencher. Might just be my favorite wheat beer, although New Glarus is very close.

bottle. pours a hazy gold with a huge, dense white head that rose about an inch out of my glass and maintained shape for a few minutes. nose is of lemon and orange peel. zesty lemon flavor. smooth creamy mouthfeel. finishes dry and slightly astringent.
Bottle #361 Slightly hazy golden pour with large white head. Light wheat aroma and flavor of citrus and wheat. Good brew overall, it¬ís been a while since I¬íve had a German Hefe.
Bottle. Hazy golden with handsome head. Spicy banana aroma. Mild but refreshingly sour taste of citrus and little banana, some. Well-balanced. Well carbonated medium body leads to great drinkability.
50CL Can. GOlden color, nice head. citrus, hazy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, astringent,
Had this on tap at the yard house.  A wonderful hefeweizen true to its name.

Opaque 12 oz. dark grapefruit juice colored pour with huge frothy head. Aroma of citrus and yeast. Highly carbonated. An almost tangerine taste in front palate, spicy mid palate and dry yeasty finish. Very drinkable but too carbonated for my taste. This would pair nicely with a summer salad on a hot day.

Bottle. Pours light golden with a big fluffy head. Smell is dry and yeasty. Taste is biscuit like at first with a big estery finish. Lost of bubblegum and banana oil. I¬íve never had a beer with this much ester character. Very good and unique.

Tasted 3/10/08.  500ml bottle.  Hazy sedimented golden orange hue.  Layer white head.  Good Hefe nose.  Bananas and oranges.  Touch citrus.  Floral yeast character.  Straight otta the fridge, but still crisp and refreshing.  Light to medium bodied with smooth palate and easy transitioning brew to the slightly bitter end.  Subtle light fruity esters abound.  Crisp bready wheat.  Typical yeast flavor.  Tart acidic finish.  Faint zesty hops.  Hints of melons, pepper and wood.  This is a standard.

Citrus but mainly banana. Pours a cloudy opaque gold with amber highlights. Aggressively poured it gives a nice white fluffy head. Nose is all banana, and ends on a nice, refreshing hoppy note. A good Hef all in all.
Pours a nicely hazy golden color with a creamy white head.  Spicy aroma of citrus and banana.  Good flavor as well, but a bit watery on the tongue.  Not bad.
(German) Hazy Orange color with a Sm-White Head that dissapates quickly.  This Brew has a Banana/Wheat Aroma. Smooth, But with a watery Hops taste!!! I wanted a bit more from this one, But enjoyable.

I¬ím not typically a big Hefe fan, but this one is solid.  The body is a hazy, glowing tangerine-gold.  Pair that with a billowing head of thick, meringue-like, snow white foam and this brew just looks incredibly refreshing.  The lacing is as thick as any I¬íve ever seen, coating the glass entirely, from top to bottom.  Scents of orange chiffon, lemon peel, coriander, clove, allspice, and banana cream pie are well blended and inviting.  The first sip is just a bit of a letdown, as the citrus notes are slightly watered down and not as crisp as they showed in the nose.  Creamy banana and spices are again a bit subdued.  A lighter than medium palate is well carbonated and not at all sticky or cloying, lending to its supreme drinkability.  Short, clean finish.  This is nothing special, but it owns Tucher and Julius-Echter in the widely-available Hefe category.

I¬ím glad I made this purchase.

There was a bit of sediment in the bottom of the bottle, and I rolled the beer around a bit to get some of it up before opening and pouring. 

It was very cloudy and had a beautiful yellow-orange glow. The scent was appealing, wheaty and fruity. It tasted primarily of hops and banana. This went down smooth and was a bit creamy.

I will undoubtedly drink this many times again.

Nice looking head and color. First tasting impression was that this beer is kinda weak and watery, on the good side its got smooth mild flavour, hints of caramel and cofee, a bit sour but quite refreshing. Would be good on on its own an a hot summer day rather than in a winter. Overall not bad.

Reddish gold with a generou, lively creamy head.
Fresh banana, citrus smell with a woody feel.
Refreshing watery, sour flavour - well balanced.
The first taste is quite intense banana which then drifts into hints of cherries, lemon and a saturated background: un unclear palate which I can¬ít place but which seems to accentuate the banana-lemon combination very nicely. Bit too dry for a weissbier, though.
Very interesting beer - it promises to be a good German weissbier and turns out to be that and something more. Unexpected.

#100!! 16.9oz bottle.  Pours cloudy golden/copper, substantial creamy white head.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana and spice.  Excellent balance, hop bitterness noticeable yet allows the banana, spice, wheat & yeast filter through unimpeded, like bright sunlight through lace curtains over venetian blinds.  Carbonation tingles over the tongue, aftertaste of banana bread and spicy hops.  Beautiful brew that I look forward to enjoying uch more of in the future.

Poured cloudy with off white head. Aromas of wheat and yeast. Mild flavors of wheat, bananas and some other fruits. Easy drinking mellow beer. You could drink alot of these. Good thist quencher. Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and carbonation that tingles on the tongue. An excellent wheat beer.
One of my absolute favorite German Hefeweizen beers.  Clean taste, goes down easily, with an inviting cloudy pour.

Nice and cloudy pour with a decent amount of head. Aroma is pretty bland being almost entirely wheat, but the taste as much more complexity to it. There is a very nice spice that compliments the wheat flavor with a hint of yeasty goodness. Excellent beer all around and not too extreme. I imagine that this is the perfect beer to introduce someone to the imported/craft brewing world.
Very solid wheat.  A friend brought me this from Germany.  Hazy cloudy pour with a frothy head.  Aroma of wheat but a very spicy taste.  I¬ím not much on wheats but this one I liked.
Pours a cloudy dark yellow/orange with a small white head. Nose of apricot, banana, and malt. Smooth well balanced flavor that grows on you. Might be my favorite Hef.

On tap at Sharp Edge.  Pours a cloudy orange-honey color with a 1-finger head.  Nose of fresh sour apples, clove, banana, coriander and some other fruity esters.  Very smooth taste.  A lot of citrus, spice, honey and some yeast flavor.  A hint of bitter in the finish.  Very light and refreshing, but has a good mouthfeel.
Decent wheat beer with a great pour and good spicy taste.  I got hooked on this beer last summer, and it compliments strong flavored food very well.

very cloudy, with cloud like thick head.
wheat dominates on nosing.
very nice wheat flavor, not overpowered by coriander or cloves/bannas/ bubble gum. very clean & balanced. for those who dont like the cotton-candied/buble-gummed weisse beers, this is killer shit.  on draft it would rival any weisse beer out there. schneider edel & weihenstephaner only was in same stratosphere.

I absolutely love this beer.  Got hooked on it just outside of Fussen Germany.  Rich, banana flavor with just a hint of spice.  Love to have this with a Brat and sauerkraut.  Finish it off with a hunk of beer cheese  (made from stale beer).
One of the best Hefes. Beautiful classic, hazy, golden pour. Robust citrus, yeast, spicy aroma. Medium body with citrus, clove, slight bananas, yeast and wheat. Pleasant aftertaste.
Yep, this is THE hefeweizen.  Smells of bananas, citrus and a little bubblegum.  Taste is a little of bananas, wheat, and finishes clean.  This is the standard.

pours a cloudy amber with a white head.  aroma is a bit sour, with some cookie dough, banana, some spice, yeast, and a tiny bit of citrus.  taste is spice, clove, bitter banana, straw, bread, and grains.  mid-bodied with a bitterish clovey finish.  lightly prickly clean mouthfeel.  watery, soapy lacing that drips pretty quickly down the side of the glass.  not bad.

This is the beer that started me on the path to craft beers. One of my favorites. Cloudy pour with the beautiful wheaty head. Aroma of banana¬ís. Taste is banana, spice, and just all around easy to drink. Franziskaner is a great beer to introduce to those that have been brainwashed into thinking bud, miller, and coors are the only beers on earth.
Cloudy Pour with a good citriusy yeast taste. Good overall Hefeweizen. Spaten has yet another winner with this one.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2008 Very cloudy pour. Nice citrus like flavor (though not overwhelming). One of my very favorite beers.
Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a nice medium head and lacing.  The nose is honey suckle and citrus and some nice spiciness comes through in the mouth.  A great summer Hefewiezen.
Very drinkable heffe. A little carbonated. Creamy and fruitful. A thrist quencher. Would have liked to drink it all night but had to try a few more beers. Will definately add it to my ¬íregulars¬í.

Bottle. Tanks to Tjalve.
Body is hazy golden and has a white head. Aroma and flavor is sweet banana and candy-like. Also some citrus and yeast. Little thin.

July 2006 - I can¬ít believe I haven¬ít had this yet. Anyway, being the least expensive of the readily available German hefe¬ís, I wasn¬ít expecting this to be all that...and I was pleasantly surprised. Straw color, HUGE head and lacing. Absolutely beautiful. Sweet bubblegum smell with wheaty aspects. The flavor was also a tad sweeter than the "other" hefe¬ís, more bubblegum, less clove. Mouthfeel was extremely smooth...coulda convinced me my bottle came from a tap. Maybe a little less full in flavor, but if drinkability were a factor, I¬íd give it a 10. Delicious!

16.9 oz bottle- pours a cloudy orange color, nice foamy white head. Wheat taste to it as well as a hint of banana. Refreshing to drink but not too light. Clean and easy to drink overall. A pretty good Weissbier.
Bottle. Pours yellow/orange with huge foamy head. Banana and candy in the nose and more banana and wheat in the mouth. Thick but still thirst quenching. I love it.
16.9 oz. bottle, pours a big fluffy head and orange body, has lots of fruity banana with some clove at the end, very nice hefe

Excellent Hefe, refreshing taste, wonderful aroma, nice think foamy head, and great with a slice of lemon or orange. Nice golden orange in color with an aroma of spices, fruit, and yeast. The taste is much of the same but you get the taste of the wheat added to it.
moderately tasty and refreshing. Not my favorite style but a very clean and banana powered example.
My favorite beer in the world, so far.  This delicious Hefeweizen tastes and smells of clove, banana bread, almond, hops.  Big yummy foam and classic cloudy body.  WOO!!!

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2009 Re-rate. Pours light and cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma has sweet fruity banana notes with a nice spicy presence. Medium body with notes of banana, clove, and yeast. Very drinkable and very tasty.

Poured from bottle. Super cloudy gold with that banana scent that seems to come with every Weissbier. Also tastes of bananas with a faint aftertaste of hops. I¬ím not a big fan of wheat beers, so I can¬ít say that I really enjoy this beer. Nevertheless, I think it¬ís a good brew for wheat beer aficionados.
spicy banana and clove... maybe too much for me. The beer was enjoyable and refreshing but not the best for the middle of winter when I tried it.
Hazy orange color with a big fluffy head and some sediment. Nose has wheat, banana, citrus.  Taste adds cloves to the mix.  Refreshing, a tiny bit sweet.

Nice cloudy pour although a little heavy on the "bubblegum" flavor than can be a bit off-putting with wheat beers.

Respectable wheat though.
hazy golden pour with a nice frothy head. nice bananas and yeast in the aroma. sweet spice and yeast in the flavor. refreshing, crisp and always a good choice in a hefe-weiss.
There is nothing more that can be said for this true classic made bySpaten.Refreshing,bananaflavors as well as wheat and light clove.One of the first to look at for a German Hefeweizen.

On Tap expecting a good beer but disappointed by the dullness of the beer. A bit too watery for my palate. Good apperance, hazy with a small head. Not the type of head you expect on a Weizenbier, due maybe to the small 30cc glass they use in Holland. Almost no smell to speak of, a light sweet flavor almost no hops or bitterness. Still better than the Belgian ¬íWitbieren¬í.
The first weissbier I came across, way back in 1992!  Nice cloudy pour and well defined palate. Hints of banana in the palate, clean finish and very easy to drink. A fine example of the hefe style

Bottle. Translucent amber-yellow, rocky head with lacing. Aroma is grainy bread, hints of cookie dough, and mild citrus fruit. Flavor is a mild mix of yeast and grainy bread. Palate is substantial, textured, creamy and lively. Excellent hefe!
Bottle in Germany. Poured hazy dark golden with full head. Nice fruit nose with some spice to it. Flavor supports the nose and has a smooth mouthfeel to it. Clean finish

Bottle. Pours orangish yellow with a mid sized white head that steadily dissapates before 3/4 gone. Aroma is strong bananna. Flavor is typical Hefe, but not as sweet as the other few I have had. Nice cloudy pour, especially when swirlled.
Vague aroma. minimal head.Kind of sweet smelling. Very fizzy. sweet ale taste. . its got a nice banana flavor. spicy after taste. i wouldn¬ít eat with it.
one of the first craft brews I ever had. good beer at a decent price. easly a drink all night beer

1-6-08 tap 
Unfiltered cloudy orangish yellow with nice head.  Skunky belgium yeast aroma.  Bubbly palate - somewhat surprising in this one.  Very "hefeweizen".  Taste is sweet and not too doughy.  Really not that bad for my least favorite style!

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2010 [1/14/08] Straw colored pour, cloudy, with large foamy white head. Sweet wheat aroma with a touch of banana and some yeast.  This might be my favorite hefe.  Very pillowy and crisp.  Sweet wheat, clove, ripe banana and bready flavors.  Extremely drinkable and not annoyingly metallic or over-banana flavored like a lot of examples.  7.4.8.4.17 . . . . . . . . . . . . . .[much needed rerate bottle 6.23.10]  Pours a hazy glowing orange tinted straw color with a medium fizzy soda bubble white head.  Aroma is a bit meaty, interesting malt flour, light sweet banana, hint of fruit, light bubble-gum note.  Flavor follows, fruit, quite estery, some banana candy, really like a now and later, ripe banana, touch of bread, some pink bubble-gum, maybe just a touch of bitterness, sweet and super estery, some sourness in the finish.  Light bodied, pillowy carbonation with a slight sizzle, larger and bit corse, bit chalky, just a tad too sweet for me.  7.4.7.3.14
Draft at 1849.  Blond pour with some white head.  Aroma of sweet malt, banana, and yeast.  Flavor was the same, and is probably my favorite hefeweizen.
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2008 Poured to a white head with aromas of yeast and alcohol. Initial flavor was citrousy with a slighty bitter and tangy finish. Not as good as the Paulaner Hefeweizen.
Clear fruity finish, light, refreshing, clean, exciting, golden in colour, good from the bottle however awesome if on tap.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2009 Pours cloudy yellowish to orange with a small head in a pint glass on tap.  Nose is fresh orange, wheat, and lightly spiced from the yeast.  Flavor is strongly of wheat, and lightly spiced with flavors of clove held in check without being overpowering.  This is a great example of the style, and the heavily wheaty and fruity character of it really made it appeal to me.

Hard wood aroma.
Dark white foam with dark golden colour.
Burnt wood flavor with sweet palate.
Great speech beer.

On tap at Green Dragon in PDX--Poured a very hazy, glowing golden orange with a shade of mustard,  Big banana clove nose typical of style smelled from across the long bar. Spicy yeast flavors.  Slightly tangy and acidic, yet fruity.  Finished on the thin side, but very warming.  A cery nice beer!

A√≠ est√° uma excelente Hefeweiss pra ser par√¢metro no estilo. Creme muito branco, persistente e consistente. O aroma segue o sabor t√≠pico de mel, banana, cravo e fermento. Final longo, doce e lupulado. √ìtima.

Rated: 20 November 2006
Bottle 500 ml, brown. 
Body is hazy with quite a huge white head. 
Aroma of strong yeast, not ripe apple and banana. Franziskaner unfortunately has no full rounded taste. Its too accidic and metalic for me and the body is definitely too thin as for a "premium" german hefeweizen.
Aftertaste gives some notes of citrus accidity and quite noticeable wheat grains. Again more like soft refreshing hefe which lacks a bit more yeasty flavour and thickness of the body. Looks much worse for me when compared to Paulaner Hefeweizen, not only in terms of taste but also in terms of body appearance, I think because of lower yeast ingredient.

Golden, hazy wheat with a huge, white head. The aroma has notes of wheat and banana and the mouthfeel is prickly. the flavour is slightly sweet with clear notes of wheat, banana and citrus. It might have more body, but it¬ís a nice weiss.
This beer is legit! One of the best Hefeweizen¬ís I¬íve ever had and I love it¬ís unique taste. The strong banana and citrus-like tastes set this beer apart from other Hef¬ís.

Pours a cloudy orange from the bottle. Small amount of head, pretty carbonated. Smells sweet, a bit like sour oranges. I¬ím not very keen on the taste. It¬ís a bit too sweet for me. Tastes of Lemon, orange but a bit sour with a strange aftertaste I don¬ít care for. This isn¬ít a bad beer but it¬ís not my style. I wouldn¬ít order it again.

On tap. Hazy gold/orange. Aroma was pretty good-a bit yeasty zest and oranges to keep things interesting enough. Taste wasn¬ít too bad either, but the body was rather thin and watery, which covered up the flavor. Could have been .5 or so better.
Draught. Nose is pure orange and slightly sour. Hazy orange-brown with a light head. Orange up front, spice and a sour finish. Thick and hardy but intensely smooth. A wonderful hefe.
Tap at Ginger Man Houston.  Cloudy pour, fruit and citrus aroma.  Flavor is typical: wheat, citrus, light and refreshing body.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL for $1.49 Very good.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a dense white head. Wheaty and slight esteric aroma. Slight dry wheaty flavour with a subdued esteric note and a vague fruitiness. Dry wheaty and mild bitter finish.
12 oz bottle.  Nice golden color.  Very "wheaty" with "banana-like" taste from the wheat and the yeast.  This is what hefeweissen should taste like.

Bottle at The Cove Fishery Grill, Lancaster, PA...pours gold in color with a full complimenting head...smell offered hints of banana, mild spice, musty wheat...taste of banana, dull citrus fruit, clove...still not a big fan of the Hefe but a very easy drinking beer, went well with the fare.

This is absolutely one of my favorite hefe-weissbiers.  This fine beer pours thick and cloudy with a wonderfully full, creamy head.  The aromas of banana, citrus and butter are very forward and distinct.  The beer drinks smoothly with a hint of sweetness, and the finish is always subtle and pleasant.  Very easy to drink.  One of the world¬ís best beers.  Enjoy!

Picked this up on tap at the Steinkeller in Oxford OH and nabbed the commemorative Xmas class to boot.  This weissbier packs a lot of flavor and really stays smooth throughout.  Maybe the top hefe I¬íve had (though I am not generally a fan of the style).

12oz bottle part of variety "beers of the world" pack. pours a very clean cloudy buttery orange with a nice full head. can smells some buttery aromas mixed in banana is very apparent in the aroma and it invites a taste.. initial hit to the palate is very light but filled iwith a cornicopia of fruitiness.. bananas, an hint of apple and a slight buttery wheat lemon... smooth all the way down and by far exemplifys what a good slow brewed hefe should taste like. Im wasnt  a hefe fan until I had this one.  great finish.
An easy to drink hefeweizen. Quite soft and refreshing, not overpowering in any way. Has the essential banana and clove flavors along with some lemony zing. A little bit on the sweet side
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2008 Poured with a nice head that lasted.  Great aroma of fruit.  Nice hazy color with taste of vanilla.  what a nice beer, would drink again

One of the best Hefe-Weiss out there. Bottled. Poured into a Dortmunder glass just for the heluvit. Formed an outrageous rocky, fluffy head, which brought oohs-and-aahs from others present. Underneath said head is a delicious, light, fruity brew. Slight banana, lemon, and grassy(?) flavors balance well with the overall wheatiness. A fine beer with nice packaging and presents well. Want to impress average, crap-beer drinkers? Introduce them to real beer? Start with this one. It is not so hearty as to offend a limited imagination, but has it where it counts.

Thick, full, and strong head. Cloudy yellow to brown colors. Very first smell is a sweet banana aroma. I Definatly taste banana flavors with orange and lemon flavors. This beer feels is smooth and foamy as it goes down giving a good compliment to it¬ís rich bouquet and full body.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2008 re-rated:  old rating 6/4/7/3/15 - 3.5
new rating:
pours a semi-cloudy orange with a small white head.
smell is ripe banana, wheat, some spice, yeast, touch of citrus.
taste is crisp, wheat, lemon, banana, pepper, a little on the dry side in the end.
overall a good hefe, not overpowering, nicely balanced.

On tap. Cloudy golden yellow with short lived but decent head. Nice complex hefe-weissen aroma. Palate is OK, medium body and carbonation. The flavour was somewhat disappointing; it was thin compared with the expectation from the aroma. It¬ís a nice beer, but not terribly special

Received as a small sample. Like a typical hefe-weissen, pours cloudy. This is a deeper yellow than others I¬íve had. Taste is extremely predominant. Banana, citrus, other light spices. THin head that remains for a good bit. Very tasty. I would purchase a case.

Pours a cloudy pale orange with a sparse white head. Aroma is full and fruity,mostly citrus notes. Taste is crisp and very citrusy. Very smooth on the palate, nice carbonation level. Finishes light and smooth. Overall, fantastic.

Can 50 cl. Pours a cloudy yellow with a big white head and smell of yeast and citrus. Taste starts really good, wheat, yeast citrus, orange and mixed spices, but a bit watered down. This could have been a lot better, though it still is a good beer
Ein sehr leckeres Wei√übier. Die Flasche freilich ist schlicht, der Inhalt keineswegs. Wirklich schmackhaft, auch wenn ich es nicht ganz so gut finde wie das dunkle.

This beer pours out a nice thick golden head to complemt the nice golden golor it has. The color is kind of merky orange  and the arom is resembles orange peel and some minor citrus notes. There is  nice citrus and lemon zest initial flavor. The palate is full of honey and orange peel and the duration si somewhat decent.

Bottle; first time from a bottle.  Poured a cloudy gold with medium to large white hed.  Aroma was of yeast, clove, wheat, and banana.  Flavor was pretty tasty with a very nice palate.  Flavor of yeast, wheat, banana, bubblegum with a light spicyness.  Very malty and tasty.  Easy drinking.  Very good.

I¬ím not a huge fan of hefeweizen, but this is good. I suppose it¬ís the standard to what every hefeweizen in the US is compared to. Big white fluffy head, cloudy, especially after swirling the yeast and pouring it into the glass. The usual banana-bubblegum notes. Smooth, which is something I like - most wheats are too fizzy for me. I can see why these are savored in the summer.
solid hefe, there is a few better than this but it is by no means average.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 Not my favorite style.  .  Medium head, cloudy as expected. Standard juicy-fruit aroma.  Flavor is lightly malted, but mainly watery with slight hops. Should wait for summer, I suppose.
Hazy golden with a small white head. Clove and banana aroma. Sweet grainy taste with a bit of sourness and a dry finish. This could be the moment I was completely sold on Weissbier.

A fabulous hefe...  really enjoyed this beer.  Pours a gorgeous golden color with appropriate haze.  The head on this one is perfect for a hefe...  pure white, foamy and long-lasting.  Aroma was clove and banana with that awesome touch of bubblegum-like notes.  Rolls across your palate with malty sweetness.  Truly a wonderful beer.

Pours a deep golden with large foamy head.  Swirled the bottle at the end to get the last bit, which left a slight cloudy, but proper look. A very good looking beer, but use a hefe glass to get the full effect.  Initial aroma of banana, giving way to some fruity malt. Flavor is fruity malt, with a hint of citrus. A very good hefe-weizen that¬ís pretty easy to locate. We paired this with the Brickskeller Carrot Ginger Curry Soup recipe from The Best of American Beer & Food and the match was delectable.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2008 500ml bottle.
Light cloudy orance, self-supporting head. Spicey aroma - hits towards zesty orange. Crisp refreshing mouthfeel, good carbonation. Soft light malts, sweet and slightly zingy. Caramel.
This seems to be the easiest German hefeweizen to find in my area and it is one of the better ones.  It seems to taste fresher than most.  Maybe it is brewed here?
Love this beer!  Poured a deep gold with a cloudy appearance.  This one went down very easily and had a nice banana flavored finish.
Good cloudy beer with a spicy fruity taste. I like it, I was actually expected a bit less then what I actually got from it. It is very smooth in the mouth and going down the throat. Very Nice!

Tap & bottle in Germany & US-  It is a very basic Hefe in my opinion.  It lends most of it¬ís aroma and taste to the yeast.  Very mild and not as strong bodied as other german Hefes.  But, VERY available and hits the spot for a reminiscent taste of Germany.
Favorite wheat beer by far - excellent flavor with a clean, almost sweet finish.  Try it on tap if you can find it.
8/22/07 - Dark gold, hazy w/ creamy head.  Smells of banana and a bit of clove.  Notes of banana w/ a bit of hops.  Good.  Nice hefe.
One of my favorite beers which I experienced for the first time in a small biergarten out side of Bremen Germany.
Flaske. Dejlig hvede√∏l. Duft af banan og en smule vanilie. Skummet har meget kraftig banansmag, og der er en ganske let bitterhed til slut i smagen. Dejlig.
My First Rating(bottle) banana, floral, golden, cloudy, medium sweetness, light body, creamy, average carbonation, great summer beer.
The best Import @ $2.00, hands down. Good color. Slight sweet finish. A summer sipper.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text: Pours a cloudy golden color with a white medium sized head.  Lots of carbonation.  Aroma is more bready than typical of the style.  However, th flavor is more what you would expect.  Clove and banana flavors are easily found but are somewhat muted.  Tartness, fruitiness,  and bitterness came late.  This was a nice hefe and I love that style.  However,  in my opinion it was not exceptional and the high rating by others is a surprise.
Bottle. Fresh banana aroma. Hazy yellow colour with a thick white head. Very bubbly but not much taste at all.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with an enormous white head of tiny bubbles. Aroma of wheat and clove. Flavor of wheat and fruit/banana, but kind of soft. I would like a little more peppery spice. Not bad but not the best Hefe that I have ever had.

(Bottle)  This was absolutely the best of the bottled imported German Hefeweizen that I have tried.  Aroma is very balanced, subtle.  Not sweet, not at all sour.  A sort of muted wheat taste, with some complexity.  Very enjoyable texture...crisp and clean, not heavy the way many wheat beers end up.  Somewhat dry tasting.  I really like it.

On tap @ Grand Central:
Poured a hazy burnished gold with a smallish white head. Spicy aroma with cloves upfront not much banana. Reasonable Hefe, easy to drink with some peppery notes, quick dry finish.
Opaque gold appearance; impressive head; spicy and sweet on the tongue; thick body; wheat evident; not my favorite type of beer to begin with, but this is a good example of a Hefe.
hazy golden amber in color.  A thick head full of banana.  Nice wheat body and fruity notes.  Small bit of clove and spice.

Poured a cloudy, hazy, slightly carbonated golden color, with rediculous head of 4 fingers.  The head retention was really good, and the lacing was well above average.  The aromas were strong of banana, clove, and wheat.  It tasted the same with a creamy wheat character, thick mouthfeel, fruity ester notes, and a quick vanilla snap.  Very nicely done

0.5L bottle from some bar along the Studio Walk at MGM Grand, Las Vegas.  Pour is a cloudy orange with a billowing slightly off white head.  Aroma of bread and a bit of sweetness.  Some spice and clove in their as well.  Taste is the full wheat body, slight spicy sweetness and more of the breadiness.  Nice.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2009 The aroma reminds me of simmering sweet corn or aged bread dough. I just love the look of this beer too, with its crisp white head that froths nicely and diminishes evenly. Its murky tan/orange is a great sign posting of what your about to drink. Zesty orange, apple cider, wine, bock, bread and beer. There is no down side to this Hefeweizen. Even the finish is tangy and sweet and leaves your yearning for another gulp. Franziskaner monks didn¬ít start out celibate, but if you had to chose between this beer and women......... tough one.

Re-Rate:::::
After a couple years of looking for a better beer I have concluded.....there is no better beer than Franz. 
PS: It¬ís better than sex.

Pours dark yellow/light orange, if you reserve the bottom inch of beer at the bottom of the bottle, and shake it around real good, it will break up the sediment at the bottom and make a nice cloudy brew.  The way I like it.  This has the best aromas of the German Hefe¬ís I¬íve been drinking.  It is very banana and wheat, sweet, like dessert.  The tast is not as strong as the others, but it has a nice sweet finish to it that lingers.  This is not a gulping beer, this is a sipping beer.  If I want a little more zing to a hefe, I¬íll go for a Schneider.  But really, all in all, I have about 5 types of hefe¬ís in my refrigerator, and I always run out of the Franziskaner¬ís first.  It¬ís the aroma, then the taste.

12 oz. bottle pours a cloudy pale amber color. Has a citrusy sweet, black pepper smell. Medium bodied with a refreshingly tart wheat malt flavor with a hint of parsley to boot. Finishes with a zesty wheat malt flavor in the throat.A very easy drinking brew. Nicely done.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: bottle: Deep golden color. Natural cloudiness, with yeast Crispy, refreshing, spicy and fruity. er, I mean, it¬ís slightly cloudy with a fluffy white head. I can see through this one a little easier than other examples in the style. The nose is strong of apples with good wheaty character and papery hops. The flavor is not as bold as I¬íd like, but this isn¬ít the most robust of styles. Even at that, this one is a tad watery.  Subtlety is displayed in the workings of the apple, wheat, bubblegum, and clove aspects. The finish is medium dry. This is a classic example of a hefeweizen with good reason, but my American taste buds would like to see a little more oomph.
Deep golden color. Natural cloudiness, with yeast Crispy, refreshing, spicy and fruity.

Pours with pure white head, and color is a cloudy and golden, nearly amber.  Aroma is bold and smells sweet.  Flavor is reminiscent of caramel with a light hint of apple, lingers masterfully.  Definitely a repeat purchase.
Looks and smells a bit like apple cider. Thick head upon first pour, but it diminishes into smaller version. Really sweet, very good. An excellent hefeweizen.

(bottle): Pours a huge foamy white head, very lasting. Clear pale golden yellow color. Belgian flowery aroma, sugary. Aroma of Light fruit, like pear or green grape. Not too strong, but enticing. Pear taste, malt, sugary clean aftertaste, watery. Light, some wheat. Light taste. Too watery for my taste.

1pt 9oz bottle.  Aroma is yeasty and malty, sweet banana nut bread with some spice.  Large white head that mostly diminished and left no lace.  Hazy yellow amber hue.  Flavor is classic wheat beer.  Fruity malts with a clean finish.  Palate is watery and lively.   Good example of the style.
this is a bit too fruity for our tastes... not the best ¬íchief¬í by a long shot even though the Spaten brewery makes some of the best lagers on the planet!

A solid Hefe. What makes this such a tight Hefe is the fact that the aroma, the flavor, and finish work together seamlessly. Crisp banana flavor with no lingering fruitiness. finishes very crisp and refreshing. Fruitiness is nice in summer beers, but only if the finish is clean.
I enjoyed this on the suggestion of a friend.  It¬ís not the best I have ever tried, but far from the worst.
Golden with a touch of haze.  Decent sized foamy head.  Aroma is wheaty and yeast with a touch of spice.  Some sweetness at the front before getting wheaty and slightly citrusy.
Had on tap.  Pours light cloudy gold with a big white head.  Mouth feel is very bubbly. Aroma is banana and a hint of spice. Flavor is smooth and quite good with banana and bread flavors dominating.

Ma√ü at Hippodrom on 9-28-07.   I was exited to find that they had more than one real beer (not radler or alcoholfrei), so I got a ma√ü for the veriety.   Not the best glass for a hefe, as the right glass makes a good hefe amazing to drink, but you don¬ít get less than a ma√ü at oktoberfest...   Cloudy light amber, small head.   Very nice yeasty banana aroma.   Crisp, fruity taste with plenty of hefe taste in there, low bitterness.   Good break from festbier.
This is part of a beer club. Had only one bottle but was decent for the price. Poured great and had a nice finish. Would do again.
It poors a nice creamy head. The aroma is full of yeast, banana and sweet. The flavor has yeast and banana too, but the banana is more diffucult to taste than it was to smell it in the aroma..
At one time, early in my drinking days, this was luxury to me. A German wheat! It¬ís still a fine beer. But I¬íve moved on as well. I guess that¬ís how I like my relationship with InBev beers.

Pours lovely warm golden colour with large creamy white head. Banana very much in evidence with an abundance of other spices and some yeast. The taste was quite crisp but soon softened to reveal more of that banana, yeastyiness wheat and spices, for such an easily accessible beer this is actually very good.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2008 Pors a very rewarding head. Golden in colour. Nice aroma of banana, cloves and some citrus. Very much a wheat beer with some nice bitterness in there. Good but not great owing to a simple pallette.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2008 Deep, almost amber orange color.  Poured a thick white head that stuck around until the bottom of the glass.  A tart, sweet, yeast and wheat smell.  Tastes pretty much like it smells, banana and cloves are distinguishable but not overwhelming.  Pretty carbonated but goes down great, very refreshing.. one of the better hefe¬ís.
Unclear, deep yellow. Tall white head. Sweet aroma with wheat and yeast. Mild flavour with more yeast, wheat and some underlying malty sweetness. Notes of tropical esters - bananas... Very drinkable.
12 oz. bottle.  very good wheat, but i still like paulaner and ayinger better. seemed to be a little sour on the finish.  drinkable.
The most drinkable Hefeweizen around. If you haven¬ít tried it and you like a real wheat beer... then your missing out!

Half-liter weizen draft at the York Tavern, HInsdale, IL. Hazy yellow turning to orange in the thick upper part of the glass, pillowy head up top. Set aside the lemon slice to pick up a nice weiss smell with some citrus clinging to it. Taste is exceptionally clean, light and refreshing. Usual banana esters stay low, perhaps because it¬ís served colder than it should be. But we do get more citrus notes, like lemon zest, and a spritz of wheat spiciness. Great to have from a well-kept draft keg.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2007 This beer really started my foray into the true beer world and for that I give it respect.
Had this poured from large bottle into Weizen glass in Aspen after a ski day. Healthy head.  Interesting orange look. Very spicy and wheaty aroma is the highlight here. Some banana and clove perhaps.  The spices and floral fragrances remain when drinking. Blend is not perfect, balance on the palate is a bit too light and washy with the mouthfeel. Not holding up to the great ones after having more at a later date, the depth is not there. But then it¬ís a hefe, not a stronge ale. Nonetheless a very good beer.
Pour: hazy golden orange. Head: creamy white. Aroma: earthy, wheat, yeasty. Flavor: wheat, yeasty. Palate: smooth Finish: wheat.

Bottle, 50 cl. Thx tot Leen.
Cloudy yellow-golden color with a nice white head. Aroma a bit sweet, wheat. Medium body. Taste is not as the Belgian whitebeers, this is sweet, very low spices, malts, little bitterness.
But it¬ís pretty en good drinkable.
A cloudy golden color with a white head. The smell is citrus wheat yeast and hints of hops. the taste is wheaty with notes of lemons, oranges, and floral. The finish clean and crisp.
such a fan of this, sweet citrus smell. generous head, love the cloudiness. Taste reminds me of bread and lemon, bubbly. glad this is easily obtainable.

"sweet and fruity taste with a touch of tartness. Crisp taste with a good smooth feel and finish. Nothing bitter about it. Great summer brew. I do love that cloudy look that wheat brews have- just looks like your getting something extra."

Pours a cloudy gold with a large head. Nose is of lemon with a tone of smoked wood. Taste is smooth with a hint of lemon that starts, disappears, and then returns in the end. I will say that the flavor seems to drop a bit too quickly - at least I think so. Feel is bubbly and calm. Very nice indeed.

Bottle.  Drank head-to-head against Paulaner, the two Munich hefeweizen giants.  This poured roughly the same blond and cloudy color but with a thinner head.  Aroma is not as intense as Paulaner and has more fruit intensity.  Flavor is much more mild and not nearly as yeasty (it tastes watered down compared to Paulaner).  Still a nice beer and very good standing alone I¬ím sure.  The finish is clean and crisp.  Overall, a very nice wheat but not as good as Paulaner Hefeweizen.
Large foffy head with hazy orange colour.Aroma of wheat and banana.Nice soft mouth feels a really tasty beer.

Nice standard german wheat. Cloudy amber pour with a thick white creamy head. The aroma was strong banana, light soury wheaty aroma, spicy, a bit sweet. Tastes similar smooth on the mouth, banana, spice, light sourness. Delicious hefeweizen.

12 oz. bottle. Powerful, classic hefeweizen aroma: Lemon, bubblegum, skittles, spices, chocolate chip cookies, banana bread. It doesn¬ít get much better. This is what a hefeweizen should smell like! Pours a hazy, cloudy, surprisingly deep gold. Small amount of suspended particulate. Large amount of frothy, cream-colored head. Flavor features green apple, lemonade, sugar candy sweetness, and a touch of light hoppy bitterness in the finish. Lively in the palate at first but settles down upon multiple sips. Soft. Light body. Very refreshing. Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier is more about the aroma and quenching of thirst than it is about the flavor, although the flavor is by no means unpleasant. This is one of the few beers that I recommend drinking relatively cold.

Draft at Brixx. A solid banana, citrus, and carmel nose. Pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Nice smooth feel and that classic banana flavor of a German hefe that does down really clean and leaves the mouth wanting more. Lovely summer beer or a sessionable brew all year long.

pours a cloudy straw color with a nice two finger fluffy off white head. aroma is wheat with banana and a little clove. flavor is the same as aroma but a bit stronger. has a light to medium body with good lacing and carbonation. has a nice creamy mouth feel a pretty good hefe all together.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2008 Personally I prefer Franziskaner over Ayinger. To date this is my favorite Hefe I have tried and I¬íve tried every Hefe I have available to me locally. 

I can¬ít but help put my nose to the lip of the glass as I pour. It¬ís just such a nice aroma.

Since its not a stout or porter I don¬ít really put much into the palate aspect.

EDITED: 01/01/08 I have to update this because I had the chance to drink this on draft. This was my favorite Hefe to begin with and the draft version just blew me away. The difference was outstanding. Everything was improved over the bottled versions Ive come to love. So Ill give everything at least an extra point.

Light golden cloudy color, white head.. Great wheat beer with no fruit flavor like you will find in many other wheats. Great warm weather beer. Aroma of banana and light yeast. Quenshing carbination. Really enjoyed this one.

Everything a Bavarian weiss should be - nice bit of spice, cloudy, yeasty and light with a healthy head on it. Came from a bottle so remembered to swirl around the last bit for the yeast on the bottom or you miss the spice!

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2009 One of my favorite German hefes.  Banana, clove, yeast, some citric notes playing rhythm.  Taste follows suit with a refreshing wheat tang playing well off the esters.  Perfect for those summer months.  Or breakfast.  Great mix of flavors and textures here.  Sure, American brewers represent well but these guys put it down.  
Hold the fruit please!
yello,golden color big pillowy head,clove,corriander,light spitzy nice flavor.i like this beer

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2011 Re-rate 5/19/11: Can sample at a blind Hefeweizens tasting. Cloudy golden with a nice white head. Aroma of banana and bubblegum. Sweet fruity mellow flavor. Medium-bodied. Nice. My 2nd place of the tasting. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Draught. Cloudy yellow with a stable off-white head. Aroma is fruity and wheaty with citrus, banana and some clove. Flavor is sweet, wheaty, yeasty and fruity. Light tartness. Medium-bodied. A very good Hefeweizen. 7/4/8/3/15=3.7

Bomber. Pours cloudy yellow, with a large pillowy white head. Aroma is banana, bubblegum, and a hint of cloves. Flavor is banana and sweetish grain up front, with cloves and other spices, a bit of tartness, and some hops in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel. A bit drier, tarter, and more hoppy than other beers in the style, but I don¬ít think it suffers from that, and it¬ís quite complex and well made.

Name: Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier
Date: 07/10/1997
Mode: Bottle

i to ii+
light yellow, frothy head, slight hop aroma, mild clove flavor, slight hint of citrus

Name: Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier

Words: Wild Wing Cafe
Words: Marietta

light clove aroma, bubblegum

hazy dark yellow, big creamy white head, light spicy clove and sweet banana aroma, light malt flavor, nice wheat character, just a touch of hefe esters, clean finish

big classic banana and clove flavor, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.3/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **+/4
