Cabbage and clove aroma. Dingy opaque golden color, thick white head. Very grainy with hints of baby food banana. Wheat and barley grains are dominant, although there may be oats as well. Baby food finish. Not a great weizen, but a fairly good beer. Anyone that likes dortmunder AND wheat styles will really enjoy it.

bottle.  metallic yellow with slight haze. thin foamy head with considerable lace. aroma is vanilla, light citrus and yeast - nice. flavor is tart banana.  carbonation is really well done.  rolls around on the palate.  crisp mouthfeel.  excellent.

Poured a light yellow color with a large white head. Has some lacing. Overall taste was wheat and alcohol. Some sour fruits and spices. Finished very nice. Carbonation was balanced perfectly with the alcohol.

Poured from a bottle. Nice head that sticks around for awhile. I love the aroma, banana and clove. Lighter in color, straw, maybe a little darker.  Very refreshing taste, though it leaves me wanting more. Not sure if thats good or bad. Definitely one of my favorite beers right now.

50oml bottle in weizen glass.  Pours cloudy pale orange with dense off-white head.  Mild aroma of fresh orange, mild clove, and faint bubblegum.   Very mild flavors of honey-orange with mild bitterness.  Very refreshing, if not very flavorful.  A little watery.

Beautiful hazy golden and a powerful towering head.  Inviting bananas, yeast and faint tree fruit nose.  All those scents became flavor throughout my mouth, even the roof!  Finishes clean and refreshing with some earthy yeast.
Bottle at the Falconer.  Hazy orange amber with a fizzy white head.  Banana bread aroma and taste with a sweet finish.

Draught, deep orange colour and extremly hazy, nice big head, aromas of honey and wax. complex fruits in the mouth, especially mango and passion friut intermingled with noticeable alcohol. long friuty finish with some sourness.  A wonderfully balanced beer and Probably the best beer i have drank of its kind up to now.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2009 Better with food than by itself.Golden color with a white head. Aroma of yeast, bananas, vanilla and clove. Filling and has a noticable effect of its alcohol for the style. Taste, much the same as the aroma. Overall, a good buy, but there are better weissbiers out there.

Not bad at all.  Pours out a ncie golden cloudy yellow color with a large white head.  aroma is citrusy and has alot of wheat notes thoughout.  flavor was very refreshing and crisp.  this is one of the better hefes that i have drank.  damn good beer.
A really delicious Weisse beer. Tastes better on tap then in the bottle but still great either way. Almost no bitternes very smooth

Pours cloudy pale yellow body with a large creamy white head that lasts a while.
Aroma mostly of spicy wheat and smaller tones of citrus, some banana is there to but not much.
Flavor of wheath and citrus wery large wheat notes.
Big banana tones in the aftertaste.
Palate is thin and smooth.

Picked up for the price ($1.79 for a bottle), very enjoyable hefe.  My only other experience with a hefeweizen was domestic, so it was interesting to try a German version.  If I¬ím ever searching for beers in this price range I would definitely not shy away from this.

Bottle from HEB. Pours a golden hazy color with a very good white head. Smells slighty spicy and yeasty. Tastes of slight clove, spice, malt, and yeast. No real taste of hops. Has a very smooth feel to it. Pretty good beer though not my usual style as this beer is very light as most hefe-weizens are in my book.

Bottle. Aroma is a candied rush of bananas foster, light honey and indiscriminate minerals. Pleasant. Pours a hazed honey gold, with a little opaline character and a silky soap of tracing white. Flavor is gentle and lightly sweet, with some more honey, a bit of bread crust, lots of faintly peppery spice and more pale fruits, sliding tropical. A bit thin. Leaves a nice wish of caramel and almonds on the backend. Nice lemony hop smack, very noble.

Pours hazy orange with a large dense off-white head.  The aroma has banana esters, rich wheat and light clove.  Medium body that has somewhat sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts with rich wheat, banana, clove and pepper.  The finish has more pepperiness and spice, then turns water.  This is an okay hefe that seems to be vastly overrated.

This is a damn tasty beer. The most standout flavor I found in the beer was vanilla. I¬íam really used to hoppy beers so this was a big change. Washes down nice with a sweet aftertaste. Not bad at about $2.50 a bottle. I tasted no fruit, I must have different taste than alot of these other people.
1pt bottle, pours a hazy golden straw color, wonderful aroma of banana and fruit, lovely taste of citrus and banana, good carbomation, overall a great hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy gold with a rocky white head.  Nice aroma of clove and white pepper as well as banana, apricot.  Phenols dominate the taste.  This beer reminded me how much German wheat and Belgians have in common.
Pours gold with a moderate head. Aroma is citrus and rather spicy. Flavors of banana, citrus, and spices. Moderate mouth feel.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with a billowing white head. Standard hefeweizen of bananas, cloves and citrus. Flavour was of bananas and spice. Mouthfeel was smooth with a touch of graininess.  Enjoyable.

Bottle from Germany. Slight reddy-golden hazy color. Aroma of tree-ripened banana and of spices, clove, sweet lemon rind. Hops come through in the flavour which begins a little sweet and finishes dry. Respectable Hefe.

on tap at Loreley NYC.  cloudy light yellow color, fluffy white head.  aroma of banana and faint clove, flavor is drier than the aroma.  a little grassy for a hefe, but also tangy wheat malt and a little dry citrus.  less banana in the flavor, and the clove is light also.  dryish finish.
Bottle.Hazy orange.White head.Smells of sweet bananas and light citrus.Light sweet and sour flavor.Spicy,crisp,yeasty.Good Hefe.
Light slightly fruity brew with a soft quality. Smooth with a great finish. A good example of a Hefeweizen.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2007 Great summer beer!  Hazy and wheaty in aroma and flavor, smells a little banana-y.  Not as thick as a lot of the wanna-be Hefes.  Re-rated 8/28/07, from the tap, in a Weizen glass: Sweeter than I remember, with the same banana aroma.  Actually got better as the glass warmed a little bit.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2008 A delicious hefeweizen. I just got into these in the summer, so I hate to see the summer coming to an end! Aroma was decent...yeast and heavy banana. Pour was a nice cloudy gold with a small one finger head of tiny white bubbles. Taste was nice and tart...a little thick...wih strong yeastiness  and banana notes. Great summer beer! Light and crisp.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Cerveja de tribo. √ìtima aparencia, colora√ß√£o fosta, laranja, muito bonita. Espuma densa, branca e presente. Cheiro frutado, banana. Densa, gosto frutado, levemente adocicada, refrescante. Gaseificada, com gosto forte e marcante.
Tap:  Pours hazy gold with a large cloudy white head.  Citrisy with a hint of sugary sweetness.  Very smooth finish to this one.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2008 Garrafa, em janeiro de 2008. Colora√ß√£o √¢mbar m√©dia. Creme branco/bege volumoso e persistente. No aroma, cravo, banana e especiarias. Aroma muito bom! Personalidade. Algo de tutti-frutti, suave. Drinkable.

Pours beautiful hazy golden with billowing white head.  Yeasty vanilla and banana aromas, with a light metallic touch and whispers of spice.  Wheaty bananas, vanilla, yeast and a nice clove finish, a great hefe.
pours strong, but still good from the bottle. crisp and refreshing, with a smooth aftertaste

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2008 Pours must darker than most hefes. An orange yellow color with a poofy white head. Smells somewhat sour. Intial taste I would equate to a new pair of rubber sneakers in the mouth. Additional samplings give me tastes of caramel honey vanilla and wheat. Actually decent after a few sips. Additional tasting notes. When a lemon was added some tastes of wild yeast/ funk were present. i found this to be very interesting.
bottle.  cloudy pour with great head.  wonderful aroma.  nice spice malt balance.  great brew.  this one has grown on me.

500ml Bottle 30/04/2007
Large white head. Golden coloured and hazy in appearance. Fruity aroma. Some sour fruit flavour. Crisp and dry creamy malt finish.
really bubbly and hard to get down quickly, but it tasted ok. not the best weiss bier i have had.

This beer pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head leaving some good lacing down the sides.  The aroma for this beer is not very strong, which I prefer a stronger aroma for a hefe.  But I can smell the bananas, and lemony zest.  The flavors are about the same;  not very pronounced for a hefe but better than most.  All in all this is a very well crafted beer, but it could use just a twinge more.  Cheers!

I¬íve never wanted nothin¬í more than Franziskaner.  So drinkable you could have a whole boot of it; so flavorful it¬ís like they cram a bunch of bananas into every bottle.  The flavors are concentrated, not overwhelming.  This beer has got it goin¬í on like Donkey Kong.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2008 naturalmente torbida schima importante profumi di lieviti banana e spezie note di cereli frumento fruttata leggermete acidula rifrescante forse un po troppo frizzante

Bright white head atop the cloudy orange gold body. Slightly sweet aroma with some yeast there too. Flavour is a little thin on the ground but there¬ís some fruitiness (banana, orange) and the taste is fresh and clean.

Draught. One finger dense creamy head. Unclear light orange/golden body. Initial aroma of ripe banana followed by scents of wheat, acidic fruits and spice. Fresh fruity and wheaty taste. Notes of yeast. Soft,  refreshing and easy to drink. A top end Hefeweizen
I guess I just don¬ít care for the "fruity", "sweet" taste. Not so bad I would dump it out, but probably won¬ít buy again. However, my father-in-law really enjoyed this hefe.

Canette de 500 ml rapport√©e d¬íEspagne par mes parents. Ar√¥me: Odeur d¬íagr√ªmes et de miel. Apparence: La couleur est orange p√¢le voil√©e avec une faible densit√© de bulle. Pr√©sence d¬íun moyen col mousseux et d¬íune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Go√ªt d¬íagrumes et d¬í√©pices. Dur√©e moyenne de l¬íarri√®re go√ªt. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture cr√©meuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Pr√©sence d¬í√©pices en arri√®re go√ªt. (Rating #1137)

Pours a cloudy golden bronze with a frothy well-lacing white head.  Aroma of sweet wheat and banana with some bready yeast.  Starts with good carbonation and fairly full, sweet malt and wheat character along with a light citrus and yeasty flavor toward a smooth, crisp clove finish.  A nice hefeweizen.
From tap pours hazy amber color with lots of head.  Nice wheat beer flavor with a refreshingly smooth aftertaste.

On tap at the Trenton Thunder game on 7/16/07.  Pours a very cloudy light brown color with a tight light beige head and minimal lacing.  The scnet was very esthery and fruity with wheat and malt coming through.  The taste is very dry and refreshing with hints of citrus, yeast, bananas and honey on the finish.
Aroma is clove, banana, and vanilla.  Taste is largely banana and vanilla with clove characteristics and a nice, slightly hoppy finish.  A wonderful hefeweizen.

1 pt bottle. Poured a unfiltered cloudy yellow-orange, head was white and quickly dissapeared. Aromas of clove and some soapy earthiness. Flavor is banana in the forefront, with light citrus and yeast bringing up the rear. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy and smooth. Finish is long with more banana, and a bit of a ponderous soapy aftertaste. A good, but not great, hefe.
great beer.  i thoroughly enjoyed the taste of this beer.  this one of my first beers to try so i was surprised at the taste.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2007 non malvagia, bevuta innumerevoli volte perch√© si trova in tutti i supermercati e spesso anche al pub. Ultimo assaggio ieri sera alla Pantera Rosa di Brescia (dove mi sembrava la proposta migliore, ed √® tutto dire).
On tap at Horst Gasthaus in Myrtle Beach. This is a good hefeweizen. Light but murky appearance. A spicy banana/yeast flavor.

Pale white head that is fairly large, dark golden color. Yeasty honey aroma with some citrus. Fruity flavors with a hint of some clove-like spiciness, bready. Some banana hiding in there too. Overall a nicely balanced and classic German beer.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2012 A beautiful orange-yellow hazy beer with a big and white head. Aroma of wheat, lots of sourness, banana and some spicyness.Taste of wheat and sourness, slightly bitter, quite lot of bananas and fruitesters, spices, some carnation. Lot of carbonation and it itches in the mouth, but still nice to drink. Refreshning, quite sour hefe.
I really enjoyed this beer.  It had a delicious lemon and honey flavor, with a medium body to it.  It was delicious!
citrusy and wheaty.  med carbontion kind of spicy too - overall a great beer.....
A classic german style wheat. Full of flavor. Available at our local german joint, student prince. Great summer beer.

If Consumer Reports rated quality beers, this would be considered a "best buy".  A great  Hefe-Weisse - a classic.  Pick up a bottle or two a week for less than $2.00.  This puts many premium priced beers of all styles to shame.  Yeasty, citrussy aroma, nicely carbonated, and very very smooth.  Some Hefe¬ís can be so tart or so sweet, they aren¬ít pleasant.  This one is very drinkable.  It is a thirst quencher.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Great hefe. Orangish color with big white head. Fruity, clovey, cloudy & spicy. Refreshing beer & well done
Excellent heffe! Pours a cloudy orange colour with a nice white head. Aroma of fruits, spices. Great flavor. Love it!
Great flavor, not a bad alcohol content and I can order it throughout the US and EU and expect the same great quality.
Poured from bottle into chalice glass.   Aroma of bananas and playdough.  Great flavor...bananas and cloves.
Cloudy, golden colour, big white head. Aromas of citrus, banana. Sweet flavours, with the right amount of bitterness. Good beer.
xxx gotta love heffes, fun to drink, fun to say.  this is the token introductory hefe, and a good one at that.

bottle.  large, white, creamy head (fully lasting) into cloudy dark yellow body.  aromas of yeast (bubble gum), spices, bread, and banana are all present in aroma.  flavor is on the light side-semi-sweet with hints of bitterness.  light body.  moderate legnth duration on finish.  pretty good hefe.
12oz bottle.  Pours like every other hefeweizen.  Aroma is banana, yeast, cloves, etc.  Taste is smooth, crisp, acidic.  Very standard for the style.  Good but nothing remarkable.
Big butter-white head, rocky. Yellow hazy body. Aroma is sweet, with notes of honey, papaya fruit, citrusy and  hoppy. Flavor is sweet, too, with some tartness.
Okay, so this isn¬ít the greatest Hefeweizen, but its not bad either.  Goes down fairly smooth with a bit of a banana bread like flavor.
This is pretty good.  Those monks can make a mean beer!  I like the flavor, and the aroma of it, very good indeed.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2007 This is one of my favorite Hefeweissbeer. The monks just know how to brew good beer! Traditional good old German beer. Cheers
Cloudy golden orange color.  Big white creamy head.  Some banana and citrus flavors. Musty, malty aromas. Very smooth.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 Lovely tight head. thick and foamy and lasting. Coudy orange appearance. Old banana smell/flavour. Yeasty/cloves ..and all the rest of the expected aromas are there. Nice mouthfeel indeed. Liked it to be bit darker but thats nitpicking. Nice on
On tap. Poured gold with white head. Aroma of citrus, nothing else. Taste was of citrus and sweet malt. Nothing really there.
UPDATED: APR 8, 2008 very easy to drink really nice appearence.  nice & smooth and perfect for a hot day.   good summertime beer

Berlin Trip beer No.18. On draft and drunk sitting in the Monbijou Park. Nice fluffy head that quickly dissapated (it was 31oC out!) Hazey honey-orange colour, very pretty. Loads of lemon zest and lime juice, corriander and yeast combined with malt sweetness. Short finish. I¬íd like to try the bottled version because on this tasting I prefered the kristall version. But still a good hefe.
Cloudy pale orange, thick foamy white head.  MIld banana-clove aroma.  Flavor is the same, with a bit of citrus--nice wheaty finish.  A bit too watery and weak though.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2007 Had this in Berlin at a nice little pub/cafe. Amazing flavor! I really recommend this! It went well with some currywurst too!
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour with a large off-white head. Aroma of bananas & a bit spicy. Light flavour, also here a bit spicy.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2008 Bottle and Can and all sizes. hehehehe... Nice dark golden color with a big creamy white head. Some notes of spicy banana aroma and not so bitter like others...
Portugu√™s:
Cerveja dourada com boa espuma e cremosa. Notas de banana bem marcantes n√£o √© t√£o amarga quanto as outras hefe-weiss.
cloudy orange, huge creamy head reducing to minimal, banana and spice, very light hops, malty, creamy feel
Bottle.  Cloudy orange-gold with a good head, nice lacing.  Smells of a bit of spice and fruit.  Decent taste but ends in entirely too much banana.  Good mouth feel.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2007 bottle.  Nice german hefe.  beautiful cloudy orange color with nice head.  Hint of nutmeg.  not watery or with a yeast flavor that over powers.  This is one of the most strong and consistent of the german hefes.  My wife likes it too.  I agree good for summer.
my god this is good.  I love it.  banana-esque, hits you with kind of mildish but distinctive. taste. just slides down your throat so smoothly, no bite, pleasant after-taste.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour, medium-sized head. Spicy banana aroma. Banana flavours, some yeastiness and clove. Finish is drier. A great beer for a hot summer day.

A great beer for summer to ease your thrist away. Please do a 2 part pour that includes a swrilling of the bottle on the 2nd pour to release yeast, flavor and aroma. Pours cloudy and murky gold...should see some yeast floating. Nice white head that stays somewhat. Smell of nutmeg and grain. Detect citrus, bubblegum and bannana. Finishes easy to smooth. Great mouthfeel. I¬íll have another!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2009 12 oz green bottle. Cloudy, burnt orange with a lasting, medium-sized head. Aroma is spicy banana and peppery lemon. Flavor is mild banana and prickly lemon grass. Aftertaste is bready yeast, wheat, pears and slight bubblegum. Palate is dryish, smooth and has fairly high carbonation. Excellent hefe.

sun gold and thin white head aroma of lemon hay green apple and a little basil and phenols thin body and spritzy, creamy vanilla lemon bread and some light herbs nice light bananas, refreshing well rounded and classic
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2008 Good beer. Not as spicy as some hefeweizens, but it had a much fuller body to it. Not watery at all. Yeasty, wheaty, and malty taste.

On tap. Thick foamy white head, cloudy pale golden color. Nose was of citrus, mixed berries, spices. Taste was of citrus, malt. Very yeasty, this yeast and thick froth give the bear a great mouthfeel. Very refreshing on a hot day. Definately a good hefeweiss by which to judge all others. I would recommend.

Pours a cloudy orange with a nice white head. Immediately you¬íll notice the sweet and sour balance and a citrus bananaesque yeasty taste. Lots of wheat as well, but it¬ís very sharp and refreshing like a hefe should be. I enjoyed this one, mostly because I was drinking it on a hot day!

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 This might be as basic as a hefe can be? A Warsteiner of hefeweizens. It¬ís yeasty, bananish and wheaty. Overall quite flat and lacks personality. Doesn¬ít really call for more. Re-rate: Not nearly as boring as I recalled. It¬ís a text book weizen alright, but a good one. Can¬ít go wrong with this one, no matter how basic it is.
Bottle at D√¶mningen - shared with Karen, Henning & Mette. Unclear orange - whie head. Elderflower, fruity, flowery, yeasty, banana, wheat, Medium cabonated.

Cloudy and yellow, as expected, with a head that lasts a bit and leaves some lacing. Sort of sweet and sour, but not overly so. Citrus, yeast,  and banana flavor notes. Not heavy or too carbonated, but not watered down either. It took me a minute to get past the bananas (a fruit I despise), but then that part ceased to stick out and I found this very enjoyable.

Light pale gold in color with a soft white head. Big sweet banana ester nose. Flavor is sweet banana throughout with a light wheat flavor and crisp finish. Good beer, but a bit on the sweet side, sometimes you get these and they are nice and crisp, sometimes, like this one, they feel a bit flatter.

Bottle: Pours cloudy yellow. Fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, spice, the usual hefeweizen suspects. Orangy flavor, with a strong hit of bitterness over the somewhat sour base. For me, the citrusy notes dominate. Very little sweetness. Maybe a vague hint of spice, but it was weak. Good smooth feel in the mouth, though.
A decent one, but there¬ís better out there.

Bottle 50cl. Poured a deep cloudy orange, with a good blooming white head. Pungent aroma of banana and cloves, vanilla and toffee. Quite sweet. Very tasty and refreshing, slightly bitter and quite sour flavour with hints of bubbl egum, wheat. Smooth full palate, slightly oily. All together an excellent hefe, tasty and refreshing. Recommended.

Bottle.  Aroma was bready.  Appearance: fizzy carbonation, very hazy gold, good head retention with very light lacing, light/med body.  There was a yeast bite in the finish, but the finish was short.  I found this beer was similar to Paulaner.

Excellent beer. Golden colout, foamy head. Smell is fruity and yeast predominant on the taste. Also caramel. A lot of citric yeast in the aftertaste with fresh spicy notes. A beer to drink at any  moment.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2008 A nice German hefeweizen. Very fruity. Had it on bottle as well as from draft. The smell af yeast and fruit makes this a little better then average

Oooh, I get the 1000th rating!  Nose of bubblegum & sawdust, pepper & spice.  Pours a sparkling cloudy pale honey with melon highlights.  The lovely cascade resolves into a fully lasting gigantic white creamy head that leaves fair lace.  The well balanced flavor is predominately grainy.  The light body is creamy & lively.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 while this isnt something to shit your pants over, it was quite good for a hefe and is one of the most popular ones in germany for a reason... much better than most of the stuff out there

Rated 1/13/06:  I was beginning to think that hefe¬ís were not for me, the previous few that I have had just didn¬ít do it for me. This one takes the cake so far. A beautiful deep yellow/orange color filled my glass with a constant head and adequate lacing. The carbonation is like the other hefe¬ís in that it is strong and constant. What stands out about the franziskaner is the aroma and flavor. My previous hefe¬ís were too sweet smelling and the banana taste was overpowering. This one melds a whole lot of spices and citrus flavors and rolls them into a well crafted wheat beer. I can¬ít say enough about the taste with this one very smooth and extemely refreshing, I¬ím glad I never gave up on hefe-weissbiers.

12oz bottle.  Aroma:  Lightly tart wheat malt, bready yeast, lots of banana, light bubblegum, lemon and clove.  Appearance:  Light honey in color and very hazy.  White head was full and foamy with good retention.  Good lacing.  Flavor:  Nice wheat malt up front with some light lemon.  Bready yeast, and some light clove and pepper.  Lots of banana and some light bubblegum.  Medium dry finish.   Palate:  Medium bodied.  Medium-high carbonation.  Overall:  A standard for the style and delicious to boot.

12 oz. bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow/orange with a pillowy white foam head.  Streaming bubbles.  Lots of yeast and wheat in the aroma, like half-baked bread dough.  Rich bready wheat malt and yeast flavors, with underlying citrus notes and what seems like a "dusting" of nutmeg over the top.  Full and smooth mouthfeel.  Nice. No lemon required.

Looks like a cloudy apple cider.  Light golden with a thick white head, seems stable.  The nose is rather wheaty.  Banana, some apple, a little tart lemon.  Rather creamy, nicely balanced.  This is perfectly mouthfilling in texture.  Creamy without an abundance of carbonation.  Perfectly appropriate for a session style.  The flavors are in line with the aroma, though perhaps more captivating.  An apple cider acidity balances an banana sweetness.  Slightly spicy lemon tartness, with some cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.  Really remarkably clean for the style, and quite enjoyable to me, who dislikes the style.  A tart lively finish with a lingering wheat acidity finish.  This really is rather good, not even just for the style

Pours hazy and orange colour with a big fluffy head and some sediment. Yeasty aroma has wheat, banana, citrusfruits. Mouthfeel is quite biting a first but softens when the beer gets a bit warmer. A very tasty weissbier indeed.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden with a one finger white head that lasts leaving good lacing. Aroma is very yeasty with notes of citrus, bananas, wheat, and light cloves. Taste is the same as aroma with a mild bitterness. A very refreshing and delicious Hefe.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2008 Bottle 50cl. A hazy orange beer with a nice, fairly big head. Very beautiful soft aromas of wheat, ripe fruits which include lemon, oranges, bananas, some cloves. Mildly spicy. Very nice nose indeed. Not much hops in the taste at all. The flavors are really dominated by the wheat. Impressive mouthfeel. An extremly refreshing beer. Good maltiness. A very enjoyable Hefeweizen with a slight spicy finish. Rerate: Some interesting hint of carrots (?!) in the taste.
Slightly metallic in scent with a hint of sweets, butter, malts.  Dark amber in colour with a consistent white head.  Tastes of sweet and spice, malty, metallic.  Not bad, not great overall.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2007 Aroma of clove. Orange in color. Flavor is clove clovey and mildly banana. Very carbonated probably due to pastuerization. Spicy on the palate. Very large head. Ends smooth.

Orange glow, letting some light through.  Dusty grass aroma with flashes of lemon.  Concentrated banana flavor with green apple.  Quite dry at first, with an odd, almost painful acetic flourish in the finish.  Still a quaffable refresher.

Just the perfect beer! If I had to come up with the prototypical Bavarian wheat beer, this would be it. From a bottle poured into a weitzen glass, beautiful hazy golden color, and yes those are chucks of yeast floating about, with a great four finger head. Smell is bannanas with a touch of citrus, where the taste is the reverse, with a nice dry tangy finish. As with all good hefe-weitzens, this goes down super-smooth and easily makes it a great session beer.
Hazy orange beer with big head with aromanotes of hospital, yeast, banana and an example of a good mainstream Hefe-Bier. Flavor is similar, but needs some to reach Maisels.
I thought Hougaarden white had it all, but this one is even better. And in 50 cl bottles too.

Sampled at two Eastern League (AA) baseball parks, 04/19 @ Trenton, NJ  & 04/21 @Reading, PA.   Also had both ways, with and without a lemon wedge.   Cloudy meduim body wheat beer with thick head and spice and citrus flavors.   Very easy to drink, this was a solid wheat that for reasons beyond me I have not drank in at least six years.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2008 A pretty good Hef, but not as good as other German Hefs that I have tried. It pours a nice thick gold color with an inch head or more. Tastes good citrusy, but just not smooth tasting. I liked it though.
Commercial description seems pretty accurate. Yeasty, sweet and sour, citric, smooth full mouthfeel with carbonation bite and some hop on the palate. Refreshing and very tasty.
In my opinion the best of all the wheat beers.  Pours a very nice orange\honey color.  Very domanant yeast taste.  Hints of citrus and a mild hop biterness.  A great beer!!!!!!!
Wheat has grown on me quite a bit in the last year. I really like this beer, but found that the dunkel is much better, it is actually very good.
Tasted 2007-03-29. Fresh bottle 50cl. Hazy, greyish yellow with big white head. Yeasty aroma of cloves and banana. Ditto taste. Like it!
12 oz. bottle at Zeno¬ís, Penn State.  Poured cloudy orangish/gold with fluffy white head.    Aroma consists of lemon, banana, and corny malt.  Flavor is fairly citrusy and sweet.

wheat is not my thing. still i drink this beer. looks, good aroma and nice body (i could say texture) the right kind or wheat doughy sweetish malt back attention is known to a really savy brewer. good when it¬ís sunny and cool.
Not a bad beer.  Huge, creamy white head.  Cloudy amber body.  Light to average malt.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2007 Bottle at Mahar¬ís - How fun!!  The label was on upside down, and it¬ís pretty tasty anyway you slice it!

Munich, Germany. 12 oz Bottle poured into a weizen glass. Instantly when poured you can smelly the yeasty, european hops. A Murky Honey Colour gave it a unique presence which I really enjoyed. The head was frothy and thick, the head full lasting down to the last sip. Unique fruity citrus taste and hops, a mild bitterness in the aftertaste. I really enjoyed this brew in munich.
Bottle. Claudy yellow colour with huge creamy white fully lasting head.  Yeasty aroma. Sweet flavor. Hints of honey and banana.

16.9oz bottle served in a Weizen. Pours a beautiful golden color, bubbles throughout. Huge, cloud like white head. Very nice. Aroma of yeast, bread, clove, banana. Smells fantastic. Fore of the tongue is sweet, slightly astringent. Thin to medium mouthfeel. Finishes with a nice yeasty note, with banana dominating. Also get some malt and clove in the finish. I thought the Paulaner was too sweet in the finish. This is just right. Very nice beer.
A great hefeweizen. Pours pale cloudy gold w/thick head.  Carbonated, w/typical hefe flavors and v. drinkable.
A hazy honey color with a large ,thick white head.  Typical aroma of cloves, bubblegum.  Taste is mildly sweet, fairly crisp, not to sweet.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Light aroma of cloves and yeast, with just a touch of banana.  Light, soft and somewhat watery body with moderate carbonation. Sweet taste of honey and fruit that finishes just a little sour. No idea how long this one has been on the shelf, but still a nice beer.

Poured a Huge White Head, then again I slammed it into a  hefe glass and it might have been a little warm. Nice Nose of Yeast and Malts. Some banana and spice, maybe nutmeg or caccis. Somewhat thin body and watery with light carbonation. Flavour is typical hefe but don¬ít get any banana or yeast flavours. Just smooth malts. If you want a Hefe lite this one will strike you fancy. CHEERS!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 Draught at Southwark Tavern. Cloudy gold with a thin white foam of head. Bubblegum/Juicyfruit aroma with notes of orange and yeast. Sweet with flavours of banana, orange and yeast. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2008 50cL bottle.  Poured a hazy, golden color with a short but stable white head.  Seemed a little more bitter than a hefe should be. A good hefe but there are certainly better hefes out there; still enjoyable though.

Bottle. Hazy pale golden, big fluffy white head. Very complex, spicy aroma, with yeast notes and fresh bananas, and with some subtle hops. Medium bodied with quite high carbonation. Very refreshing flavour with a pleasant acidity and some bitterness. Great hefeweissen.
Very disappointed...I needed something else to get the rotten banana taste out of my mouth.  Not pleasant at all.

A very smooth beer, it would be perfect with a light pastry dessert or at the beach.  It has undertones of pear and banana, and a soothing mouthfeel.  Excellent all around and definitely worth trying at least once.

(in can, 50 cl.).
The aroma is of wheat, with something of the malt. It spills a color lightly cloudily palely brown, almost a bronze. It is really thick, with a smooth and colored head (with a lot of duration). The flavor is to fruits. The hop is very subtle, you upset perceptibly. (The hop is in the depth, to support for a long time, the aroma and the flavor). It is a beer, which will return to be bought, always.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2008 Thick, frothy head, amber-orange color, fairly clear for a weizen beer, very faint citrus nose, very pleasant wheaty taste.
This is not my favorite weizenbier but is a very good one and since it is readily available here I buy it again and again.
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2010 Fresh but clovey aroma  The palate is rich yet evanescent.  Great herbal flavor.  If Hefeweizen is your style., then this is a great beer.
I am a huge Hefeweizen fan so keep that in mind.  Great beer overall - very smooth.
Not bad, nothing special, go for the dunkell instead. Pours a mid-golden color with a thick white head.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2009 Draft Paulie¬ís Pub and Grille- A cloudy orange with a good white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and wheat. Taste of banana,whet, citrus, and coriander. A great Hefe but not as good as Paulaner IMO.
Yellow and a little clearer than most hefes. Wheat flavours definitly, banana, lemon and clove, but not too pronounced. Very drinkable but wihtout being bland or boring.

Good Hefeweizen. Not as good as Paulaner. Pours a nice golden orangish/yellow. The funny thing about this beer is that when I bought it as the bottled picture it tasted nasty, but when I bought it in the six pack it was pretty good. I wish there was a bigger Hefeweizen following. This beer was decent. I am starting to enjoy Imperial Stouts more and more. The flavor was okay, Hefeweizens are becoming too carbonated and too thin for my taste, but for Hefes this has a thick taste to it. It had the taste of fruit, I would lean closer to lemons, or a sour orange if I had to choose a citrus flavor. Decent pour, the head settles quicker than other Hefes. Please God bless this planet with better Hefeweizens! Maybe my nose is messed up but I don¬ít smell any bananas!

Enjoyed at Kurt¬ís Steak House in Delafield, WI.  Pours a cloudy orange-yellow color with a generous white, long-lasting head.  Aroma is strong and pleasing to the end of the beer, with a sour yeastiness, spices, and a refreshing citrus edge.  Flavor profile matches.  Mouthfeel appropriate for style.  Quite enjoyable and most of my business party had been ¬íconverted¬í by the end of the event.

Pours a nice golden color, very cloudy, lots of foam.
Grainy aroma with some spice and fruit.
Fruity taste with nice malt. Hints of banana, clove, and citrus.
Mouthfeel was a little heavy for me.
Good, but not my favorite of the genre. Not my top pick for the style.
Very good aroma: Spicy, banana and citrus. Golden color with creamy head. The flavor is usual wheat beer. Light body.
Puors into a beatiful cloud, with a long lasting creamy head.  A meal in itself, refreshing and fulfilling.  Hints of citrus.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with lots of white head. Aroma of wheat and citrus. Taste is of yeast and citrus with some spices. Palate is somewhat thin but has some texture to it so it remains easily drinkable without being too watery. Overall a nice beer if your looking for something refreshing with a decent amount of flavor.
Spicy citrus flavor with strong banana and clove, a little watery This is a pretty good wei√ü, but not the best.

You have to be careful pouring this one, in his own glass it has a massive foam if you don¬ít take care. A golden very cloudy colour and lots of chunks ( that I like to pour when we talk about a non-filtered beer. Aroma of banana, peaches and maybe apples, and of course cloves. Velvety mouth, with the fruits and the clove again, and citruses notes with maybe some coriander. Very refreshing, medium to light body that make it easily drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Bottle & draft. Pours a deep, hazy orange body with thin white head. Nose is strong spice, soft citrus, yeast and sugars. Mouthfeel is medium bodied and super spicy with notes of bright spicy yeast, clove, orange peel, wheat and light fruity malts.

This is, in my mind, the standard by which other Hefeweizens are judged.  This beer is cloudy in color with abundant head.  Aroma is lots clove.  Flavor is additional spiciness.  I had this beer on tap last night, and have had it from the bottle many other times; I actually feel it is slightly better from the bottle (I like the bit of sediment in the bottom).  Mouthfeel is smooth.  All-in-all, quite good.
This was a no big deal kinda beer, I¬íve had better and worse beers than this one. The good thing is that its easy to get.
Keg was a clowdy yellow, where as bottle more orangy, with a nice fresh citrus nose. its a fairly typical wheat beer.

Cloudy yellow gold.  Good strong fruity hefeweisse aroma. Light body which is too light and watery.  No real flavor, the aroma comes through only slightly. Has a carbonated taste to it. Slight citrus and spice taste that isn¬ít enough to make up for its deficiencies. It is not bad but I wouldn¬ít get it again.
Bottle. Pours muddy dark yellow. Fine medium creamy white head. Aroma is sweet with a spicy banana edge. Flaour has lots of banana, with some peppery spicyness. Ends citric bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2007 From bottle. Spicy, wheat aroma. Cloudy orange colour, good white crisp head. Exciting texture of apricot and pears?, however lacks bite. A little spicy but weak overall. Enjoyed it a lot floating down the Rhine valley
Impressive for a hefeweizen!  Nice, thick white head that really lingers.  Cloudy. yellow-orange color with a yeasty aroma.  Taste has some bready yeast, fruit and a little spice.  Well-balanced.

By far one of my favorite beers. Sampled many times and always look forward to the thick head of the pour. It is properly two fingers of solid head that will last the entire drink. Golden straw color is tremendous and the flavor is amazing and goes down so smooth. One of the best hefes!

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2011 Bottle. A hazy/cloudy medium to dark blonde beer. with a huge, frothy/fizzy, fully lasting white head. The aroma is moderately malty and lightly yeasty, with notes of bread, lemon, clove, with a hint of pear and bubblegum. The flavour is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, average length finish with light bitterness. Rather nice for being a commercial beer, having a good, fruity nose and rather balanced. I still enjoy it from time to time.
I thought this was a great hefe.  On tap at Flying Saucer in San Antonio.  Yeasty flavor, lots of banana, nice thick head.  What¬ís not to love?
Great Hefe.  Well balanced - not too citrusy.  I loved the head which stayed around a while.  I will definitely try this one again.  I had it on draft, but pretty sure I can get it bottled as well.
Great looking beer that smells really fresh and crisp. Tasted the same, fresh bubblegum flavours all throughout with a nice whack of wheat to finish with on the aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2007 Smells spicy and yeasty.  pours a cloudy yellowish orange with a frothy white head that sticks around for a bit with some nice thick lacing.  After it warms a bit it tastes very fruity with lots of banana and clove.  Noticable carbonation without being too watery.  A nice easy drinker without being too wimpy.  I¬ím new to the style (only have had this and Widmer) and after having it again I can really appreciate its refreshing crispness.  great after a hard day¬ís work in the summer heat!
Moderate grain and light yeast aroma. Thinkish head and very cloudy. Taste is lest than you think from the aroma. Finishs with spicy flavor, allspice, coriander? Pleasing fizzy mouth feel.
Bottle. Poured a murky unfiltered color. Aroma is citrus like a belgian strong. Taste is sweet with a hop and malt finish.

Compared to other hefeweizens, this beer floats toward the top of the list. The only knock is that after three or four, your palate is shot and the beer begins to taste sour. I¬íve noticed this many times.
Copper translucent.  Estery aroma with evident banana.  Taste is creamy and tastes of banana and wheat malt.  Great balance, great beer.

First off, I want to say that I drink this beer all the time and enjoy it.  But, I don¬ít know if this has as much to do with it being a great beer, rather more to do with the fact that it is easy drinking and smooth.  The truth be told, this beer, like most Hefeweizen, is completely one-dimenional in taste: on the palate it is smooth and refreshing, and the finish is very easy to enjoy. But ¬ígreat-tasting¬í or original, not a chance.  The best compliment I can give this beer is that it is great during Oktoberfest when consumption is the name of the game, and drinking yourself silly is what everyone is doing.  However, if I am sitting down to have a nice beer in the evening this one would leave me wanting something more.  Anyway, enough rambling.  Enjoy, cheers.
Light, with a creamy banana flavor.  Very refreshing.  Bottle, cloudy pour.  Definitely up there as a favorite hefeweizens.

Bottle.  Cloudy orange pour, with an intially thick dense white head, which quickly thins to about 1 finger.  Note: great lacing.  Aromas are banana, pepper, clove, coriander, and some off metallic notes.  Taste is very refreshing.  Banana is the main flavor of the day, but also spices, apricot, very good.  Up there as one of my favorite hefeweizens I¬íve ever tasted.  I would like to see how this stacks up to Westaphaner.  Very good and nice session beer.

Draft.  Nice golden pour with a smooth banana, citrus, floral coriander blend.  There is nothing significantly impressive about this beer.  It is a reasonable brew and that¬ís about it.  Definitely a thirst quencher though.   That¬ís a good thing.

Strong clove aroma, followed by banana then citrus, slightly floral. Nice mouthfeel, maybe a tad thin for a hefe. Well balanced with a creamy banana finish. Easy to drink, great for those new to hefe¬ís. I love this one with spicy or salty food.
Light cloudy orange in color with nice white head.  Great fruit filled aroma and sweet fruity flavor. Light and easy to drink

Bottle... Great color. Aroma is not as bright as some Hef¬ís, but dont let that fool you. Great taste of Banana, Clove, Citrus, Creamy aftertaste. Nice carbonation and lacing. Really a great Heffe. I¬ím always able to find this at my local BevMo.

Pours a nice deep hazy golden color.  Aroma is very biscuity, and also shows banana, clove and some toffee.  Flavor is wonderfully balanced and very creamy.  A nice beer that I unfortunately had forgotten about.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: Bottle. Clowdy gold color. Thick creamy head that goes away after half the glass. Sweet aroma, fruity smell and aftertaste. Love the directions on how to pour on the back of the bottle!

Bottle. Hazy golden with a very nice beautiful creamy big fully lasting white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, some banana and cloves. Flavour is fresh and smooth, gooood yeast and wheat,  fruity with cloves, coriander and bananas. Very, very tasty wheat beer at its best!
Golden color.  Heavy thick foamy head beautiful pour.    Heavy banana!!!  Lovely citrus.  Very smooth creamy and light.  the banana is a wonderful flavor to play with.
This is nice a crisp, with great spice notes of vanilla, and nice fruit.  Bits of bananaworks well with the yeast and hops!  EXCELLENT!

Butterscotch and vanilla is the first thing that comes to mind.  Perfect aroma with an excellent fruity citrusy (banana and orange) taste with a great palate.  Great body, sweetness, head, lacing and flavor.  Exceptionally creamy with a nice butterscotch finish.  I was not expecting this taste from this beer.  I wish I could reproduce this one!  Fantastic.

Hazy yellow appearance with a very long lasting white head. Sweet fruity, yeasty aroma, with a sweet flavor of wheat. Hobs are hard to recognize. The carbonation seems abit over the top, almost hurts to take a big zip of this one. The malt comes through in the finish and changes the sensation from sweet to bitter.
Pours a Beautiful Hazy Golden Orange with a huge fluffy white head. Aromas of bannanas and some citrus fruits.  Great smooth palate. Great Beer

Cloudy yellow, massive thick merangue of a head. Terrific aromas of banana, vanilla biscuit, and a little bready yeast. All of this carries over onto the palate with a soft creamy mouthfeel. Delicious!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours Cloudy golden and heady. Lemon citrus aroma and flavor. Light and sweet. Good on a summer afternoon
Pours golden and hazy with a huge head.  Aroma is sour and floral.  Flavor is nicely malty with hints of wheat.  Finish is mild.  Enjoyable hefewizen.

Hate the gold, flaky wrapping.  Love the high quality beer. Probably like other beers (not sure) glad this is brewed in strict adherence to the Bavarian Purity Law of 1516.  Cloudy, citrusy - not strong at all.  Very, very easy to drink.  A bit too carbonated for me.

A classic hefeweizen. Dirty, yeasty and with banana and cloves apperant in both taste and aroma. It¬ís quite light in the wheat appartement, though. 
It¬ís a really nice beer, but does in no way compare to the really great hefeweizens.    A llittle too unexciting and mainstream...

On a hot day, I can¬ít think of a better beer.  In recent years, I¬íve had a hard time trying to find a great hefeweizen.  It seems like a lot of the craft brewers are making wheat beers with regular ale yeast.  They end up making a flavorless beer.  Franziskaner is a very flavorful beer with lots of banana and ester flavors.  This is a great beer.

500ml - I was expecting the typical big glass o¬íbanana and that strange glowing yellow liquid, but that was not the case here.  there was still some turbidity, but this was a hefe you could see through.  It also had a malty fullness you don¬ít find in the Summer weight hefes out there.  Still had the hefe spicy notes, and you could tell it was a wheat.  It was a fuller wheat.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2007  Delicious citrus, banana, and vanilla aroma. Deep cloudy golden color.  Large head which dissipates regularly.  Heavy sweetness with a light/medium body, and slick texture.  A very fruity wheat beer, but good nontheless.  I will definitly be buying more of this.

On tap at the Germany pavillion in Epcot. I was a little hesitant to try this beer because of the style. At the same time I haven¬ít tried many in the style so what the heck. Pours a cloudy orange color with a nice white head on top. Aroma is full of fruit, clove, wheat, and spice. Flavor is full of malts with a nice banana flavor lingering. A nice refreshing beer on a warm Florida afternoon. This beer wants me to try other beers in the style category.
Cloudy light orange pour......tons of white head on this one.  Plenty of fruity malts in the front end.  Spicy finish.
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2007 Bottle pours hazy gold. Almost fruity aroma. Very sweet, finish is good, but not remarkable. Overall, not a bad beer, but not great.

Bottle.  Cloudy orange.  Lighter head than expected for a wheat beer.  Lovely banana/citrus aroma and flavor.  Fizzy but normal for this type.  Banana cream flavors, more sweet than bitter.  Spaten¬ís hefe-weizen entry is excellent.  Would be a wonderful session beer any time of the year (thoroughly enjoyed mine in the dead of winter).
Pours a wonderful cloudy golden brownish color.  liquid bread.  great fresh taste, nice banna bread with cloves.  mass produced cheap liquid gold.  great finish, great beer for any season.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2007 16.9 oz bottle.  Cloudy golden color, chunky white head.  Aroma is of banana, spice, wheat.  Taste is extremely refreshing, bready but not in a bad way, fruity, crisp finish.  Hefes don¬ít get better than this.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 Staring into this glass is as hypnotic as watching the nitro bubbles in guinness.  The only difference is that this is tastier.  Had to call the wife to come and get me since the pub in town just got this on tap.  This makes getting haircuts and going to the store fun again.  A luciously smooth body that is sweet and then yeastily tart. I beer could give you a nice warm friendly hug, this is the one that does it.

I was surprised to find this in my parents garage.  The beer was poured from a green bottle.  I was worried it was going to be skunked.  Surprisingly it wasn¬ít.  It pours to a nicely hazy caramel colored body with a lasting fluffy white meringue head.  The aroma is nice with lots of crisp wheat, some interesting yeasts that remind me of New Glarus Copper Kettle or some of the Bells Wheat series.  Yeasty bananas with nice earthy caramels and spicy with some cloves.  The flavor is nicely wheaty with a clean finish.  Light bananas and cloves fill out the brew.  Good hefeweizen.  I¬ím surprised I¬íve never had this before.  Much nicer than Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse.  Moderate mouthfeel that¬ís well textured with lots of wheat and yeasts in it.  With my vague remembrance of New Glarus Solstice Weiss, it¬ís hard to say which is better.  Too bad I can¬ít do a side-by-side comparison.

Bottle. Pours cloudy pale gold/yellow with a fluffy white head, and some yeast floaties. The aroma is strong on mild fruits, yeast, bread, banana, and spiciness. The flavor is a bit lighter than I expected, but very nice with it¬ís bready spice, and crisp finish. Seeing that I drank this in the Winter, I think I will try it again in each season, it really seems like a beer that lends itself to warmer seasons.
Apricot and banana aroma but not as much in the delicious, powerful yeast, lemon and wheat flavor. Medium to light body. Crisp brew for summer.

Draft Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head.  Has a good fruity aroma and a thick texture.  Not as heavy as I would have thought.  Overall a very refreshing beer.  A touch sweet but not in a bad way.  Good finish and decent duration.
Aroma of fresh bread, banana and clove.  Cloudy golden color.  White head that dissapates quickly.  Tastes biscuity with some fruity tones.  Clove in the finish.  Good wheat.
This is my first beer love, and it will always hold a special place with me. It will always be one of my favorites.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2007 Bottle.  Nice aroma, banana evident.  Poured to an attractive cloudy orange.  Nice lacing on glass. Spicy, yet fruity taste. Good medium mouthfeel, not too thin, nor too thick.  I liked it a lot.  If you don¬ít like this, you probably don¬ít like this style of beer.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2007 Pronounced nose of banana, wheat, spice and apricot. Nice balance, medium body.

Cloudy golden-yellow with seemingly endless head consistency. Exceptional drinkability and near perfect balence. A very inviting summer beer that is also very refreshing. The quintessential germanic hefeweizen.

Hazy dull yellow, with a voluminous and long-lasting white head.

Exuberant aromas of peaches/apricots/other stone fruits, along with sweet pumpkin pie spices.  Mouthfilling and sweetly fruity, with a strong banana flavor.  Becomes rather watery later and goes down very innocuously, with the faintest (and I mean the faintest) hint of hop.

A classic sweet, satisfying quaff.  Almost too much fruitiness for regular drinking, but definitely an archetypal wheat beer.
Bottle. Pours a huge head with a active body. I¬íve always loved the look on this beer. Good crisp flavor that is smooth but mild. Decent flavor and mouthfeel.

From a bottle.  I was a bit disappointed with this beer.  It was almost like being light lager with pureed banana, but at least enough yeast-flavor came through.  Overall, there was nothing either spectacular nor offensive with the taste of this beer.  Nice for a change, but most of the time, I want something with a richer taste.

Bottle. Cloudy golden colour with and impressive massive head. Nice lacing on the glass. Defiantly the best Hefeweizen I have ever tasted so fare. Aroma is quit complex with some of the bouquet being wheat, banana, citrus, yeasty, apricot. Maybe some hint of spice in there as well. Very balanced with medium sweet flavour. Medium bodied with a medium sweet finish with some notes of bitterness that makes you want to take an extra sip. Well amazed by this Hefe!
Bottle.  Pours a golden color with a decent head, and some lacing.  Not a strong citrusy flavor like some other hefe¬ís, but a nice flavor, maybe a touch of banana.  Not bad at all.
poured from a bottle.  nice creamy head, small bubbles.  wheaty a bit of banana.  not as citris-y as some other hefes I¬íve had.  I think it is a decent beer but I¬íve had better.

On tap at Bavarian Bier Cafe, Sydney. Best of the Franziskaners... confused as to why I hadn¬ít yet tried this one, but my rating say i haven¬ít, so there you go. Thought it just tasted better on tap than bottled, but i must have just been thinking of the kristall. Anyways, a damn fine wheat beer.

Bottled - bought in the City Liquors, Breck.  I found this surprisingly light in both aroma and flavor overall, but then again its the first proper hefe i¬íve had in a while. I¬íve been sessioning lots of American IIPA¬ís lately, which may have affected my taste buds slightly. Pours like a typical hefe. A bit of apple, banana and spice with plenty of wheatiness on the nose.  Not a lot of flavor really - lots of wheat and banana again. Palate is OK but perhaps a touch thin. Very refreshing. A nice hefe but far from the best.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2007 This German miracle have I found in one of Top French hypermarkets in Poland.  Aroma of strong yeast and unripe apple.banana Franziskaner has seduced me with its full rounded taste od wheat and yeast, perfect head and nothing but nice and pleasant aftertaste. More of wiesebier in poland will probably make me change my rate. But for now I keep the franziskaner bottle on the top shelf of my beer bottles collection.It¬ís like an ideal of Hefeweizen

Green bottle.

Pours cloudy gold with a huge lumpy cream-colored head. The aroma offers lovely fruity esters -- banana, passionfruit, lemon, nicely spiced -- but the flavor comes through too hard on the overripe banana for my personal liking, a bit buttery and the finish could have a bit more snap to it. The mouthfeel isn¬ít anything particularly special, and I¬ím left feeling rather ambivalent about this one.
This was a kind of strange one for me, It looked great, It smelled good too, but after that it left me hanging, Don¬ít get me wrong , a good one of its style for sure..but..good on tap!

Bottle.
Hazy yellow coloured with a white ehad.
Aroma of bananas, fruits and spices.
Flavour of bananas, fruits and spices.
had it on tap in wisconsin dells. wow! This hef is complex, aromatic, fruity and very memorable. prost.
This is a great beer with a true Bavarian Hefeweizen style.  Great flavor and very rich!

Bottled, 500ml. Light orange gold with big white head. Herby aroma this is a sweetish citric spicy beer, rather heavily flavoured with notes of thyme and a peely grapefruit. A little harsh on the tongue, finishes with fruit.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2007 Bottle. Nice orangy color with a creamy head thait stays. Spicy, citrus taste. To me, this runs a very close second to Paulaner weissbier. This is a really good, refreshing beer.
"Der bayerische Hochgenuss." Try it and see why.

Bottled. I had not had this in awhile, it is a very good German Hefe. Good refreshing beer with some spice and banana and vanilla overtones. Some don¬ít approve of the Lemon wedge in a Hefe, I happen to like it, really adds to the refreshing vibe of this beer.

Got this beer in Italy, because there are no better beers in Italy. A quality white beer that is darker than many other white beers. Definately has that white beer taste, but it is sure good about it. It is really convenient that they have this stuff in Italy and America, where it outclasses many other beers.

Pours a hazy but brilliant orange color. Beautiful white creamy head. It shows good retention and leaves a nice lacing.
Aroma is wonderful, malty, fruity and hoppy. Rich and complex with notes of banana, orange and vanilla. Hints of wheat, pineapple, tropical fruits. Powerful and fantastic.
Sweet fruity and balanced with hoppy layers. Lots of banana, vanilla, apples and tropical fruits. I never tried such a tasty Hefe before.
Medium body and carbonation. Oily texture. Medium lasting finish. Long fruity and semi-alcoholic aftertaste. A wonderful brew. I¬ím impressed. 
Bought in Mendoza, Argentina
Bottle shared with <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-31163.htm&g and <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-35128.htm&g />
An excellent weissbier - typical aroma of banana and yeast; cloudy gold colour with a white head; smooth fruity body, with banan and vanilla, not overpowering; clean aftertaste.

Bought @ Steilacoom Wine and Brew. On Tap. This beer is so subtle, yet so flavorful and unique. Lots of German Hefe-Weizens start out like this... Banana on the nose with some yeasty notes then on the palate a smooth, mildly carbonated, lactic, banana, spice beer that just hits the spot! This one is just a little different than some others. A great beer after a hard days work!
It¬ís a tasty, little banana-tasting beer with glorious appearance with a beautiful white head. Incredibly tasty! Could be a little less oily...
Second best hefeweizen after Paulaner. Overall excellent.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2009 This is the beer that got me into beers as a hobby.  It showed me that there is something more than Bud, or Becks (when it comes to imports).  Now, years later since it¬ís been introduced to me, my sophistication for beers has changed a lot, and even though I find myself drinking wheat beers less and less, this one I¬íll purchase every once in awhile.  Amazing all around taste and very full bodied, with a strong spicy citrus flavor, and some hops to finish the job.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2006 1pt .9oz bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into weizen - Pours cloudy gold with a red orange tint with a HUGE white head that fizzles out pretty quickly; Malt, banana, yeast, some citrus to the nose; Banana, a little spice, and some wheat on the initial taste; Yeast, light citrus, and some wheat on a fairly sweet and watery backtaste; Little carbonation can be felt or seen. It¬ís almost flat; Not like most German hefes I¬íve tried, but not bad by any means. A little too watery to be a really good hefe in my book. They got the taste and aroma right though. Interestingly the yeast at the bottom didn¬ít really suspend that well even with my patented "slam the bottle down to get the stuff to suspend in the beer" technique.
A pale cloudy Hefe weisse beer.  Sweet, but very tasty and refreshing.  A very good German ale

Bottle. Head was thick off-white and long lasting. Color was golden and the ber is cloudy as Weiss beer is.

The initial taste was a little citric and the fruity with some sweetnes. Aftertaste primarily fruity.

This beer have a light body, lively carbonation. This is a perfect and well tasting thirsteliminator!

bottle at Bohemien Crystal restaurant Westmont Illinois. This place was OLD SCHOOL! Great food...oh yeah, the beer. orange, hazy and nice white rocky tight head. aroma was was mild banana and earthy with a hint of pine. starts sweet and slightly smooth candied fruit and light wheat bread then  more earthy and mild  spice. finishes balnanced and dry.
Bottle. Hazy orange body with a big white head. Malty aroma with hints of banana. Flavour is sweet banana and wheat.
About the best beer that most people are willing to drink, this is a safe standby at many crappy bars. Aroma is citrusy spicy, and effervescent.  Taste is same, and has a hint of yeastiness.
Bottle. Orange colour with a white head. Aroma is banana, citrus, spices, yeast. Flavour is banana,citrus, spices, yeast, wheat.
Excelent beer. Pours well in the glass. Nice color and flavor. Just enough citrus to be noticable.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Friendly yeast aroma with a hint of orange lemon citrus. Beautiful carbonation in my three stooges glass, the whole brew appeared fluffy. Initial slight bitter bite, but no apparent bitter aftertaste on the finish.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Typical hefeweizen.  Hazy orange body, medium off-white head.  Banana aroma.  Banana flavour.  Tart and thick don¬ít go together as nicely as you might think.

Huge, light-yellow dense head over pale orange beer with a mossy shine. Lots of banana- and other fruity esters, a bit soapy. Place for surprise in the taste: apart, and in fact dominating the banana/citrus flavours, there¬ís a wry, nearly bitter overlying flavour. Maybe a bit walnutpeel-like, but nowhere that intense. Warming up, converting to more usual flavours with a marked wheat presence. Wheat slickness, medium bodied. Not really bad, in a sort of indifferent way. I might have accorded another point, weren¬ít it for the can it came out of. The day that Burgundy fills cans with  Roman√©e Conti , I¬íll accept cans.

Pours very cloudy orangy/yellow with a very thick bubbly white head. Strong aromas of clove, banana, yeast, and some other spices. Flavor is a little off: very yeasty, spicy, hint of banana and some other fruit, and fairly metallic. Lots of carbonation, too much. Palate is medium, slightly fruity and spicy, but mostly metallic and yeast. Carbonation hides the flavor too much, and it¬ís way too metallic. Not a bad brew, but not very good either.

Drank with Stegosaurus. Pours a hazy orange with a decent white head(head retention was good) Strong aroma of citrus and whet. Flavor was a bit this for my taste. Not a bad hefe but I had much better in Weihenstephaner and Hacker schor.

Medium gold color. Large head. Aroma is malty with a hint of bananas. This is a nice medium bodied weiss beer. Malty and wheaty, slightly sweet. Mild banana and clove flavor. Soft and slightly spicy. Good brew.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a large nice looking white head. Banana and citrus aroma. Nice clean palate, smooth. Nice sweet flavor. Very good.

1 pint, 9 fl oz bottle found at Lou¬ís in Augusta.  Rather uniformly murky  yellow body with a five or six finger thick off-white head that dissipates a bit more quickly than expected, but not completely by any means.  Head retention is better than average.  Smells overwelmingly citrussy with hints of banana.   Banana and citrus dominate the taste.  A bit more spicy than most hefeweizens...  Nice full-bodied beer.  Very tasty and pleasant.  Best Hefeweizen I¬íve ever had by leaps and bounds. And 2.19$ per bottle, it¬ís a steal.
Tap. Pours cloudy yellow with a nice head. Lost of banana and fruit aroams. Flavors of yeast, grapefruit and more banana. Very well done, nice body and just the right amount of carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a nice light yellow with a really good foamy head. Scents of cinnamon, yeast and wheat. VERY effervescent, very light, on the lines of a brut champagne. Very light mouthfeel, with some clove midway through the taste. Some light sugary sweetness.

Hazy straw colored pour with a 2 finger, effervescent white head.  Strong bannana clove aroma w/ hints of honey and some yeastiness.  Big sweet bannana clove flavor up front w/ a refreshing dry wheat finish.  Medium, sticky body.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2007 This is a GREAT beer.  Paulaner has a very similar hefe, which I silghtly prefer for its slightly stronger banana and weaker lemon tones.  Nice cloves, smoothness, drinkability, refreshing.  I¬íd take either hefe any day, though best in Summer.
Had this in Nelson Bay.  Don¬ít know if it was the setting but his was a wonderfully balanced satisfying wheat beer for a Sunday afternoon.  A benchmark in drinkable simple beers.

On tap - plastic cup.  The poor serving probably skewed my opinion towards the negative, so I tried to think back to previous Franziskaners from years past.  Nice Hefe look with pleasant wheaty aroma.  Taste was OK - smooth and sweet.  I will have to try again with a bottled version.
On tap at Mt. Angel octoberfest. Pours a golden hazy color. Spicey bananna wheat nose. Medium bodied. Well carboated. Nice wheat finish.
On Tap at Flying Pie Boise. Pours out a hazy yellow topped with a tall white head. This was a GREAT hef. very sweat.

A wonderful German wheat beer with the perfect blend of yeast and wheaty flavors with a very fruity aroma. The dark version is much better in the falovor category but this is still a wonderful beer. Even my non-adventourous wife will savor every drop. The perfect weiss to use as a benchmark when learning to appreciate this category.
Bottle. Hazy golden with typical enormous white, wheat head (does marijuana beers come with a "pot" head?). Banana, wheat and yeast in aroma. Sweet, malty, yeasty flavour. Not bad...

Pale yellow, hazy pour with huge, frothy white head. I thought this was a solid hefe. Sweet, yeasty, wheaty, fruity nose that is dominated by banana esters. The flavor hit on coriander, allspice and sweet fruits, especially banana. Slight lemon flavor. Medium body, lively carbonation, short finish.
Definately my favorite Hefe. Offers (to me) a perfect blend between the citrus and yeast notes. Some subtle lemon or banana flavors going on too.
I¬íll be short.  This is my go-to hefe.  It¬ís regularly $1.99 at my local Vons, which is a-ok by me.  No, it¬ís not the best Hefe, but it¬ís damn good, especially for the price.  Widely available.
Aroma of yeast and citrus. Hazy light orange color with bubbly white head. Yeast, light malt and some citrus - arguably lemon. Quite tastey.

Cold 16.9oz bottle:  Pours a cloudy yellowish orange with small ivory head. Some chunks which settled to to the bottom of the class. Aroma is of sharp yeast with notes of banana and citrus.  Taste is mainly of yeast, sweet malt and lemony ending.

Bottle (500ml).  In my Erdinger hehe glass.  Poured cloudy ight orange with a huge foamy lasting white head - very nice.  Decent aroma - banana, apple, spice, grain and yeast, a little wheaty.  Taste is solid - right on after the nose, plenty of candyish malt, fruit (banana big time), lemon, sweet spices (cloves) and yeasty - not a weak flavour, but it finishes apple-sweet, somewhat dry, and quickly.  Average hefe body, nice an syrupy mouthfeel, just enough carbonation, very light and quenching - decent, if light hefe.
12oz bottle pours yellow golden and slightly hazy with a thick white head.  A nice yeasty wheaty aroma with malty wheaty flavors a little banana and cloves.  A rather crisp finish.

Bottle. Admittedly my first "hefe" and I may need to sample more variety before deciding I don¬ít really like the stuff. The flavor didn¬ít live up to the promise of the aroma and appearance; sour and metallic.

cloudy gold with a large creamy head.  grainy banana and spice aroma.  sharply carbonated mouthfeel.  i notice the usual banana but also some tropical fruit flavors(pineapple?)  a sweet fruity hefe.  slightly thinner body than some.  good but not my favorite.
Bottle. Nice big head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma is yeast and malt. Taste is yeast and malt as but with some fruit added.
Bottle.  Poured a light copper with a thin off-white head.  A pleasant sweet aroma.  A nutty malt upfront before a rather underwhelming finish.   Thin and watery finish.

500ml bottle - Pours up a  light, cloudy orange-yellow with a big head that soon fades to a thin, lingering froth.  It smells of yeast and citrus.  The flavor is sweet with quite noticeable citrus notes.  The body is a little thin, but not bad.  I didn¬ít detect very much hops.  The finish is light and refreshing.  This is a very tastey example of a hefeweizen.

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/large,
Head/Color-white,
Head/Longevity-ful diminishing, Body/Hue-cloudy,
Palate Body/light
This hefe is a classic example of european brewing. My only complaint is that it begins to become too aromatic after drinking a couple.

This hefe sadly a letdown.  For what you get at the average price it¬ís completly unjustified.  A much cheaper Hefeweizen can do the trick.  Mine not served with orange.  The flavor is very low carbonation, fairly light and watery flavor, a very unlasting finish.

Bottle. Unclear, slightly hazy orange beer with a nice white head. Banana, spice, slightly lemony aroma with hints of yeast and cellar. Sparkling, medium to thin mouthfeel and a flavor with banana, cloves, some yeast and citrus. Nice and refreshing with some bitterness in the finish.

Bottle - pours a very hazy yellowish orange..  Aroma is citrusy with yeast and  hints of bananas ....Now the flavor is another story .. tastes very bland for a hefe , but tolerable   the problem is its WATERY!   and it ruined the experience for me.... not a good beer IMO
Bottle at home. A tangy white beer. It was pretty bitter and had no kick at the end. Not a fan of white beers so unimpressed.
Bottle 0,5l. Golden almost yellow colour. A large white head. Did not find any distiction: A standard german weissbier, but found it rather watery.
500ml bottle shared with Finn. Pillow head. Pale yellow body. Aroma of coriander and wheat. Sweet banana flavour. Diluted and dull.

I¬íve had this in bottles, but most recently I had it on draught.  Light orange and cloudy in appearance, not too much carbonation.  This beer has good sweet and almost spicy flavor to it.  Aroma and flavor is wheat, banana, and citrus.  The draught version seems more spicy or something and seems to have a less hoppy flavor.  This is a great hefe that I always enjoy drinking when I find it on draught.

22 oz draught, $5.75 at the Winking Lizard Tavern (Crosswoods).

Bottle. Tasted like a banana milkshake with an orange twist.  Good mild wheat.  Flavors do not overpower between light sweetness and light bitterness.  Good lasting head, amber color, lively medium body.  Very refreshing and smooth, but very mild.

This Hefe is on the high-end of average.   Had on tap in .5 l weizen glass.  Nice hazy look, with nice mound on top.  Solid Hefe flacors - some yeast, some citrus, a little banana perhaps.  Nice wheat nose, solid mouthfeel.

Sorry - Not a big wheat beer fan. I like hops way too much to be able to rate a wheat very highly. Dispite this personal deficiency, the Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse is very drinkable. It¬ís like drinking a nice cheese - it really has a food quality with a solid mouth presence. Forget the cloudy, disappearing head appearance. This beer, all 1/2 liter will supply a pleasant, well-balanced drinking experience on a warm day.
Draft.  Hazy orange color, with white head.  Wheat flavor, wheat aroma.  A little too dry for my tastes, but then again I made the mistake of drinking it on a resturant patio on a Virginia summer.

From 12 oz bottle.

Pours a hazy pale gold with an enormous frothy ivory head. Smells of lemon and clove. Faint banana, faint skunk (I assume from the green bottle).

Sweet wheat malt. More pronounced banana here, less clove and lemon. Smooth creamy mouth. Clove in the finish. Tasty and goes down easy. One of my summer favorites.

Pours orange with white head. The foam doesn¬ít lace the glass particularly well. The beer is a little cloudy. The aroma is largely of wheat - very doughy smell.The flavor is very wheaty. The phenols from the yeast and the overall flavor is a little mild compared to some other authentic hefeweizen, but still a tasty beer. It tastes like bready wheat, with just enough hops to balance. The mouthfeel is a little thin (thanks to a lot of carbonation zip) and little dry.  I think I would order a Paulaner or Wiehenstephaner hefeweizen first though.
Bottle.  Cloudy orange with a giant white foamy head.  Standard hefe things going on with banana, citrus, and clove.  Solid summer brew.

Had this on tap at Taco Mac.  Nice dense head with great lacing.  Aroma is heavier on clove than some other hefe¬ís.  It also had a little more of a hint of hope/citrusy.  Taste had a little more of a bit than some others and more of malt presence.  Definitley a decent hefe, but not quite as good as some others.
12 oz bottle.A slight hazy light golden orange with anice white head.The aroma of citus,banana,and malt.Tastes of spice and banana,clove and well balnced leaves you wanting more.

Bottled. Unclear, slightly hazy orange beer with a nice white head. Banana, spice, slightly lemony aroma with hints of yeast and cellar. Sparkling, medium to thin mouthfeel and a flavor with banana, cloves, some yeast and citrus. Nice and refreshing with some bitterness in the finish. Like it. Goes very well with summer heat. (060724)
06 State College Brew Expo.  Pours a hazy milky golden with a white fluffy head.  Aroma of banana, citrus and wheat.  Flavors of the same with more of the yeast in the flavor.  Very solid Hefeweizen.
500 ml bottle.  Cloudy orange color.  Thick head.  Good carbonation.  Caramel aroma.  Nice coriander taste.  A bit like Hoeegarden white.  Nice beer.

Hermosa corona, como para tomarle foto, precioso color oro a la vista, olor agradable y sabor bastante bueno. Va bien con un piqueo salado, para matar la sed, para refrescarse, para relajarse...buena cerveza!

fine fluffy white head, cloudy, light in colour, strong aroma of banana on the nose. very dry on the palate which i like a lot, kind of tingles. tastes almost bread like and a very strong banana finish wheaty and a good sharp bite at the end

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2010 Rerated for BJCP program practice. 7.5.8.5.16=4.1

Picked up a few bottles for cultivating a yeast sample for a hefeweizen.  Slightly cloudy, golden yellow.  Large, fluffy head with long retention.  Wheaty, citrus, malty in the nose.  Crisp on the tongue, with straightforward wheat and bread.  Mineral and banana notes in a medium finish. 
8.4.7.3.15=3.7
One of the better Hefeweizens I¬íve tried, with a nice, cloudy yellow-brown color and complex flavors to boot.
Aroma is refreshing with an orange color.  A smooth taste with a little spice (cloves).  One of my favorites!

Dingy orange color with foamy white head.  Aromas are a bit metallic at first (like a Becks or Heineken), but wheat/yeast comes through strong as time goes on as does a slightly spicey air of cloves.  Flavor is light and cloves and yeast come through strong as does a bit of a lemon/grass undercurrent.  Subtle, yet complex.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle, 50cl. This one is a classic! Clear brown and hazy with a huge (and i really mean huge!) tan head, mostly lasting. The aroma is really pleasant with notes of wheat and yeast. The flavour is very light and dominated by wheat and yeast, almost with no hops. Crispy and refreshing. A true reference for all other Hefeweizens.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 (Bottle BBE 05/2008) Banana, yeast and wheat-like aroma. Yellow brown colour, hazy/murky (sedimentation in the bottle) and white, large head with fair lacing. Banana, lemon, acidic, slightly soar and yeasty flavour. Lively carbonated, slightly sticky and medium to full-bodied palate. One of my favourite Weizenbiers. 02/07/07
Great wheat beer.  Fine head of foam and mildly phenolic.  Hints at banana and clove.  Very refreshing.
This is a phenominal hefeweizen. My favorite of this style by far. It has a very large and froathy head of foam.
5 dl can. Hazy orange with a huge thick head. Taste of malt, lemon and hint of banana. Very good for the low price. A bit too light for my taste, but an enjoyable drink nonetheless!
hazy orange with fine white head. Aroma of yeast & citrus. Taste of wheat & malts and has an easy sweetness.Good, especielly in 40 degrees. Fine fresh finish!

Slightly cloudy golden color with nice white head. Wheat, sweet malt and a bit of yeast for the aroma. The taste is overall a bit too sweet for me. The grain malt and wheat isn¬ít strong enough to balance the sweetness. Still, no off flavors, smooth drinking summer time brew.

Pours a cloudy golden with white head (consistant). Yeasty and fruity aroma. Crisp and refeshing taste which is balanced with a yeastyness and fruity flavors (bananas). Tingly refreshnig texture. Nice hefe weiss.

Mildly sweet aroma with a thick white head.  The color is a cloudy yellow-orange that is normally associated with hefe-beers.  The sweet aroma continues to the taste which adds a bit of fruit.  not bad at all.

Cloudy butterscotch yellow  with a giant pillowy head.  A powerful aroma of wheat and fruits.  A real rich and full flavor of spices, clove, fruits, and grainy wheat.  The spice lingers.  A high quality weizen and i drink this style often.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy light gold.  Head is white and creamy with very fine bubbles...lasting.    Aroma has a very good balance between banana and clove, with some wheat sweetness in the background.  Body is medium light, with some residual sweetness in the finish.  Flavor has a lot of banana, as expected, but it¬ís not overpowering.  Clove is there, but not the main flavor.  There¬ís a nice tartness in the finish from the wheat.  Overall, a very nice beer....certainly pegs the style.
Poured pale golden.  Failry light aroma.  Light and refreshing Wheat beer.  Not a very clear pour very prominent haze to it,

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2006 Hazy apricot-orange with a billowy, ice cream cone head. Juicy banana sweetness with a cleansing wheaty sourness. Great clumps of yeasty sediment like dissolving aspirin. Seductive clove-banana aroma. Quenching balance of wheat and fruit. The Bavarians have done it again. God bless ¬íem.

On tap at The Nomad.  Poured a hazy medium golden with a thick cap of whitish head.. looked very nice.  Nose found the usual suspects... clovey/banana-ey wheat, cereal malts, and hints of lemon.  Smooth caramel and cereal malty middle surrounded by banana and cloves with lemon highlights.  Just shy of medium-bodied and somewhat grainy.  Quite refreshing.
bottle. murkey light gold color. large head. fruity banana. fresh summer beer. one i prefeer.

Bottle: Aroma had clove, spice and banana along with some grain. Dark cloudy gold body with big white head that disipated quickly. Flavor was a good mix of banana and spices. Good medium body brew that was refreshing on a hot summer day. Some spice left on palate but not much.

Smokey and clove spice aromas come through with banana mixed in.  Beer poured with a huge tall white head that lasts for some time, as it should. Yellow color and cloudy from the yeast that was swirled before pouring in the glass.  Good clove spiceyness with with yeast flavor and a nice medium banana sweetness mixed in. Beer has a good finish that leaves me wanting more. A good classic german style wheat as I expect from a franziskaner.
Hazy light golden color with a thin white head. Sweet banana aroma with a very strong banana flavor.

Thin small bubbld head. Little retention. Gorgeous hazy dark yellow brew.

Big banana smell with yeasty breadiness.

Strong sweet banana flavor up front with with a slightly bitter finish to finish.

Minutes later banana hangs around.

This is a great hefe. I really enjoy this beer and will have it again.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2006 Orangy, opaque appearance.  Moderate spice aroma with a hint of citrus.  Light body.  Nice spice flavor at the beggining with a citrusy hopppy falvor at the end.  Medium to low bitterness with a nice finish,
