bottle.  Poured a cloudy light orange with a big off white head. Aroma is of the expected banana clove and spice, taste is smooth, bananas and clove wheat with some light citrus notes.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2009 Bottled.  Whoa.  Can¬ít believe the style percentile of almost 98%.  This is distinctly average as would be expected.  Only slightly hazy orange with a small off-white head and a touch of lace.  The aroma is fizzy and bananas.  The taste is creamy with vanilla and lemon notes.  No real depth of flavour.  Drinkable but dull.Score 2.9Subsequent rating scored 3.4. Average becomes 3.1

Maybe I¬ím just an amateur, but this one was darned good (contrary to what I read below). Hefe¬ís are at the top of my list and this one is hard to top... in a bottle nonetheless. No more Paulaner for me, where both are available. Great citrus / fruity smell, nice golden cloudy appearance and a flavor that was perfect for a wheat beer.
The aroma has notes of apple and banana.  The pour is a cloudy golden with a nice white head.  The flavor is dry with apple undertones and a light crisp finish.
semi-murky yellow body with a huge head.dusty hay like aroma.flavor was a mix of apples,hay,and wheat.light mouthfeel.

Draft at Frankfort Aiport--#22 on the 2006 Europe Tour.  The color was yellow with a huge head.  The citrus aroma overwhelmed you with large undertones of banana and wheat.  The taste was exactly like the aroma, with smooth wheat and fruit flavors.  The texture was just the right amount of chewiness.  Easily found around the US, but it was special to have a German brew in Germany.
Tasted on tap.  Lots of banana and spice.  Very nice.  Quite powerful aroma.

Pours a cloudy yellow color with a thick foamy head. Grainy (almost rice-like) with a sort-of-banana flavor to it. Very drinkable. Can¬ít beat the 6-pack for $6 deal at Trader Joe¬ís for this either - great summertime drinking.

Draught pint at Red Bones 5/29/06. Pours a thick hazy yellow color with a bif foamy white head. Nose is coriander, pepper, banana. Palate is nice and thick with a creamy texture. Flavor is dominated by bananas but a nice vanilla pudding note, some light spicy coriander and pepper is also noted.

Pours lemony yellow w/ full creamy froth. Aroma of ripe bananas. Light nectar with relaxed residual effers. Mellow flavors of the great hefe. The froth is so persistant on the pour I decided to drink from the bottle. You get this fantastic heavy cream mouthfull. Good stuff. Dry banana on the finish with a slight souring.

Pours a cloudy, light brown/yellow color with thick white head.  Aroma has some sour notes with lemon, dried fruit, wheat, slight citrus, and some earthy spices.  Flavor is of wheat at first then gives way to the spices, citrus, and a hint of banana.  Slightly sour and bitter to finish off.  Pretty decent German brew.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2006 Bottle 44F Weizen.  Fruity aroma, smells of bread, and apircots, subtle sour notes.  Cloudy tan-orange color, with a white head that lasts moderately, with modest lacing.  Light taste of citrus notes, no malt or hops to speak of.   Finishes semi-dry with a subtle bitter nip.  Pleasant taste very light and quaffable.  Moderate to heavy mouth feel with a lot of carbonation, very fizzy on the tongue.  One of the best German Hefeweizen¬ís I have tasted, quite enjoyable and I am sure it would be great to enjoy the warm summer weather in Munich.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2007 500 ml bottle.  Cloudy orange-yellow beer with thick white head.  Very good looking brew.  Aroma of wheat,ripe fruit, banana, orange, light nutmeg and heavy cloviness.  Light apple aroma as well.  Really wheaty tasting along with the aforementioned fruit.  Quite fresh tasting, with lots of wheaty character, clove, banana and bubble gum.  Highly carbonated with a light sweetness and a lingering spiciness.  Great brew.
Huge head on top of a cloudy dark straw body. Aromas of yeast, esters and slightly sweet wheat penetrate the air. Flavor is is close to the same with a higher wheat presence.
Golden body with white head. Very well rounded beer. Clean finish. Has a nose of wheat more so than anything else. Wouldn¬ít expect nothing less from Franziskaner. Love it.
This hefeweizen is tops.  Very different from any other I have tried.  Hint of spice is distintive.  Smooth and full with a clean finish.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2007 Wow!  Pours with an insane head. The taste is supper fresh and great for the heat here in Panama.  I got loads of fresh banana yeast and other fruity flavors.  I¬íll be going back to this one again!

I¬ím a hefeweizen addict, and Franziskaner is up at the top for me. Good pale yellow appearance. A decent amount of head.   I could taste a nice flavor of bubble gum, banana, and a little spice.  Very nice on the palate.  Great on a summer day.

My first rating = I¬¥m a newbie.
Nice golden colour. Rich of small bubbles. A realla nice, fruity aroma.
Tastes really good to.

Yellow-golden, cloudy body; small bubbles with average density; large and lasting white head with average lacing.
Aroma is moderately malty with a citric background due to hops; fruity notes (banana and apple) together with some spicy notes (cloves, I¬íd say).
Sweet malty flavour at the beginning, then leaves space to a moderate bitterness in the finish; light acidic feeling n the background.
Body is light to medium with a lively carbonation; lightly astringent in the finish.
This beer is very satisfactory and refreshing; the balance between fruity notes and bitterness in the finsh is very pleasant.

Draft at Prost. Big white head, gorgeous golden body. Amazingly complex nose--loads of lemon, melon, and other citrusy goodness. Flavor opens up fast on the attack with citrus and some spice, broadening to a pale malt base with a bit of herbs on the top. Very little bitterness. Totally refreshing and satisfying.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow pour with a big, white, foamy head. Nose is big wheaty, spicy - coriander, light clove. Some bananna aromas. Dense white veil of lace. Fairly light flavor, more malt than anticipated. Naturally, is is wheaty, and the spices really shine as is warms a bit. Excellent example of the style.

(500 ml bottle from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/maine/augusta/l target=blank>Lou¬ís Beverage Barn) Pours a fairly cloudy light yellow-orange with a big foamy white head. Aroma is wheat, citrus and glue. Spotty lacing. Mouthfeel is soft and tingly. Refreshing wheaty and citrusy flavor. Seems like it¬ís lacking a little freshness, no telling how old the bottle may be. A nice wheat nonetheless.

Pours a slightly hazy golden/orange color.  Decent frothy head.  Aroma is combination of yeast, trace citrus and maybe a little spice.  Taste is very yeasty and wheaty.  Good representation of style.  Not the best, but pretty darn good.
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2007 Great yellow apricot color with must a little head. Nose is banana and cloves. Meadium body, with a light finish...sweetness and banana...but not too much so. Very nice Weiss.

Bottle from Taco Mac in Tucker, GA.  It was a clear straw yellow and it did not have much of a head.  There was not an aroma coming from the glass, but the taste was hoppy and spicy.  Not really something I¬íd buy again.

This is probably my favorite beer in the world.  The only downside is that it lacks "all day drinkability".  Unlike some lighter styled beers, I cannot have more than three at a time on a warm summer¬ís day.  Had some on tap at Epcot, and they were very good, though a little heavy to be refreshing in the late summer Florida heat and humidity.

Poured a nice hazy golden color. Smelled of citrus and yeast. I enjoyed this beer very much, much better than the american styles. The taste was sweet and refreshing, dominating flavors were of lemon and banana. Damn good hefe.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours hazy golden/orange with a  white head. aroma of wheat, malt, citrus, and fruit. Flavor is carbonated, citrus, and wheat.

Not incredibly cloudy in the first pour, probably should have coaxed the yeast back into suspension.  Light orange with a fluffy white head.  Vanilla and orange noticed in the first few sniffs.  Orange peel in the flavor with a bit of chocolate? or gum? noticed later on.  Smooth and lemony sweet.

500ml bottle	Lt orange/yellow, cloudy.  Tall white head. .. .. 	Intense estery aroma - cloves, bubblegum, banana. . ¬Ö	Sweet banana flavor w/ hints of spices - black pepper (?). . .. ..	Medium-light body, mouth coating. .. ..	Very excellent weissbier!

On tap. It had a fruity bannana aroma and had a flavor of clove and bannana. It had a very slight off bitter flavor, I was smoothly carbonated and just a little watery as it warmed. Changed the way I feel about Hefe¬ís. i will drink it again I hope.
Smooth, simple, satisfying.  A nice fruity scent, with a nice wheat finish.  I had this beer from the tap, so I can¬ít speak to the bottled version.

Corn, corn, corn. bitter, cold, wet, sharp.  did I mention how much this tasted liek corn?  Possibly unfresh, but it was from the tap.  This is what woudl happen if wheat tasted like corn.  I don¬ít like it one bit.  Tastes like the bud of hefeweissen.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2006 decent.  been trying lots of hefe¬ís lately and i¬íve decided 2 things: Piece Top Heavy is the best, and hefe¬ís are a whole lot better on tap than from a bottle.  this one is a lot more wheatgerm flavored.

I have tried this before a few times.I liked it better the last time I tried it.Perhaps I have had much better ones since.I thought this was a bit too sour tasting for me.It had a good body of flavor and decent head.I think I would have picked another beer before I would drink this,but it still tasted better than most of the common beers available in our local area bars and stores.Perhaps I will have to re-rate it in the future.

(0.5L Bottle) I have tried this beer many times before, but didn¬ít sit down to rate it until now. Hazy with a nice, lasting head. Noticeable banana taste, with a slight vanilla aftertaste. Overall a very smooth, drinkable beer.
31mar06 one bottle for 2 dollars.  golden honey wheat, filling taste and round finish
cloudy, golden appearance, clean taste. a good drink.  I can¬ít think of a reason to not drink it
Compare this beer to the dunkel version and I like this one much better.  Very light and refreshing.  Lively feeling in the mouth and looks great.  Good with a nice steak.
Bottle: Pours hazy yellow with large white head.  Aroma of Bread like yeast and cloves wiith no trace of hop smell.  Tastes a bit like chewing on a piece of bread

50 cl bottle from Swedish "Systembolaget" on March 24.Very hazy, clear yellow color, very large white creamy head. Smells typical from wheat, the cirtus and almost banana fruity scent. Frsh and sour taste, feels like a perfect summer beer to clench your thirst in the sun. Works in winter too of course :)

Bottle. Hazy gold with a huge white head. Nose of sour citrus, bready yeast, dry hay, and faint cloves. Terrific mouthfeel, very smooth carbonation, with flavors of yeast, bread, and sour/tart lemon and orange citrus. Quick, dry finish, very refreshing. I really enjoyed this one!
A really soild hefeweizen. Pours a really beautiful orange golden haze. Head is really thick, has nice flowerly hints of clove, banana, and citrus flavor. A great springtime brew.

Poured into my Hofbrau weiss stick. 
It poured a pumpkin orange hue with a thick ultra-white head.
The smell is all spice, bananas, and heavy clove. It has a pungent after aroma.
On the first taste, it¬ís slightly bitter, but it mellows out into a smooth light banana, with the aformentioned clove and coriander.
The mouthfeel is very smooth, but still crisp. The beer never became limp.
It was a little bitter for me, but all and all, a damn fine beer.

Golden body with lasting white head that leaves small laces; Small citrus nose with a little clove; Balanced body to the acidy side, great carbonation, buttery fell that extends into the finish which is nice and long, a little watery, contains citrus, yeast and clove.
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2006 25 oz. bottle. Good appearance and aroma. Spicy start, but tasted flat at mid glass. Short, watery finish.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2010 Bottled from Asda. Thick cloudy custard bosy, swarms of esters, decent bready feel onthe palate, very enjoyable.

500 ml bottle Light hazy brown. Banana and yeasty aromas. Soft and thick mouthfeel. High prickling feel from the carbonation. Little flavour. Dry watery aftertaste. Only a little bitterness. There are better hefe-weizens out there.

50 cl bottle. Yeast tha bottom. Cloudy yellow colour with a great white head. Nice aroma of banana, yeast and a lot of bread. Also nice flavour of wheat with some sourness. Very drinkable, one of the best hefe-weissen I had, so far.

Bananas and citrus.  Smells fantastic!  What a great smelling weissbier!  Pale in color with slight clouds... an almost white head that diminishes quickly.  Tastes just like a German wheat should, with a slight, yeasty finish.

√òl (50 cl.) k√∏bt i Tyskland.

√òllen er tis-gul og ufiltreret. Har naturlig frugtagtig og g√¶r smag som weizenbeer har og fylder godt i munden. Skummet er hvidt og t√¶t.

Duften er s√∏dlig (banan) g en anelse g√¶rret.

Absolut en af de bedste weizenbeer jeg kender.

50cl bottle. Poured murky gold into a footed pilsner glass with a huge, lasting white head. Nose is DMS and fruits with some banana at the edges. Strong banana at first taste then mostly DMS-y pale lager flavor with a metallic undertone. I¬ím nonplussed. Pretty good mouthfeel, crisp, well carbonated and refreshing if watery. Highly drinkable. I¬íve now tasted 2 of the current top 10 hefeweizens and I must say I¬ím disappointed with the flavor in both cases: basically cheap lager with a shot of banana. I¬íve heard (and I hope it¬ís true) that hefeweizens tend to be much better on tap.
spicy aroma, nice light orqange color.  citrus, spice on the nose.  spicy hoppy finish.  blows hoochgarden away and makes me happy

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2007 Cloudy gold with a pillowy white head.  I thought I hit a fluke with the weihenstephaner hefe as a great german hefe, but this one is just as good.  Really silky in texture.  Flavor is deliciously refreshing.  Good citrus and bubblegum.  Extremely well balanced.  RERATE, i think this is second to weihenstephaner for hefes out of the bottle. tons of delightlful esters.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2006 Bottle. I must say I was inspired by the happy monk on the bottle. Hazy bronze with fine floaties and a small creamy yellow head. Very light and fine carbonation streams up the body. Aroma is sweet like grilled bananas, cloves, and straw. Some light malt is present. Banana taste coupled again with clove. Spicy goodness reminds of starfruit with a slightly acidic finish. Very light hop presence. A bit dry, a bit carbonated, and a bit watery in the finish. Pretty good.

Pours a very cloudy, pale golden color with a frothy one inch white head, slowly settling to a thick cap that leaves behind a thick sheeting of lace.

Smell; slightly bubblegum like aroma, very ripe bananas, wheat and pale malts. This also has a nice mildly spicy herbal smell.

Taste; wheaty bread dough, with touches of citrus and clove. There¬ís some banana, and a bit of a hop presence. The finish was a bit weaker than expected, lacking in the spiciness in the few other Hefe-Weisse beers I¬íve had. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with nice lively carbonation.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Cloudy peach body with a big frothy white head. Big fruity aroma, bananas, apricots, and cloves. Flavor is banana, bubblegum, orange and cloves. The mouthfeel is fairly smooth with a slight tingle on the tongue.
A great beer on a warm summer day. Nice strong aroma, with a banana clove like ester.
A beautiful, deep, golden orange pour with a full head.  Aroma is slightly fruity but the spices come through beautifully.  Taste is slightly sweet but very clean on the tounge.  A personal Favorite.
500ml bottlePours a cloudy orange with a moderate, fluffy white head.  Aroma of citrus, spices, banana and bubble gum.  Flavor is spciy, citrusy with the obligatory wheat.  Not too bad.

12 oz bottle. Great aroma of banana, citrus, and spices. Pours with a nice head that lingers througout. Not much lacing on the glass. Sweet banana flavor with hints of clove and wheat. A great beer after a long hard day at work... Or anytime really! Crisp finish. 

I¬íve tried a lot of Hefe¬ís and this one has got to be one of my favorites. The only thing better than this (that you can still easily get in the states) is the Dunkel version. 

Prost!
A cloudy unfiltered wheat, with a delicate and pithy head. Carries the aroma of an oven full of pastries.  Spiced to perfection with hints of clove and ginger.  I enjoyed it with and without lemon.

Initially tried this one at a local sports bar.  Spicy, yet not as overpowering as a doppelbock.  The wheat is noticeably present, but does not linger on the palate.  A very good drink to have in the evening after work.
Bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber with a crisp white head.  Aroma is fruity, spicy.  Drinks clean with a nice finish.  A great find at the local beer store.

On tap Gingerman. We judged this against the Live Oak and it lost. This is a good beer if you like drinking bananas and bubble gum and cloves (the bar-wench wanted to throw a lemon in there as well). An overspiced wheat that satisfies any need to drink perfume.
Golden appearance with a delicate wheat taste that is not overpowering like some others I have tried.Sharp clear taste and very refreshing.
On tap: Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a huge frothy white head. Aroma and flavor is sweet and banana. Finish is smooth and sour. Refreshing Brew!

Bottle.  White and long lasting head, of course, one should almost say. Golden unclear body. Nice and sweet banana lemon aroma. The added yeast in the bottle makes it much better in comparison with the Kristallklar version. The flavor is swet banana caramel and a bit of carbonation making the bear fresh to drink.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2006 Pours deep, hazy bold with creamy head that quickly dissipates.  Very subtle nose in my sample.  Very lively. Abrupt finish.

Golden yellow, cloudy, some white frothy head. Nose is rather grassy, lemony, with some spice. Flavor is subtle, but not overly so. Bubblegum, clove, and banana bread tastes. Clean tart finish. Just a typical hefe, but solid and drinkable.

Tap @ Barclay¬ís. Opaque, hazy golden hay color with a white head. Smells citrusy and yeasty. Fruity flavors (estery), tangy, citrusy, and yeasty. Somewhat chewy, but not as thick as others that I¬íve tried.
Pretty much taste like a good...really good blue moon.  That being said...that doesn¬ít say much.

Bottle:  Well, I am not as enthusiastic about this brew as TheBeerLover, but I do admit it is better than American Hefe¬ís.  This has a cloudy gold color with jumpin jack flash style carbonation seen in the bubbles that continuously rise to the surface.  Of course, this keeps a nice, white fizzy head on the surface at all times.  Initially, the aromaa reminded of a pilsener, but after it warmed up a bit, I noticed corn, ripe bananas, and butterscotch.  It is a milder than the pungent American hefe¬ís that tastes like fermented corn silage on the farm to me.  This beer has a real creamy feel with a well balanced aftertaste.

Of all the German and domestic hefeweizens on the market today, Franziskaner Hefe-Weiss Bier is one of my all time favorites. This beer is very accessible, and is one of the best examples of this classic German style. Franziskaner Hefe-Weiss Bier pours to a bright, opaque golden color with a huge, dense, rocky, white head, and a very lively carbonation. Remember, you want to swirl the yeast sediment into the beer, so it is going to be cloudy. The nose on this beer is fantastic. Fruity, estery aromas of clove, banana, and bubble gum flood the nose. The palate is tart and refreshing. Flavors of wheat malt, pear, and more slight banana flavors coat the tongue. The body is round and smooth, and so drinkable. Franziskaner Hefe-Weiss Bier finishes with a nice balance of malt flavor, a touch more clove and banana, and just enough hop presence to balance. 

This really is a wonderful beer, and the perfect summer refresher. Hefeweizen in Germany is often consumed in mid-morning with weisswurst sausages, making it, believe it or not, a breakfast beer! I would not at all be against the idea, in fact, I have enjoyed a hefeweizen with breakfast on more than one occasion. I enjoy making a drink called a "hefemosia" which consists of equal parts hefeweizen and orange juice, that is very refreshing and delicious. That being said, I really believe this beer is more suited for lunch or dinner. It works really well with German fare, such as bratwurst and saurkraut, and would work well with roasted pork or chicken as well. I however, enjoy this beer most after a long hot day, as a thrist quencher.

Cloudy pale amber beer with lots of carbonation and sediment in the bottle. Thick white head which lighty laced the glass as it slowly went down. Aroma of bananna and yeast. The banana taste comes through very lightly.

I don¬ít have all the adjectives to explain it, but its really great. I think the banana flavor comes through, but there¬ís just something about this brew that makes it consistently excellent everytime I try it. When I am confused about what I should buy,  I always seem to be able to fall back on this. Its not always cheap though. Its often around 7.99 USD per six pack, which isn¬ít horrible, but not exactly a bargain price either.  Once I had to have an opportunity to get it on draft, and it was incredible. It was a wedding reception with a free bar, so I kept coming back for more and more and more till I was hammered, and it kept tasting great, but the point is, this is what I kept coming back for, and didn¬ít want anything else once I had figured out that this was the ultimate, that is, when it was draft.

Pours a golden amber color with thick white head that lasts.  Aroma of hops and citrus with a taste that follows nicely.   There¬ís just something I like about this.... it¬ís very refreshing and tasty.

I¬íd say refreshing was about the only fitting description I could think of after tasting this World famous Hefeweiss. I didn¬ít have a bad sample as it was clean as a whistle so I am assuming my taste-buds were asleep for the afternoon. Poured a very lively, hazy pastel orange with an enormous rocky white head that rose a  good inch from the glass. Head would not budge for the length (making tasting difficult, so off it went) and it left globs of foam daubed all over the sides. It certainly looked good! Nice deep toasted malt and gritty wheat grain nose with underpinned notes of banana, strawberry, bubblegum and what seemed like burnt wood. So far so good. Quite tangy in the mouth in the first sip. Spritzy in carbonation and medium-light, light bodied. Pleasant yet overly subtle mix of soft fruits like cantaloupe, and honeydew before tangy citric fruits take-over in the back. Light grainy note balances out the subtle flavours with an ever growing note of cloves that became over-powering by the end as it lingered solo in the mouth. It¬ís otherwise undemanding as it had the mouthfeel of a watered down lager. Good to look at and pleasant to the nose, but a little bland in the mouth to save itself. One for the re-rate bin! (50cL, BBE 04/06, Int¬íl Beer Shop, W. Leederville)

Simply the best hefeweizen I¬íve ever had.  Pours cloudy gold, with lots of carbonation and a billowy white head.  The taste is wheaty, and very sweet, almost like a trippel.  Crisp finish.  I really like this beer.

Bottle. Pours a dark yellow bordering on orange... not very white at all! Head is thick but short lived and leaves minimal lacing. Beer is cloudy though no individual clumps of yeast are found. Aromas of yeast and hops and a hint of citrus. I noticed the head smells vaguely of stables and manure... which distracts a little from the more agreeable aromas. Flavours of yeast, hops, clay and wheat. Mouthfeel is light and the carbonation is delicate though persistent. Not bad, but not particularly exciting either.

Just like it says on the box, it is a "classic hefe-weizen", the aroma is fruity and a little spicy, the apprearance is golden with a big frothy head and is cloudy with yeast, the flavor is full of notes of fruit and spice some banana.  Overall its always a good beer to drink, very refreshing
golden opaque yeasty beer with a thick light head.  slightly crisp with a healthy dose of fruitiness.  excellent, availible and fairly inexpensive.

Lots of yeast in the aroma, with a little undertone of citrus and possily cheese(?).  Cloudy orange color that wasn¬ít all that appeasing. Taste was slightly better than mediocre, a pretty average hefe. The cheese taste, or whatever was held me back from totally enjoying this one. Don¬ít think I¬íll have this one in my regular rotation, but it was certainly not a washout.
A pretty standard hefeweizen, made better by the fact that the bottle tells you how to pour it into a glass, so as to get all the delicious yeast into the beer.
Cloudy orange in color with a large head. Strong yeast and banana aromas. Sweet strong fruit influence adds almost a tropical  aspect to the taste. Sweetness makes the finish a little sticky.
On tap at the Saucer. Decent head, great smell.  Golden in color, a little cloudy.  Very fruity.  A great hefe, look forward to another.  Good buy on draught night.

Poured from bottle into shaker glass.  It had a profuse off-white head with a murky yellow color.  Aroma was of mild cloves and green bananas.  Flavor was light and citrusy with a bit of a sourdough bread finish.

I like this non-imposing hefe for its citrus flavors, blend of spices and sweetness. But, to me its more of a session beer than anything spectacular. The finish is kind of dull and there are tastier hefes out there.
Bottle.  Just what a hefe should be with the banana citrus and mild spice.  It¬ís just lacking a certain something in the finish.  Possibly it¬ís better fresh.

I really enjoy this Hefe.  Nice orange cloudy appearance, with a head that lasts forever.  Banana and cloves are apparent.  Sweet taste and aroma.  I can get this in my area for $9.00 a 12-pak of bottles.  Cannot beat that price.  It is worth much much more.

Cloudy orangish body with a volcanic rocky head. Probably the biggest I¬íve seen for the style. Aroma is typical banana, clove, yeast, wheat, etc... but later also a hint of alcohol. Flavor is a step above the ¬ítypical¬í hefe making this an enjoyable experience. A tad bit of alcohol in the flavor, usually I can¬ít detect any.

"Wow i expected this to be ranked a much higer beer. I had it on tap at a little place in Philadelphia, awsome. Had a nice big head on it that lasted till the last drop. Had a sweet aroma and tasted sweet taste"
Bottle:Initial smell of fruit maybe apple.  poured cloudy light brown with long lasting golden head.  Definate bananna flavor all the way through.

sweet fruity aroma. pours cloudy yellowish amber color with large white head. Have to agree on the strong banana flavor. nice and fluffy. not as good as i anticipated. My first german Hefeweizen though so i just might not like the style. Ok beer though.

Cloudy, golden yellow color with a tinge of yeast.  On tap in Germany.  Aromas are somewhat citrusy, but banana fruits dominate the flavor.  Medium bodied, yeasty wheat beer with a nice pleasant finish without being excessively sweet.

12oz bottle pours cloudy golden with a fluffy white head that stays and laces some on the sides of the glass.  Aroma is citrus, some bannana, and a touch of clove.  Flavor is much like the aroma.  Somewhat more sour than the usual hefe..  Not in a bad kind of way though fairly pleasant.  Palate is light and fluffy and very drinkable.  Not bad at all.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2006 Pours a nice cloudy golden color with a lot of head.  Smells slightly citrusy.  Complimented well with a lemon.  A wonderful medium body with no after taste.

Pours light, golden tan. Smells somewhat sour to me. Not sure how else to describe the flavor to much. Does have a apple cider like appeal to it. Finishs very clean. Very little aftertaste. Has alot of flavor to me. Again, not sure what they are. Yeast is the flavor I am getting the most of. Very dirnkable
Pours a hazy golden yellow.  Aromas of bread/grains/ and some citrus.  Had a taste of yeasty grains with some spice and citrus.
Maybe not served in the right conditions but it wasn¬ít as good as expected.

From tap in the USA.  Light and slightly cloudy with a large head.  Aroma of yeast which sweetens the taste.  Very nice on the palate, a full bodied beer.  A little bit watery compared to some other hefeweizens I¬íve tried in Germany.

Can at home (030822).
Light amber with a large white head, almost lasting, fine lacings. Aroma moderate malty and yeasty, light hoppy (coriander, citrus).  Flavor moderate sweet and acidic, light bitter. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

An American purchase.  Upon open, a sweet aroma of apples.  Poured into a tipped glass as suggested, heavy foam that did not dissipate.  With glass straight, I poured the remainder of the bottle into the glass.  The beer was very cloudy reddish-brown.  Taste was similsr to an apple cider.  Being an American, I was overcome by the wonderful flavour of this drink (being used to Budweiser as what beer is supposed to taste like).  This beer would be wonderful with a beef roast suc as a Standing Rib or a Rolled Rib with Au Jus.  Definitely worth buying.  I would love to try a fresh bottle, and not one that was sitting on the shelve for probably a year.  This beer is sold in Erie PA. at a distributor called Penn Beer.
A lightly cloudly heefe.  spare head with sparse lacing, possibly due to the adition of lemon.  Flavour is good, but lacking a stronger component.  Very Drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2005 Re-rate: I¬íve had bottles in various parts of Germany, have been pleased with each.  Pleasing and on the sweet side, one of the better Hefeweizen.  Cloudy concoction that¬ís a beautiful, light golden color up top and slightly darker at the bottom.  Hoppy aroma.  Good level of carbonation, sticky head, smooth creamy mouthfeel.  There¬ís some banana in there, and a bit of a fruity aftertaste, nothing bitter.  Refreshing!.

(bottle) Hazy yellow colour with a big fluffy white head. Soft wheat malty aroma with light yeasty banana-fruity notes and cloves. Moderately sweet flavour, medium to light bodied, lively carbonated mouthfeel. Wheat malty and yeasty taste with banana and citrus notes, light-sweetbitter malty finish with traces of floral hops. Decent quaffable everywhere-to-get Weizen.

US Bottle Pour - Beautiful yellow-amber body with large white head... slightly cloudy. Deliciously sweet and citrusy with spices in the aroma. Medium creamy body with sweet malty flavors... leads to a very mild and sweet aftertaste. Absolutely delicious.

On tap at Chalet Alpina, Forest Hills, Queens, NYC.  Cloudy yellow-orange hued beer having a long-lasting giant white head. Soft carbonation. Fresh sweet malt, spicy clove, and citrus aromas.  Light-to-medium bodied that starts with a creamy slightly sweet malt with spicy flavors and finishes clean with no discernable aftertaste. A refreshing and delicious hefeweisse beer.  Goes great with smoked pork loin and pickled red cabbage.

Bottle: Beautiful glowing apricot-gold with a thick, rocky white head. The nose revealed a similar level of quality, expressing sweet orange spice and enticing clove aromas. Some fruit spice and very subdued banana. However, the flavours emerging felt somehow disharmonious; sparkling citrus and savoury wheat with some background DMS echoes. Nevertheless, this is a pleasing and racy little number that I feel is one of the great Hefe¬ís.
Pretty good, nice yeasty taste, especially good cold, would be a very nice refreshing beer.  Nothing much beyond that to say.
wheat, yeast, fruity, citrusy.nice bittering in the finish and hops have a nice tang, but far not one of the best.

Nice white foamy head. Golden colour. Aroma of spices, yeast and tobacco. Lots of carbonation. Flavour of sour bread, wheat, lemon and some bananas. Medium bodiet. Little bitter aftertaste. Like other weisbeers it¬ís unavailable in a hot summers day.
I love the sweet flavor of this German beer.  No matter what mood I¬ím in, this one does the trick.

Beautiful pour, with fluffy pluming head.  Aroma of predominantely fruit.  Flavor of bananas, spiceness, and cream.  Very smooth and quite refreshing.  My first of the style and definitely one of my favorite styles thus far.
Tap.  Full, head and cloudy on the pour.  Creamy, with some banana and spice.  A good Weiss, but just short of being excellent.  Still, a very nice beer.
Strong banana flavor with a hint of spice.  Typical color and cloudiness.  Smooth and easy to drink.  Pretty good beer.

Swirling the bottle and adding the yeast, the hefe takes on a beautiful chilled haze - a deep golden bliss.  The lively head settles into a creamy pillow top to compliment the lustrious body.  The aroma is slightly musty, noting ripened banana mostly, but hinting at the spiciness ahead.  The body is creamy and smooth, highlighting the yeast¬ís fruity and sweet esthers, which are conveyed beautifully by the smoothness of the wheat.  The clean, crisp finish suits this wiezen perfectly.  Very enjoyable and very drinkable.

Very creamy white rocky head.  Noces is wheat, citrus and yeast, maybe even a hinty of clove?  Body poured with with a amber-gold color.  I had a _LOT_of huge chunks of yeast floating around in the beer after I poured.  Looked almost disgusting, and with most beers you don¬ít want that in your beer, but with the hefeweizen¬ís that is part of it.  I just thought it was a little much I guess.  I¬íll have to try another bottle and see if it is the same way.  Initial flavor was light and citrusy.  Finish is slightly hoppy and bananna and clove taste.  This is a pretty good beer.

Bottle. Predictable aroma of citrus and yeast. Pours a cloudy deep gold with a generous soapy white head. Flavor of apples, oranges, yeast, malt. Good mouth feel, consistency of coffee with cream, lets say. Finishes far less yeasty than other hefeweizens I¬íve tried, more orange and bread. Light and refreshing, if not too heavy on the flavor.
I was pleasantly surprised by the taste. It wasnt all that expensive. It has a pleasant aroma and smooth taste.
Anise ,banana, nutmeg aroma very present. A bit light bodied but very drinkable Weisse. Light bite slight hops. Lacing and head was poor in the bottles I had.
Smells great but has little body. Very little head, and an almost sour note on the finish. Not the best hefe.

Cloves, yeast, sourish, honey, light malt.
Sweet, sourish, bitter, hoppy. 
Mouthfeel is fizzy and standard.

500ml bottle.  Spicy, citric aroma, quintessential German Hefe attributes of clove and banana along with background sweetish honey and wheat malt notes.  Hazy, pale golden color with a rocky white head that fades to a fine cap.  Flavor profile is sweet, bready and grainy to start with a hint of vanilla, becoming fruitier and featuring plenty of citric, acidic lemon thereafter, finishing clean with a refreshing, bitter quality.  Light and fluffy on the palate with a light-medium body.  Highly drinkable and a classic interpretation of the style.

An immense, rocky head falls slowly over a thick, cloudy, golden/wheat body. Big, bold, classic Hefe aromas, heavy on the clove with additional green grapes and smoke. Aromas are bigger than the flavor which falls a little flat in comparison. The yeasty goodness is still abundant, but it doesn¬ít last due to the beer¬ís thinness. I concur with the previous rater¬ís comment about it being a "drinking weiss" (sic).

<font size=-4><a href=
http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/illinois/elmh Sal¬ís Beverage World, Elmhurst, IL<font size=-1>
Good in the summer because it has no body. It¬ís more of a drinking weisee than a savoring weisse.
It is a proper weisse, no doubt about that, but it is a bit too malty. It lacks some bitterness and freshness to balance it.
I used to love this. Now I find it way too banana. But it¬ís still a well crafted German weissen.
Draught. Hazy golden color with soapy white head that laced the glass. Delicious estery banana and yeast aroma. Bananas, cloves, yeast flavors. This is a great example of the style.

Cloudy yellow, fine frothy white head that lasts. Estery, yeasty aroma. Falvor dominated by fruit esters with some yeasty sourness. Light hops bittering noted in the finish. Not quite as clean tasting as Ayinger or Weihenstephan, but still quite enjoyable.
Yellow and cloudy in appearance.  Noticeably large head.  Earthy aroma of hay.  Mild sweetness and with wheaty tastes.  Smooth and drinkable.
golden, hazy, frothy, lightly sour, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation, Enjoyable, but not as hefewiezen as I prefer!  Excellent frothy head!
Hazy light brown color with lasting white foam. It looks very good! Yeast and some citrus in the aroma. Spices and some bread in the flavor. Watery aftertaste.

Bottle from Asda. Pours cloudy orange with a fine, fluffy white head. Aroma is spicy, banana-like, wheaty, a touch fruity and a little dusty almost like it has a little damage from light. Flavour is sweet, wheaty and spicy with underlying  biscuit character and notes of fruit (banana), bubble gum, alcohol, cereal, bread and a little soap. There is more banana in the aroma than in the taste. Very pleasent and well crafted hefe, excellent.

Draught with dinner at a new resturant.  Was the best part of dinner although not served in a tall glass.  Fine carbonation head at tastes small bubbles.  Not as strong a wheat as most hefeweizens.  Very refreshing in October.
Pours a hazy yellow with a nice long-lasting head. Nice lacing. Sweet and light sour. Fruity aromas of yeast and some banana. Low CO2 level. Mild and a bit watery.

The beer poured a cloudy straw color with a tan head and had good lacing. The smell was of spices with a some banana.  There was a banana and ester taste, but overall the beer was a little thin.  This is a decent hefe, but I have had better.
Taste hits your palate immediately, flavor is delicious, perfect blend of fruit and spices.  Could drink 6, the night before a marathon and you would be fine.  Perfect for athletes.
very good hefe with hints of bannana and cloves in the nose. tastes of wheat and bannana as expected. very good finish, smooth. very excellent brew.

Hazy straw color, medium head.  Aroma of wheat bread,, clove and a hint of pepper.  Flavor is bready with bold spices.  Very crisp and somewhat dry with a clean finish.  Had this at the ballpark and went down well on a hot night.
bread, alcohol, amber, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, sticky, light carbonation, long finish,

delicous hefe. wheat, banana and citrus in the nose. tastes sweetiish, sourish, fruity, wheat and spicy. finishes wheaty, spicy and with lots of banana. classical weissbier with a perfect balance. looks great too. yummy!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2005 An excellent Hefe-Weisse.  Very large thick head that lasts with a body of cloudy orange.  Delicously sweet and fruity taste with hints of banana and apple at first.  Has a sour and spicy aftertaste that lingers in the mouth too long.  Soft carbonation and not too strong of a yeasty taste.  Very well balanced but not as rich of flavor as the dunkel (dark) variety.

500 mL bottle pours a nice cloudy orangish color with a large head typical that never quite goes away.  Taste is a good balance  of fruity and yeasty.  This beer is good out of the bottle and great when it¬ís fresh from the tap in a Biergarten in M√ºnchen.
Pours cloudy caramel with a large cappuccino head, aroma is pure Hefeweizen...delicious. Taste is instantly bananas then spices. A cracker.

(500 ml bottle: $1.99 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) This is most certainly a gorgeous beer.  Pours a bright orange-golden body that¬ís fully cloudy, but I can still see quite a legion of carbonation bubbles rising quickly through the beer.  The tall white head settles to and maintains a quarter-inch crown atop the beer for the entire session, leaving some patchy lacing.  The nose is only mildly aromatic and is nicely balanced with wheat and banana, but there¬ís also some plastic table cloth going on there too.  A balance of wheat malt and subtle banana in the flavor, but the finish seems a bit stale to me.  Light-medium body tends to trail off toward wateriness in the finish.  Contrary to what the visuals might indicate, the carbonation level is pretty light on the palate.  You know, I seem to remember this tasting better years ago, and looking back at past notes, the quality seems to have dropped off now that it¬ís part of the massive conglomerate.  Just not that exciting a beer any more.

A Creamy head - the body a bit too Cloudy - color a bit muddy Yellow.
Slightly thin beer with a delicious sweet flavor and not bitter at all!
A good weissbier with a fine creamy head. The beer has a sweet flavor initialy.
Bottle from Morrisons. Yellow orange with massive rocky persistant head. Sparkling. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, yeast, apple. Fruity taste, minerally finish. Refreshing.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2005 Big white head, lasting. Nice fruity flavour. Great on the palate, full flavour, almost no carbonation. Only the slightly too sour aftertaste took the over-4.0 rating from this one. I personally like Paulaner & Erdinger more. Still very, very good hefeweissbier, definitely recommended.
Mostly lasting nice white head. Wonderfull yeasty aroma, very hoppy, moderate flavour, average finish, soft carbonated. A good beer but then it was supposed to be!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2006 Very nice hefeweizen. A very refreshing style, and this one covers all the usual assets well. With a nice and steady banana + clove aroma, it also carries through well into the flavour. A fairly well balanced flavour it is, which gives it it¬ís quaffability. A little gassy with a bit of rubber in the aftertaste, but it¬ís a pretty solid beer.
Great wheat beer for sessioning.
Yellow colour with a large mostly lasting head, Cloudy body, which however is a bit watery. Taste and flavor of malt and hops. A bit sweet.
Pours hazy caramel brown with active carbonation and large thick rolling foamy tan head.  Sweet yeasty, earth aroma.  Sweet/sour malty nut yeast flavor.  Thin, easy to drink, slightly watery palate.
The Pope used to drink this beer.and it¬ís my favoorite beer so far. The drinking sensation is like drinking a velvet stuff. Pope has more credit iwith me now.
A lighter example of the style, this still has good spice & a fruity palate, clean and very satisfying. Nice looking beer.
A typical hefe pour.  Aroma is of banana and clove with some spiciness from the wheat.  Flavor is banana, clove, a hint of vanilla,  and wheat.  A fine Bavarian beer

An excellent beer from Bavaria, you can find this beer in Italy.
Aroma: banana candisugar, Very smooth and refreshing
Hazy golden coloured, large snowwhite head. Aroma: some banana, candisugar, yeast. Refreshing flavor, reasonably wellbodied. Good Hefe

On tap at Pickle¬ís in State College, Pennsylvania, the new place, apparently to hang out.  One of the better draughts they had available, and it being summer, I decided to give it a whirl.  Not as flavorsome as their dunkel variety but still banana-nutty with notes of orange and citroen.  At a trendy new place like this, I wonder how many other college kids actually drink this stuff.  But kudos to the operators who decided to make it available.
Had this on tap in France. Very smooth and refreshing. Mild taste and mild hop bitterness. Great on a warm summer day.

Fair sized white head lasts and laces on top of the totally cloudy, homogeneous pale gold body. Propagating phenols fill the glass surroundings, very medicinal in nature, clovey. Doughy yeast, unbaked cookies, christmas spice and a large banana-ish ester base. The wheat comes out a bit more in mouth, but I don¬ít find that the yeast richness follows. Feels a bit sweet for the style, rather lemon pie like, meringue included. Rather well balanced, straightforward example that does the job with no shortcuts nor star moments. Light-medium body, moderately high carbonation, airy texture.
An excellent beer from Bavaria. Flavored and crisp. One of my "favoriten" so far ;).
A hazy golden color full of sediment with a fair white head. Aroma of malt and fruit. A citrus flavor is present with some banana and clove. Nice and crisp. Fairly refreshing.
Nice hefe. Pours the typical Hefe-weizen color. Taste is grassy and organic with some bannana-clove. Follows with a spicey, citrus-hop bite that washes the grassiness down. Good Munich weizen.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2006 1st beer I had at the Flour City Brew Fest.  A refreshing brew with a hazy orange color and a slightly fruity taste.  I enjoyed it.  Had again during super bowl XL.  Still good.

How have I not rayed this one? Pours cloudy gold with a large white head. Aroma of wheat (banana) and yeast (bread). Flavor is heavy wheat with a little spice and a touch of bitterness in the finish. Good carbonation and mouthfeel. Lots of flavor without getting heavy. One of my every day beers.
Had at the Rohrbach¬ís summer beer festival.  Very hazy, very nice traditional weisse.  Wheaty palate.  Orange color.
pours hazy golden/orange with a large white head, aromas of wheat, malt, citrus, and fruit.taste is carbonated, spicey, citrusy, and malty, not a bad beer by far, i liked it.
On draft, hefe quickly becoming my favorite type of brew.  Served with a lemon, didn¬ít need it, my wife even liked this one, and she doesn¬ít drink much beer.

The aroma is like sour kraut, yeast, and bread. The appearance is cloudy golden with large foamy head. Flavor is sweet malt and average hopping along with hints of banana and cloves. The thin palate and aftertaste that is similar to pilsner hurt the ratings somewhat but overall a good, complex brew.
Smell = bread dough, banana, musty, Taste = sharp wheat, tropical flavor, citrusy, caramelly finsih.  very pleasing in the mouth, creamy, spritzy.  Very good.

Pours hazy straw with a true-to-style huge head and some beautiful effervescence. Spicy, citrusy, and banana-y aroma. More of the same in the flavor, with a mildly astringent finish. Very little aftertaste. Good stuff.

served on tap in 23oz shaker glass., sadly not quite full to the rim.  cloudy yellow. nicely carbonated fruity, not real yeasty or spicy.  lots of banana, sweet and estery.  finish was slightly lacking.  this was a nice refreshing light to medium bodied hefe.
Excellent Excellent Hefe.  THis is on par with the best in the field.  Light golden with strong pear and banana scents.  Taste is smooth a crisp with a bit of citrus in the finish

Pours a cloudy light amber with a big white longlasting head. Aroma of yeast and malt with a bit of citrus and ripe bananas. Flavour reflects the aroma yeast, malt, citrus, banana and a bit of clover. Nicely coats the tongue. Very refreshing. An excellent hefe- weissbier.
Good hefe with exellent smooth and longlasting head. Thats the way to go. HIghly drinkable.
A great german beer.  They made this with the best wheat and not having to add a lemon is awesome.  I really liked this beer,  The color and flavir where awesome.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2012 This is one of my favorite hefes.  Good amount of head, good cloudy yellow/amber color.  A huge range of flavors can be found in this hefe... citrus, spice, fruit-punch-ish flavors... super-refreshing beer.  An all-time favorite of mine.  I used to buy them by the case.

Pour a cloudy orange/amber with a big white head. Aroma of yeast and malt with hints of citrus and bananas. A little spicy taste with hints of cirtus and a malty taste. Smooth aftertaste with some bitterness.
[bottle from peckhams] pours a cloudy yellow/orange. nose is wheaty with some orangey notes a some spices. body is good but just a little carbonated for my tastes. overall an excellent beer.

17oz - Aroma of yeast, candi sugar, lemon, and banana.  Opaque golden yellow with champange like bubbles and a sustaining thick head that leaves no lacing.  Flavor is right on to the aroma with a bit more bread dough.  SLick palate washes down clean.  A pretty good hefe.
UPDATED: MAY 24, 2007 Original rating 2.9. A solid beer for a wheat, in that it goes down especially well, without any bad funkiness. A great example of the style.

Listen... this is the best beer you¬íll ever have that reads "Malt Liquor" on the label (see vertical print on right hand side of label--US only?). Pours antique-globe amber (amber waves of grain)with fair size head. Terrific aroma like sweetgrass (or sweet grass?), freshly bailed hay but in a good way. What¬íd the hay ever do to get arrested? Bahdumdum! But seriously folks... wonderful refreshing flavor, tiny bit of skunk comes through, but good skunk, I swear. Good and lasting mouthfeel, holds to the tongue a little like coffee (but it obviously doesn¬ít taste like coffee). Spider web of lacing slowly drains. I like this beer; I bet I like this beer more than you do. But you¬íre wrong. Cheers!
A great Hefeweizen beer. Lasting thick white head. Golden color. Tastes of yeast and fruits (mostly citric). Very enjoyable !
Bottle; poured a white head that lasted. Hazy, light amber hue. Hints of banana, flowers, and grapefruit. Light citrus taste. Oily texture with soft carbonation. OK but not a favorite.
A solid German Hefeweizen. Taste: yeasts, touch of fresh orange, malts and light hops. This beer has not disappointed me once.

pours a cloudy off brown copper w/ a small white head decent lacing.  An odd sour light fruit aroma hints of wheat and lemon maybe cuz some idiot threw a lemon in my beer.  Palate is mildly carbonated ok coating.  Fairly light.  Tastes of bannana nut bread light yeast and nutmeg.  A pretty decent beer.
Bottle. Hazy, yellow/orange colour with a white head. Sharp, yeasty aroma with citrus. Flavour is acidic with yeast. Dry. Nice finish. Too much carbondioxide, though.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2008 a great hefeweizen in my opninion.  Has a  slight hint of spice mixed in.  Very drinkable for any occasion.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2010 Rated 2005.06.28 - Golden and cloudy with a large rocky white head.  Clove and some banana aroma, smells delightful.  The taste is a bit disappointing.  An initial malty taste fades into a refreshing wheat finish.  A good representative of how a hefe should look and smell, but uninspired taste. 
Ar7 Ap5 Ta5 Mf3 Ov 13

Rated 2010.07.26 - Pours hazy light golden with a thin mostly receding white head. Notes of light banana, clove, sweet wheat and yeast. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.
Ap4 Ar7 Ta7 Mf4 Ov 14
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2005 Hazy orange color with a large longlasting white head.  Both aroma and flavor were a little off for me.  Not a bad hefe, but was a little disappointed overall.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2006 Bottle - June 2005

Average lasting, big and white head ( on the weak side considering it¬¥s a Hefe). Yeasty appareance ( though not so cloudy) maybe  a little too "white", even for a wheat beer. Somewhat citrusy aroma. Flavor is slightly acidic, tart and citric.  Flavor may have affected because of the green bottle and the beer being not so fresh ( Germany is really far from here and i think it was imported pretty long ago, maybe for an Octoberfest promotion or something like that). Quickly disappearing aftertaste. Not bad, but i prefere more "accentuated" Hefes or Wits.
Not a hefe fan, but this one is nearly as good as paulaner in my book. Great head, nice flavor, not as sweet as others, which is good.

Huge head. Light citrus and wheat in aroma.  Thin body, as expected, and decent on the palate.  A little citrus and some wheat in the flavor.  Not quite as good as Weihenstephaner, but still a refreshing beer.

Bottle.  Poured hazy yellow with a HUGE head, and it left a great lace to boot.  A beautiful hefe.  Aroma mainly of citrus, yeast and wheat.  Not too big, but not too weak.  Flavor is front loaded with lemon zest with some hop bitterness following to the finish.  Speaking of the finish, it¬ís dry from the citrus (and bitter from the hops).  A nice light beer for the summer.

Not quite as good as Weihenstephaner, but close to the best you can get for this style. Great looking beer in a weizen glass. Cloudy, blond, yellow, light orange with a large fluffy white head.  Good banana, yeasty aroma. Maybe a little too thin, but a thin body is good for this style. Tasty wheaty flavor with some fruity hints. A weaker finish. I could drink this all day.

A Mes rate:
Not sure if it is just me because the previous rater gave it a 7 for aroma but this is the worst smelling beer I have had so far. Nope I just asked sim to smell it and she says it smells like blu-tac or putty. And she is exactly right. It stinks. Typical weiss looks, straw coloured and cloudy. Typical weiss flavour.... Typical weiss. Don¬ít get me wrong its ok as long as you dont smell it. Nothing to write home about.

Too thin. Maybe in the heat of summer this would be a good light beer. Nice apperance, but no real body or palete. Hints of bananna and clovse alongwith a swhite long lasting head and a lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2013 Hazy yellow appearance. Tall white head. Heavily carbonated. Nice, light citrus aroma. I don¬ít taste any of the "spicy" notes from the description. The flavor has lots of wheat, it¬ís a bit earthy, with some lemon zest. Best enjoyed cold.

A cloudy applecider-like color.  Good balance with citrus aroma¬ís.  Not ¬ída-bomb¬í hefeweizen, but pretty good.  I bought a bottle- 25oz for about the same as a comparable sized BUD.  obviously, way way better.  My point, it¬ís great- especially at a good price.

On draft at the Sanctuary in Iowa city--and even on special for 2.50!  Cloudy pale gold, foamy thick head, aroma of cloves and banana, just like a hefe should have.  Smooth with spicy banana peel flavor, very refreshing in the heat.  A great summer stand-by.
A beer style, I am coming to appreciate. Subtle banana,clove aroma, big foamy head, dry banana a much more delightful lawnmower brew than an American Macro

This has to be one of the finest beers around, at the moment.Always consistant in all aspects of the drink.

Very refreshing and easy to drink.
Great Summer beer.  Big foamy head and cloudy appearance.  One of the smoothest hefeweizen¬ís I¬íve ever had.  Sweet but not sharp.  A thoroughly enjoyable adult beverage.
Pint bottle.  Appearance of a typical hefe: cloudy yellow-orange with a thick head. Very wheaty, banana-y dryness. Nice and refreshing for the summer.
(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy amber with the kind of head that simply refuses to die. Soft, malty character and a yeasty fruitiness. Classical Bavarian Hefe-weizen and a fine example of the style. 141099

While I prefer the Dnkel, this beer is a must have for summertime. Cool and refreshing, it¬ís banana peel flavor is well balanced with hops. Goes down well on draught or in a bottle. Use a tall weiss beer glass when pouring, as the rich head is worthy to see at it¬ís ultimate. I¬íve never seen a head on a beer that frothy or one that would stand up that high. It¬ís like a fine Cuban cigar that you let burn without flicking the ash off, it¬ís will go almost forever.
Poured a medium amber color with a larger (4-finger) sized head. Fruity aromas and tastes. Bananas, wheat and light yeast. It was OK but maybe a little on the thin side.

On tap at the Senator lounge at Munich Airport. Classic german hefe. Unfortunately I was in a hurry as I was only in transit. Cloudy straw gold with big fluffy white head. The usual banana and clove aromas and flavours with a litte dough as well. Unlike many who have reviewed this beer I thought he palate was a little watery. Still, a very refreshing beer.

On tap at the Lowenbrau Keller in the Rocks, Sydney. Like the beer my review is going to be a bit clouded. Simply because this was free, one fifth ofa very nice and gratis tasting tray. I don¬ít really have to be too worried about giving this a fairly positive review because any beer that is sitting on an 88 percentile after nearly 600 reviews must be pretty good. Great presentation in the glass with a good cloudy body and bleach blonde head. Ample cloves, banana and other wheaty esters are present. the flavour is crisp and dry with a very pleasant palate. A shame the weather is turning colder as this would be an ideal summer sipper.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text:
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2005 Typical cloudy amber (apple cidery) color.  Decent white fluffy head with decent lacing.  Fruity esters, with a medium bodied mouthfeel.   Slightly sweet and slightly bitter.  I will imbibe this one again because it is one of three decent beers that I can get here in Mississippi!   

Also had this on tap, and I remember the bottled tasting much better than the tap.
On Tap. Thin whiteish head. Aroma-not much from what I would have expected.  Color-cloudy straw/gold.  Nice palate, interesting taste, bananaish.  Better than average Hefe-weissbier.
Light, cloudy golden color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Flavor is dominated by banana with a spicy clove finish.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Light and very refreshing.

Fine meringue-like head smells mainly of esters.   Light amber color with slight cloudiness.  Overripe banana notes behind fresh wheat malt, like a liquid banana bread loaf.  Plenteous fine carbonation gives this a light finish, along with some yeast-induced sourness.

Hazy golden-yellow color. with a dense white head that sticks around until the end of the beer. Yeasty  aroma with a hint of banana. It has a refreshing creamy mouthfeel, With mild banana and a hint of spice flavors. A good Hefe, but not a great Hefe!

Bottle. Stand back, this head knows no limits. Stayed till the end and left a beautifully intricate belgian lace. Nose was sweet but not cloy, a little dreamy and very enticing. Tasted slightly sweet with a bitter touch, while also being spicy and dry. Well balanced and a nearly perfect amalgam of flavours. Add a solid mouthfeel and a thrilling finish and this was one top drop.
Spritzy refreshing wheat with strong fruit (lemon and banana) notes.  Very creamy texture.  Long lasting head.  Strong suggestion of cut grass in the aroma.  Very nice brew.
This was banana-y and walnutty, and had good yeast and malty flavors and aromas.  yummers.  i enjoyed it.
Yeasty aroma and almost ridiculously large and fluffy head. Sour citrus flavors. Not a bad beer at all, but you can get better hefes.

Had this after the dunkel, and this one has more pronounced hefe aromas and flavors, yet I rate it lower than the Franziskaner dunkel weiss because of less complexity in flavor and less balance.  Still, that¬ís like saying a Toyota Camry is not quite as good of a car as a Honda Accord.
Decent, but by no means outstanding. A pleasant allround hefeweizen. Too little yeast for my taste.
Nice german white. Had it from a can. Yeasty and a bit on the sweet side. Little citrus. Aftertaste is good.

Pours yellow and hazy with a huge white head. Spicy and yeasty in aroma with a little citrus. Thin in body and moderately dry. Decent hefe flavor with no one distinctive feature but on the watery side. Bit of a metallic finish also.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2005 The commercial description is actually pretty accurate here.  But more pecifically, it also has understatements of apple schnapps, which could annoy you if you have misgivings about said beverage like so many folks.  Goes well with cheeses and soft pretzels w/ mustard.  Attractive labeling as well.  Put a black monk on a malt liquor bottle and I guarantee sales for it will burst out the wazzoo!
Tastes like a good heffe should but could use more flavor. It¬ís a bit bland. I¬íve definitely had better. This one tastes a bit macroish to me.
Very Refreshing good hef-wiesse Cloudy orangish and amber pour.  enojyed this very much.

Great flavor, just like a weissbier should taste.
Nothing fancy - a safe bet any day

Bottle. Hazy light amber with a huge rocky white head that diminished slowy. Aroma was full with wheat and banana. Flavor was moderate sweet with a moderate sweet banana finish. Medium body with creamy texture. good brew.

Had this on tap at Gustav¬ís Pub in Portland, Or. and  it is an EXCELLENT Hefe, but what else do you expect from Germany. Great appearance, with a beautiful head and a very citrusy flavor. If anyone puts a lemon in this, they should be shot.

Solid German hefeweizen but not a patch on the Paulaner I had yesterday. Poured a cloudy peach-tangerine colour with a 4cm head that burped and farted for several minutes before settling down. Laced a little. Slightly sour aroma. Some characteristic weizen banana, plus vanilla. Not the most inviting hefeweizen aroma. Light-bodied and quenching, with a fizzy mouthfeel. Perhaps a fraction over-carbonated. Distinct banana notes and a mild bitter-sour finish. It¬ís decent enough but I wouldn¬ít rate it among the best of the hefes. (Bottle, best before Aug 05)

Overall, one of the finest hefe-weizens available on a consistant basis.  Starts sweet, with clove and dry grass aroma.  It follows through a bit on the dry side, and maintains a smooth and fruity tone on the palate.  You don¬ít want to pollute this one with an orange or lemon slice.
Pours amber/gold with a generous head.  Smell is on the vanilla end of the spectrum.  Taste is fruity and sweet with a nice lingering aftertaste.

the typical cloudy golden appearance, aroma is a little yeasty. flavor is a mild sweetness, but not as much as other wheat beers i¬íve had.  the only thing i didnt like was the bitterness that stayed in my mouth after i had swallowed.  not a bad hefe, but i¬íve had better.
Just as it says, yellow body, white fluffy head, yeast aroma, cloudy body, , yeast taste, watery mouth feel, Nothing really mind blowing, but an easy drink.
Draft at San Diego Brewing Co.  Cloudy yellow with a nice white head.  Banana aroma with a banana flavor as well.  Went down great with no bad aftertase.  A new favorite Hefe.

I poured the bottle carefully because it was bottle conditioned and unfiltered. It poured a slightly cloudy golden liquid with a medium white creamy head that gradually dissipated. The lacing was quite nice. The aroma was classic wheat beer ... banana, vanilla, and citrus. The mouthfeel was quite smooth, almost velvety while the flavor started off with that sour-fruit taste that wheat beers are known for. The middle presented hints of clove and the finish was crisp, clean and dry.

Not a bad hefe.  Pours a hazy yellow with a large diminishing head.  Very slight lacing.  Aroma was a bit skunky.  Made me think I was cracking open a Heinieken or Becks.  Taste was of the style, clove and banana.  Very well balanced.  Was pretty smooth but the mouthfeel leaves something to be desired.  Slight bitterness  after the swallow.   Not a bad beer  but I¬íd go with Weihenstephaner or Paulaner for a nice Hefe.
Pours hazy pale yellow with a thick white head. Sweet caramel nose. Sweet rounded spicy flavour with segments of bananas.
a great wiess beer.  had this on tap the other night.  nice citrus flavor  --even with out the lemon twist.

Crisp spicy aroma.  Murky beige body under a pure white head.  Bubbly.  Nice bits of yeast floating around.  Sweet, fruitiness with a crisp finish.  Not bad overall.  I think mine could have done without the sun tan in the green bottle on the way from Germany.

A fairly representative hefeweiss, lots of bubbles, crisp clove and banana aroma.  Decent milky amber appearance makes this a decent choice, but there are much better beers out there.  Save your money and buy an ayinger or erdinger.

Too fruity for me, I prefer a bolder hefe-weiss.  Pleasently crisp though and very little to no after taste made this beer drinkable for me.  I would not serve this with anything heavy or seasoned though.
Cloudy orange-yellow with a big white head. Yeast and orange aroma. Mild yeast and strong banana flavour. A good zesty and refreshing beer but with a short finish.
This beer brings back memories of the early winter beer gardens in Munich. Great big head with a golden color, has hints of banana and citrus. A wonderful weissbeer.
Pours a golden weisse, with a somewhat thick head. Aroma is pleasent of wheat and fruitiness, mostly banana. Palate is some of the same, though with emphasis on wheat.

1 pint 0.9 fl oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy dirty gold with thick off-white head.  Plenty of effervescence.  Aroma is yeasty and of bananas and spices.  Taste is surprisingly smooth.  Still tangy though not as much as I expected.  Very refreshing and crisp.  Taste is spicy and fruity.  Excellent.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2005 Tasted 05/03/2005.  Batch L05441T.  Green 330ml bottle from Regional Wines and Spirits.
Pours a murky gold with a volcanic carbonation that fires clumps of yeast everywhere and lifts up a tumescent, stormy, off-white head.  This collapses nicely after a few minutes.
Nose is greeted with a punchy bouquet of banana along with a woody and spicey yeast (cloves, cinnamon).
Mouthfeel is not at all watery (as I¬íve come to almost expect from wheat beers).  It is in fact quite creamy and releases a wheat and banana flavour with some yoghurty yeastiness.  Little noticeable bitterness.
Palate is left spicey and sweet with some alcoholic warmth.
A top class wheat beer and a standard for the current kiwi wheat beer craze to aspire too.
Shame about the new "export green" stubbie bottles.

This bottle is not very fresh, but even so...
Aroma is bursting with bananas and yeast. Pours is an nice golden orange, cloudy and with lively carbonation speeding up to a white frothy head. The head is about and inch tall and maintains itself well. Taste is subtley sweet, yes - bananas, light but earthy grains, giving way to a strong yeasty doughiness. The sweetness is well balanced by a light bitterness. Smooth texture, body is thin yet somehow creamy. Some unpleasant metal after the swallow. Leaves your mouth feeling lubed. I find this beer really refreshing. I passed the best afternoon of the quarter drinking these with a buddy until dinner.

50 cl bottle. Served in Franziskaner glass. 
Cloudy yellowish. Big, stable head. Pleasant, fruity aroma and flavor. Lacks some depth. Easily drinkable, though.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 sweet citrusy and honey aroma, smells alot like a very good belgian whit, yeasty. Taste is smooth and again it reminds me more of a whit then a hefe, acid citrus is a bit dominant but is balanced quite well ... this is exceptional for the style and very easy to down a few kegs of

Poured from the bottle.  A cloudy coppery appearance beneath a good full head.  Loved the aroma, with banana and honey coming through.  Tasted very bitter for a wheat beer (I¬ím not complaining) and was very smooth over the palate.  Would be the best wheat-based beer I have tasted for a while.
UPDATED: JUL 29, 2005 Orange and hazy. Big lasting head. Fruitesters in the nose - banana. Nice fruity sweetness, citrus and yeast. A really good weissbeer, but not the best i¬íve tasted.

One sip and I¬ím sitting with my buddies in a biergarten overlooking dowtown Munchen on a smoldering summer evening. Yeah it¬ís that good, at least if you have ever pondered copulation with a good weizenbier....

Pinter. Poured into a taller glass like it was poured in Germany. Poured cloudy-yellow with lots of haze. Bread/Banana aroma. Taste followed same with the additional lemon. Kind of typical. The yeast at the bottom didnt really seem to evapourate after being spun. Kind of just, clumped out and danced lazily in the glass. Very smooth palate and enjoyable to drink in the late afternoon as its light.

This one was one of the first non-swill brews I ever bought.  Bought it at the Kroger in College Station, TX back in ¬í94.  I love this beer, not only for the nostalgia, but for the taste.  This is a nice and sprigltly lil¬í sippin¬í brew that is to be savored.  The monk on the label is funny looking, and that marketing tool has worked on me for over 10 years.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottled. Yellow, cloudy, huge white head. Citric barley dominates the aroma. Soft and smooth taste of sweet citric barley and wheat, with hints of caramel. Not much aftertaste, only a lot of sweetness, which stays for about 15 seconds.

Served on tap at the BW3¬ís on Hwy 100 - suprised to see this available!  Looks like a hehe.  Pleasant white bread / banana aroma with subdued toasted mint.  Bread dough plus banana candies plus clove and a light astingent papery finish.  The finish detracts a lot, otherwise this was a fine wheat beer.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2005 Impressive head.  Delicious beer.  Drink it by itself to experience the full range of flavors.  It¬ís my father¬ís favorite beer.  Lucky for me, I inherited his stash of Franziskaner when  he went on the South Beach diet.  Sweet!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2010 On Tap (usually).  This is my go-to hefe, I have it all the time.  Its just delicious, all around refreshing.  Fuity and spicy, full of flavor, but not too heavy.  If you haven¬ít tried it, please do. Just make sure it¬ís not an old bottle.
Pours a cloudy pale color.... large white head that fades.  The aroma is alright.... flavor is awesome.  Makes my mouth salivate *sp*  Good beer.

Lemon peppery.  Not my favorite of this style by far.  Kind of dry, maybe a little bit stale in this bottle?  Color was something bland too, for a Hefe.  I see this stuff everywhere though, I guess its somewhat accepted.

Cloudy dark blonde with a medium head that recedes.  Aromas of hops and malt.   Flavor is good..  malty, yeasty, citrus (mostly lemon) and some hops peeking through.  Very tasty.  Nice body for a hefe.  A little tart and crisp.  Very refreshing and flavorful.  Nice!
good size long lasting head..a lot of carbonation...a bit sickly looking yellow..smelled funky/musty...strong malt taste almost like beef broth..ech..bottle
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2005 light cloudy orange color. large head . slight lacing. very tasty.
Tapr: Cloudy lgiht color.  Smooth and sweet flavor. Very light wheaty flavor.  Slight citrus taste.

Descent German white beer, but i don¬ít know why they call it white beer, there¬ís nothing white about it.
Very good taste though, it¬ís wirth a try when u can get it.

Hazy orange with a medium frothy white head and very good lacing.  Looked really good in a standard Berliner Weiss Goblet.  Fresh malty aroma with plenty of fruity sweetness - bananas, pear and vanilla.  Smooth creamy mouthfeel and more banana and floral herbs on the toungue.  Satisfying finish.  Very refreshing and entirely too easy to drink one after another.
Very cloudy look,creamy head,Banana fruity beer.It is now imported to Turkiye.Great step for Turkish beer lovers now we are going to understand what beer means.
Pours a murky amber, with a creamy fluffy white head.  Aroma is typical hefe, bananas and cloves.  Taste follows from aroma.  Clean finish.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2005 From a bottle .Golden yellow in colour,nice head,sweet malty and fruity.

Big fat foamy head, a hazy yellow color thats golden, and thousands of bubbles rising in the beer.  Aroma isn¬ít to bold, but of that rotten fruit smell that i love in germany and beligum styles.  Not a overbearing flavor of wheat but some enjoyable hints of banana and sour apple.  Didn¬ít think i was going to like this much since it was from spaten, but it turned out to be very quaffable.

very good beer refreshing white head 
light malty taste and smell little sweet
head lasted the whole bottle didnt loose its fizz ends with a good hoppy taste
muito boa a cerveja...foi a segunda melhor q provei na alemanha....muito gostosa...avalio tb pela praticidade de se achar uma cerveja para comprar.
Pours light brown. Aroma is slightly yeasty, light malt smells. Initial taste is light and sweet. Over all a smooth beer. Nothing mindblowing, but I¬íd drink it again.
Christmas 2004 gift.  Thick frothy head that held up while drinking. It was cloudy yellow in color. Citrus flavors were evident throughout.  This beer did not impress me.  It did have a hoppy finish.
bottle.  pale, cloudy yellow. lemon citrus flavors.  a nice beer but I¬ím sure it would taste better on a hot summer day.

On tap at Zum Franziskaner, Stockholm. Nice cloudy golden/orange body topped with a thick foamy head. Typical yeasty aroma with spicy and citrusy notes. Taste is fresh and well balanced. Various flavors of yeast, banana, citrus and spices. Ends with a good hoppy finish. Good example of German Weizen.
An above average good german Weisbier. Its refreshing, but lacks a bit of temperment. It¬ís lazy, but still my daily favorite over a pilsner.

A bit boring, typical cloudy golden with white fine head.  Nose was a bit skunky, mouth was watery, clean finish.  I think I nedded a fresher one, unfortunately I still have four skuny ones. hmmm.  Maybe I¬íll revisit.

Another good hefeweizen beer, not as good as I was expecting.  The initial flavor provides great complexity with warming depth.  As the beer settles / warms, there¬ís diminished character.  Flavors remain consistent, instead of wildly diverse and exciting. Recommended, but try enough other German offerings and you will be sure to find one much better.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2006 Bottle.   Good gold color, decent head for the type.  Lemon tinge below the hops.  Odd aroma.  Decent brew, but seemed a little lacking in overall balance.   I guess I am just not a big Hef fan.  

Note:  I drink this on draft this time in Eisenach, Germany . Very different from the bottle I drank before so maybe it was bad lat time. This time it was clean and a cloudy gold, with a big white head. Good nose, and very refreshing. Nice flavor of spices and fruit.   I am re-rating this.
Excellent hefeweizen.  Like all of that type, it¬ís quite heavy.  Good aroma, great taste, very refreshing.  Doesn¬ít need a lemon to survive, unlike others of its ilk.
Cloudy gold color with a medium size white head. Aroma of wheat, cloves and banana. Flavor of wheat, yeast, cloves, banana and citrus. Somewhat tart. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle.  Golden colour, small white head.  Odd wheat like aroma, slightly citrusy.  Some malt base in taste with a crispy mouthfeel and a little hoppiness at the end, but otherwise, pretty average really - enjoyable, but not something I would reach for again.  Thanks for sharing jercraigs.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2006 Hazy medium gold in colour. Clove and banana aroma, with perhaps a bit more weight on the clove side of things. Surprisingly rich texture and full flavors of vanilla, banana, clove, and yeast. Long lasting head too. Very nice indeed
Hazy amber with a weak white head.  Sweet malty, wheaty, fruity aroma.  Somewhat thin and light.  Ther flavor is subtle hoints of wheat and yeast.  So-so.
Clear color with branch glares. Dense foam and of long persistence. Intense taste with mildew aroma. Optimal.
Translucent gold with large white head but very little lacing.Aroma was clean and fresh.A smoky banana taste that was stronger than I expected.But still a good offering.

Hazy golden body witha  good sized fluffy white head. Nice slighty tart wheaty aroma, some mild yeast. Flavour is tart and wheaty with some notes of lemon. Palate is light for a wheat beer but nice. Thanks for the bottle NYSammy.
Another good Hefe. On par with Hacker Pschorr. I¬íd have to have side by side to determine a winner but they seem about the same to me.

Cloves, banana from yeast. Lemon in there. Above average for style. Malt sweetness aftertaste. Less carbonation would work .
 On tap at Blue Tusk.

Light sweet aroma, wheat and yeast notes. Cloudy golden orange,  rocky head.  Light smooth mouthfeel,  clove and light banana notes. Fruity but not very tastefull.  A little bit thin at the end. Overrated, in my opinion.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2004  Very good Hefeweizen.  This beer is much better on tap then out of the bottle.  Very accesible also.  I recommend it highly.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2006 Pours a cloudy yellow, great thick white head. Aroma is very grassy. Taste is the same grassy and hops but a slight irony aftertaste, very very slight banana but not even evident, pretty boring really, but not bad tasting, almost more a pilsner or lager really.

Bottle. Aroma is wheaty, with malt and just a touch of hops. Pours a slightly cloudy pale brown, with a really thick, rich, pillowy light-tan colored head. Head lasts damn near forever. Flavor is fruity, with prominent banana notes and slightly detectable alcohol. Hops is hardly detectable, wither in the aroma or flavor. Light to medium-light carbonation. Probably a repeat buy.
A wheat-n-fruity presence on the nose.  Good malt presence.  Seemed kinda of a light mouth feel, but still heavy on the stomach.  Certianly was crisp in the finish.

Had on tap at some random bar in Munich.  Good head retention though slightly less cloudy than some other wheats in germany.  Nice coppery gold color.  Aroma and flavors are subdued slighty.  Some banana- some clove, and a hint of vanilla at the end with good maltiness and wheat throughout.  Very smooth finish and a nice aftertaste.

My main criticism is that this is a soapy beer. When I first tried it, I hated it, on grounds of this alone. Of course, I also hated Hoegaarden for the same reason. But now I realise, a more mature beerdrinker, that both of these are good beers and Franziskaner is yummy, light, frothy and beautiful. I love the monk on the front.

One of my favorite hefe¬ís. Plus I don¬ít have to go far to get it. ;^) NIce clove flowered maltiness slighlty citrused.
Large white lively bubbled head. Long lasting laciness on a dimpled mug. Not to complex in flavour pretty much straight foward cloves and bananas, perfumed soap I agree. A utility hefe if you will.(common) I like it bunches.

Mmm, mmm, good.  That¬ís what the happy little monk says on the front of this bottle.  It¬ís a full, complex brew, wheaty and malty.  However, it has a soapy twinge, but not in a bad way.  A good brew.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Update, and a long time coming.  Used to be one of my classic default beers, and I still enjoy it, only it¬ís not as good as I once thought it¬ís was in my younger years.  The need to finally update this rating comes from having it on tap at Lowenbrau in Munich.  Pours as a hazy gold in color with a nice creamy head.  Taste is light, sweet and fulfilling.  Easy to pick up traces of bananas and cloves, with subtle accents of oranges and a little bit of vanilla in the background.  Refreshingly effervescent.  Great, sweet and clean finish.  A solid rendation.

12 ounce green bottle, as in the posted picture, purchased from Wilbur¬ís Wine & Spirits in Fort Collins, CO  Lovely cloudy-orange beer with a huge head that lasted the whole glass, with lots of sticky lacing.  Pronounced lemon-yeast aroma, with a hint of something warm -- maybe clove?  Taste was really delightful -- mild, citrus with a touch of yeasty banana, and a lingering spicey, almost peppery clove-like aftertaste. Not as heavy as Paulaner or Weihenstephaner -- milder, less forward, and a bit less hops bitterness.
Amazing mouthfeel for this style of beer: quite smooth and rounded.
