At 5.0%, and such a pleasant taste, you could drink these comfortably for a long session.
A really nice beer.  Not quite as thick as some weissbiers.  Still, though, a nice, swet and fruity taste.  I agree with other comments that notice a hint of banana.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour with a large, white foamy head. Aroma is banana and cloves. Some banana in the taste but mostly citrus, with a slight sour edge. Medium mouthfeel, quite highly carbonated. Smooth, clean and very drinkable. Very good weissbier.
UPDATED: JAN 30, 2006 It tastes awesome!, since I tasted weize bier for the first time, I felll in love with them. This one is excellent.

Full-bodied; the flavor lingers and is shooth but sparkling.  Thick yeast-y carbonation as is the style. Bananas and cloves sums it up very nicely.  Mildly citrus flavored but not bitter or acidic. A very nice Hefeweizen. Smell doen¬ít match the flavor but this is the olny bad mark I could find to give it.

Pours a cloudy yellow body with a frothy white head the taste has hints of bananas, a little bit of citrus, and a very clean finish. I¬ím growing to love wheat beer more and more and this is one of the best I¬íve had in a while. When you can get the chance to buy this stuff at $1.99 a pint go for it!
Poured a cloudy yellow with a big off-white head. Citrusy and fruity nose. Clove, cinnamon, banana, grain, and lemon the tongue. Nice lingering aftertaste. My favorite beer in its style.

Granted, I haven¬ít tried many hefeweizens, but this tasted quite lovely. Bananas, a little bit of citrus, and a nice clean finish. Since I¬ím a student, at $7.50 for 6 12 ounce bottles, I¬íd say that this is a damn good deal.

Pours cloudy yellow with nice lasting white head.  Banana spice to nose and an underlying new hay smell.  Flavor is more banana, some citrus, cloves, not allspice like the Paulaner.  Finishes with lingering slightly overripe banana flavor.  Aftertaste is refreshing and a little malty.  Overall very good.

A cloudy yellow body with a frothy white head, this looked good enough to drink.  The mild grassy aroma with a hint of fruitiness was an enticement as well.  Nice tart lemony taste with solid spicing as well.  Clean tart finish.  Great warm weather drink.  Great in all seasons.

Hazy, straw-yellow color,
enormous, pillowy white head: so far, the perfect look for a hefe weizen.
Aroma: fresh, flowery, dry, loaded with lemon.
Light and smooth, with a good, grainy texture.
Marvelous fruity flavor, with the requisite Bavarian banana/clove character really showing itself more in the middle, and rides on out through the end.
Wonderfully refreshing, thirst-quenching, damned-easy quaffability.
Belongs among the top tier of weizens: ah, delicious!

That was the first nonlager beer that I ever tasted. It remains a sentimental favorite. The first time I tried it, I drank it fast, and from a bottle. I hated it then, thought it was too lemony, spicey and generally undrinkable, I expected to see it bashed on sites like this, but I¬íve seen only really positive reviews of it. That got me thinking, and I realized that the problem wasn¬ít in the beer, but in the way I was drinking it, tried it again, this time sipping it slowly from a glass, and the taste opened up to me. And I loved it. It¬ís smooth,a bit yeasty, and looks a bit murky, amd the banana taste lingers a bit in the background.

12oz Bottle: Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a head that dissapears rather quickly. Fruity smell, somewhat like bananas. Fairly smooth taste, with a surprising bite far an aftertaste. Overall a very good Weissbier.
(30 Apr 04) Light yeasty aroma with a hay/straw malt and a hint of clove.  The body is murky yellow with citrus flavours.
Classic hefeweizen. Very smooth and fruity (banana ). With Paulaner the best hefeweizen, I think.
Second best in a flight of wheats at the Flying Saucer in Memhis:  really malty and on the sweet side for a wheat beer, otherwise, classic for the style.

This hefe weizen poured a hazy amber color with a full head and nice lace. The head diminished quickly, but the carbonation kept coming to give it a fresh bite throughout. It has a fruity smell (bananas), yet tastes more citrus. The taste was smooth with a biting finish. This hefe weizen is refreshing and lively.
Bottle; Pours a cloudy golden yellow.  Great yeasty aroma, flavor is light and refreshing.  Yeasty and fruity.  A bit thin, but good nonetheless.

(on bottle)Strange roasty notes with the sents of Brussels sprouts. Very full mouth of yeasts and whiped-cream-likefullness. (The mates tells me that the Brussels sprouts are still there, but I don¬¥t think so)Very good carbonation and a good, wheaty finish.

Pours a cloudy orangy yellow, with a thick white head. Aroma is straight up bannana, with a little wheat. 
Flavor is fruity, peppery, with a lemony finish.

Poura a nice cloudy orange with a big lasting head.  Aroma is very creamy and yeasty.  Flavor is like a nice fresh batch of banana¬ís.  I also get lots of yeast and a very bitter flavor like lemon.  Very smooth and drinkable and probably one of my favorite hefe¬ís.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2005 From a bottle at Yeoman¬ís Road Pub in Tampa. This is one of my favorite Hefeweizens. Pours a beautiful hazy golden color. Ample head and a hearty yeasty aroma. Tastes like liquid hay. Earthy and substantial tasting in the mouth. Extremely drinkable.

Probably would enjoyed tthis more if Bennigan¬ís had anything close to proper gassware to show the head. Lots of fruit in the aroma. Crisp flavor that paired well with the fish, lots of the banana and clove characteristics in this one/

Was able to get a hold of some fresh bottles, and Spaten¬ís weiss is best of the Munich brewers save Schneider.  Nice banana, phenolic and fruit aroma. Perfect thick white head. Very smooth finish that¬ís wonderfully refreshing.  One of the best.

thick white head that stays well.  Pours a cloudy gold color.  it has a spicy pepper taste mixed with some banana and prune. It goes down smooth and has kind of a yeasty, bread-like finish.  An enjoyable spicy beer.

Smells sweet, bananas, pours dark hazy gold with frothy white head.  Tastes only mildly bitter and like bananas.  Has longer finish then I would have liked.  Goes down and feel pretty good.  Overall not bad, but to me not much different than the Sam Adams one.  This is probably due to the fact that I don¬ít like this type of beer all that much.

In the bottle. I picked this up in Bristol, VA. Kids, this is a nice Hefe. Delightfully cloudy even though I suspect that my yeast-caked bottle was pretty darn old. Beautiful full head. Aroma of cloves. Pepper was the dominant first flavor to bite the tongue. Then a wave of wheat that mercifully blankets the spark. I don¬ít find this to be very tart at all. This is light years better than the Club Weisse.
Pours a nice cloudy, almost orange color. Has a big long lasting foamy white head. Smells kind of fruity. Has a nice fruity taste to it with a bit of a spicy kick. Sweet and a litlle tart.

Cloudy yellow color, big white head. Yeasty, strong banana aroma. Also carbonated banana flavor, hops come up in the end too. Carbonation makes beer crispy, feels good. Aftertaste is lasting banana. I¬ím not very big friend of Hefeweizens, still this is good in it¬ís style.

I very nice and refreshing beer. Hazy  orange and gold, yeasty and estery but not at all cloying. The wheat charcter is just right (for me). Spicy with a nice citrus backbone and handles a lemon slice well if you choose to add it.

Had this at Pappys in Panama City, bottle.  Wonderful Hefeweizen appearance, yellow-orange and hazy with a bright white head. Aroma of wheat, fruit, citrus, sweet malts and spicy hops. Flavor of golden roasted grains, lemon, cardamom, cumin, and pepper with a sweet-n-sour finish. Nice medium body but the carbonation was a little aggressive. Overall a good beer and nice drinking experience!
Deep golden cloudiness...thick head...subtle banana aroma...bitter finish...nothing really interesting...
UPDATED: APR 10, 2005 Hazy golden color, light fruity aroma and taste, medium body, fresh light bitter finish.
A very good german weissbier.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2004 Cloudy golden color with a thick head. Citric tones in the flavor but more subdued in the aroma which is dominated by the wheat. Crisp in mouth, overall extremely refreshing and thirst quenching. Pouring from bottle is extremely important on this beer, since yeast tends to add unwanted bitterness.
One of the few beers where the bottled version is superior to the tap.

On tap at the Bavarian Grill.  hazy/cloudy deep yellow with a fat marshmallow head. banana aroma. also has a slight banana taste. not much to this flavor, it¬ís wheaty and a little bland. very slight bitterness at finish that is almost unnoticeable.
Very good hefe.  The aroma had a banana/bubble gum combo.  Citrus flavor.  The color was a nice medium golden color with a good white head on top.
I prefer this Hefe-Weize over the Paulaner (or any American Weiss Bier knock off). A very nice wheat taste, cloudy orange color, one of my fav. Hefe-Weize beers.

Hazy light orange color, topped with a massive, dense white head.  Banana is the most dominant aroma, with a little lemon.  Very soft wheat beer.  The hops weren¬ít very spicy, but just a little bit citrusy.  The wheat flavors were evenly balanced and not too rich.  Easy drinkin¬í.

Unfiltered yellow appearance with a large, fluffy head.   Banana aroma and taste was not as pronounced as in some other German hefe¬ís; wheat, citrus and spices are more prevelant.  Creamy mouthfeel develops from the medium-bodied flavor.  Crisp, dry finish.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2006 Pours hazy golden with a big fizy white head. Lots of carbontation. Taste is clove/spice with light citrus. Not as over the top as some hefes. Well done.

Nice gold color with a monster head.  Aroma of wheat.  Taste is just more wheat with some malt mixed in.  Just a hint of yeast and fruit.  It is what it is: a hefeweizen.  Not too bad; a decent way to celebrate 400!
Gold Coloring.  Big Frothy Head.  Very good Hefe.  Not Really Distinctive.  Just Nice and Mellow...Could be Drank in Succession.
Cloud gold in color with huge white head and noticable yeast. Smells of fruit, cloves, and spices. Didn¬ít seem as fruity as other hefes. Kind of had a more watery taste to it with some lemon.
Nice, malty, yeasty, fruity and wheat flavor; dry in the back end; lively palate; pretty good.

Pours a beautiful hazy but not cloudy orange color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is mild and yeasty with mild orange presence. Flavor is of course yeasty, but very subtle in the fruit and spice department. Very clean tasting with lively little bubbles and a lemony aftertaste. This is a good hefe for sure.

light cloudy yellow color.
thick creamy foam head.
sweet candy bannana aroma and taste.
a little to strong of a sweet flavor  for me.
I dont really like wheat beers but this wasnt to bad.
A truly good weizen. Not very heavy but the body is full flavored with tones of spices and fruit. Drank it in the summer time and it went very well with food. The best weizen ive had to date.
A great tasting beer.  A bit sweet, yet still has a dark taste.  Very good tasting beer and satisfying
A yellow-golden, slightly cloudy body with a big white head.  Nose of spices, bananas, and yeast, typical of hefes.  Very refreshing and spicy taste.  One of the best hefes I¬íve had.

On tap in Moscow.  This beers pours into a beautiful cloudy golden color with a large wheat beer head.  It smells of bananas and other yeastyness.  Drinks smooth and very nice.  I usually don¬ít like wheat beers, but the offerings from Franziskaner have made me re-evaluate my opinions.

Cloudy gold in appearance.  Aroma bursted with banana but I didn¬ít pick up much clove.  The flavor agreed with huge banana up front followed by a slightly sweet after taste.  Was a touch watery on the palate.  Overall an excellent effort true to style.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [bottle - Great European Beerfest 8, Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Pours a very rich gold color with a decent white head that left nice lacing. Very faint citrus aroma, mostly lemon and orange with a hint of yeast. Initial taste is a citrus zest with a yeast and wheat mixture making up the body and a sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2011 Overall a good hefeweizen - though a few still outshine it, you really can not go wrong with a Franzy. +++This time I sampled it from a 16.9 oz brown bottle. This beer poured a beautiful cloudy orange-golden color that whets the appetite with anticipation.  The large white head has a slight orange tinge to it as well. There is a faint scent of orange peel. The scent is very pleasant but extremely faint. The flavor was very bready and yeasty. An orange peel flavor definitely shone through. A sweet yeasty aftertaste lingered.

unfortunately, green bottle.  heavy aroma of yeast, banana, citrus, spice, wheat.  frothy white head on a couldy color somewhere between orange and tan.  very tangy and sweet flavors, bready yeast still present.  very clean finish, with a pleasant finish.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2007 Nice cloudy gold. Large bubbly white head. Sparse lacing. Aromas of yeast and wheat. Some citrus. Banana and clove. Flavors are citrus (orange) and more banana. Peppery spices. Coriander maybe. Malts and wheat are abundant. There is subtle yeast hanging around there.  The palate is crisp and refreshing, the body is nice and light and bubbly and it finishes with spice and fruits.
Bottle: Cloudy golden, heavy long lasting white head. Aroma is sweet with clear notes of yeast and it¬¥s taste is also sweet, spicy with lemon traces. Refreshing, well balanced a good brew.

I really liked this hefeweizen. Poure a cloudy brownish orange, pretty carbonated for a hefe ... lots of tiny bubbles making their way from bottom to top. Head was medium sized, white and lasted a good while. Thick creamy lace all around the glass. Aroma is yeasty with hints of banana and wheat. Taste is very nice, all wheat, fruit and malt with a lightly sweet finish. Feels very silky in the mouth and you can detect the light sting of carbonation. All in all, a very good hefeweizen, in my estimation.

Bottle into Weizen glass.  I¬ím not inclined to get weis beers, but it was this or Miller Lite, so I thought I¬íd try it out.  Overall, I would say that it was inoffensive, but unimpressive.  Even though I don¬ít usually like weis beers, I like them to try to be the best beers they can.  This one was weak and watered down it seemed to me.  The aroma was the best part, citrusy with some harsh hoppy biting accent.  Orange and hazy in the glass, it had a sizeable white head with ok lacing.  Initally, you taste the acidity but it¬ís not that smooth.  Then, feeble and underdeveloped orange and lime flavors emerge and disappear quickly to be replaced by the wheaty aftertaste that wasn¬ít that strong.  Still, better than Miller Lite.

Cloudy orange/gold and quite still.  Aromas are sweet malts, candy, wheat, spices and banana.  Flavours also have the banana and cloves along with some yeastiness and fruit.  Has a nice dry finish.  Sticks to the roof of the mouth - in a good way.

Bottle. I bought it at a supermarket. Deep straw colored. Not as complex as I expected but very smooth and easy to drink. Quite nice gentle aroma that I wished was more apparent. Great mouth feel and finish.

Orange with a persistent foamy head. Sweet aroma with a little cloves. Flavour is dominated by abundant corriander or cloves, however there is a lemon influence in the finish. Reasonably complex for a hefe.

Seriously hazy honey gold with a large fine bubbled snowy white head. Aroma is faint citrus floral and sourdoughy when cool while a faint fruity estery develops as it warms. Mild light watery body. Flavours are rather weak malty grain with hint of spices and sourdough when cool with slightly sweeter and more sourdoughy as it warms. Finish is a soft mushy white bread. I definitely prefer the bigger Maisels or the classier Weihenstephaner.
This wheat has a banana/clove dominance, in both the aroma, and on the tongue.  The taste is full from start to finish. Carbonation and head are strong, palate is lively.

Rich brown pour with a huge head.  Good lacing on the glass. Small amounts of spice in the aroma.  Flavor was well developed with hardly any after taste. Spice in the flavor. Texture was nice, nothing too abrasive.  A great anytime beer. Very drinkable.

The colour was murky, light orange/straw with a good size white head. Aroma was of cloves to me. The taste firstly was soft banana and a little bubblegum, in the middle came a little lemon and zest and then the cloves reappeared finally it was a little watery at the end. Texture is slightly oily and the body was firm and medium. Very enjoyable!

bottle.  Light sediment present, but not much.  Moderate white head, light orange body.  Little aroma, some lemon and water.  Flavor is dull, watery, tastes like watered down bubble gum and clove, with little spicy hops and hardly any sweetness.  Maybe I got a bad bottle, but hard to believe that, this stuff has been refrigerated.  Will try again.

Cloudy golden to yellow body, the classic nig hefe weizen head. Nothing special about it. Aroma is very yeasty, citus and grape hints too, banana, spices and clove. The flavor is yeasty and wheaty, but i couldnt get much out of it. Very drinkable.

Bottle:  Yeasty, citrusy aroma.  Pours a cloudy yellowish-orangish with a large white head with very good retention.  Strongest flavor is the banana, but a very good balance with the citrus, cloves and spices.  Slightly sour finish.  Not much aftertaste.  Very carbonated.
Bottle.  Poured a thick head, nice lacing.  Aroma of spice and yeast.  Taste is of wheat and a little spice.  Not bad at all.

Cloudy yellow with a big pillowy white head. Nice wheat and esther aroma. The flavor is very nice with a nutty wheat up front then banana and finishing with more wheat. Body is medium and smooth. A real drinkable beer.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 Bottle - Nice banana/citrus malt aroma.  Cloudy orange yellow with giant head.  Very nice banana, clove and malt flavor - well blended.  A very fruity Weizen - a very consistent beer .
This one is a little to heavy on the banana and cloves for me. I¬íll stick with weihenstephaner.

a fine beer to break in my newly eBought weizen glass.  a beautiful looking beer.  dense white head that diminishes but stays around for the ride... lemon, wheat aroma. soft on the palate.  malty, sweet, citrus.  one of the finest hefe weizens i¬íve had.

A very fine brew. Pours somewhat of a cloudy orange color with a HUGE white head. Taste is sweet, spicey, malty, yeasy and wheaty with some banana. Feels like a Belgian Witbier to me. Not my favorite style, but still good.
Draft. Hazy pale golden color with a big head. Citrus and yeast aroma. Well done wheat beer with a bit of clove spiciness and a light wheat taste.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2004 bought this, the club-weiss, and the dunkel.  this is the best of the bunch.  pours hazy brown color with a huge white head.  smells nice, tastes pretty good.  an all in all good hefe that is readily avalible- infact i was surprised i had never drank this before.  not the best hefe ive had, but by far not the worst.  good beer

bottle 05.01.04  Pale, hazy golden (yellowish); not as rich looking as the commercial pic and I¬ím using a big tulip glass so it should be darker?  Big ol¬í frothy, foamy head that jsut won¬ít quit.  Aromas are light and brisk - floral yeasts, fresh herbs, hay.  Flavor is calm, subdued, soft maltiness but nice and crisp.  Palate is alive and tingly with carbonation, but not fizzy.  I never did find much spice, shouldn¬ít there be some?  Vanilla begins to blossom on finish as beer warms.  Nice clean finish.  Good, readily available beer.
A nice brown color. A delicious spicy brew. Had the clove flavor of a belgian. I definitly enjoyed this.
Had it on tap at a German Restaurant, a good restaurant in fact.  Nice beer. Banana and clove flavors. Spicey. good beer.Cloudy yellow in color.
Tiene ligero sabor afrutado. Tienes que servirlo batiendo un poco la botella para aprovechar la espuma.
tap-Hazy golden beer with light aroma of spices and bananas, which come out nicely in mouthfeel, with more pronounced spices. lighter bodied beer.
Hazy yellow with a large frothy head. Aroma is wheaty and lemony. Flavour is crisp wheat and citrus. Nicely malted but not too sweet.

The green bottle probably didn't help this one. Aroma was grass and lemons. Appearance was a cloudy yellow. Flavor was bananas, lemons, and wheat with a slight skunk character. It was ok but little else.

On tap at Mt Angel brewery in Oregon.
Very nice sour wheat and honeyish aroma, very appetizing.
The beer is a pale hazy orange in colour with a small wispy pure white head.
The taste is very fresh and light, some bananas and honey,  the taste is not as pronounced as Paulaner Hefe, but its good.
It seems a little carbonated, but its actually ok.
This was very drinkable with the Smoked ribs I had. A nice summer beer.

I think I had a few to many of these last night, because I feel like a Bag of Ass today! Being that my girlfriend is out of town, I think one of her friends was trying to pick me up. She was buying me this beer one after another, seriously forcing me to drink them; but I¬ím a trustworthy lad, I went home alone!   
 Poured with a pale copper body and a thick creamy white head. The aroma was tart with lemon, and yeast. Flavor was citric and big notes of clove and banana. The palate is oily and the finish is tart, crisp, citric and dry.  My head hurts, and I need a nap.

Beer pours slightly cloudy golden color with a massive off white head that is nicely retained.  Aroma is very nice with elements of banana, clove, and other spices.  Excellent flavor as well.  Nice banana flavor, wheat of course, and just a dash of spice.  I will be drinking many of these this summer.

Slightly cloudy, light yellow appearance.  Fluffy white head that can get out of control if you pour it too fast.   Aroma is mostly banana with a little yeast.  Taste is predominantly banana with hints of wheat and cloves.  Moderate carbonation on the tongue.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Above average brew, rather cheap as well.
My friend Paul drinks this stuff cause its German and it makes him feel special, dont ask. I like the aftertaste, sweet yet dry. Good all around.

pours a soft dark orange with a thick off-white head.  The aroma is distinctive to the style, but slightly sweeter than normal, with citrusy tinges. the flavor is very citric and not as sharp as the smell would indicate. very nice package overall.

Light aroma of citrus, bread, clove ... Head diminishes rather quickly, capping the cloudy/amber appearance of your typical Weisse ... Flavor is very smooth, with a bready/doughy taste to it.  A light, hoppy bite towards the end adds crispness, but overall, it isn't anything special ... A bit disappointing on the palate, leaving a hint of bread on the tongue ... Overall, I'd rate this as subpar compared to other Franziskaner brews I've sampled.  Not bad, but there are far better hefes out there.

El jefe of hefes for me. Perhaps not quite that high above others, but rates this place for the simple reason of being not only good, but my first of the style.  Yes, we have bananas .. and a very nice finish.

An easy to drink hefeweizen. Quite soft and refreshing, not overpowering in any way. Has the essential banana and clove flavors along with some lemony zing. A little bit on the sweet side. A good summer quaffer.
Cloudy deep golden color with a medium dense white head. Aroma is sweet with banana and yeast. Flavor is of bananas,sweet wheat tang and mild clove. A damn good hefe.

Bottle pours a nice and cloudy yellow with a monster head, no lace.  The aroma is yeasty and banana.  The flavor is sweet with a major banana component.  There is a refreshing wheat driven side that dances well with the banana sweetness.  The palate feels real good and makes for a refreshing Hefeweizen.  Overall, this is very, very good.

Poured it out after rolling the 1 pint .9 oz bottle between my palms.  Looks the part with pale straw yellow-gold colored body that is very cloudy with a 3 inch tall head and an onslaught of carbonation.  The smell is dominated by bananas.  The taste is a mix of bananas and cloves and is ultra-refreshing in its simplicity.  It lacks the spicy zing of Weihenstephaner, but is good in its own unabashed fruity way.

Bottled. 
Hazy yellow, rich cotton-like head. Faint aroma of banana. Smoothly malty with a fresh, fruitiness. Notes of clove and banana.

Bottle
Perfect big white foamy head! Typical hazy orange weizen color as well as sweet banana aroma. Smooth palate, taste is weizen-like sweet banana with citron flavor bitterness. Dry finish. This is another excellent hefeweizen!

Pours a hazy orange color, topped by a thick off white head.  Aromas of clove, banana, and citrus waft from my glass.  The taste is tar, acidic, and it has a soft banana finish.  This beer is well carbonated, which contributes to a tingly sharp sensation in my mouth.  This is quite good, and quite refreshing.  Certainly not the most complex, but it is quite tasty and hits the spot perfectly on a warm day spent outside brewing beer.  Quite fruity, with a bit of sweetness.  This beer is light bodied, which helps it to go down easily.  This is as good as it gets for warm weather/ in the sun drinking; smooth and thirst quenching.

Bottle from Metro Wines, Syston, Leicestershire. Delicious aroma - bubblegum and bread. A vision in gold and orange, with a towering white head. Superb flavour - bubblegum again, banana and marzipan. Refreshing and balanced - the initial sweetness relaxes into a level, crisp, full yeastiness. An excellent beer.
Thick white head, with a clody yellow body. Strong clove and citric aroma. Flavor follows the same profile as the aroma. No noticeable banana taste.

Draft. Cloudy yellow gold color with a small head. Hard to really tell by the plastic mugs they serve at Goat Hill. Nose was typical hefe, banana, clove and citrus. Taste was wheat and lemon. Kinda thin for my liking.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2006 This one improved from my initial evaluation. Nice Hazy pale gold/lemon color, as a good weissbeer should have, aroma hints of orange and lemon.  Dominating flavors of citrus and clove.  An excellent Weissbier!

Thick white head that lasts. Cloudy medium golden color. Light aroma of bananas and spice. Full bodied brew with plenty of carbonation. Sharp wheat flavor. Yeasty aftertaste fades quickly. Nice and lacy all the way down the glass.
Nice dark color and a little cloudy, strong head.  Another excellent hefeweizen available for a reasonable price.
Hazy yellow color with a nice thick head. Fruity and yeasty aroma with a taste of fruits and clove. An inexpensive hefe-weizen. Good.
smelled like skunk to me. la la la. Grain, Hay, Straw, Cereal. 18 oz bottle. ben likes this beer.

What a lovely beer!This beer started my beer hunting career a few years ago in Stockholm on holiday.It is still one of my favourit beers.It has a huge head and a slightly cloudy body.It has a lovely wheatbeer smell and taste and a long bittery aftertaste.It¬¥s an enjoyment from the first sip to the last.A great beer.

(Bottled) Nice, very murky yellow color, big foamy head. Strong yeasty, soapy, banana aroma. Yeasty, fruity (banana, pear) flavor. Sweetish at first, but finishes sour. Nicely balanced, soft palate. An excellent weizen, very good all-year round!
Bottle - A hazy yellow color with huge white head. Very strong banana aroma that lingers on every sip. A full-flavored hefe that does not dissapoint.

Served in a 400 ml. tumbler, from a 500 ml. bottle.

A "dirty" yellow beer with a very big foamy head...quite murky.

Smells of slightly stale bananas. 

A very long-lasting, lovely banana-like after-taste.

I'm hardly experienced in the Hefeweizen department but, this is well worth a try.

Bottle pours a hazy yellow with an extremely foamy white head. ¬† Lacing is sticky, carbonation is very active.  ¬† Aroma is of banana and yeast. ¬† Taste yields banana and cereal flavors.  ¬† Mouthfeel seems a bit thin. ¬† Finish is lacking... perhaps a slight pear flavor. ¬† Not as wheaty in taste and mouthfeel as I would have hoped.
Nice hazy gold color as is expected in a good Hefeweizen. Rich head and nice aroma of yeast, wheat and fruity banana. Smooth and filling. Very refreshing. Not the best, but a very good one.
Hazy golden colour with big and lasting head. Aroma is of wheat. Flavor is very nice, with hints of banana. Palate is good with a nice smoothness.
Hazy golden color with big fluffy white head. Aroma is of wheat with hints of clove. Flavor is clean and crisp wheat with a hint of banana, and touches of cloves and all-spice. Very solid hefe.

Deep golden color with a nice fine head that faded away fairly quickly.

Nose is malty/yeasty with promise of spicy esters.

Bold assertive taste with citrus, malt and a softer wheat edge than most (I find the wheat wang to be a bit offensive sometimes).  Nice delicate spiciness--lemon, nutmeg, hints of clove?

A very nice Hefe.
Wonderfully cloudy and  golden.  I agree with mip it was quite yeasty smelling as well as in the taste.  It had a chewiness to it, and it is almost doughy in mouthfeel. Very good hefeweizen.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2005 Bottle. Bright and cloudy. Nice white head. Lovely fruity, yeasty smell. Tastes like it smells, only a bit more acidic.
Huge Head! A weiss eeer glass is s must with this stuff. a an excellent brew but still a hair below the weihenstephaner.
pours with a huge slowly diminishing frothy white head. slightly fruity taste, but not at all sweet. not the hugest flavor ever, but what's there is crisp and clean.

on tap us/munich and in the bottle:
this is a classic german hefewiezen that america has tried to emulate a thousand times but just cant get it right...its in the yeast boys! anyone thats has this knows this is one of the best 'wheat beers'...nice and murky with a huge frothy head...great classic german banana clove and bready flavor. get this one for a hot day!

Cloudy light brown beer witha huge off white head. Weak spicy, roasted caramel and hop aroma. The taste is light bitter with a dry aftertaste. A very nice thirst quencher but not much of a taste. All in all a nice beer on a warm summer's day.
Pretty typical heffeweizen.  Orange in color, large frothy head.  Sour flavor with banana and clove.

A great representation of the style. Nice and murky light amber-gold color. A little band-aid/ plastic aroma with nice graprfruit notes. The flavor is full and as Braudog says, definitely has a strong banana flavor.Mine poured with a quickly dissapating head.

A cascading waterfall of bubbles form the huge slowly settling impenetrable head over a cloudy light orange beer.  Classic banana aroma.  The flavor is creamy and banana-dominant with an excellent spicy finish.  Classic weizen ... the standard in type.

Quite cloudy, good head retention.
Aroma dominated by clove, some banana, faint vanilla.
Flavour has some of that soft maltiness but there is a pronounced hop flavour and a fair bit of tropical fruit (pineapple mostly) in the finish. Also, I know it's supposed to be highly carbonated, but this was way too fizzy, which made it hard to drink. Not the worst Hefe, but miles from the best.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2004 This is one of the best beers I ever had in my whole life! Because is made with wheat its flavor is quite unique among the rest of the beers in the market. Its presentation is very appealing...I just love the funny monk on the label taking his drink! Excellent beer.

On tap at the Beer Sellar in Knoxville, TN. A very good Hefe. Cloudy yellow/orange color with a nice white head. Wheat and yeast in the aroma. Wheat and banana in the flavor. Good beer. Glad I tried this!
A good Hefeweizen - fruity and lightly sweet. Not too dry. Cloudy orange in appearance with a fruity/wheat-straw nose. A decent white head tops it nicely. Pretty good stuff.
Cloudy yellow with a foamy white head.  Strong wheat aroma and flavor.  Aroma also hints of yeast.  The flavor is acidic and leaves an astringent feel on the palate.  Very crisp beer.

This beer is about as fruity as Richard Simmons.

But, of course, I mean that in a good way.

I think this is my first German hefe. I broke my self-imposed boycott of German products because it was on sale. 
< hanging head in shame >

Pours very cloudy, very nice head and *lots* of carboneation. Smells of fruit; bananas and pears come to mind.

Taste is very good. I was expecting something more like a Widmer but I was pleasantly suprised. The fruit flavors really come alive.

It's very carbonated, my tongue seemed to bubble even after a couple of swallows hence.

This is a good beer. I also picked up the other version of this (starts with a D?) from the same brewery. I'm looking forward to comparing the two.
Beautiful tall white head and a cloudy golden body. Aroma is yeast with some citrus and banana. Flavor is also yeasty with banana. A little bitter aftertaste. Soft palate.

0.5 L bottled. Light yellow colour with an aroma containing some citrus/lemon as well as yeast. Flavour containing elements of lemon in good balance with bitterness and sweetness with a long aftertaste. Very good.
I really must say that most of the weissbiers are the same to me. This one is not an exception. Yeasty, sweet and not very refreshing to me.

Pretty head that doesn't taste bad either.  Needs to warm up a bit after chilling to release the almost sweet and sour spicy taste with a hint of celery seed.  It's the perfect drink to complement PA Dutch Potpie and one of my favorite lunch beers.
(Draught) Pours a ocre, cloudy body and a white head. Nice lacing. Strong banana nose. Hollow banana flavour however. Lasting finish.

Bottle. Cloudy golden color with a nice big fluffy head. Aroma was yeasty and banana. The flavor was of crisp malt banana. And not just a little bit of banana. They may have disovled a whole banana in that bottle. I've never really liked super fruity beers, but I love bananas and this one was very different than a boring fruit beer like Magic Hat 9. Great beer.
Clean & crisp with little atertaste.  Lots of tiny bubbles throughout.  Citrus and bread aromas.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2011 Cloudy yellow with lasting, bubbly white head. Banana/yeast  aroma with a hint of smokiness. The flavour is a sweet banana hell. No balance just banana esters. At least no brewing flaws though.
Clear yellow with a small fizzy white head. Mild wheat aroma and light wheat flavor with cloves. Mild fruit notes. Nice.

While not as stunning as say Hacke Pshorre or Weihenshephaner, this beer is great. Nice cloudy color, rich semi sweet taste. Defintly a classic wheat which is my fave. I taste a little pear in this one. Quite good.
Thick fluffy. Yellow/orange color. Very crisp, clean and refreshing. Nice hints of banana. Good lace.

Amazing cloudiness and wonderful smooth taste.  I enjoy a pint of this stuff nearly every week at the neighborhood bar.  Add a lemon near the end to give it a little something else.  So smooth and delicious, a little fruity.  The most beautiful glass and amazing color.

I think I was a little surprised at first at how highly this was rated, because the subtlety is strongly suppressed at even a bit colder than ideal.  Big, white head, more regular and slightly larger bubbles than the Club-Weisse, dark yellow/brown/amber, mildly hazy (not deeply so).  Quite light aroma relative to the flavors, with yeast and wheat being strong.  The flavors are nice when it is warm enough, spicy and fruity, bananas, light pepper touch, gentle clove, perhaps a bit of bubblegum.  Like the Club-Weisse, also, the palate improves as it warms, from the initial watery bleakness to a soft, fluffy carbonation with enough citrus sensibilities to think someone chucked in some lemon zest.  Still, a bit flat, but the flavors are good.  Somehow I would think the ideal hefeweizen would have those flavors at a slightly colder temperature than is required for this one to reveal itself.

Cloudy in texture and aromatic like dried potpurri flowers.  The beer itself is not opaque which is a little suprising for a beer that is fairly light in taste.  I can't see my fingers through the other end of the glass.  Fluffy head.  I taste fruitiness, citrusy... peach, lemons, orange peel.  Decent beer with a little bite.

Had this draft, poured with a nice head. Cloudy light color. Smelled a bit fruity, plums/raisins/bananas? Nice carbonation, pleasant taste, I imagine this would go down well on a hot day. A bit subdued on the finish, little left to savor. Not my favorite style, but tasty just the same.

Bought a single pint.9 bottle that was very well priced (under $2). Tall, thick head atop golden lager.  Smelled great and tasted easy, relaxing, and refeshing.   Tiny bubbles.  I will buy again, especially at this price.

Have tried this one several times. Sweet and strong aroma, light yellow cloudy color, large head - fine bubbles. The yeast taste was stronger than the wheat taste (reminded me a little of pale Belgian ale). I have the good fortune of living near a resteurant that serves it on tap in 17 oz glasses ("Settlers Bay", Watertown, WI). The last time that I was there I had 4 glasses and was feeling pretty good by the time we left.... thinking that the alchohol content must be higher than 5.0, but who knows :)

Light cloudy amber color with plenty of head.  Nice orange, sour apple smell with a light bubbly palate.
Nice smooth, light summer beer with a mild sour after taste.

Cloudy yellow lager. Huge, white, frothy head.
The nose is of clove, grapefruit, underripe banana and white bread.
The flavor is well-balanced; fruity and yeasty; lemon, dough and straw.
Thin and watery with lively carbonation. Short, refreshing finish.

Very hazy golden colour with a nice white head. VERY strong aroma banana aroma with mixes of cloves and coriander seed. Fantastic look and smell! Medium-light bodied; Strong spicey (the two aformentioned notes as well as curacao) but very clean with yeast and wheat characteristics. Aftertaste very clean and refreshing. Overall, a great German wheat - really one to savour. I actually had this one (I just realised it) at the Frankfurt Airport (Lufthansa terminal) well before I was 21! I had this beer on draught at MacGregor's in Rochester, New York on 21-October-2003.
Hazy golden color with a thick white head. The taste is sweet and fruity with a yeasty note.  Nice on a hot summerday.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2010 Nice light yellow, bit hazy, big ol¬í head.  Aroma of cloves, bubble gum, and lemons.  Nicely carbonated, lively, but no bite.  The malt was thinner than I remembered, with the wheat flavors quite subdued.  Yeast flavors dominate, namely cloves and some fruitiness, namely mandarin orange.  Wish the wheat was more up front.  RERATE:  Draft at Michael Minas¬í Sea Blue in Las Vegas.  Got this to go with the "fried trio" of crab cake, chicken empanadas, and other random fried seafood item I can¬ít recall off the top of my head.  Worked nicely for that, and I must say, flavors were essentially as I remembered, although I picked up lemon as opposed to mandarin orange.  Rating remains the same.  I nice, albeit light, weisse.
Pale yellow, a good example of the style.  I find that it tastes better when I invert the bottle once or twice before opening.
Typical blonde weissbier. Banana dominates the nose. Good malt flavor. A touch of hops in the background. I have a hard time distinguishing this from many of the other true weissbiers.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Here is one of, in my opinion the top 10¬¥s among the German Weissbiers. Beautifully coloured, a firm head and a fullbodied ending with lots of bitter-sour sweetness.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2004 Deep orange color. Cloudy. Looks so delicious. Citric nose. Tastes very well-balanced. Yeasty, citric, fruity. Goes down very smooth. I think it¬¥s the best of the very easily avaible Weizens. Rerate: After drinking hundreds of bottles of this beer I¬¥ve probably got to rate it higher,  and it never ceased to amaze me, so a couple more points are justified.

Cloudy pale orange. Nice white head. Smells of wheat, coriander and lemon. Tastes of licorice and bubble gum, tiny hint of citrys. Smooth and a little bitter. Maybe a little skunked. Good overall feel.
Probably the best German Hefe I've had so far. Very cloudy golden-orange color. Pleasant aroma. The flavor is wonderful and fruity, but not strictly banana and clove like others. Complex. Good stuff!

I met this beauty in Split, Croatia...Topless toffee body with a cute little off white head.  The monk on here was enough to get my engine running but once I saw the beauty without her clothes..err bottle and into something a little sexier like a nice glass..i was stunned..went excellent with the foreplay of pasta with tuna, corn, and mayo.  I hope she stops by my liquor store again so i can tap that cap.
sweet orange aroma, pours with a cloudy goldeb hue and a frothy head, quite thin bodied with a watery finish, nothing much really, Im not a great weissbier fan.

Consumed on tap at Gasthaus Bavarian Hunter Oktoberfest in Stillwater, MN. Aroma is very wheaty. Had to pull slice of lemon out to make sure I was rating on the beer. Deep amber, orange color. Since it was poured out a keg, don't get the full yeast effect that you get from a bottle (neither from appearance nor flavor). Thin layer of white foam (in plastic cup); would have been thicker if poured into glass. Flavor is rich, lemony citrus, banana. Some clove notes. Excellent.
Murky orange, huge head and nice lacing. Spicy yeast aroma. Heavy yeast/ bubblegum flavor, sweet wheat medium finish, average carbonation, medium body. Good and standard hefeweiss.
Mmmm, good stuff for those that like Hefe.  A middle of the road industry standard, by which all others should be measured.  Very nice spicy fruity nose and flavor.  HOLD THE DAMN LEMON, PLEASE!
Hefeweizens are not one of my favorites, but this is a deceent beer.  Has a deep golden, cloudy color and a good thick head.
Has a nice ginger spice taste and the cloudy appearence seems tostat in its place when you turn the glass.  A good hefe, but I like Schnieder better.
Aroma of fruits, citruses, and spices.  Probably the spiciest of all the weissbiers I've had flavor-wise.  A solid wheat.

Tried this one on draft, and thought it was so so.  Very typical in the sense that it is very true to the style.  Has that zing, of clove and banana with that fresh effervescent mouthfeel that remains evident thoughout the beer.

One of my gateway beers to good beer. Fruity malty aromas. It has that classic yeasty weizen flavor of bananas and cloves. Nice and delicate on the palate, the spices are evident. Very refreshing. Stir it up for one good beer.

Nice hefe appearance and creamy head.  Lemon, citrus, spicy notes on the nose.  Refreshing and pleasant.  Banana bread, yeasty flavor that I've always enjoyed.  Probably the best Hefe you can get that is highly accessible.  Reminds me of Hoegaarden for some reason.
Huge white head, mostly lasting.  Cloudy medium yellow appearance.  Aroma is quite nice with hints of bannana, malt and yeast.  Medium bodied, a good hefe.  Refreshing brew
Gotta love this, all yeasty and hoppy to the nose. Wonderfully murky. Many different fruit flavors with the right clovish spiciness. Pleasant aftertaste.
Well done German white: pale golden color, huge head, aroma of citrus fruits, yeast, spices and sour milk. Complex sweet banana and clove flavors, soft hoppy aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2012 Draught; free airport lounge rating, FrankfurtCloudy blond color with small head. The bread and malt aroma is nice, with delicate banana impression. It has a nice body and smooth texture; a light and delicate wheat flavor, with light banana and some residual sweetness that blends all together; the bitterness is low.A classic.

What the aroma lacks the flavor makes up for. Aroma is weak and dusty, a little spice. Flavor is heavy clove, a little banana. This is obviously fermented on the cooler side, since this yeast strain gives clove when cold and banana when warm. Reminds me a lot of ROOT BEER. Just the right amount of banana sweetness. Huge puffy head, looks just like the picture. Has the right mouthfeel, carbonates/lively but not too fizzy. I am biased towards weizens and this is a better example, so I give it high marks.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2005 Murky light yellow.  Typical German wheat aroma full of citrus and bread.  Taste is sweet, flavor is yeasty lemons, and is very crisp.  Heavy carbonation gives this beer an interesting pep and life.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2005 RERATE - Nice looking, opaque with a whipped cream head.  Haes a very fresh aroma and taste.  Yeast, wheat and spice distinguish themselves nicely.  Finishes nicely, if not too fast.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Nice dark-ish golden colour with a thin head. Nice nose of wheat. Overall not bad, starts with a kind of alcholy flavor and finishes with a light touch of wheat. Probably the most drinkable and enjoyable H.W. I have had.

Had this on tap at the Lowenbrau in Sydney. Great classic weizen with bananas all over the place and a cool head and you can knock it down quick if its your first for the day. I can see why the germans drink weizens for breakfast now: it seemed nourishing or something.
Cloudy and dark golden golden with a big rocky head. Aroma of fresh banana, yeast and some small notes of lemon. Flavour is yeasty with some fresh citric notes. Banana and yeast in finish.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2010 An above average hefeweizen, but not much more. Hazy orange body with a too thick head. Peppery prickles of hops in the nose with a crisp, musky banana clove taste--the banana increasing its assertiveness midway through the experience. Medium mouthfeel--a middle weight german wheat, while good, leaves you hoping for more.

It pours with a nice thick head, fast to rise, slow to fall.  The aroma is a bit overpowering, with a hint of orange.  It looks like a white beer, but doesn't have the traditional flavor.  Not terrible, not great, not my first choice.  I hate to say it, but even Blue Moon is a better choice.

Been drinking this for  6 years now and it's always been very good.  I prefer it in the half liter bottles.  Laying this beer down for a year in the basement produces an almost incomparably well balanced hefe.  Nothing else as readily available comes close.  Of course, laying this beer straight down into a glass ain't such a bad idea either.

0.5L brown bottle with gold foil on top. Poured out a cloudy, swirling, nebulous cloud of orangeish delight. High carbonation evident as soon as bottle was opened. Aromas right away of banana, clove, and wheat malt. Lactic smelling as well. No hops aroma discernable. It had a solid 2" thick, white meringue head on it, as it was poured into my wheat beer glass. Tasted very good. Smooth on the tongue, with a little bit of a lactic wheat malt kick at the end of it. A very tasty wheat beer, especially after a dog day at work. My boss's screams fade more & more as I drink down this glorious nectar. My day seems to fade away from me as the head slowly dies. A really good beer, if you ask me. And you may.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 First rating was 7-2-5-2-7, or 2.3 overall.  Second rating: from 16.9 oz. bottle, beer pours (in Franziskaner glass) a very cloudy lemon-golden color with a small amount of white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is of banana, lemon (no lemon put in it), spicy.  Flavor is wheaty, banana, lemon, smooth, with no hoppiness.  Sampled alongside Weihenstephaner Hefe-Weissbier, and Franziskaner is easily better.  Sampled nicely chilled.
Hazy yellow color with huge amounts of white head.  Great aroma, fruit and yeast and some spice.  Flavor comes through as well, lots of fruit flavor.  Light body...good stuff.
Hazy yellow colour with a nice thick head. Fruity and yeasty aroma and a taste of fruits and clove. This is a nice wheat beer !!
This is a good wheat beer, better than hoegaarden in my opinion.  Extremely smooth, goes down nicely.  Nice aroma and a good head.  Medium body.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Looks like typical wheat beer. Similar to Hoegaarden but with more coriander. Peary, heavy coriander spice throughout. Great and refreshing
Had in a 2.0 liter glass boot in Madison, WI.  Deep honey golden haziness.  Good to drink in the heat.  Light-bodied as a good deal of wheats tend to be.  Would drink again if given the opportunity.
Very nice head and colour. Smells really good, but somehow disapointing taste and palate. Very refreshing.

Could smell this stuff out of my pint glass, feet away, while already soused. Scary start really but that was the end of the nastiness. I'd had a lousy experience with Ayinger's Ur-Weisse and was scared of this German Wheat. To my complete surprise, THIS one is completely balanced and unoffensive. Nice cloudy amber pour with a large-ish fluffy white head. Malty wheat flavor is strong but not obnoxious. I don't notice the hops in this one. Light body, clean finish. I'm pleasantly surprised.
One of those beers that lingers in back of your mind, very clean like most German beers (and towns) nothing bad about this, the smell is a little heavy but who cared!

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2007 Rerate, 12-09-2007, 50cl can, Leffe goblet, bbe 06/08.  Head is large and creamy, descending upon a hazy golden body.  Aroma is big on bubblegum and cloves, no bananas to my nose this time around.  Sweet flavour with bubblegum and heavy creamy quickly picks up spicy clove and pepper notes closing with a semi-dry, tart and wheaten finish.  Medium bodied with a velvety texture and bustling carbonation.  Flavour would be better if it were more banana than bubblegum, but oh well.Old score: 7,4,6,3,13 = 3.3  500 mL bottle, served in a hefe glass.  Frothy white head diminishes slowly.  Body is a hazy peach color with no visible particles.  Banana and clove overtones; perhaps a hint of bubblegum.  Grainy malt, flowery hops, doughy yeast.  Sweet start is pushed back by a slightly acidic and bitter finish that is somewhat short.  Medium body has a watery texture.  Significant carbonation consists of many small bubbles.  Slightly chalky finish.  Taste doesn¬ít quite live up to the aroma; palate doesn¬ít quite live up to the appearance, IMHO.  Still, a good hefe, if a bit overpriced.

I am surprised that I never rated this one. This is a classic amongst german wheat beers.  I will fluctuate in quality depending on where you sample it but at its best it is a tart, super refreshing bavarian wheat beer. It has a high degree of phenolics (cloves) and banana esters in good balance.  Although refreshing, it tends to have more body and character than most weissbiers.  Absolutely lovely.

I sampled the 0.5L bottled variety, which pours cloudy but brilliantly deep yellow and with just a hint of orange color.  In the appropriate glass, it also offers a large, bright white, effervescent head that left a trace of lacing.  I give this medium-bodied beer extra points for the ritualistic pouring instructions that extract all the important constituent parts of this brew, including the pleasantly yeasty, spicy hops and citrus-like aroma.  The carbonation level is just right--crisp and refreshing as are the mid-palate flavors of grapefruit, lemon, clove and cardamom.  The finish is strong and, again, pleasingly refreshing.  I¬ím rating this beer as a personal favorite.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2004 Straw gold color and surprisingly clear for an unfiltered wheat. Interesting spice and yeast aromas. Flavors of apricots, bananas, and bread with slight residual sweetness. Less complexity than Weihenstephaner, but an excellent Hefe-weizen nonetheless. To quote Bob Dylan, "Yea! Heavy and a bottle of bread".

I had this from a 500ml bottle in October 2002.  Gold body with thick head. Smells fruity sweet with a relaxed spiciness.  Once in the mouth, banana flavor dominates along with a mild spiciness, just as the aroma promised. Soft/velvety feeling in the mouth. Aftertaste turns a little tart with hints of citrus. A good beer with a suprisingly high ranking. To me, it doesn't do much to distance itself from the likes of paulaner, tucher, ayinger, et al.

On tap at der Steinkeller.  I doubt it gets much better than this.  An excellent hefeweizen, surely the best I've had the pleasure to sip.  Pours a very cloudy orange with a thin white head.  Aroma of cloves and banana.  Flavor is similar, with cloves dominating, but banana and light citrus notes permeating the smooth spiciness.  This smooth hefeweizen is quite refreshing and intriguing.
I sipped this out of the bottle for a minute before pouring.  It had a weird meaty taste.  After I poured, it was ok.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2003 Pale golden color with a creamy white head that left nice lacing.  Spicy clove/wheat aroma.  Nice crisp, refreshing taste of sweet bananas with a real quick, almost bitter aftertaste.  This is a good one.

This beer is brewed in Munich, the capitol of beer. This is a beer for relaxing an enjoying. It's flavor is incredible good. The best place for drinking this beer is in the middle of the alps. That's the bavarian way of life.
(500 ml bottle). Typical hefe in any aspect: Appearance cloudy golden, enormous head, lovely aroma of ripe bananas and cloves, refreshing crisp flavour with cloves. Very good.

6/20/03, draft, Berlin.  I have to love the German sensibilities!  I sampled this Hef at a street fair set up in the middle of a busy hotel/conference area featuring more beer booths than food stands.  I enjoyed this while watching the locals drink and relax on a Friday afternoon.  Wonderful Hefeweizen appearance, yellow-orange and hazy with a bright white head.  Aroma of wheat, fruit, citrus, sweet malts and spicy hops.  Flavor of golden roasted grains, lemon, cardamom, cumin, and pepper with a sweet-n-sour finish.  Nice medium body but the carbonation was a little aggressive.  Overall a good beer and nice drinking experience!
Good wheat. Cloudy golden color with a light white head. Banana and citrus aroma. Similar flavor with some clove and yeast. Medium bodied. Refreshing in these hot summer months.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2003 Update - had this on draft at the Reading Oktoberfest this past weekend, don't know what I was thinking the first time around when I tasted this, but this beer was much better now, maybe my taste buds for German wheat beers have been enhanced, this had a nice cloudy murky golden appearance, huge bubbly soft white lacy head, lots of spiciness, lots of banana flavors & coriander, very very smooth & drinkable, excellent wheat beer
I don't vary much on my rating of aroma, but this one simply smells bad; the flavor, fortunately, is not as bad as the smell, but it isn't above average

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2005 bottle-pours a cloudy orange hue with a huge white head that was sudsy, like a bathtub full of soap.  nice yeast, orange peal, banana aroma with notes of spice and hops.  Flavors were spicy, banana, clove and even some spicy hops on the finish.  I really liked this one and it was gone in an instant it seems.  A great hefe if you ask me!
Nice creamy head, citrus/hop aroma, slightly bitter hop finish, deep mirky orange appearance, sweet fruit flavor with notes of citrus and spices. stobor.
Large white head. Cloudy golden colour. Aroma; slightly acidic, yeasty, fruity (banana!). Medium body. Taste; sweet (wheaty!), banana, little spicy, little bitter/metallic finish. It does me head in.
Bottle:  nice nose.  Cloudy golden color with creamy white head.  Very fruity flavor - pleasant and drinkable.  Very nice overall.

Hazy yellow with a good head and very good lacing, thin-bodied. Leather yeast and grapefruit aroma, could detect some spices and a very faint hint of banana, more mild aroma than some other hefes. Taste is spicy and wheaty, the mouthfeel is fizzy but dry. Their dunkel is better, overall an drinkable hefe, but some on the market are better.
Bottled. Cloudy white body with fluffy white head, wheat & citrus aromas and flavours. Had it in Barcelona in the sun with my good friend Alberto.

Hazy, cloudy, gold colored body w/ a nice frothy white head; typical of hefe style.  Cloves and wheat malt very apparent, slightly yeasty, but banana/vanilla/bubble gum aromas are missing;  however, cardboardy(oxidized) aromas are more apparent than the standard aromas.  That's too bad!  Wheat malt and clove flavors present, but so are oxidized/cardboard flavors.  Neither hop nor malt flavor are truly dominant and aftertaste is of wheat malt and cardboard/papery.  Very high carbonation, expectant of style, but it's missing the creaminess and smoothness of hefe style.  Very dissappointing, although I know this is normally a very, very good beer.  I'll rate higher based on past experience, but I'm not quite sure who to blame for this bad example.  Whether it's the distributor or the store, it doesn't really matter.  This is just a travesty to this particular beer to be treated so poorly.  I will re rate this at a later date and the score will be higher!

Quite good... hazy but bright bronzed-orange color with plenty of foam.  Poured into a traditional long German Wheat glass... so it sparkles quite actively.  Aroma is sweet, fruity and yeasty with hints of spicy wood and banana.  The mouth is subtle by comparison.  Flavor isn't too strong of wheat, quite mild and bready.  The woody fruit tastes I expected from the aroma aren't really there... but, the finish is full and crisp.  Very nice hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy golden orange, with a tight, thin, persistent white head.  The aroma is is fruity, yeasty and spicy, with notes of banana, clove, citrus, coriander, doughy bread and phenols.  The mouthfeel is pretty good.  It's a little too sharp, perhaps from too much carbonation, but not terrible.  The flavor has strong wheat tendencies, with only a hint of the fruit and spice coming through.  A fairly good hefeweizen, nothing too extremely but pleasant and quite drinkable.
(Can 50 cl) Excellent beer. A great wheat beer with a complex and very sweet taste. Fruity aroma.

This brew poured a large thick white foamy head with small bubbles. The aroma was fruity and spicy. This was a very enjoyable smooth brew which was much to my liking and I enjoyed the flavor very much.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 This brew poured a large invigorated head of finely sized white bubbles. It has a yeasty malty aroma with a cloudy yeasty dark orange body. It has a flat initial taste that finishes with a banana flavor and a fizz in the back of your mouth. It has a very nice flavor and goes down very smoothly.

Hazy golden with a typical tall slightly off white head. Very light aromas - Mild bubblegum, touch of banana, little malt, but no cloves.  Smooth and malty/wheaty.  Does have a touch of cloves in the flavor. I have not had this in a while and had on tap last weekend and now tonight in a bottle.  Seems better than memory serves.  Either the beer has gotten better, or my memory is failing.  I'll pray it's not the later.?

pleasent for a wheat beer.  Light citrius flavors with a hint of spice.  Servered on draft,  so i didn't have to work about the standard bottle problems,  which why it did well for a type of beer i'm not a large fan of.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2005 Sooooo nice, a medley of mild bubblegum and biscuit dough.  Round like a melon in your mouth.  Yeasty, clovey, right amount of carbonation.  Full swallow with with a quickly dissipating sharpness.  Mmmmmmm
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2003 extraordinarily full for a 'light' beer.  very smooth going down with no unpleasant aftertaste.

Smells...well, kind of fishy.  beyond that, pleanty of a spicey smell, cloves ginger and cinnamon. Color is nothing impressive, and head is moderate.  Palate could use some work, which is my biggest complaint from the beer.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2011 This is another great Weizen and I¬ím rating this one I had from draught. Great appearance with a mountainess head of froth towering over the rim of the glass. The smell of wheat and a little clove come right off the top. Feels great on the palate and I prefer to drink this one on the warm side (55-60f) in order to the most flavor. possible. Like a good loaf of bread in my belly. Extremely satisfying!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: The beer that started my love of wheats.  Mine poured just like the picture.  Especially helpful since I have the glass (thank you Charlie).  Beautiful hazy golden color, fluffy white head, perfect blend of banana and clove phenols.  Great wheat taste and mouthfeel.
This one pours a light orange with a medium white head.  Not being a fan of wheat beers, I liked this beer a lot.  I had it off tab and it is not as good out of the bottle.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2003 Cloudy orange/gold body and medium white head.  Aroma of spice and citrus.  Flavor of sweet malt and a tinge of citrus fruit.  Good wheat beer.
The beer poured an orangish amber with a fluffy head.  Nicely balanced between the dry, wheaty flavor and the malty sweetness.  Overall, one of the better weissen beers I have ever had.
An unclear orange beer with a very fine head. The aroma is of wheat, yeast, and pretty sweet. The flavor is very light and dominated by wheat and yeast, with no hops. Too light for my liking.

1/4 draught: Huge creamy white head on a cloudy pale/dark amber liquid. Fruits, yeast, banana, cloves! Great aroma!
Lovely creamy mouthfeel, yeasty malty wheat taste with hints of vanilla/banana in the aftertaste. Very well balanced, hops dont stand out at all.
Has a cloudy yellow color and a fruit/spice smell.  Taste is of wheat with bananas/fruit/spice flavors and finishes very smooth.  Overall a great wheat.
Tawny, cloudy appearance. Sweet with tiny traces of sourness in the creamy texture. Beats the hell out of most wheatbeers that cost twice the price.
Cloudy gold with abundant white head. Aroma of bubblegum, with some slight cloviness. Straightforward flavor of malt and yeast, with hops kept way in the background. Medium body.
Cloudy yellow color, nice light head, with a fruit and grain nose.  wheat, fruit, and malt flavors with a nice hops finish. A good wheat beer.
Nice golden/cloudy yellow color, flavor is wheaty, has a nice grassy aroma, a great german beer.

Large head,nice golden color,malty sweet lemon aroma.Flavor slightly sweet,spicy and citrus hints highly carbonated,kinda gives you that bubble festival feel in the mouth with all the carbonation.Gives a malty lemon grass after taste that is quite pleasant but fades quickly with a dry finish.A very nice brew but i think the carbonation would get to me after a while.
Party with a Monk, the ad says.  Hmmm, this beer is not something I'd take to a party.  Cloudy yellow brew with a strong yeasty sharp aroma.  Green grainy flavor.  Almost sour-tart on the finish.
Typical Weissebier, cloudy yellow with a citrus sweet and wheaty aroma. The flavor is wheaty and light with a strong citrus kick to it. Very mellow finish, however.
Nice hazy golden color with a massive white head. The aroma was full of bananas and bread. The flavor was a spicy, clove, yeast, wheat flavor. Nice crisp feel. Typical German wheat.
Pours cloudy golden with big white head.  Has nice grassy aroma.  Spicy wheat flavor with some citrus notes and plenty of yeast.

(Canned) Good strong wheaty, spicy aroma. Appearance is okay, cloudy orange/yellow with a remaining head. taste is like the smell, bit sweet, spices and wheats. But a bit weak. Refreshing palate. Good brew.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2003 [Re-rate 3/13/2003] Pale yellow, usual cloudy appereance of Hefe-Weiss beers. Good rocky head, quite creamy and lasting. Hoppy aroma at first, then some fruity notes. The taste is obviously yeasty, sweeter than other German wheats, with some good fruity notes (melon and plum) and a moderate sourness. Moderate hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. A clean, plain Wheat beer, very drinkable. This beer gives its best when bottled: on tap is much more watery.

What the crap was this. Was it skunked? Was it just naturally awful? Who knows. Incredibly spicey, usual clove type aroma. Reminded me far too much or...best i can describe this is...eggs. Egg nog. Didn't enjoy it at all or the 4 bucks at the bar i spent. However I saw lesbians dancing.

Thiny and creamy white head, long lasting. Color is a cloudy deep golden. Aroma is fruity with floral notes. Aroma is fruity too, malty with citrus tones. Finish is moderately sweet. Medium to full bodied.

Medium gold color. Large head. Aroma is malty with a hint of bananas. This is a nice medium bodied weiss beer. Malty and wheaty, slightly sweet. Mild banana and clove flavor. Soft and slightly spicy. An excellent example of a German Wheat, Smooth. Light and refreshing. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Wonder why I kept passing this beer by on the shelf.
Very good, beginning with a pleasant aroma of herbs. Light golden color, great white head (as it should be). Round, full, long lasting taste. Excellent aftertaste, not too acidic.
What can I say that hasn't already been said. Excellent example of the style. Nice citrus flavor, without being overpoweringly so.
A floral aroma with a touch of citrus. A floral flavor also with some spice and sour citrus acidity. A decent dryness.

Although I am not a wheat beer fan ths was quite good and what I would imagine a good wheat beer to taste like.  Decent head which lasts for a little while and decent carbonation.  Typical murky golden/orange color as in wheat beers.  Strong aroma of wheat and yeast from the start.  Strong taste of wheat and yeast with a little bit of spices and a hint of iron.  Smooth and creamy and finishes slightly sweet and hoppy.  A very good wheat beer by most standards and should be definately tried if you like the style.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2005 Golden and cloudy.  Scent of citrus and banana.  White head that lasts a long time and coats the glass.  Sour, fruity.  Refreshing.   Finishes slightly sweet.  Became sweeter as it warmed
As a fan of wheat beer Franziskaner has it all. The head is super.It is a beautiful cloudy gold. It has a good aroma with a great after taste. I could drank these all night.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 
Feb, 2003 The Franziskaner brewery can trace its roots back to 1363, over a 100 years before Columbus bumped into a large rock he called America. That¬ís a long time. A very long time. Weisbeer has been produced in Germany since 1520, despite breaking the Purity Law. That¬ís only 28 years after the discovery of America. That¬ís also a very long time. Gee. What else can I say? [2.0]
May, 2015 500ml dark bottle, unfiltered, from Tesco. A pleasant enough drinking beer. Quite refreshing. Mildly antiseptic aroma. Sort of washed out flavour, quite dry. Like sucking on a week old pre-squeezed lemon. Feels like it¬ís missing something - a slice of lime or lemon would be good. And perhaps half a spoon of sugar. Might make a half decent shandy. Drinkable and inoffensive, but too lacking for me. [2.4]
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 Great zest and fruitiness. lots of orange and citrus notes, big creamy head that stays right where it should. Man, this is becoming one of my fav hefe's
A pretty strong wheat in this one, but nothing spectacular by any measure. A little too light for my taste.
Yeasty, banana aroma. Refreshing beer! Tasty nice yeast flavours but otherwise a bit light in taste department. A bit acidic.

The old standby for me.  Used to love it, burned out on it, and now love it again.  Not my favorite hefe, but it's up there.  I think the spice (mostly clove) and citrus are more apparent than banana.  Nice head, light color
Solid, but unexciting weissbier. Light banana in scent and flavor. Large fluffy head. Opaque light brown color.
Just what u suspects of a German Wheat, a little lemon, banana and the great taste of grass
Solid weiss, really good off tap.  Allgauer and Farny still the best though.
this surprised me tasted none of the cloudiness very very smooth and refreshing

Cloves, banana, and a bit of vanilla mingled together for a lasting aroma. The bier poured a yellow gold that was cloudy. Had a thick, white head with nice retention. Wheat and clove flavors with a medium tartness. A moderate amount of carbonation with a light finish. I enjoyed the creamy texture, which was good although down to the remnants of the head. Well balanced - none of the phenols were overpowering.
Damn fine beer.  Smooth, clean taste.  Light yet flavorful.
Quite an excellent wheat.

Draft.
Deep, murky golden color. Nose had hints of bananna and clove. Tasted wonderful, refreshing and spicy. A solid Hefe-Weiss.
murky peached tan color, lovely rich yeasty scent. all the usual hefe characteristics -- better than tucher but not as good as paulaner or weihestephaner.
Amber colour with a beautiful head. Aroma of rhubarb and mint tea. The flavour is well-balanced and slightly acid. The finish is very poor. Not terrible.
Not with so much flavor, as expected, but anyway it has it, and with a bit of banana in it??
Wheat, and cloves aroma, hazy orange, huge frothy white head. Full wheat flavour, cloves and yeast too. Very flavourfull. A fine Hefe-weisse. Thanks Radek.
Less crisp than other hefe-weiss beers, but solid flavor.  Huge foamy head.

Bottle conditioned. Hazy copper orange with a good head and slightly low condition for the style. Aromas tend towards the lemony citrus side rather than banana esters, although some phenol character is noticable in the mouth. Sweet, refreshing and powdery finish.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2003 Yeasty and wheaty. Wheaty and yeasty. Take your pick. Looks like apple cider. Estery aroma. Tastes like sourdough.
Bottled(500ml). -I dont like wheat beer but this is the best I tasted...refreshing with fruit aroma

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2003 Draught @ Papago
I believe that this is the best time of year for us ¬ìBeer Lovers¬î, well at least for this ¬ìBeer Fanatic¬î! The fall beers are coming out, Oktoberfest celebrations all over the place, and all these fine German beers I cherish so much in bottles magically appear on tap.

This marvel of the brewer¬ís art pours a deeply chill hazed golden amber with a nifty somewhat creamy head that is white in color, the lace a satin sheet on the glass. Nose is lemon like and crisp, hints of wheat; coriander with a smooth freshness that just over whelms the senses, start is semi-sweet, with a splendid wheat and malt profile that leads to the moderate top. Finish is deliciously hopped, delicately acidic, and pleasingly dry and one fine beer in my humble opinion.
A nice golden, cloudy brew with a delightful cloudy head. Refreshing taste with a good malt flavor.

Poors like a golden mist with volcanic head (not kidding). The head was huge. I kep pouring a little bit more just to see the explosive reaction of the head. Surprisingly there was not too strong of a carbonation feel, but present nevertheless. Aroma was that of banana, cloves and hops with a slight hint of wheat and yeast that is common with this style. The flavor was unique. This is my first German wheat hefe, so the lack of citrus taste that is present in Widmer hefe caught me off guard but the smooth banana clove flavors took me to a good place. I drank almost the whole bottle just by doing the review! A nice wheat finish and true to the style. Well done! On my palate it was enriching, slight carbonation and a wheat feel, reminds me of eating oatmeal for some reason. Overall one of my favorite wheat beers now. I knew from everyone else¬ís reviews that I wouldn¬ít be disappointed.
My co-worker turned me on to this.  Great stuff.
Cloudy yellow, thick white head.  Smooth and no overly wheaty. The best wheat I have has to date.
Tap.  Great appearance with its cloudy look.  Corriander, orange, and lots of spice.
Nothing great but not bad either.  I prefer other wheat beers over it but I would still prefer it over most common beers.
Nothing really to write about, this is an average wheat beer, The one I have came in a green bottle, so it may have been light struck. Still it¬ís not bad, just average.
First german wheat I¬íve tried - the spice taste in there (assume clove) just does¬ínt work for me (IOW ruins it for me). Will be giving the remains of the sixer to jcalabre.

This beer poured a cloudy dark yellow color and formed a huge white foamy head that looked like a float when it subsided and left some nice lace. Heavy amount of carbonation that probably accounted for the sudsy head. The aroma was of clove, spice and hops. The flavor was of clove and hops. The body was a bit light and the finish didn¬ít posess much of the flavor or aroma.
A great example of a Hefe: Golden, cloudy, w/ a big frothy head. Banana & apple in the nose, crisp wheat taste, w/ a clean finish

Truly one of the best German wheat beers accessible in the U.S..  Everything one looks for in a wheat: cloudy yeast driven appearance, clove and bannana in abundance, great pillowy white head.  This would be the beer to have a non-micro/import drinker try to lead him on the road to quality brew appreciation.  Wonderful for the summer, but enough body for the winter too.  A fanatastic example of this style.
Cloudy orange colour with big fluffy head.Sweet Wheaty aroma, mild whet taste. More a summer beer

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2003 Pours dark cloudy golden, thick creamy head that sticks around for a while.  Aroma is dominated by banana and clove, while the taste is dominated by the  banana.  Body is on the light side, ends acidic and dry.  Tasty, refreshing, great for after mowing the lawn.
Beautiful, billowing head wiht continuous bubbling.  Light clove aroma.  Nice firm palate underpinning bursting clove and banana with long flavorful finish.
Good example of a Bavarian Wheat. Mellow and friuty, not a big bite, Try it without a lemon first.
Nice bananna aroma.  Hints of banannas and cloves throughout.  Slightly spicy ending.  All in all a good German Wheat.
This is the best beer I¬íve ever had! Rock on happy monk!
Ogle Center Bier Prost )OCBP) tasting. frothy, white head,spicy. Light bitterness,decent German Wheat.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2003 Very smooth weisse that reminds me of the Sprecher Hefe-weiss with a less pronounced aftertaste.
best beer ive ever had.
Very nice wheat
definite aroma of bananas and cloves.  good looking cloudy yellow beer, just the way it shoul be.  the flavor is fruity then spiced by cloves right at the end of the taste.  true to the german style.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2010 Rerate 7/28/2010Not quite sure what happened with my original rating 8 years ago - maybe I had a bad bottle or something, but since then, Franziskaner has become one of my favorite Hefeweizens.  The aroma has a wonderful blend of fruits, spices, yeast, and bananas while the taste is pretty much exactly what a hefe should be.  Fruit, cloves, and vanilla all dominate the tasting and blend together perfectly.  A truly wonderful hefe.I¬ím usually a huge fan of hefeweizens, but this one seemed a bit bland.  The color is the usual hazy yellow with a medium sized head.  The aroma is slightly fruity and the taste as well, but overall, it seemed weak with a taste that left something to be desired.  A refreshing beer, but nothing special - not a stand-out hefe.Original Rating: 6/4/6/3/13 3.2/5.0 on 10.10.2002
Aroma and appearance to style.  Light clove no banana esters.  Quite refreshing.  Nice body, with good spiciness.
A great wheat beer.  Slightly fruity aroma and taste.
This is a nice golden color with a huuuuge white head.  Tasted slightly like bananas and cloves.  I like Schneider much better.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2005 Rerate Still just as good - my palate has just become a bit more knowledgeable and I do not rate as highly. Good bubble gum aroma and flavor with some bananas thrown in there for good measure. Thick creamy mouthfeel. Original 4.1 Excellent wheat beer - from the citrusy aroma to the cloudy appearance - this was a refreshing end to a hot early fall evening. Smooth finish - left me thirsting for more!

Man, do I love wheat beers! This was great. Very eveident fruitiness (citrus) and spice taste to this one. Very crisp and not very hoppy. Cloudy blond with a slight brown hue, probably from the sediment in the bottle. An almost perfect hefe-weizen. Recommended.
Nice Germasn White beer, but nothing special.
Great German wheat. Very thirst quenching.
A delightful weissbier.  Very wheaty and malty.  Not much carb.  Nice!

Decent mix of fruit and hops, but nothing spectacular and it leaves too strong of an aftertaste. rerate: I didnt care for it too much this time, dry and yeasty, I think I am souring on the wheat style all together.
Good weissen beer. The best bishoff beer there is.
Pretty decent wheat, but I wish it were a bit thicker and stronger.  Needs more carbonation.
UPDATED: OCT 19, 2005 Nice head and cloudiness, good fruity-spicy aroma.  Typical flavors, nothing spectacular.  This may be lacking something you¬íd get in a fresh bottle.

Typical banana and clove scent of a hefe. But there is something about this beer¬ís taste that I¬ím not overly impressed with (could be the green bottle syndrome.) Thus lowering the drinkability factor for me.  It¬ís still fairly decent brew though.
When fresh this beer is divine. Clean tasting wheat beer with great sized head. Awesome aroma.
Sitting back and having this great beer right now.  Well balanced and smooth. One of the best wheat beers. Recommended
One of the best wheatbeers i¬íve tried. Very light, but still full-bodied at the same time.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2003 Bottled: It has a nice light orange colour and a reasonable head. Aroma isn't as significant as other Hefe beers, but still it quite spiced. The flavour is typical Hefe. This is an great beer to enjoy while firing up for the BBQ. I like this.
Wow! What a great beer! It has a nice roundness from the yeast and wheat, which gives it a banana aftertaste. Not a beer for all the time, but a great refreshing beer after a hard day¬ís work.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2011 Excellent aroma, complex taste. One of the best German wheats. Drank this one last year in Germany, but now it¬ís also sold in my local supermarket for only 89 eurocents for half a liter. This is going to be a nice summer...
Very good hefe, though still slighly behind paulaner I¬íd say.  Good blend of citrus and spice.
Yeasty, fruity (peach, grapes) and a bit hoppy. Dusty, dry mouthfeel.
One of the finest examples of a hefe... not as clean tasting as Hacker-Pschorr
Excellent wheat beer that leaves you wanting more.  A little fruity but not overly so.
Very good wheat beer.  Not too heavy not too light just right baby
Wow! Distinguished by a very snappy bite. Very nice flavor, aroma a bit subdued comparatively. On my recent German Wheat mini-binge, this one shines through as a keeper.
Great wheat beer with a nice citrus nose and flavour with plenty of head.  The best wheat beer I¬íve had so far.
Another excellent wheat beer.  Try with lemon.
Dusty lemon nose. Nice golden color with a little head. Taste grain, yeast and cereals. Nice refreshing beer.
One of the best bavarian...
Very good for a style I don¬ít like that much.  Clean flavors shine through : peppery, clove, banana.  Good color and pours well.  Excellent carbonation.
