Hazy gold. Immense sticky and foamy white head. Uproarious carbonation. Lulling aroma of cloves, bananas, wheat and spicy yeast. Soft and mellow with cloves, wheat, tart dry fruitiness and a long yeasty finish. Light bodied, almost thin in nature, but ample flavors. Dryish and a little thin and sticky. Finishes musty and yeasty, yet still abounding in clove flavors and a gentle thirst quenching tartness. Solid, but far from exceptional.
I really like a good German wheat.  Unfortunately this was not a really good German wheat.  It was mediocre at best.

This is a good summer brew, nice orange color with a medium head. Citrusy (particularly pineapple) aroma. More of the same in the flavor, although slightly sweet. The directions on the bottle for serving this beer are interesting. It says to rinse the glass, pour about 3/4 of the beer, swirl the bottle, then pour the yeast. I did just that but I don¬ít know if it helped or not. Unfortunately Hefe¬ís aren¬ít my favorite type of beer.

Good looking, with tall head, funny monk on the label.  Aroma is distinctive Weiss, without knocking you over with banana yeast.  I just tried this back-to-back with Paulaner, and I¬íve got to say that I like this better, except for the palate.  Not as sour as many weiss, very grainy and not as yeasty.

As far as wheat beers go i much prefer sharp cirtusy ones to the big estery versions.  This one is one of the latter.  It is a beautiful beer - nice head, lovely cloudy appearance, but my least favorite of the three weiss beers I tried on tap in Clarkston last night.
Good beginner Hefe. Nice cloudy-straw color and yeasty aroma. Medium body with an offsetting aftertaste. Not bad, but there are better choices with more flavor.
A pleasant hefeweiss, but I liked <a href=¬íhttp://www.ratebeer.com/ShowBeer.asp?BeerID1 better. This one seems more tart and less substantial, and it only mellows slightly as it warms up.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2003 Pours a cloudy murky yellow, nice thick foamy white head, leaves a clingy lace in the glass, aroma of wheat and bananas. Flavors of wheat, banana-clove yeasty flavor. Light body  clean and crisp, very refreshing another one of my favorites, always good.
A hazy honey color with a citrusy spicy nose. Quite similar to Oberdorfer Weiss. I had to buy a sixer of this, and I¬ím glad I did! A delicious beer, anyone have advise on duplicating the recipe?

Not one of the better German examples of a hefe. Estery yeastiness was weak and seemed lacking. Also had a slight dirt character to the malt taste. I had to squeeze the lemon and I usually refrain from that. A lighter color than Schneider Weiss.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 Bottled:Pours a muddy, pale brown colour with a large head. Aroma is yeast, dough and toffee. Dry, yeasty flavour with notes of clove and dandelions.
Nice cloudy wheat beer.  Nice sweet flavors, with a little bitter finish.  Lots of head.  But a very tasty beer.  I really enjoyed this one.
More of this!!

One of the best Hefe I have tasted. Cludy Straw color.  Huge head for a Hefe.  Bananay aroma.  Sweet fruity start.  Thin-Medium body.  Slightly acidic finish.  Good carbonation which gives a nice refreshing mouthfeel.
Foggy yellow color with a pillowy soft merengue head. Aromas of bananas and cloves, especially as the beer warms. Silky smooth with flavors of bananas and cookie dough?. Solid Hefe.
Fine example of this style. Found it slightly more enjoyable than Paulaner and more citrusy. I¬ím beginning to like this style more and more.
Beautiful foam. Its aroma and flavour are quite discreet.
One of the better hefes out there.  Hold the lemon please!  This beer already has a nice a pleasant citric taste.  Spicy banana flavor as well, maybe some ginger?  Very good.
Good beer, but a bit of a sour note.
This is an excellent, refreshing wheat beer with smooth citrusy characteristics.  Top of the list for a german wheat.
Mild sweet aroma, the flavor is sweet wheat and has an airy mouthfeel.  Delicious.
This is a very nice beer, with a very nice fruity taste ala banana.
(Draught) Deliciously fruity with nice hops, lovely transluscent colour. I love German wheats! Compliments German food well!
Gotta love that sweet wheat beer aroma.  Picture perfect cloudiness of a hefe.  And oh so good.  Sweet and wheaty.  Definently one of the best.
I really enjoy this beer.  It is very well balanced and almost has a champiagn aftertaste.  Slight banana flavor that¬ís not overdone.

This is a bavarian hefe to the T.  Attractive cloudy pale gold.  Citrius on the palate with restrained clove/banana compared to other german hefes I¬íve had.  Extremely crisp and refreshing.  A perfect beer for the hot spring day on which I sampled it.

pale hazy yellow like a heron¬ís beak.  a billowing creamy stout-like head,  but blonde. a brisk clean citrusy yeast aroma over a suggestion of english muffin. big hefe in the nose for sure (and i customarily don¬ít  care for big things in my nose).  the taste is all citrus, some spice, bracing like slapping on an aftershave, clarion and festive on the palate; great, cleansing, except that, tsk, i¬íve never been ga-ga about lemon.  it¬ís a brewing marvel, a classic, just not my type.
Thick, sweet, crisp malt flavor. Nice balance.
Really great wheat beer. Good lemon/spice aroma. Nicely balanced taste. Great tasting and great looking too.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2003 Sweet yeasty aroma. Banana, bread. Orange-amber cloudy with pillowy lacing off-white head. Light-medium carb & silky watery body. Smooth taste - wheat, yeast, fruity, citrusy. Sediment gives nice bittering in the finish and hops have a nice tang. Great German wheat.
Good, straightforward german wheat beer.  Its very smooth and nice.  Just as expected, no surprises.  Not very complex, but not bad.
I am not a huge fan of wheat beer. This one is a strong tone too. Not for the faint of heart. You gotta love wheat beer to drink this crazy stuff.

This is a zesty, cloudy wheat beer that is marketed as a malt liquor in the United States because of its high alcohol content (about 5.5%). The beer is ¬ìcloudy¬î because it is unfiltered and bottle conditioned. The malt is derived from a combination of wheat and barley. When I stick my nose in the glass, I smell spicy fruit aromas: apple and lemon. Finishes slightly oily on the tongue, but the taste is light and refreshing, more sweet than bitter.
Extremely fruity, clovey, citrus, bananas.. hazy golden color... very refreshing and satisfying

Heavy clove, some smokiness, very light banana ester....as it warmed the light struck sulphury smell came out (too bad it started so well).  Pleasent malty flavor, a little of the smoky flavor carried over (weird), not terrible though.  A very pretty hazy golden almost orange color.  Overall not bad but a sad example.  A favorite of mine I¬ím sure it¬íll be better next time!

Yep!  This is an imported beer alright.  I still have not grown a liking to foriegn beers yet, and my favorite type of hefe is american made.  But this beer is pretty good for an import.  I definitly think it¬ís the yeast they use that gives it it¬ís bananna flavor.
nice haziness.  medium body. lightly bitter/tart-sour.  a decent wheat.
this beer is one that has to come with an acquired taste.  it has a sour taste too it.  it is good when you don¬ít have lots of money to spend on alcohol.  Very cheap but gets the job done.
Banana and apricot nose with that hefe cloudiness and thick head. smooth flavor that ends with a slighly acidic taste on the tongue. skip the lemon wedge on your first one to get all the flavor.
I really really like this one.  Wheaty, not too citrusy.  A top refreshing, but still beer-tasting weiss.
I generally prefer dark wheats to hefe-weissen, but of the light colored ones, this stands out. Nice balance of sweet and sour fruits with spice.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2004 Head is initially huge, frothy, white, fully lasting. Body is hazy medium yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (bread, cookie), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), trace hops (flowers), with light notes of bubble gum and clove, hint of plastic. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter, slightly husky. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. A somewhat-less-estery-than-most and rather commercial example, not as clean or interesting as better hefeweizen. Vaguely artificial, some off notes as well.  Not very good.
A decent hefe!  Banana smell that doesn¬ít reflect in the taste.  Dry finish, very satifsfying.
a slightly spicy fruity beer.  I enjoy it throughly.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2003 Quite refreshing, but lacks carbonation compared to Erdingers Weissbier. The taste is also more sourish. Re-rate: This is in fact better than my first rating indicated. A nice and refreshing weissbier.
Great hefe weizen bier!
Pale yellow, hazy and lively. Softly malty, estery, soft wheat aroma, nicely malty.
Not nearly as good as Paulaner.
My personal favorite Hefe.
Good hefe weizen bier

Awfull German offering, drink if you dare. Often used to fill ¬ísheets¬í not worth the effort! Update 2/16/02 .... I should add that most Weisdbier gives me pounding headaces. But the real reason I diskike this stuff is that it was overtly trendy at my local for many months and i just didn¬ít see it.

Lovely hazy straw color, has a thick, lacy, bubbly head.  Smells fresh and crisp with some lemon.  Taste is very, very spicy, more Belgian Wit than German Hefe.  Lacking a mite in carbonation, but still refreshing.
One of the better Weissbiers.
Try it with a slice of lemon.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2003     Very good hefe-weizen.  A sweet clove taste.   Really stimulates the senses.    Gotta find some Weihenstepaner.

I¬íve had this beer from a bottle and on tap from two different places, one being a German restaurant and the other being an English-style pub called ¬íThe Fox and the Hound¬í located in Naperville, Illinois. Let me tell you, the stuff they serve on tap at the English Pub is one of the top two beers in the world I¬íve ever tasted. (The other being Weinanstephaner on tap at another German restaurant called ¬íThe Schnitzel Platz¬í located in Glendale Heights Illinois.
Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse is good in a bottle but really great if you¬íre ever around the Naperville, IL area.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Splendid aroma, great cloudy chill-haze, abundant and lasting head with moderate lacing. This beer does come off as a little watery, but that makes this beer very drinkable and the excellent carbonation makes up for it. I have had many 6 packs of this beer and have et to grow tired of it.

Nothing more than an average hefe in my estimation.  Mildly yeasty and spicy aromas, but lacking when compared to Ayinger Brau-Weisse, Maisels Weisse or even Paulaner.  Beautiful deep amber color and bone-colored medium head make it pleasant on the eyes.  Flavor profile lacking in complexity.  Some yeast and spice, but seems too subtle here as in the nose.  Slightly dry finish and average mouthfeel.  Nothing to write home about.
Great hefeweizen!
A very nice  hefe beer.

Huge nose on this one with bread-like tones.  Wonderful cloudy orange color.  Typical banana-like flavors dominate.  No skimping on the ¬íhefe¬í (yeast) here.  Its a mouthful: big and chewy.  I always seem to get a paper-like finish with German wheats - endemic to the style?  Overall: Classic!
Pours with a thick white head, with a little yeast on the bottom.  Smells and tastes of clove.  Very dry finish.
Nice wheat beer with a slight touch of lemon
Good German hefe.  Not as yeasty as I would have liked, but still very decent.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2003 Magnificent head, sweet and spicy (allspice?) with a citrusy finish. You don't need a lemon wedge. I have a weakness for this style, and this one rocks!
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 The prototype for the style as far as I¬ím concerned (and I¬ím not a huge fan of the style, but I really like this beer) Banana and clove... the usual suspects   :-)
UPDATED: APR 29, 2010 My favorite german wheat. I originally rated this a 5 but i have had better beers since. Still one of my favorites. Lovely banana, clove, and citrus flavors. Great beer.
like the foam, cloudy, some kind of smoky

Hefe-Heineken, albeit not as sour. Golden amber, naturally cloudy appearance. What does naturally cloudy mean? Compare it to Pyramid¬ís rendition, for example. High carbonation interfered with the front, mild yeast-wheat flavors present in the mid. Finish was somewhat sour.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2005 Dense yellowy orange appearance, good head formation. Well spiced peppery clove nose. Sweet banana flavor, clove is well emphasized, touches of peppery spice, nice complexity.
Not bad but not the best in the style.  Paulaner is still better.
Pale color. Aroma with spices, some citrussy banana effects. Easy-drinkable. Pleasant wheat.
Very good but I like Paulaner hefe-weizen slightly more.  This is still one of my favorite beers.
Ok hefe. Fits style nicely but I brew a better homebrewed hefe.  Needs more flavor
Brilliant, frothy head, and a wonderful, dusty gold color.  A bit tangy, with nice carbonation.  I sensed a few apple tones along with banana.  Great everyday hefe-weisse.
very clean tasting beer...i picked up a hint of spice? excellent beer
Dark yellow, very hazy. Big head. Aroma is full of cloves. Pretty big body and an explosion of flavor.

Splendid weissbier, a rival to Weihenstephaner. This boasts a gorgeous appearance, smashing flavor, and an outrageous head (yet without being overcarbonated on the tongue, like their Dunkel). Wonderful.
Never disappointed
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2006 Bottle. About time i updated this one. This is still quite nice. Lemon, clove, wheat, and banana esters. I think this is really solid.
Old reliable in the wheat class.  Never disappoints, but also never dazzles you.  A dependable wheat

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2005 Great weissbier, with proper cloudy-yellow body, nice head and surprisingly complex nose and flavor; many fruits there, as well as a touch of allspice & coriander.  At the end, its a bit too hoppy and bitter for the style, but still a top 5 contender.
Very sour - hoppy

Cloudy, yellow color, white firm head, good lace. Sweet, banana, hint of toffee, light bitterness. Nice mouthfeel, smooth. Very nice German Weizen example.
Excellent Hefe. Definately one of the better I have tried. Not much more to say than whats already here...
Easy to drink, interesting flavors without a lot of bitterness.  Very good.
What¬ís the best part of a wheat beer?  The wheat.  Golden color clouded by wheat and a taste dominated by it as well.  A very good beer.
Cloudy golden appearance. Mild malt aroma. Wheat tart taste with hint of banana. Highly carbonated.
A hint of lemon that doesn¬ít overpower. Amazing head. Well worth the $1.69 paid for it.
Another great wheat from Spaten. These guys do a great job. Even better on draft!
This beer is the reason I love wheat beers. Plus the guy on the bottle looks like my grandpa.
there¬ís only so much you can say about good wheat beer
Ganz gut!  Das bier ist wunderbar.  Those wacky Franciscans have done it again.  Very palatable and not too ¬íwheaty¬í.
Rich and fruity taste. Among the ¬íbig¬í beers one of my favorites.

The commercial description is very appropriate in general. For such an inexpensive hefe-weizen, I am very impressed. Nice rose-water presence. Aftertaste is rather dull. But an excellent beer nonetheless.
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2003 A really good beer. One of my favorites. It had a great taste to it and is definetely one of the best imports i have had.
clove aroma, kind of a sticky taste, looks absolutly amazing

A nice hefe-weiss.
some interestingg tastes-  banans perhaps?
i wish  bars would serve it without the lemon wedge(makes it harder to taste)
very plesant hefe-weiss.
A pleasant wheat with an unassuming presence, like a quiet old friend whose still waters run deep and strong, whose moments of spiciness one lives for.
Biggest banana flavor I¬íve had in a weissbier yet. Other than that, not much to speak of. For the price, however, it¬ís probably the best Weissbier you can get in the States.
Less fruity and more straightforward than Paulaner.  Not as good, tho.
A decent wheat beer. Perhaps a bit weaker than most German wheats. It is missing just a little in the finish.
The best beer in the world!

Hazy yellow, big hefe head. Clove , fruity aroma, taste the cloves and has a smooth  somewhat banana flavor but feels rather thin and finished that way...waterey for some reason...should be thicker like the club-weiss. I have had better samples of this beer. But normally i love drinking it. ( I had the draft version of this..oh my god...brigh yellow, cloudy, big clove smell..thick, almost a fruity/clove taste..tons of flavor)A joy to drink.
Yeasty and malty with excellent presentation and full nose. Not too many better than this.
I love the yeasty wheaty flavor.  A rather good example of a rather excellent style of suds.
Judging by the high ratings I am assuming that I just got a bad lot. I was unimpressed, but will eventually try it again.
An excellent Hefe. (Mine was the tap version).  I have now had it in bottles and cans.  Still great!

Boasting a magnificent aroma, this beer is a little light in taste.  Probably the least cloudy hefe weissen I¬íve had, its taste is muted compared to Paulaner or Weihenstaphaner. However, if I was introducing someone to this style of beer, this would probably be my choice, because it has a nice, even flavor and smooth feel.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2004 Estery and metallic yeasty aroma.
Cloudy golden orange, quite heavily carbonated, big stable rocky head.
Yesty/estery and clove flavors dominate, banana and vanilla in the background.
Medium to light body and a somewhat fizzy mouthfeel.
Not really a bad beer, but they try to brew a beer everybody on the whole world will like - and the lowest common denominator tastes just like that.
cloudy orange colour, fine head, corn and orange aroma, sweet with a hint of acidity

Very delicate, but fresh tasting.  Nice flavor of 
wheat and a finish of citrus.  Good for the summer months.
A very naturally yeasty brew, very related to almost any German Weisse
Citrusy and wheaty, and very tasty.  Good introduction to German wheats.  For the love of Cromm, don¬ít put a lemon in it.
Not a huge wheat fan, but this is a nice malty beer.  Quite cloudy, a great aroma, and big flavor.
A pretty ordinary beer. Not a whole lot of flavor, but still ok.
Just another example of how the german¬ís have perfected the wheat beer. Whipped cream head stays throughout. Banana aroma make an apperence but does not dominate.Incredibly rounded.Well done!
Similar to the Kristall Weissbier, but bigger and more assertive.  Quite a good example of the style, as the other tasters have clearly indicated.
Has a wonderful feel when you drink it - thick but not heavy, great head and a clean finish.  Some tanginess I liked, too.
Cloudy gold with a wheat grain and clove and banana aroma. Smooth mouthfeel with a fine carbonation. Some initial lactic sourness with a slight yeast bite. Semi-long spicy banana/vanilla finish.
This is good beer!

While hefe weisse isn¬ít my favorite style, this is a great beer.  Very good wheat flavor and aroma.  A bit of a tanginess to it, which is appropriate for the style.  Cloudy, with a rocky white head.  A great example of the style for sure.

Although my preference leans to darker beers, I love hefeweiss brews.  Franziskaner is the measure for this category by which I judge all other hefes.  Aroma - wow! the wheat seems to be springing off the head right into your nose.  Appearance - wonderful hazy yellow.  Flavor - great wheaty taste - slightly lacking in citrus - however I tend to prefer this - you can add your own with a  lemon if needed.  Simply another great brew from the historical Spaten Brauerei. Cheers!
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: Pours with a nice, thick, rocky head.  Cloudy color with bannana-like aroma.  Very true to style.
A good weiss beer. Smoother than most other weiss beers.
Middle of the road weiss beer.  Looks nice in the glass, a little weak in the aroma department, and not too bad with the flavor.  I wouldn¬ít say ¬íno¬í if this were handed to me.

Excellent Hefe.  I bought the large bottle, and ended up wishing it was larger still.  On par with Paulaner, though I didn¬ít have them side by side.  Refreshing and true to style, this is a beer I¬íll be having again.

I knew this would be a good beer just from the aroma - it was outstanding.  The flavor was very nice - nothing wrong with this beer.  I did have this on tap, so that may be a reason for the higher rating than the other guys.

Cloudy golden yellow, thick firm head,
all appropriate for style.
Mild, clean taste, smooth and refreshing with
alot of carbonation.
Not much flavor however, and not very
complex.  I detected a hint of a metallic
taste.
